After Hours Capers. Jen is given an important letter from her boss to mail. When she gets home she realizes that she forgot to mail it. She knows that if her boss sees it on her desk she will be fired. She goes back to work and bribes the security guard to let her in. She grabs the letter and drops it off at the Post Office

Ruined Pants. Jennifer's grandmother told her to not climb the fence. She ignored her Grandmother's instruction. Jennifer climbed the fence and her jeans caught on the top. She hung from her pants until her Grandmother came to help her. Jennifer ruined her favorite pair of pants that day.

New Underwear. John had problems with his stomach. He had an accident on the way to work. John had to go to a store and buy a new pair of underwear. He tried to do it as subtle as possible. He changed and nobody noticed.

Mildred Tries Out For Soccer. All of Mildred's best friends played on the soccer team. She wanted to join them but was afraid she wasn't good enough. One day Mildred summoned the courage to join the team. She tried out and just barely made the cut for the varsity team. Mildred felt so happy to play soccer alongside her friends.

Flossing Pain. Miranda was trying to get better dental health habits. She was doing fine brushing and using mouthwash. But every time she tried to floss she felt great pain. She didn't want her hygiene to suffer so she tried floss picks. Luckily, the kid-friendly picks made flossing a lot easier.
Dominick's Birthday. Becky has a nephew named Dominick. Dominick's birthday is today. She got him a pack of Uno cards. Dominick is grateful for his gift. Becky and Dominick can now play Uno together.

Ice Cream. Tom was a father of three beautiful daughters. Tom wanted to spend more time bonding with his kids. Tom decided to regularly take them out for ice cream. The whole family enjoyed the ice cream visits. Tom was happy he found a fun way to spend more time with his kids.

A Wall of Burning Books. Donald didn't like books, not one bit. He got a job just to earn money to buy books and burn them. Donald felt very pleasant every time he burned a book. It was almost like he was burning the nasty, frightful ideas inside. Donald hoped to achieve the power to do it on a large scale some day.

Biking Through a Puddle. Mike was riding his bike to work. He wasn't looking as he sped through a puddle. The bike wheels splashed water up onto his clothes. All of his work suit was damaged with muddy water. Mike still went to work and hoped that no one would mind.

US Invades Iraq. George Bush declared war on Iraq. We invaded Iraq in 2002. George Bush declared victory after we captured Saddam Hussein. The war continued long after his presidency. The war is still going on.
Story. The boy told a story. It didn't make much sense. His dad helped him work on the story. The story improved. The boy told a good story.

Blankets. Sara wanted to have a good night sleep. She decided one of the best ways to do that was with clean blankets. She took all the blankets from her bed and washed them. She then put them on the bed fresh from the dryer. She then crawled into bed and got a good night sleep.

Envy. The award ceremony started. The principal called the first student to receive an academic award. She was about to hand out the most outstanding student award. Although I was confident about winning it, she called Jeff's name. I became mad when he walked across the stage.

Old Bear. Olivia loved her old dirty teddy bear. She has had it for several years. She took it on vacation with her and left it in her hotel. After a maid cleaned up her hotel, the bear was gone. She searched through the dump for hours but never found it.
The Pool. Kelly was sweating. She decided to take a dip in the pool. It was so cool and refreshing! She swam until dinner time. She was happy she'd escaped the heat for a bit.

Swinging. Gina came home from school and went to her room. Outside the room she could hear voices inside. She walked in to see her sisters in her room. The little one was swinging from the gold ball on the top of a pole. Gina yelled at them, and they ran out of her room.

A skiing accident. Molly was invited on a trip with the church. They went up to a mountain to go skiing. Molly had never gone skiing before but she was able to learn. Unfortunately, she made a mistake and crashed. She ended up having to rest for the remainder of the trip.

The Swan. Michael was bullied for his weight in school. He distracted himself by playing music. After high school, he lost 150 pounds. He also became a signed musician. Now all those kids are trying to be his friend.

A Difficult Reading. Jenny had a mandatory reading for her English class. She didn't understand her readings. Jenny went online to read about the work she was reading. Jenny was able to more understand it. Jenny understood everything the teacher talked about the next day.

Recital. Erin had her piano recital coming up. Erin told her teacher how nervous she was about performing. Erin's teacher told her to practice as much as possible. Erin took her advice and practiced every evening. Erin nailed her piece at the recital!

The Grand Escape. Mary's pet gerbil escaped from his cage. She looked all over the house but couldn't find him. Days later her mum noticed a scratching sound coming from the cooker. Mary laid a trap with Nibbles' favourite food as bait. Happily it wasn't long before Nibbles was caught and safely home.

Lost purse. Anne lost her purse one afternoon. She had gone to lunch and thought it might be left at the restaurant. She went back to see if it had been found. The manager handed Anne her purse back. Anne was so thankful to the kind stranger!
Lying. The dog was lying down. She didn't appear to be breathing. My son panicked and yelled for help. We ran to check on her. She was just sleeping, and we all sighed with relief.

Overgrowth. Aaron got home from vacation to discover his lawn was overgrown. The lawn service hadn't come to mow or trim while he was away. He went to his neighbor's house. He asked if he could borrow their lawn mower. Aaron mowed his lawn and canceled his lawn service shortly after.

The Driver's Test. Marie went to take her driver's test. She couldn't parallel park so she failed the test. That weekend she practiced how to parallel park. She went back to take the test. She ended up getting her license.
Green Thumb. Billy loved to farm. He just planted some peppers. They started to die. He looked up how to tend them. They grew up nice and big.

Snake Escape. My brother bought a pet snake. He forgot to put the lid on its cage and it escaped! He looked all over the house and could not find it. Today, when he was watching TV, he saw it slither across the screen. He grabbed the snake and put it back in its cage.

Mandarin Chinese. I speak Toisanese, a dialect of Chinese. It is very different from Mandarin. My granddaughter is starting to speak Mandarin. I bought a set of cds to try to learn Mandarin. It was too hard for me and I quit.

Devil's Paradise. Jack was to meet them at 6:30 at the park. When he didn't arrived, they began to worry. Then, one of the group turned on the news. They saw a report of Jack's death. He had been shot in a drive-by shooting on his way to the park.
Broken Axle. Tom bought a new 4x4 truck. He was excited to go off roading. On his first expedition he went too hard. Tom wound up breaking the truck's axle. He had to be towed back home.
Near Drowning. Jane went swimming with friends. The waves at the beach were strong. One knocked her over and she got swept out. She struggled to get back to shore. Jane didn't go back into the water.

Too fast. When I started the race, I was incredibly nervous. Other runners were passing me and I felt I was running too slow. Seeing the one mile marker ahead, I increased my speed. Passing the two mile mark, I started to get a leg cramp. By mile five, I had to stop, and couldn't finish the race.

Boo!. Adam works at a funeral home his family owns. He was never bothered by it but his friends were. Sometimes he would scare them on purpose. Once he tricked them into going into the embalming room in the dark. After that his friends rarely visited Adam at home.

time capsule. Harry put a time capsule in his basement and stored things there. The things like pictures represented memories and life lessons. Harry would put these things monthly. Eventually Harry stopped putting things in it. Years later, Harry looked at the time capsule and remembered his life.

Berry's Trick. Berry grabbed the soda can. He held it up in the air for all of us to see. We didn't know what he was going to do with it. He grabbed it firmly in his right hand. Smash, he crumpled it against his head!

Car accident. Steven was driving on the road one afternoon. He saw a car swerving towards him and tried to escape it. The car slammed into Steven and his car. Steven got out and was not hurt, same with the other driver. The ambulance and tow truck arrived shortly after.

Falling tree. A large tree stood over a house. The owner of the house took an ax to the trunk. The tree began to lean away from the house. A strong breeze blew and the tree swayed the other way. Moments later the tree crashed down on the house.

Special Delivery. Caleb got his first car for his 16th birthday. It was decided he would work a part time job. He needed his own money for things like gas and insurance. The very first job he applied to he got. He ended up delivering pizzas and had a blast.
The Pie. Nancy picked a lot of blueberries. She took them home and washed them. Then she made a pie with them. She served it to all her friends. They gushed over how good it was.

Clean Room. My family was going to come visit for a few days. I had been working extra hours all week so my apartment was dirty. Leaving work earlier gave me extra time to clean the apartment. I mopped, dusted, and took care of the trash. When my family arrived they noted how clean my apartment was.
The Race. Brad had trained for the sprint. Brad was nervous. Today was the race. Brad ran the race. He got first place.

Lifetime Puppy. London and her sisters really wanted a puppy. They begged their dad everyday for a dog. One day their dad came home with a new puppy. The girls were so thrilled to have a dog of their own. Their dog stayed with them into their adulthood.

Bicycle Racing. Herman was a bicycle racer. He kept his bike in tip-top condition. On the day of a race the bike lost a vital piece. Herman knew it was sabotage. He repaired the bike himself and won the race anyway.

Free Samples. Beth was walking around the mall. But she became hungry. She had no money but saw several restaurants giving out free samples. Beth got as many free samples as she could. She was satisfied with her free lunch.

Bike. Alex was about to turn five years old. All the kids in his neighborhood had a bike but him. Alex asked his parents if he could please have a bike as well. Finally the day of his birthday party came. Alex was so excited because he got the bike he always hoped for.

Don't make false promises. Anne worked in the service center of a freelance writing firm. An author called in after payment was delayed for a week. Since the author was desperate, Anne offer to try and help. She said she could get the author paid earlier than a week. She had no such ability, and the author now has to pay late fees.

Wheeled. The doctor wheeled her back to her room. Her feet kept hitting doorways. He apologized and teased her for being too long. He immediately hit another doorway. He told her to call in advance next time so he could order longer beds.

Secure System. A thief broke into Jeff's house. He used a small hairpin to unlock the door. Once he stepped in, the alarm went off. Jeff's parents woke up and went downstairs. They only saw a crack in the front window.

Distracted. Lucy sat at the dinner table with her grandparents. She kept staring out the window at her pet watermelon Mel. When she finished she headed toward the door. Grandma insisted she go to bed instead. With a heavy heart Lucy turned to go to bed.

Morbid reality. Pam hasn't shown up for work the last week. She had been looking very ill, but always seemed to be positive. Her desk was covered in little notes about thinking good thoughts. Her coworkers had to pack everything up since she wouldn't return. Among the notes was an affirmation about not letting cancer beat her.

Chemistry. Ed had an extra class slot in his senior schedule. He decided to take a chemistry class. He thought it would be very difficult. But he found that it was fun and challenging, not too hard. Ed was so glad he had chosen chemistry!

The Football Star. Victor started playing football when he was 8 years old. He practiced everyday hoping to become professional one day. Victor was a senior in High School being scouted by over 20 colleges. He accepted a full ride scholarship to play with the Univ of Ohio. He wishes to try out for the NFL and continue chasing his dream.

Flat. Tom was had a flat tire on his way to work. Tom hopped out and went to work on changing the tire. Tom then proceeded on his way to work. Tom walked into the office and noticed people staring at him. Tom later saw, in the mirror, that his face was streaked with grease!

Lost Money. Jeff went to his boss to ask for his paycheck. The boss opened up the store safe and took it out. Jeff took the check and put it into his pocket. Later that day Jeff reached into his pocket to get his check. The check was nowhere to be found.

Bad Start. I woke up to the start of the new year. I cleaned myself up and walked into the car. After driving for a few minutes, my car shut down. I got out and called a towing service. Another driver wasn't looking in front and ran into my car.
Mountain Trip. Tim went mountain climbing. It was a person challenge. He made it almost all the way to the top. He gave up shortly before the peak. Tim wants to go back and finish.

Bad Grades. Duke was a star athlete at his school. He performed well in everything but his academics. He was failing all of his classes. Duke's coaches found out and had to kick him off of the team. He was so upset he dropped out of school and didn't graduate.

Cute Awakening. Trina was awoken by her small dog sitting on her chest. Her dog was whimpering and nervously padding it's paws. Trina knew what her dog wanted. It had to use the restroom. Trina got out of bed at three in the morning to take her dog outside.

Paul's Change of Address and Change of Heart. Paul's parents told him they were going to be moving soon. Paul felt very sad about leaving his friends. His best friend told him he should try and be positive about it. Despite being sad, Paul worked hard at having a better attitude. By the time the moving day came, he was more excited than unhappy.

Angry Feelings. Tim was angry at his girlfriend. He didn't know how to properly communicate that. Instead he just lashed out. Tim's girlfriend didn't appreciate it. They wound up breaking up under bad terms.

College Troubles. Jimmy graduated high school, but his grades weren't great. He applied to his favorite university. A few months later, he got a rejection letter in the mail. Upset, Jimmy decided to go straight to work. Jimmy made good money and was secretly glad he got rejected.

Alan's Big Break. Alan is performing in a talent show. His act involves playing his banjo. While warming up, Alan breaks a string on his banjo. Without any backup strings, he's one string short. Alan doesn't play very well, and loses the talent show.

Reaching the peak. Sadie was on a huge hike. She was climbing a small mountain in her city. For some one out of shape like her, the hike was pretty tough. In the middle, she was wanting to quit. Luckily she pushed herself and managed to reach the peak.

Lip Gloss. May was waiting on her granddaughter Lucy to get dressed. She offered to dive Lucy to Blockbuster to rent movies. But that was 20 minutes ago. May was getting impatient waiting on Lucy. When she went to check on Lucy she saw her putting on makeup.

Stray Cat. Our neighbors abandoned their cat. Since then, we've been taking care of her. She comes to our porch to be fed every day. I'm going to set up an appointment with the vet to get shots for her. Then, she'll be able to come inside, too.

New pasta sauce. When tom went to his friends, he loved the food. He needed the recipe for the sauce. So he went home and made it himself. When he did though, it tasted bad. Tom didn't know what he did wrong.

The broken wick. Shannon was trying to light a candle. The wick was very low and it took some effort. She was holding it upside down and trying to light it. Suddenly, her arm wavered and she hit the wick. The wick snapped off and the whole candle was ruined.
Bookworm. I've always been a bookworm. I've excelled at school with ease. I decided to get my doctorate degree. I went through so many years of schooling. I finally got my PHD.

Spongebob. We were all watching Spongebob as a family. It is a kid's show but all really enjoyed it. This one episode was especially funny for the adults. It has humor in it that is funny for kids and adults. It is something we can all watch and enjoy as a family.

Going Back to School. Tracy had lost his job. There weren't any jobs in the area he was trained in. Tracy went back to school. He was educated in an field that was hiring. Tracy was able to get a new job.

Sarah gets lucky. Sarah was looking for some extra cash. She had wanted to buy a new purse. She thought about asking her dad. She decided to go to her dad's house. Getting in her car she finds 5 hundred dollar bills below her car!

All Nighter. Alice had a science test the next morning at 11 AM. So she stayed up all night studying. She tried to force herself to stay awake. But when she woke up, it was 2 PM. And Alice regret trying to stay up all night to study.

Hiding the Gift. Susan's daughter was having a birthday soon. Susan bought her daughter a gift. She didn't want her daughter to find the gift. Susan decided to hide the gift. She put the gift in her closet behind her clothes.

Shocked. Kylie was plugging in a computer. Her finger was touching the metal prongs just slightly. When she plugged the plug in, she felt a sharp heavy pain up her arm. She realized that she had electrocuted herself on accident. From then on, she was much more careful.
Gig. Greg had a band gig. He was going to perform at madison square garden. He was nervous to perform to so many people. When they got on stage, the nervousness faded away. Everyone loved the set.

Typing. A man wanted to be an adept typist. He tried many different methods. He found relaxing while working to somewhat help. He focused on typing only each individual word very fast. His practice made perfect and he became a fast typist.
Beach day. Last week we had a beach day. It was great. I was really looking forward to it. When we went it was very hot. I jumped in right away.

Freshman Orientation. It was Amy's first day on campus. She went to the freshman orientation unsure what to expect. There were plenty of friendly people who were also freshman. They were all new and this gave them common ground. Amy made 3 new friends that day.

Pleased. I work very hard to please him. Today I got the entire house cleaned. I washed the floors and cleaned the toilets. I took all the trash out to the curb. I was so yucky afterward that I took a shower.

Bread. Gina walked in the front door. Her mother inquired about the bread she was to pick up. Gina had no idea what she was talking about. She hadn't seen the text her mother sent. She had no way to, her phone had been confiscated in class.

Electronic music. Frank and his friend were talking about music. His friend was a big fan of electronic music. Frank did not like it and was doubtful of the genre. Frank's friend showed Frank some of his favorite music. Frank decided he was wrong and his mind was changed.

Saving a Life. Danny was waiting at the corner to cross the street. Traffic began to slow. Danny saw an old lady step out into the street. A car was dangerously close to the woman. Danny pulled the old lady back to safety.

Mushroom Pizza. Alex went out for pizza with some friends. He was the last one to the restaurant and they already ordered. They ordered mushrooms on both of the pizzas. Alex hates mushrooms on his pizza. He decided to just toughen up and eat them this one time.

The Job Offer. Kevin was excited when he was offered a job by the gym downtown. It was far from his house, though, and he didn't have a car. Kevin went to the attic and dusted off his old ten-speed bike. It would be a long trip every day, but Kevin knew it was worth it. He took the job, started getting in shape and saving money for a car.
The Bike. Wyatt got a bike for his second birthday. His mom went to put it together. First she built the frame. Then, she put the small bits on. Finally, she added some decorative stickers.

The Murder. Greg was very scared. Someone had been murdered in his apartment building! He kept checking to make sure his doors were locked. Greg was terrified that he would be next. He quickly moved out of the complex.

Judy Know Football. Jason accepted a survey where he predicted passing yards in football. He had a potential bonus of over $4 depending on how well he did. He achieved a bonus of a dollar ninety-two. The next week, he was not eligible so his wife accepted the survey. She got a bonus of two dollars fifty-four and enjoyed telling Jason.

The Touchdown. The players were running down the field. George was going to score a touchdown. When he approached the end zone, his opponent tried to tackle him. They missed! George sailed into the endzone and scored.

Stamp Collection. Dan loved collecting stamps. Dan decided he would take his stamps to be appraised. During the appraisal, Dan became nervous about the process. After the appraisal, Dan got the greatest news ever. Dan found out his stamp collection was worth $50,000!

A common scenario. Joey had quite a large ego. He thought that everyone loved him. Because of his ego, he often acted up in front of large crowds. This kind of behaviour would usually turn off potential partners. Inside, Joey was just putting on a front to hide his insecurities.

Tim buys a puppy. Tim felt like he was missing something. He had a good job and a good life. He decided to take a trip to go shopping. In the window he saw the most adorable puppy. Tim couldn't resist and decided to buy a best friend.

Court of Some Peels. Alex slumped her way into the courtroom. She'd used household cleaner instead of lemon peels to make lemonade. She now found herself being sued by a lot of angry people. She faced all of the ones who'd come to the courtroom. Alex surprised them all by faking a very sincere sounding apology.

The Carnival. Every year, a carnival came to town. Kids loved to ride the ferris wheel. Last year, The Scrambler made its debut. A ride always broke before the end of the carnival. All the kids in town looked forward to that week.

Lottery. Ruby was poor but always tried to buy a weekly luxury. One week she decided to buy a lottery ticket. She watched the drawings on TV that night, excited. The large jackpot was a million, and she didn't get it. But then she saw she had won the small pot: a thousand dollars!

Luke. Luke was John's favorite character from Star Wars. He always loved his origin story. He didn't think that Darth Vader was his father. So he was shocked when he found that out. He is so excited for the next movie.

No Perfect Dress. Sam was trying on dresses for her upcoming prom night. She had a few that she thought were okay, but none that she loved. She attempted to narrow down two choices, but couldn't. Soon the choice was getting too frustrating for her. She decided to wait on buying a dress to let the ideas sink in.

Sand Castles. Carla and Sam spent the morning building a sand castle. They wanted it to be the best one on the beach. They took a break for lunch. When they came back it was gone. The tide had rolled in, smashing it.
Rainy Day. Tom planned a picnic with friends. When it came time to go it started to rain. Tom hoped it would pass. Unfortunately it didn't for hours. Tom had to cancel plans and stay in.

Kim's Son's Glasses. Kim's son was forever losing his eyeglasses. She had tried making him put them in their case. She bought straps to keep them on his neck. He was still losing the glasses though. Kim finally bought a couple extra pairs so she had some waiting.

Fixing the roof. I noticed that the roof to my house was leaking. I got a ladder to fix it. I slipped off of the ladder and hurt my leg. The pain made me howl loudly. I learned that I should just call a professional next time.
Shoes. My wife bought two pairs of shoes for our granddaughter. She is two years old. Today her mom showed her the shoes. She refused to wear either pair. Her mom said she is very fussy.

The Boy's Dog. The father brought a puppy home for his son before he woke. When the boy woke up and saw the dog, he started crying. He picked the dog up and thanked his father profusely. He didn't let the dog go for the rest of the day. At age 10, the boy had wanted a dog for over half of his life.
Burning Down. Tom opened up a new business. It was a book store. It wasn't doing very good for a while. One night it accidentally burned down. Tom made money from the insurance.

Ticket Hogger. I looked for an interesting game in the arcade to play. I found a dart game that seemed interesting. Since someone else was using the machine, I waited for him. He ignored my presence and continued to play. The machine was out of order since he took all of the tickets.
Pokemon Hunting. Blake went to the park. He wanted to find a rare pokemon. He saw a Diglet. He threw a pokeball. He caught the Diglet.

Poor Clark. Clark didn't like his new neighbor, Alf. Every night he could hear Alf fighting with his wife. One night, a loud slap broke the quiet. Clark picked up the phone to call the police. The police came to arrest Alf for domestic violence.

Wet Phone. Jimmy had just gotten a new cell phone for his birthday. As he was walking down the street he dropped it in a puddle. It wouldn't turn on. His friend said to put it in a bowl of raw rice to absorb the water. Jimmy was skeptical, but in the morning his phone was fine.

Picky Much?. My company was hired by a woman to clean her house. When I arrived and started, she kept looking at me weird. The next day, the company tells me I'm fired. The woman complained that I was holding the broom backwards. I'm not sure what's wrong with her, but I'm left handed.
Street Racing. Sam bought a new Camaro. He was at a red light when someone wanted to race. Sam obliged and crashed his car. He ran into a light-pole The car was totaled and Sam almost died.

Tooth Fairy. Ed was excited to lose his first tooth. He was more excited when his mom told him the Tooth Fairy would come. He carefully put his tooth under his pillow that night. When he woke up in the morning there was a dollar beneath his pillow. He couldn't wait to lose another tooth to get more money.

beans. Anna had five kids to feed. She was on a tight budget. Meat was scarce, but then she found a solution. Beans offered healthy protein too, and they were cheap! Anna's kids soon ate beans with every meal.

Odd habit. There was a small town in Somerset with a strange boy. This strange boy was called Bobby. He was known as the strange boy because of his eating habits. Bobby was locally famous for eating foam cushions. Despite help from experts, he still consumes a cushion every month.
Grades. Tim always made good grades. One day he forgot to study. His teacher gave a pop quiz. Tim made a zero on the quiz. He made his first bad grade.
Walker Gets Organized. Walker had always been a very disorganized person. He vowed to change that. Walker bought a filing cabinet. He ordered all of his affairs. Walker is now much more organized.

Science Project. Jolene was getting ready to demonstrate her science project. She poured vinegar into a large pot in front of the class. Then then put on goggles and told everyone to get ready. She poured baking soda into the pot and bubbles came spewing out. The whole class was surprised but Jolene wasn't.

The Surprise Party. Amanda thought everyone had forgotten her sixteenth birthday. During the day, no one even wished her a happy birthday. After school, her mother picked her up and brought her back home. When she walked inside, there were all of her friends! Amanda realized they had been planning a surprise party!

Too much work. Chloe was unmotivated by her work. She asked her boss to have more responsibilities. The boss agreed. But Chloe couldn't keep up with the new load of work. She had to back off and go back to her old routine.

Hula Hoops. Iggy wanted to impress his friends at the last day of school party. He knew there would be jump ropes and hula hoops to play with. He practices hula hooping at home for weeks. At the party, he showed off his new skills. He impressed everyone by keeping three hoops going at once.

the Freeloader. Kim's little sister needed a place to crash. Kim and her boyfriend let her stay there a while. She didn't clean and wouldn't get a job. She ate all their food and ran up their bills. Kim had to kick her out eventually.
The world. Gina wanted to go in the woods. His mother told him not to. Gina did it anyways. Night fell and she was lost. So, a wolf started to chase her.

Bad Reception. Tom was best man at a friend's wedding. He was supposed to make a toast. He tried starting it with a joke. It was really bad and nobody laughed. The rest of his speech was even worse received.

Eli. Everyone knew her father by name but me. I read many articles about who he was but still was not sure. The internet gave me some clues but it was not much help. So I watched for him on Thursday like everyone. I soon learned Eli was Olivia Pope's father.

Running on Fumes. Tom was driving across country. Tom noticed the gas needle was approaching empty. Tom looked diligently for a sign for gas, seeing none. Tom became worried he was too far from a filling station. Just in time, Tom saw and pulled into a gas station!
kittens. The kitten wandered around the living room. It could not find a good spot to sleep. The kitten found something brown and squishy. The kitten fell asleep. The kitten fell asleep on the lab.

the graveyard. Tommy had a problem. The graveyard was on the way home from school. Tommy took the long way home because he was afraid. One day he decided to face his fear. He walked right past the graveyard and nothing happened.

The Bagel. A new bagel shop opened in town. Ben loves bagels and heard about the new bagel shop. The new bagel shop offered a one of a kind bagel. Ben went to the shop and saw a line out the door. Ben finally got his bagel after waiting in line for 90 minutes.

Pancakes with Grandma. Every Sunday morning my Grandma makes pancakes for breakfast. Today she is teaching me how to mix the batter. First we must measure the ingredients very carefully. Then we put it all in the big glass mixing bowl and stir it up. Mixing pancakes is hard work but Grandma makes it fun.

Overtime. Last week my basketball game went into overtime. We played better in overtime than we did in regulation. We won the game by almost twenty points. We decided that we would play like it was overtime every game. Our team has been great since that overtime game.

The Scary Car. Tiffany left her house to go for a walk at night. While walking, a car began to slowly follow her. She ignored it, but the car came back and did it again. This time, Tiffany ran away and called the police. The police arrived later and Tiffany went home.

Rainy Vacation. James and his family were on vacation. It had rained since they had arrived. The whole family was getting frustrated. They decided to go to an indoor arcade. James and his family were relieved to get some of their energy out.

The Cookie Exchange. Matilda was invited to her new neighborhood's annual cookie exchange. She made her chocolate chip cookie recipe that her family loved. However, at the party, she saw everyone else had made fancy cookies. She was afraid they would all think she was unsophisticated. She need not have feared, for she won the prize for best cookie!
Cereal. Ned loves cereal. Applejack and Fruit Loops mostly. He hated milk though. So he would just crunch down on dry cereal. Until he choked and milk being the only thing in his reach.

Scuba diving. The couple had never tried scuba diving before. They were on their honeymoon and wanted to be adventurous. They rented out a boat and went out to sea. They put on their gear and dove down. They saw amazing things and were delighted they had tried diving.

The Dry Milk. Daniel was playing in the kitchen one morning. He wanted a cup of milk but didn't know how to get it. He saw powdered milk on the pantry shelf and decided to try it. As he pulled it off the shelf, the bag fell spilling powder all over. Daniel's mom saw the mess and helped him clean it up.

Vladimir Plays Pool. Vladimir realized he had not left his home in two days. He decided it was time to get out and see people. Vladimir went to the local pool hall to play a few games of pool. When he was done, Vladimir felt much better. He decided he would never go so long without leaving the house.

Playing graveyard. Susie and her friends decided to play graveyard. The girls laid down on the field motionless. All the sudden Susie moved. She ended up losing the game first. Susie laughed but wanted to play again.
Accident at Home. Jane was playing around at home. She didn't realize there was a marble. Jane stepped on it and slipped. She fell over and broke her arm. Jane wound up having to get a cast.

Justin breaks down. Justin was taking a trip. His car started to make a loud noise. He decided to pull over. He popped the hood and his engine was blown. He called for help and waited to get picked up.

Cathy's Garden. Cathy wanted to plant a vegetable garden in her backyard. She shopped at a home and garden center, planning her garden. She purchased her supplies, including tools, dirt and seeds. She spread the dirt and planted the seeds, using the tools. Later that afternoon, she drank lemonade, surveying her work.

Favorite Letter. Our two year old granddaughter is learning how to read. She loves the letter W. She wants the Sesame Street letter of the day to be W. One day the letter of the day was not W. She was very upset and started to cry.

Head Stuck. In 1987 we lived in a condo with a swimming pool. It had an iron fence. One day my cousin's 2 year old got his head stuck in the fence. She had to put oil on his head. Luckily she was able to pull him through.

Lost CD. Brett had lost his favorite CD. He bought a digital copy of the album. Brett loaded the music on all his devices. He wasn't worried about losing the music again. Brett never had to buy the album again.

cringey LDR. I met my first love online. We talked for months, planning to meet. However, he lied about his age. He was really 44 and I was 18. I don't date liar, so we broke up, and I never heard from him again.
Losing Faith. Tom was a religious fellow. After a while he suffered many tragedies. It made him question certain things. He started to question his faith. That caused him to suffer more tragedies.
Woods. Timmy and Ben like to go in the woods. They enjoy building forts. They also enjoy riding bikes on the trails. Sometimes they get lost. Luckily they always find their way home.
Alex's Sickness. Alex was sick. His stomach hurt and he was nauseated. Alex's mom brought him food to eat. Alex wasn't hungry. Alex was unable to eat when he was sick.
Don't Do It. I told Charlie don't to go outside. Charlie sneaked outside anyway. Some thugs beat Charlie up really bad. The thugs were never arrested. Now Charlie just sits and thinks.

Ken's First Day. It was Ken's first day of school. He put on his uniform. Ken made sure he ate breakfast. He picked up his bag and walked to the door. Finally, he told his mom goodbye and walked to the bus stop.

Not crazy. Maddy didn't think she was crazy when she was committed. In fact, she felt lucid and in possession of her mind. She tried to talk to her doctor but he didn't listen. She screamed but she was given more medication to keep her calm. After ten years, Maddy is still there unable to leave.

Protest. America had spent years embroiled in the Vietnam War. Betty disagreed with America's participation. After seeing protests on television, Betty wanted to get involved. She was naturally timid, but believed she needed to take action. When she finally joined the protesters, she was glad to be there.
Fate. The man blamed fate. The woman thought that was wrong. She argued for free will. The man called that nonsense. The woman stopped conversing with the man.

Tom and the Turtles. Tom went on a Hawaiian vacation. Tom wanted to swim with sea turtles. He paid for a boat trip out into the ocean. His tour guide got in the water with him. Tom successfully swam near three turtles that day.
The Lasagna. Maria was a great cook. Lasagna was her specialty. She would bake one every week. Last week, she added fresh basil. Everyone said they could taste the difference!

Nurse Talitha. Talitha once had a dream. This dream involved was to be a nurse. She worked hard but stumbled along the way. Talitha kept at it and continued. Talitha finally reached her goal and is a nurse today.

Lost and resentful. Mindy and alex were best friends. One day mindy had to leave to a new hometown. They didn't speak for 5 Years. Later on, they eventually reunite in a new school. They have resentment in their relationship.

Swimming team. There was a girl who loved to swim. She spent so much time in the pool all her fingers were wrinkled. She practiced and practiced every day for a year. She got so good she tried out for the school swim team. She made the team and took the team to state!

Campaign. As election cycles go, this was a rough one. Ronald was sure he had it in the bag. He campaigned his heart out all year long. On election night, he was delivered a crushing defeat. He was flabbergasted, but he conceded nonetheless.

Final Match. Jerry made it to the final wrestling match against Drew. Drew was able to pin him down for a few seconds. Before the referee called him out, Jerry got out of the head lock. He delivered two body blows to Drew. Drew ended up unconscious.

Painting. Laurie was painting her house. She worked every morning and afternoon on the painting. She knew a realtor was coming to view her work in only a week's time. Laurie began to realize that she would not finish in time. Laurie had to hire a professional painter to finish the job.

Lindsey's first drive. Lindsey was starting to learn how to drive. Her dad took her out in the car to teach her. Lindsey was nervous and kept swerving. Her dad told her numerous times to calm down. Lindsey couldn't stop swerving and hit a mailbox.
Karen makes a sandwich. Karen was very hungry. Karen decided to make a sandwich. She gathered up all the ingredients. Karen ate the sandwich. Karen was very satisfied and full.

Ron Buys A Phone. Ron is sick of living without a phone. He decides he wants to buy one. Ron goes to the store to choose which phone to buy. He buys a cheap but nice phone. Ron is happy that he finally has a phone.

Moving. Stan moved a lot. He had switched school four times. He never made friends because he knew he'd leave too fast. After being in Texas for two Year's he finally made his first friend. Stan's moving to New Mexico next week.
Key. Kia had lost her keys. She looked everywhere for them. She was so frustrated and puzzled! Then they finally turned up - after hours of looking. Kia had somehow put them in the fridge!

Ten Year Reunion. Ellen went to her ten year high school reunion alone. She and her boyfriend had recently broken up. As she was mingling with old friends, a hand touched her shoulder. It was her high school boyfriend Bill who she hadn't seen in years. They had a wonderful evening, agreeing to get together again.
Cleaned Out. Michelle used a desk at the church. She helped teach the students. One day the pastor had her office cleaned out. It was an accident. He told her he was sorry.

Summer dreams destroyed. The Tolberts  went to their summer house in Georgia every summer. The had made many family memories there over the years. Regrettably, there was a break in the other night that started a fire. Their summer home was destroyed in the fire. The Tolberts now just drive across the country during the summer.

Inconsiderate Neighbor. Susan was very pregnant and working in her vegetable garden. She found that the neighbor's cat was leaving presents in the soil. She told her neighbor about the dangers the cat waste in pregnancy. Susan asked her neighbor to please keep her cat inside. Her neighbor refused because her cat liked to go outside.

Hide and Go. The kids began to play hide-and-go-seek in the backyard. One child remained hidden for the entire game and no one found her. They called her for hours but to no avail. One child began to panic and cry. They never found her but one was was every sure she even played.

Overwhelmed by technology. Pamela bought a tablet. As she didn't know how to download applications, she didn't use it. She left it on her shelf for six months. When she remember she had it, she looked online on who to use it. After an hour, she could finally download games and was glad.

Crazy Neighbors. We have some neighbors that make us miserable. They are a lesbian couple that fights nonstop. They smoke illegal drugs in their backyard while they burn a fire. Our house filled with with so much smoke the fire department came! Now they only burn fires and do drugs in their garage.

Back Pain. Yesterday, my back hurt. My friend Jake told me to go see his chiropractor. I was apprehensive at first, but I went anyway. The chiropractor cracked my back in three places. Afterwards, my back never felt better.

True Challenge. Mom grounded Jeff for a month. She told him that he's not able to watch television for a month. Jeff didn't care after the first week. However, he started to have more anxiety as time flew. His mom eventually found him watching television early.

Linda loses. Linda claims to be the fastest runner in her school. She makes a challenge to anyone wanting to race. A girl accepts her and decides to race her. They both race each other. Linda loses the race.

Stranded Island. Mike and Molly washed up on shore. They started to search for food, and look at the island. They found some coconuts, and saved them for later. Worried about if they would get saved, they cried heavily. But they got together and promised to stick together and make it home.
Social Media. Buddy was asked to run his dad's business social media account. Buddy started the page. It got lots of followers. They got more business. Buddy's dad paid him well.

Nick and the Doll. Nick was a young boy who wanted to play with dolls. His father shouted at him for playing with dolls. Nick didn't understand what was wrong with dolls. Nick decided to play with dolls in his closet in secret. Unfortunately, his father found out and grounded him for a month.

Drinking. Tom wanted to meet new people. Tom was socially awkward. Tom decided to use a social lubricant. Tom would drink alcohol before meeting new people. He found this strategy relaxed him and met many new friends.
Old Bed. I was sitting on my bed one day. The bed collapsed into many pieces. The bed was really old. I didn't have money for a new bed. So I used glue to put it back together.

Slump. Slump Brick Smash was a mason. One day he fired some new bricks. They came out with a sheen on them like he'd never seen before. Slump took these new bricks to the local dealer. The dealer swindled Brick Smash.

Fun pizza party. Lucy and her friends loved getting her friends together for a party. Tonight they decided to have a pizza party. The girls got the ingredients together to make the pies. When they were done, they put them in the oven. After a half hour, the pizzas were golden brown.

Celebrity Look-alike. Angie was self-conscious about her looks, especially her nose. When she got ready for a party, she tried to hide her flaws. At the party, a handsome guy and his friends came over to her. Angie was flattered when he said she reminded him of someone famous. The guy turned to his pals and said she looked like Barbra Streisand.
Gun. Anthony really enjoyed toy guns. One day his dad got him a real gun. He then practiced shooting every day. Now he is a sniper in the military. Anthony is the best sniper around!

Snake in the Yard. Joe walked outside into his backyard. He noticed a snake wedged in between some rocks. It was a rattlesnake! Joe called the snake relocation company. They came and removed the snake from his yard.

Math Tutor. Jason felt overwhelmed by math class. Jason went to see a tutor for help. The tutor asked Jason what was stumbling him. Jason explained that it was homework due dates. The tutor suggested they work on time management.

Prom Night. Michelle was looking forward to going to prom with her boyfriend Mark. Mark cancelled two hours before prom, he was sick. Michelle did not know what to do. She went anyway. She ended up having a great time, dancing with her friends.
Iron. Rod was ironing his clothes. His iron is very old. The iron left a burn mark on his favorite shirt! Rod got very angry. He bought a new iron.

Goodbye Love. Karen fell in love with a boy named Josh. Josh didn't love her like she loved him and he broke up with her. She had to let him go because he didn't want to be with her. Letting go broke her heart and made her very sad. She had to say goodbye to love and hopes to be happy again one day.

No Money No Honey. John was at Walmart to buy some honey. He got inline to purchase the honey. When it was his turn he realized he forgot his wallet. John could not buy the honey. John left the store without the honey.

Erin and the TV. Erin was bored at home watching TV. The television he was using burned out suddenly. Erin was missing his favorite show, so he drove to the store. At the store, he looked for a good TV and bought it. When he got home, he realized that he had missed his favorite show.
Old Stove. Tom had an old stove. It went out one night. Tom didn't smell the gas. It made him feel sick. Tom had to fix it.

Book of Mormon. I saw a website that advertised a free copy of the Book of Mormon. I had to give out my name, address, and phone number. A Mormon called me and asked why I wanted the book. I told her I study religions as a hobby. She said they would send me a book in the mail.

The College. Jacky was excited about her first year of college. When she finally left for college, she became homesick. While in her first year, she began to make new friends. Jacky came home for the holidays with a new perspective. Jacky appreciates more since being away at school.
baby. Anna had just had a baby. She wasn't sure what to name it. Then a nurse suggested "Kayla". Anna considered the name and decided it was very pretty. She happily christened her new baby "Kayla"!
Glare. Sam's television had a lot of glare. The light always hit it in the worst spots. He kept trying to move it to different areas. Nothing worked. Eventually Sam had to buy thicker curtains.

Where is my refund?. After standing in line for six hours I was exhausted. I was awaiting the anticipated release of a IPHONE 6. It wasn't a problem until I got to the counter and it wasn't there. I was able to prepay online to reserve a spot. But wasn't able to get a refund for the phone.
dead dog. I had a pet dog. She was really old. She started getting cancer on her face. I had to put her down. Now my dog is dead.

Seriously, They're Everywhere. A man spent years planning a mountain climb. He bought the best equipment. He even arranged a visa for a Sherpa to come in from Nepal. The ascent was arduous, and he and the Sherpa were nearly killed. When he got to the peak, there was a Starbucks there.
Samuel's sandwich. Samuel decides on Subway for lunch. Samuel orders a melt. He loves extra bacon. The employee snubs him with only one piece. Samuel files a complaint about the worker.

A miscommunication. Gary called Carlin and asked to hang out. Carlin agreed, but she misheard the time. Gary went to meet her at eight o'clock. Carlin didn't show up, because she thought he meant ten o'clock. Luckily, they called each other and worked out the mistake.
Infection. Kiley had a bug bite on her leg. She kept scratching at the bite. The bite got infected. She had to go to the doctor. Kiley was treated for a staph infection.

Picking just one. Maria was shopping at the mall with her mom. She had a cart full of clothing that she wanted. Her mom told her that they could only afford one shirt. Maria agonized over her decision. Finally, she decided on one shirt with red stripes.

maracas. Ida was assigned the role of maracas player in the school play. She had to make her own maracas. Her mom said they could do it with a jar of rice. They created it and decorated it together. It sounded just like genuine maracas!

Jam or jelly. Jim and Jake went to the local restaurant. They ordered toast. The only condiments available were jam and jelly. Jim couldn't decide which he preferred. He decided to eat the toast without any condiments.
The Manual. Something was wrong with Earl's toaster. He looked at the manual to troubleshoot it. He decided to change the coils. He carefully followed the instructions. Now the toaster worked great!

Forgetful Sam. Everyone knew Sam was forgetful. So they were worried about him being in the school play. Sam practiced his lines and reviewed his steps. But before the day of the play, everyone still had doubts. When the play began the next day, nobody could find Sam.

Cold Soup. Bobby mom called to him three times that lunch was ready. He ignored her because he was playing. He finally realized he was starving. He sat down at the kitchen table where a bowl of soup was waiting. It was cold but he ate it anyway because he was so hungry.

Wednesdays. Stanley went out to eat pizza every Wednesday. One Wednesday, Bruce went to his favorite pizza place. He was surprised to see that it had been shut down. It had been closed for health code violations. Now Stanley eats hamburgers every Wednesday.

Hiking Trip. Lauren and Maxwell went camping at Yosemite. They decided to hike a twenty mile trail the first night. When they got back to the campsite Maxwell realized he lost his keys. He was in a pure panic not knowing how far away he dropped them. Lauren, with a huge smile reached into her pocket and pulled out keys.

Every time. Jim liked to wear several pairs of watches on his arms. A policeman saw this and thought Jim was selling fake watches. The cop demanded that Jim hand over all his watches and be arrested. Jim insisted his innocence and offered the cop a watch in good faith. The cop took Jim's nicest watch and let Jim go on his way.

Salty. I bought a new flavor of potato chips. I took the bag home, eager to share them with my son. He said they looked really good. We opened the bag and poured some in a bowl. We ate them and enjoyed them while watching a movie.

Over-reacting. John came home exhausted. Since he was in his bed for a while, his parents was concerned. They constantly took his temperature and begged him to go to the nurse Since he knew that his condition was temporary, he remained quiet. Eventually, he started to feel better.

Ironing Clothes. Boris had never ironed his clothing. His mother would do it for him. One day, his mother decided to make Boris iron his clothes. This made Boris angry at his mom. Consequently, Boris decided to throw a tantrum.

Lizzie's Locks. Lizzie had gotten her hair braided and was bragging to everyone. She kept annoyingly reminding everyone of her beautiful hair. Everyone was becoming frustrated with her. Suddenly, one girl grabbed a pair of scissors towards her. Just like that, Lizzie's braids fell to the floor.

Jacob's Lawn. Jacob dragged the lawnmower back and forth gloomily. He was tired of making straight lines. Suddenly, he began making swirls and patterns. He told his dad the lawnmower went crazy. His dad laughed and made him finish, but it was still worth it.

Banana Split. Mary's mom came home with more bananas than they could possibly eat. She wondered why she had bought them all. Then after dinner that night she got a surprise. Mom made banana splits for the whole family. That was the best way ever to eat a banana!

Speech. Sarah has a speech to deliver to her class tomorrow. She was feeling nervous and didn't know what she would wear. Sarah went to the mall and picked out a dress to wear to class. She felt confident about herself and her presentation. Sarah got a good grade on her presentation and was thrilled.

Snacker. I only have one vice. I'm a mindless snacker. If I'm eating while doing something else, I don't stop. I will sit and eat anything in entirety if it's in front of me. I do my best not to multitask while eating.

Sushi. Eric had never tried sushi before. That is the only place his friends ever wanted to go and eat. Eric hated cooked fish so he assumed he would hate raw fish. He decided to try it on his own time so no one could laugh. As soon as the raw salmon touched his tongue he instantly gagged.
Last Work Sandwich. My wife is retiring this week. She made her last lunch tonight. She took a photo. She will probably post it on FB. It will be a sad photo for her coworkers.

Clark Watches Birds. Clark has never liked going outside. However, his parents say he needs to get out of the house more. Finally Clark gets off the couch and goes for a short walk. On his walk Clark sees many beautiful birds. Clark decides that going outside isn't as bad as he thought.
Egg. The man cracked an egg. He put the egg in the pan. The yoke broke when it dropped. The man threw out the egg. The man cracked another egg.

Not Realizing. Yan was walking in public to a restaurant. A stranger quickly stopped him. He asked Yan if he looked at his pants. Yan looked down. He immediately realized that his zipper was wide open.
Best in Class. Tom wanted to have the best grade in his class. He studied hard and often. He was second only to another kid at first. After a short while he overtook him. Tom got the highest grade.
Trip to Australia. Kelley wanted to go away. She thought about going to Australia. She brought along some friends. On the plane ride there she met someone. They ended up getting together.

Our New Kayaks. Today was a great day. We were able to purchase our very own kayaks! We were anxious to test them out and get on the water. We started paddling around and having a great time. I will never forget the day we got our new kayaks.
The actor. Ryan liked to act. Ryan auditioned for a play. He got the part. He was very excited. Bryan spent a lot of time practicing.

Kiera. Keira came to us from Russia. We purchased her from a reputable breeder. She showed up with beautiful grey fur and brown eyes. We fell in love with her instantly. We gave her a Russian name that we liked.

parking ticket. Nina was late arriving for an appointment one day. She circled the street but could find nowhere to park. She decided to park in a handicapped spot. When she came out from her appointment, she grimaced. There, on her car, was a ticket for using the handicapped spot!

Ruts. Bob knew people were trespassing in his yard. He could see ruts everywhere in his yard. Bob put nails in a couple two by fours. He laid them down in his yard. Bob no longer had tire ruts in his yard.

The Pizza. Luigi was a pizza chef. He was great at throwing the crust high into the air. He would catch it and then throw it again. Then he would spread sauce and toppings on it. Luigi's pizzas were the best.

New calculator. Alicia needed a new calculator for her finance class. She searched everywhere but couldn't find it. When she went to the store she saw it was very expensive. Then she found one on sale. She immediately found the sale one.
Giant Squid. Hoshi was a marine biologist. He was off the waters of Japan. He saw a large giant squid in the camera. Hoshi couldn't believe his eyes. It was amazing to see such a rare creature.

Gorilla. One day, scientists discovered a baby gorilla. It was an orphan and all alone. The scientists adopted this gorilla. The scientists taught the gorilla sign language. The gorilla learned to sign and lives in a zoo now.

Sid is the life of the party. Sid never gets invited to the cool parties. Sid never gets invited anywhere. One day as a prank he gets invited by the cool kids. At the party Sid surprises everyone. He becomes the life of the party and makes a bunch of new friends.

Skateboarding. Hershel wanted his son to get into a sport. Hershel's son wanted to get into skateboarding. Hershel felt that a team sport would be better for socializing. But he relented and let his son take up skateboarding. Hershel's son made friends at the skatepark, satisfying both parties.

President. Donald had always wanted to meet the president. It was recently announced that the president was visiting his town. Donald waited in line for three days to meet the president. After Donald met the president, he went home to rest. Donald  was able to have a good night's rest after meeting the president.

Wild Jump. Smith challenged me to a contest. He told me to give him $10 dollars if he can jump off the roof. I accepted the challenged and he went on top of the roof. When he jumped off, he ended up tripping. His back landed on the floor first.
Mike is stuck. Mike is leaving work. He gets on the elevator to go to ground level. While on the elevator it stops. Mike panics to get out. Help comes soon and the elevator is fixed.

Sneaking In. Caleb had wanted to see a movie. The movie was rated R. He wasn't able to buy a ticket to the movie because of his age. Caleb bought a ticket to another movie. He sneaked into the rated R picture.

Virginia Beach. When I was in college we took a trip to Virginia Beach. We hung out on the beach and walked around. We drove to Captain George's for dinner. When we came out of the restaurant I saw that I got a parking ticket. I haven't gone back to Virginia Beach since.

Learning how to cook. Julie always wanted to learn how to cook so she signed up for a class. At the class, she learned how to make marinara sauce. Afterwards she went home to make it on her own. She got her husband to sample her sauce. He couldn't believe how good it tasted.

Promotion. Bill heard from a co-worker that the company was going under. Bill also heard rumors about upcoming layoffs. Bill prepared for the worst as he was called into the boss's office. Bill gripped the arms of his chair as his boss began to speak. Bill was offered a promotion because he could help save the company!

Stephen gets bullied. Stephen was never in the popular crowd. One day on the bus Stephen got bullied. The bully brought him to the back of the bus. Stephen started to cry when the bully kicked him. Stephen is afraid to go to school now.

Sports. Maryann grew up playing sports. Men would always tell her she's good for a girl. This made Maryann very angry. They didn't understand that their statement was demeaning. Maryann was talented for a boy or girl.

Keeping Score. For Billy, it was a dream come true. He was going to be in charge of keeping score. He was keeping score of the baseball game. He was behind the scoreboard holding all the numbers. He had a great time keeping score.

Cat. Anna wanted to train her cat. Her brother had a dog that he had trained to roll over and fetch. Anna therefore decided she could train her cat to roll over and fetch. But she had no luck with either command. Anna decided cats were not very good at learning commands!

Shuttle. I was in school one day. We went to another classroom. We were going to watch the shuttle take off. We sat indian style as it rose into the air and exploded. The teachers quickly turned off the tv and sent us back to class.

Mutual Attraction. Mary liked her co worker Bob. She was afraid to ask him out though. She planned to ask him out in two days. She gathered up the courage to ask him. He asked her out before she could ask him.

Jimmy Drops History Class. Jimmy was having difficulty in his history class. He kept failing every test no matter how hard he studied. Jimmy decided to drop his history class. He signed up for a painting class instead. Jimmy was able to get an A in his painting class.

Chipped tooth. Kerry was eating a piece of hard candy. All of a sudden she bit down. As she bit, part of her tooth broke. Kerry rush to the dentist. She had to have emergency dental surgery to fix her tooth.

Games. Ed was playing hide and seek with his mom. He had hidden so well that his mom couldn't find him! Waiting for her, Ed drifted off to sleep. When he woke up, he was in his bed. His mom had finally found him and put him to bed!

Digging. Ben and Bobby wanted to find something really old. They decided to dig in Ben's yard for buried treasure. If no treasure, they thought they might find dinosaur bones. They dug eagerly all afternoon, looking for artifacts. Finally Ben discovered a buried dime from 1940!

The Cheating. Tameka loved her husband and would never cheat on him. But, one evening she met a handsome younger man in a nice car. He struck a conversation with her at the gas station. Next, he showed her a bankroll of four thousand dollars. She took his phone number because he was rich, her husband wasn't.

Sandbox. The baby was playing with the ball. Another baby decided to take the ball from him. The baby boy didn't have the ball anymore, and threw a fit. The baby with the ball smiled and laughed. Both babies were in a sandbox.

The ice cream truck. Briana was at the park with her sister. She heard the ice cream truck come down the road. Quickly, she began digging through her mom's purse. Luckily, she managed to find several quarters. She used the coins to buy ice cream.

Jane Opens a Candy Shop. Jane wanted to open a small business. She researched market demand in her area. Jane realized she could make a great profit with a candy store. She used the tools available for small business owners. Jane's candy shop is doing great.

The Bar. Jason hadn't seen his father in Years. He went to an Irish pub one night. A woman sat down next to him who looked familiar. She called him by name, told him his dad was there. Jason got up without a word and left the bar.

Lonely elders. Suzie visited her nan in Cornwall. Whilst there, her nan wanted to go out. They went to her nan's favourite china shop. She bought her nan the cup and saucer she'd wanted for weeks. Her nan thought it was the best day she'd had in months.
Taxi Fight. Tom was waving a taxi down. When one stopped someone else tried to get in. Tom confronted them about it. They tried to take it anyway. Tom had to pull them out.

New Job. Crys had always stayed home with her kids. Now that her kids were in school she decided to look for a job. She applied for many jobs and finally got an interview. She got all dressed up and went to the interview. Crys got a job at a doctor's office.

Alone away from home. Pamela went to a conference in Chicago. As she wasn't used to see so many new people, she was overwhelmed. She also didn't know where to eat her lunch. So she went to the cafeteria and looked around. A group of strangers waved to her and she was relieved.
Figure Skating. The skaters got onto the ice. It was their last chance for a medal. They began their routine. The couple nailed every move flawlessly. The scores were announced and they had won gold!

Haircut. Julie's hair was getting very long. Her mother suggested she get a haircut. Julie made an appointment at the beauty shop. The stylist cut Julie's hair in a pretty style. Julie was happy with her new haircut.

Obvious but Truthful. Jeff kept bothering Carly because she ignored him. He eventually ran into her at school. Carly tried to end the tension and confessed to Jeff. She said that his teeth is the reason why she doesn't like him. Despite the rude comment, Jeff understood and walked away.

Limitless Embarrassment. Mika has big thighs and a big butt. She walked into the Saturday morning meeting wearing a long T-shirt. But the T-shirt stopped at thighs, covering her tight shorts. Her manager stopped talking and then said, girl what are you wearing? Mika was embarrassed plus her manager made her go home and change.

Food Challenge. Omar and his friends decided to have a food challenge. They tried to eat as many cinnamon rolls as they could. Omar continued to eat after everyone else gave up. But he had a serious headache and couldn't stop throwing up later. Omar's food challenge made him end up in the hospital.

Mountains. Neil was on a train heading south. He had left Paris and was heading into Spain. He could not believe the beautiful scenery. He had never seen mountains before! Neil thought they were the most beautiful sight he had ever seen.

Unknown Fees. Tom was looking at his bank account. He noticed some unknown fees on it. He called up the bank to see what they were. They informed him they were recurring charges. Tom remembered what he signed up for and hung up.

Bird. Anna's parakeet escaped one day. She looked everywhere but feared it was gone. Then she heard a tiny peep. The sly bird was hiding up in the corner by the fan! Anna was relieved that it had not flown away.

Candles. Joe wanted to do a romantic dinner for his girlfriend. But Joe had no candles. So Joe went to the store to get some. He got these very nice smelling candles. He lit the candles on before she came.

Figure Skating. Kelly was in the skating finals. She was very good, but knew she had to focus. She skated out on the ice. Kelly skated beautifully, hitting all of her tricks. Kelly got perfect tens and won.
Restaurant. Fred wants to sell the restaurant. It's time to finally retire. He gets a lot of offers but none are adequate. He continues to wait. In the end, he sold it and lowered his standards.
Last Minute Decision. Tom was a guard at a prison. There was a small uprising. Tom tried to help the best he could. He tried to hold a prisoner down. The prisoner suffocated and died.

The Quota. Amy worked in the stockroom at Marshall's. The 3 others who started with her disliked the job. After a week one person quit. Amy was told she would need to work harder to make up. Amy decided she would push herself to meet her new quota.

Arrested. My friend got arrested. He told me that he was speeding on the highway. When the cop pulled him over, he complained too much. He insulted the cop, and the cop arrested him. Now he knows not to do that anymore.

Pixy. She went to the store for some candy. She went straight to the candy aisle. She found a huge box of pixy stix. She loved the ones in the pink tube the most. She grabbed it happily, and went to check out.

Presentation. Jim had to do a class presentation for school. Many days were spent rehearsing. On the day of the presentation, Jim was nervous. He felt self-conscious as he presented in front of everyone. In the end, Jim received a passing mark on the assignment.
Adoption. Jane got pregnant. She didn't know who the father was. She decided to put the kid up for adoption. When Jane had her kid she couldn't part with it. She decided to keep it instead.

Sign Language. Chris has always wanted to learn sign language. There are a few people at Chris's job who are hearing impaired. Normally Chris writes down when he communicates with them. However over the summer Chris took on online course on sign language. Now he communicates with his coworkers faster and perfectly!

Going Fishing. Gina loves to go fishing on her friend's reservoir. Sometimes she catches catfish and bass. She forgot to buy live bait, so she only had artificial. She spent four hours fishing, but didn't catch anything. Next time she won't forget to buy minnows.

Parking Spot. I went to a city. I thought I had found a good parking spot for my scooter. I did not want to have to pay for a spot. I had it on a sidewalk by a bus station. I was told I could not park there.

Burned cookies. I decided to make cookies and found a recipe. I prepared the ingredients in the kitchen. I put the cookie dough on a sheet in the oven. After a while, I noticed an odd smell. I ran to the kitchen to see that my cookies had burned.
Risk. The man took a risk. It turned out well. He took more risks in the future. They continued to go well. He called himself lucky.

Front step trout. Rugby was a yellow labrador retriever. He was always bringing stuff to the house. Usually he brought live turtles. One morning, he left a trout on the front step. We don't know where he got it.

Hillary is determined. Hillary was a hard working Woman. She was going to run for President. Hillary was going to defeat all the odds. Election day was drawing close and Hillary was ready. Hillary wins the election and becomes the first woman president.

Purse envy. Lydia bought a new purse. It was big and leathery and made everybody look at it. As Lydia was vain, she liked the attention very much. Until someone came along and snatched the purse and run away. Lydia since then buys simple purses and no one notices them.
The Catch. Al went to a ball game with Peter. They had seats in the outfield behind the fence. One of the players hit a homerun. Al leaped up and caught the ball. Al was excited about his souvenir.

teacher affair. John's grades were in trouble. John's female teacher asked him to stay after class. She talked about his poor grades and what he can do about it. She told him she wanted an affair to which John accepts. The teacher was caught and fired.

Cowboy Doll. Hank bought his son a cowboy doll for his fifth birthday. Hank's son loved the doll. His son accidentally tore the arm off of the doll. His son cried and cried for hours. Hank went to the store and bought his son a new doll.

Fish. Rob had a sick goldfish. The fish was swimming sideways and breathing hard. Rob put the fish in a small bowl with warm medicated water. After a few days it recovered and grew healthy again. In less than a week it was just as sprightly as ever!

Wet Ending. Sarah was fascinated watching her older brothers water ski. Her parents told her she was still too young to try. Nevertheless, when her parents were away, her brother let her try. She held the crossbar tightly while waiting in the water. As the boat engine roared, Sarah fell flat on her face.
Gravy. Tim wanted to make biscuits and gravy. He can never make gravy right. He decided to try it one more time. He added the flower and water to his skillet. He finally got it right!
Baby. Spencer and Sarah wanted a baby. They tried for a few months. Sarah eventually got pregnant. She prepared herself well. She gave birth nine months later!

The Eyesore. Brian walked out to his balcony one day. In front of his nice view, he noticed some construction. After a few weeks, a large building began to block Brian's view. When it the building was done, Brian's view was blocked. Angry, Brian stopped renting his apartment and moved.

The Thief. A world renowned jewel thief had his eye on a new piece. The piece was put under the best security in the world. On his attempt to steal the piece a janitor walked by and saw him. After convincing the janitor to work with him the two stole the piece. After selling the piece the janitor turned the thief in and ran away.

Walking to school. One morning, I missed the bus to school. School was nearby, so I decided to walk. I walked for a while and listened to music. I finally made it to my school. When I arrived, I was late for class.

Jumping. Jim learned that jumping was good for his health. So he decided to jump every morning to get energized. It was working well until his bell rang. He opened the door to see his downstairs neighbor. The neighbor asked him to stop as the ceiling was trembling too much.

The Shopping Cart. Rachel was pushing her shopping cart back to her car. She suddenly lost control of the shopping cart. The shopping car veered into another person's car. The shopping cart made a dent in the car. Rachel waited for the owner of the car to return.

New iPad winning. Kelly had a drawing with her work last week about winning an iPad. She never thought she would win but she tried anyway. The next day she found out she won. Kelly couldn't believe it. Her wishes came true.

The Pizza. It was a day like any other, except it wasn't. John was getting a pizza, double pepperoni. He was informed it would be thirty minutes. The pizza man had seen his face before. He noticed he wasn't wearing any pants.

Sparklers. Johnny was afraid to hold sparklers. He wanted to like the other kids. But he was afraid he'd get burned. So he watched his friends play with them. He hoped he would be brave enough next time.

Classic car. Jason just got his driver's license. All his friends got new cars. Jason got an old classic chevy. He hated it at first but his dad thought it would be a fun project. Jason then turned it into the coolest classic car ever.

The Game. A friend invited me along to a baseball game. I obliged, and as I met up with him I realized it was for a pro game. A little excited, I wondered what seats he got. As we walked into the stadium, we walked towards the home mound. As we sat down, I turned to him and exclaimed how excited I was.

Clara's Algebra. Clara was having difficulties learning algebra. She could not grasp the concept at all. Her teacher set her up with a tutor. Clara worked every day with the tutor until she did understand. She was able to ace the Algebra test.
Getting Mugged. Jane was walking home at night. She went by a dark alley. A stranger leaped out and grabbed her purse. Jane tried to fight back but couldn't. She had her pulse stolen.

Cleaning Windows. Larry spent all day cleaning his house windows. They were large and troublesome to reach. He made sure to leave them perfect. Later that night it started to storm and rain. Larry was upset that the windows got dirty again so soon.
Milk. I bought a big box of cereal. I poured it in a bowl. However something was missing. I sat in my chair thinking about what was missing. Finally, I remembered to pour in the milk.

What the Earthquake Made. When Marlene graduated she went to work for her Uncle in California. He was a jewelry salesman who could sell anything to anyone. He tried to teach her his trade but she didn't stay there long enough. There was an earthquake that scared her to death so she went home. Now Marline works as a maid at the hotel down the street.
Torn Socks. Jay was at a friend's house. They were Asian and asked that Jay take his shoes off. Jay was embarrassed to do so. His socks had holes in them. Eventually Jay agreed and nobody cared.

The new friend. Sasha and her best friend knew each other for Years. However, her friend met a new friend and began talking to her less. Sasha was very hurt. Sasha talked to her friend, and they discussed how Sasha was feeling. Sasha's friend made more of an effort to hang out with her.

Hangover. My wife had a retirement party on September 3. She invited an ex coworker, Mary. Mary said she would come, but did not show. Mary later texted saying she had gone out drinking the day before. She did not get up until the party was over.
Beat the game. Susie downloaded a new game on her phone. She wanted to finish it. But it was taking a long time. Finally she beat the game. It took her two days.

Home. Cynthia loved staying indoors, she rarely left her home. She often broke down in public places minutes after leaving her house. She was diagnosed with social anxiety and needed medicine to go out. She finally decided to see a shrink about her debilitating condition. She got better within days and now shops for herself every day.

Frozen Pizza. Jamie went to the grocery store in search of something good to eat. It was almost dinner time, and she didn't want to cook too much. After searching all over, she finally found the perfect frozen pizza. She took it home and ate it. It was delicious!

High Blood Pressure. The doctor came into the room. He told Tina that she has diabetes. She froze up and was trembling with fear. A few minutes later, the scribe talked to the doctor. He said that Tina's lab results were mixed up.

Yoga. Ava's sister said she should try yoga. Ava was always stressed, and her sister thought yoga would help. Ava was skeptical but agreed to try it. She went to the yoga class with an open mind. After, she had to admit the class had relaxed her a great deal.

The Dog Race. The dogs lined up and were eager to go. They were going to be in a race! When the whistle blew, they all ran towards the finish line. The Golden Retriever was the winner! The dogs were all panting and tired.

New Television. Cathy's television recently stopped working. Cathy decided to look for a new television at Target. After looking at the selection, Cathy choose a 24 inch TV. Once home, Cathy decided to put the television above the fireplace. Cathy was glad with her choice of television for her home.
Apple Tree. A little boy sat under the apple tree. He saw an apple fall. He wondered why it did that. His interest soared. He studied it for years.
Slurpee. Timmy got a slurpee for his friend. It was grape just like he liked it. But his show caught on the edge of the sidewalk. The slurpee went flying. And smashed to the ground with a loud thud.

Fun Times. Jim went to the same bar every night. The other patrons had become like friends with him. One night, Jim gets a DWI and has to go to AA. To ensure his sobriety she stopped hanging out at the bar. He never heard from any of his so-called friends ever again.

Video Games. Ryan just got back from the video game story. He ran over to his tv and turned it on. Ryan placed his new game in his system. He fired up his machine as he was shaking with excitement. Ryan spent the next 6 hours playing his new game.
Cartwheel. I finally got it right. I landed with both feet on the ground. I had put my hands up high. I had taken a deep breath. It was my first cartwheel.
Food. A human once tried to eat meat. It was the first time he had tried it. He loved it. He told all his friends about it. They tried it too and liked it.

Race to victory. Emily always enjoyed motorsports growing up. She eventually decided to become involved in racing. Her natural talent allowed her to win often. This allowed her to eventually race in the INDYCAR series. She was so successful that she won the INDYCAR championship.

Chinese Food. Trey ordered Chinese food at the restaurant by his apartments. He got some egg rolls, a pork dish, a rice dish, and chow mein. He waited for his order. He got his order, paid, and drove home. He and his roommates thought the food was pretty good.

Orchard. Hayden wants to purchase an apple orchard. He intends to open his own cider business. One day, Hayden decided to make an offer to buy an orchard. The offer was accepted. Hayden is now free to began his cider business.

Turtle Encounter. One morning Beverly needed to take out her trash. She walked into the back yard with the trash bag. She almost stepped on a turtle by the gate. Beverly took the turtle to a raised garden enclosure. The turtle now has a new home.
