Carrots. Sal hated vegetables. Then his mom thought of creative ways to get him to taste them. She made celery with peanut butter and rice krispy treats with sugar. She even made a carrot-a carrot cake with frosting. Sal decided he really did love vegetables after all!
The Excuse. Mary invited John to her party. John did not like Mary and her friends. He tried to find some excuse. He told her he needs to help his brother with moving. She understood.

The Monkey Emoji. I started using the monkey emoji with one of my best friends. One day she said something that was embarrassing, and sent the emoji. I thought it was cute, so it became a habit between us. Now, whenever someone says something scary or shameful, we use it. Every day, we use the emoji at least once between us.

The Meat. My mother wanted me to pick up some roast beef from the deli. I woke up late but I made it before the store closed. The clerk at the deli informed me they were out of beef. He suggested honey baked ham and I bought it. My mother is disappointed in me for bringing the wrong thing home.
Bald. Sally wanted to do something different. She grabbed the scissors and comb. And started cutting her hair. She then got a razor from the drawer. And shaved herself bald.
Hair Gel. My hair looked terrible. I decided to use hair gel. I styled the hair into a mohawk. My boss told me I looked stupid. I realized that hair gel was not for me.

The Stolen Shirt. Michelle was at her friend's house. While her friend went to the bathroom she peeked in the closet. She noticed a pretty top that she badly wanted. She decided to stuff the shirt into her bag. Later, Michelle's friend asked about the shirt and Michelle lied.

Coney Stew. Beth's grandmother told Beth she would make her coney stew. Beth thought it sounded very interesting and fun. The smell was incredible, and the taste was even better. Beth asked his grandmother was a coney was. When she explained it was a rabbit, Beth cried.

Food order. Jen ordered a hamburger from a fast food place. She asked for no mayo. When she got home, her burger was covered in mayo. Jen had to remove all the mayo herself. She vowed to never go back to the fast food place.
A Ride Home. Sam thought the taxi company ran until ten. He got off of work at nine. The taxi had stopped running at eight. Sam had to call a friend. The friend had to give him a ride home.

Math Test. Gary needed to take a placement test to enroll in math courses. He hasn't taken a math course in seven years. He spent fifty dollars buying a study guide. Gary took two weeks to study on his math skills. Gary cheered as he placed out of remedial courses.

Drowsy. Nate came out of the doctor's office. He was walking funny since he felt tired. In a few seconds, he passed on the sidewalk. His brother woke him up several minutes later. Nate immediately got up and cleaned himself.

Holey skirt. Kayla had a denim skirt that had holes in it. It was very stylish. She wore it to school and did not think twice. When she got to school, she immediately got in trouble. Kayla was sent home and had to change clothes.

Lick My Walls. Bob finally got a hold of the real estate agent for the house. He was curious to know why it was a hundred thousand less this year. The agent told him about some minor cosmetic flaws. Bob figured none of them were a big deal. It was then the agent mentioned the lead pipes and paint.

The Fishing Trip. My brother and I went fishing early one morning. My brother begins catching fishes. I wasn't even getting a bite. Finally a big bass caught my hook and went swimming into deep water. One jerk from me, my line broke and my only fish got away.
Snacks. John was on his school soccer team. After each game a team member would purchase snacks for all. It was John's turn this week. John bought many delicious snacks. His team enjoyed the snacks.

The Lost Cellphone. Jack has lost his cellphone. He has searched the entire house multiple times. Jack was beginning to worry that he might never find it. He pulled his phone out of his pocket to call the phone to find it. Jack suddenly realized what an idiot he had been.

Incommunicado. My ex coworker Paula had an affair with a man for ten years. Once the man's wife found out he panicked. He stopped calling Paula or returning any calls. Paula asked her friend Tom, to call the man on her behalf. The man has refused to return any calls.

Paintball Challenge. Tom was invited to play paintball with friends. He was nervous but up for the challenge. He wound up dominating everyone. It got to his head and he wouldn't stop bragging. Tom wasn't invited back often.

Beach Day. The sun was out and it was finally a warm day to go to the beach. Sandy and her friends packed up their car to go play at the beach. They drove to the beach and sang in the car the whole way. They laid out in the sun on their towels and played in the ocean. The all had the best day at the beach and will plan to go again.

Pick Me Up. Taj has never drank an espresso drink. He ordered one while out with his friends. The shot of espresso tasted terrible to him. Taj found that he couldn't stop talking or moving. Despite the taste, Taj love espresso now.
Video. The man watched his video. He thought it was too slow. He tried watching it at a faster speed. The voices went too fast to understand. The man returned the video without finishing it.

Related After All. Ron is a famous singer from a boy's band. He is forty-four years old. But since he was a teen, he has heard about a guy who looked like him. Ron met that men in a music retail store and research his history. He and that man were second cousins!

Bad date. Allie had the worst date. When she met Fred at the restaurant she had the worst time. He showed up late and was a slob. She couldn't wait to leave. So she excused herself and never came back.

Bird Attack. My family took a basket of food to the beach. My sister handed my brother a piece of chicken. He started to eat it. A flock of birds were moving towards him. He started to run away from them.

The Slide. Eric had been down the slide at the park lots of times. When he got there on Thursday with his grandfather, it wasn't there! It had been replaced with a new slide that was much taller. He was a bit scared but his grandfather urged him to try it. He was glad he did because it was so much fun.

The dog. Jessie ran a dog sitting company. She was always very careful not to let them run off and escape. One day however a dog ran out the door while it was open. Jessie ran up and down the street trying to catch it. She eventually caught it and has been extra careful ever since!

The Estimate. The contractor came to Greg's house to give an estimate. The contractor looked at Greg's broken windows and thought. He wrote down a number on paper and handed it to Greg. Greg saw the number and gasped. He told the contractor that he's a crook and to leave.

Mitch's Accident. Mitch had a nasty case of pneumonia. Coming back from the doctor, he drove on the wrong side of the road. No one had any physical injuries. He wasn't punished because he was so sickly delirious. Now when he gets sick, he lets others drive him to his appointments.

Strict Coach. The coach told us to do a few push-ups. Everyone got up accept Jill. As a result we were forced to jog across the baseball field. Everyone managed to run eight miles except Jack. The coach made Jack run an extra lap for finishing last.
Pet Snake. Tim got a pet snake. It was pretty cool at first. After a while Tim realized it was a lot of trouble. He couldn't take care of it that well. Tim decided to give it away.

Picking up Trash. Tom wanted to make a difference. He noticed there was a lot of trash by a lake. He decided to clean it up whenever he could. Tom would clean up the area once a week. After a few months it looked much better.

Bad Tip. Janet was serving an old couple on a Sunday. She did her best to give them good service. The couple seemed pleased with her. At the end of the meal they left a terrible tip. Janet never knew why.

Taking a Chance. Chance had always had a crush on Christy. Senior year of high school he decided to do something about it. He bought her flowers and asked her out. She didn't know who he was and already had a boyfriend. Chance was hurt but is proud of himself for taking a chance.

Camp. Joshua was nervous about spending a week at camp. He arrived and picked out a cabin to share with several of his friends. They spent the week learning new skills. They swam often since it was hot. Joshua had a great week at camp.

Puppy. Nic got a puppy and was house-training it. But one night Nic worked late. He arrived home and saw that the puppy had peed on the floor. Nic did not punish the dog. He knew the accident was his own fault.

Bathing Suit Failure. Lena wanted to spend her weekend at the beach. She even bought a new bathing suit. The bathing suit was cheaply made. It fell apart and shrunk a couple sizes as she swam. Lena had to cover herself up with a beach towel.
Fire. The man tried to start a fire with a magnifying glass. He could get it to smolder. He lit it with a lighter instead. He told his friend it was the magnifying glass. His friend believed him.

The lockdown scare. Tabby was in class when an announcement was made. The school was on lock-down because of a possible shooter. Tabby was very afraid and held hands with her friends. Hours later, the lock down finally ended. It turned out that there was never a shooter after all.

Sister, Sister!. My younger sister is a complete codependent. She is almost 40 years old, has two children, and still lives at home. She doesn't have a job, therefore our disabled parents support them. I have tried to help her with teaching about Government assistance. You just can't help people that won't help themselves.

Missed Trash. Delaney was curled up in bed one cold morning. Suddenly she heard the distant rumble of trash trucks. She realized she had forgotten to put out her can. In her pajamas she tried rushing after the truck. It was too late though and she missed it that week.

Broken Toe. Janice got out of her class when the bell rung. Since she was holding her books, she didn't see where she was walking. Unfortunately, her food hit a metal block on the floor. She immediately fell off of the ground. Lance helped her get up since she had a broken toe.

On the roof. Beth pulled into the driveway at her house. She looked up and saw an iguana on her roof. The iguana sat watching Beth as she watched it. Finally she stepped out of the car and toward the house. The iguana quickly scurried out of sight.

Grand Canyon. Ted earned some vacation days at work he wanted to use. He decided to visit the grand canyon. He just decided to drive across the country there. He had fun on the road trip. He had a memorable vacation at the Grand Canyon.

Jan's Jilted Jawing. Jan usually kept quiet about annoyances. When she got upset by something, she would keep it inside. She also rarely drank. One night, some coworkers invited her out for drinks. She got drunk and blurted out a lot of private info about ex lovers.

Disappointment. I knew he would be disappointed. The funeral was huge, but filled with my friends. No one really liked him much in life. In death, they had stayed away from him as well. He was buried in the pouring rain.

Diary. Linda loved to write her in diary. She pledged herself that she would write in her diary everyday. As Linda pulled her diary out of her drawer, she noticed it was open. Linda then realized that someone was reading her diary. She set a trap and found out her little sister was the culprit!
The Jury. Kevin was on trial. The jury watched his every move. Kevin knew they thought he was guilty. He tried to look nice and pleasant. The jury found him guilty anyway.
Severe Storm. Tom lived on the coast. A hurricane was supposed to hit. Tom couldn't afford to evacuate. He tried to ride it out. Unfortunately Tom died during the severe storm.

Bad Treatment. The swimmers lined up to start the race. Before the official blew the whistle, one person had a false start. Based on the competition policies, he had to be banned. The man got out of the water and started to cry. His parents came down to comfort him.

Friends. Tom was a high school student. He was the only one of his friends to own a vehicle. Every weekend he would pick his friends up to socialize. They experienced many fun times together. Tom went on to cherish his fond youthful memories as an adult.

Jump Rope Accident. Tara was jump-roping with her sister Laura. They took turns sharing the jump rope. When it was Laura's turn, the jump rope flew from her hands. It hit their front window and shattered the glass. Tarra and Laura cleaned up the mess before their mother got home.

Fight Sleep. Gina finished washing dishes and headed back to her room. She wanted to work on her report. She realized she was she was feeling tired. She put her head on her arm, and closed her eyes. She was fast asleep in no time.

perfect attendance. Ava wasn't the best student in class. She knew that she wouldn't get any awards on Class Day. But she was wrong! Her principal called her up to the stage. Then he presented her with an award for Perfect Attendance!

The hide and seek winner. A group of kids were playing hide and seek. The youngest kid, a girl, was hiding in a drawer. Her spot was so good that she was the last one left hiding. Nobody could find her. Finally, she came out of her hiding spot and won the game.

Mitch's Money. Mitch was trying to earn a few extra dollars over the summer. He offered to mow his neighbor's' yards. Four of his neighbors took him up on the offer. Mitch mowed their yards once a week. By the end of the summer, Mitch had saved up a couple hundred dollars.

Monkey See Monkey Doo. Dory was at the zoo with her friends. There was a monkey dribbling a basketball. She got closer with her friends, and kept watching. After a while, the monkey got closer to the cage door. He grabbed the basketball and threw it into the cage at them.
The Kite. Jessie was in the park flying a kite. The wind began to blow stronger. Jessie lost control of the kite. It flew out of her hand and across the park. Jessie chased after the kite.

Lost Keys. Morty got into his car, ready to run some errands. He searched through his pockets for keys, but couldn't find anything. He went back into the house and searched all over. He couldn't find them and walked back out to his car to call a smith. He let out a sigh of relief as he noticed the keys were in the door.
The New Phone. Jason needed a new cell phone. Jason went online and read cell phone reviews. He decided to get a new iPhone SE. Jason walked to the Apple store. Jason bought his new phone.

Solar Power. Dan recently decided to take his house off the grid. Dan had researched solar power, and wanted panels for his home. Dan found a local contractor that would install the panels for him. After installation, Dan realized his house was using only solar power. Dan was pleased with his decision to get solar panels on his home.

The Leak. Tommy noticed a pipe was leaking a little bit. He went upstairs that night and took a shower. When he came down later, he noticed a water spot on the ceiling. He didn't know what to do, so he ignored it. The next day, the ceiling came crashing down!

Rex. Jay was training his new dog Rex. He taught Rex to sit, roll over, and beg. At first Rex did not respond. But gradually he grew better and better. Jay rewarded Rex with a treat for his obedience!

Emergency. Jodie was a very active person. She was feeling short of breath lately. She scheduled an appointment on Monday to see a doctor. Jodie couldn't wait until Monday and called an ambulance. Jodie luckily survived a blood clot in her lungs.

Quarters. Sally needed quarters. She had to fill a small tube for her school to give to charity. However they were out of quarters at home. So she searched her dad's wallet. And then she put a 20 dollar bill in the tube.

My Favorite Binky. When I was three years old, I still used a binky. My favorite binky that I used every day said Love Bug on the front. I walked around with it in my mouth all the time. I even sucked on it at the dinner table, only taking it out to eat. I slept with my binky every single night that year.

Lost Puppy. Julie lost her puppy James. They had been playing in the park together. He ran off chasing a squirrel and never returned. Julie became worried about James. A family picnicking nearby found James and returned him to Julie.

Successful Mediation for Shared Child Custody. Kathy and Bob decided it was time to get divorced. They disagreed about sharing child custody of their son, Don. The two sought mediation services so they could resolve this problem. They negotiated, deciding Don would live with Bob three days per week. The situation is satisfying for everyone concerned.

The Marathon. Rob was playing Mortal Kombat against his parents wishes. He usually only played the game late at night while the slept. One day his friend Alex came over and wanted to play. They played the game quietly to avoid being caught. They quickly pretended to be reading when Rob's mom came in the room

Wordsmith. James studied a dictionary every night last week. When he went to school be began to show off his vocabulary. All of the students were impressed. James felt very proud of his lexicon. James decided to keep studying the dictionary to get even better.

Floor. The floor outside the library was dusty. Gina looked a her hand to see it was covered in dust. She wondered when they had swept this hallway last. She stood and saw dust on her pants as well. She decided she would stand instead.

Pink Underwear. Eric carefully sorted laundry, putting in the whites. When the washer went off he removed them. To his horror all his whites were pink! A red shirt had gotten into the laundry. Fortunately nothing he would wear on the outside was effected.

The Almost Revolt. When America was just starting out, there was almost an army revolt. Many of George Washington's army had not been paid for years. So some of them went to Philadelphia and complained loudly about it. George Washington spoke with them and pled for their understanding. So the soldiers went back to the battlefields to continue the war.

Stepping on a Nail. We took our friend Rose And her five year old to get ice cream one day. Rose's son was very active. He was running down the street with his ice cream. He stepped on an old board and his foot hit a nail. He had to get a tetanus shot.

Cake Disaster. Susan loved to bake cakes. She had her first order for a three tier wedding cake. She put dowels in the cake to hold the layers together. She loaded the cake in the car thinking that it would stay in place. As soon as she started to drive the cake fell over.

Gym class. Gina picked up her new class schedule. She was hoping to get into band class. Instead her schedule showed gym class. She was disappointed not to get into band. She was more disappointed to have another gym class.

Cutting my own hair. I decided I no longer wanted to go to a hair salon. The cost was too expensive and not worth it. So I decided to get a pair of shears myself. I went to the drugstore and picked up a pair. I then went at it on my hair.
Movies with girlfriend. My girlfriend and I wanted to do something yesterday. We spent hours thinking until she had an idea. We decided to go to the movies. I was glad we went. It was a good movie.

Orange Seed. The rainstorm destroyed Sandy's orange tree. Her mom took her to the supermarket to buy orange seeds. She immediately planted the seeds in the backyard. Within 2-3 months, a small tree grew. It sprouted several fresh oranges.

Not Creepy At All. Gil was ready for his first day at being a nurse. He got to the hospital on time and eagerly asked for some work. The head nurse smiled warmly and held up a bed pan. She instructed Gil to start making the rounds, changing them. Gil lost his eagerness just a minute into his job.
Nap Time. Cam is so tired. He lays down to take a nap. He can not fall to sleep. He gets up and eats a snack and watches some television. He falls asleep on the couch while watching his show.

Cora. Cora was starting her job as a kindergarten teacher. She worked that her young students wouldn't like her. But her first day went very well. All the kids had a great time. At the end of the day, they all told her how much they liked her!

New Job. I am a college graduate who just moved back in with my mom. I have no money and student loans. I have been job searching for months with no luck. Eventually I started to get a few call backs. I have four interviews lines up next week and I'm hoping for the best.

Modern Dating. Bill was lonely and wanted to meet someone. Bill decided to try online dating. Bill bought a membership to a website and created a profile. Bill waited and waited for someone to respond to his picture and info. Today, Bill got a message from someone asking him on a date!

The Paper. Alan's english teacher assigned everyone a research paper. He had to pick someone he admired and write about him. Alan's father is a police officer. He decided to write about him. Alan got an A on the paper.

Santeria. Hank was looking for a new religion. He stumbled upon a Cuban man. The man told him to look up Santeria. Hank was very interested and took up his suggestion. Hank ended up joining this new religion.

Clip. Dan's friend sent him a funny clip of a comedy sketch. The clip featured Tom Hanks as a Trump supporter on Black Jeopardy. Dan though the sketch was hilarious and laughed at it. He sent his friend back a Trump fan espousing how good it was. Dan's friend didn't seem to appreciate that quite as much.

Lost Dog. Mellie was taking her daily walk around her neighborhood. When she turned the corner, a dog ran up to her. Mellie looked around for the dog's owner. There was no one in sight. She decides to take the dog home and call the number on its collar.
Lost Phone. My dad and I were driving to see my uncle. My dad's cell phone started to ring. He could not find it. I pulled over. It was in my pocket.

Neighborhood thief. Kari and other neighborhood residents noticed they were missing things. They realized it wasn't the usual things that they were missing, too. Kari talked it over with them and they set up cameras on their homes. A few nights later she had video evidence of the thieves in action. It was a homeless dog stealing food, and clothing for litter of puppies.

Making Lisa mad. Lisa invited Tina and the girls over for a clambake. When the girls got there everything was fine. Yet all the sudden Rosie started raising her voice. Lisa got very mad. Lisa was so mad she asked Rosie to leave.

Frisbee. Some friends invited me to play frisbee on the quad. It was my first time and I was nervous. I didn't want to look dumb or unathletic. I figured it would be easy enough. Unfortunately I got it stuck on a tree in the first throw.
New World. Ken was happy to divorce his wife. He thought things would be better some place else. He was wrong. Life got much harder. He really regretted leaving his family.

An Extra Treat. Lucy was waiting for a delivery from Schwan's. She happily signed for and accepted the delivery. She and her grandmother unpacked the shipment. In addition to Lucy's order grandma had gotten her a treat. Grandma had ordered her favorite ice cream just for Lucy.
c-section. Anna was in labor. She was struggling! After hours and hours, her doctor made a decision. He performed a c-section on Anna. Soon her baby was safe in her arms!

Aluminum Foil Swords. Timmy requested a pirate themed birthday party. His mom couldn't find any toy swords at the store. She decided to buy cardboard boxes and aluminum foil. She cut swords out of cardboard and wrapped them in foil. All the kids at the party had fun playing with their safe weapons.

Shelby goes to new york. Shelby always wanted to go to new york. Her parents tell her she is going to new york. They get her a ticket and send her on a train. She arrives in new york. She loves her time in her dream city.

Kim's big test. Kim had a science midterm to study for. She spent weeks reviewing notes and making flash cards. Kim stayed up late at night reading chapters from her text book. Kim did not sleep well the night before the test. Kim fell asleep during the last half of her midterm.

Meatloaf. Sue loved eating meatloaf. She called a local restaurant to see if they had meatloaf. It was her lucky day, they did have meatloaf. Sue couldn't wait to get home and eat the meatloaf. The meatloaf was terrible, she threw it away.

NYC. Lisa ran away from home when she was 18 years old. She took a bus to NYC and stayed with her cousin. She partied, and dreamed, and learned a lot about life. She started thinking about college. She decided to go home and enroll at the community college.

The Farmer's Market. It was the first day of the new farmer's market in town. All of the town's folk were eager to see it. The market opened and practically the whole town was there. The produce looked great and many people left with full bags. The farmer's market was a great success and was sure to continue on.

Camping Disaster. Joe was having a terrible time camping. He forgot his bug spray. And he couldn't find the way back to his car. Late at night, he finally made his way back. But he couldn't find his car keys.
The Boat. John and his dad were going fishing. His dad stopped for bait. John looked out his window while waiting. He seen a bright blue boat for sale. His dad bought the boat.
Kind Acts. Richard was having a horrible day. He went through the drive thru for lunch. Someone had already paid for his meal! He was very grateful. This small kind act really improved his mood!

Soup Kitchen. On Thanksgiving, Brian's family worked at a soup kitchen. His job was to hand out rolls. He felt sad to see all the needy people. But he was happy that he was able to help them. He hoped his family would go back to help again next year.

book. Holly loved reading. Recently she picked up the harry potter books. She was surprised that she did not read it sooner. She was so engrossed she did not eat all day. She finished the first 3 books in one day.

New pair of louboutins. Wendy really wanted a new pair of louboutins. She searched numerous department stores but couldn't find anything. None of them were cute enough for her. Finally she stumbled across metallic gold ones. She immediately picked those up and purchased them.

Conduit. Mike came by my house to buy my chainsaw gear. I decided to give him other stuff as well. I gave him some old packrat traps. I also gave him some nice underground electrical conduit. We had no trouble loading everything into Mike's truck.

The Snake. Joe saw a snake out in the wood pile. Joe caught the snake and put it in a box. He brought the snake inside the house. The snake got out of the box. Jane found the snake in the closet two days later.

The Prescription. Simon takes a prescription medication everyday. One Saturday he noticed he had taken his last pill. He called to pharmacy and asked for a refill. The pharmacist informed him there were no refills left. The pharmacist gave him enough pills to last through the weekend.

The Stand. On a hot July day, Jeff opened up a lemonade stand. He put out large pitches of drink to entice people. A customer came up and asked for a glass. Jeff said that it would cost nine dollars. The customer laughed and walked away.

Sleepaway Camp. Susie's mom decided to send her daughter to sleepaway camp. She helped Susie pack for the trip. Susie looked nervous about the adventure. Susie's mom told her daughter a funny story about her own camp days. They laughed together and finished packing.

Presley. Presley Adams was named after Elvis Presley. Her parents were huge fans of the King. Presley found his music hokey and old-fashioned. When she moved out, she had her name legally changed. Later she came to like Elvis' music and regretted the change.

Dog Ate My Homework. I spent all night last night working on my homework. I left my homework sitting on the kitchen table. I got up early in the morning for a run. When I returned I found my dog eating my homework. When I told the teacher he didn't believe me.
Wet Pants. I went for a jog in the park. I rested on a bench. It was wet. My pants now had an embarrassing mark on the bottom. I hoped no one would notice as I made my way back to my car.

Presidential Campaign. In November 2016 America will elect a new president. Both the Republicans and Democrats have many candidates. Many young Americans are choosing to vote for the first time. The candidates are vying for their votes through advertisements. These young Americans have an important choice to make for the future.

Taffy. Taffy Smaffy was working on a film set when she met her husband. They were working on different ends of a set of a filming. When a light nearly fell on Taffy. Her groom to be dived and tried to save her. Unfortunately his jump was short, but the light wouldn't have hit her.

Fishing Alone. Lucas woke up early to go fishing with his father. He knocked on his father's door. His dad told him he was too sick to go. Lucas went by himself, and slipped in the river. When Lucas got home, he had a good scolding.

magic mug. It was nearly Christmas and still i don't have a present to give. I was thinking of a gift that is simple but useful. Then i saw the magic mug that reveals picture when poured with water. I decided to buy it as a gift for my parents. As they poured hot water on it,it revealed their wedding photo.

Bluebirds. Nick loved bird watching. He spent many hours of his free time watching birds. Nick noticed some bluebirds in his backyard one day. He decided to build a bird house for them. Some weeks later he was delighted to see a bluebird was nesting in it.
Street Fight. Tom was drinking on his yard. He was listening to music. His neighbor told him it was too loud. Tom was annoyed by it. He almost got into a fight over it.

No Mail. Someone in my neighborhood ran over my mailbox. The mailman did not know how to deliver my mail without a box. I did not get mail for 2 week until I got a new mailbox. The first day with the new mailbox I got 20 letters at once. It took a long time to read them all.

GO HOME. I left my dog Max in the car with the windows down while I shopped. When I returned to the car Max was nowhere to be found. Realizing he jumped through the window, I began searching for him. I looked around town for hours and could not find him. I finally went home and discovered Max sitting by my front door.

The Grapes. Jenna loved healthy food. She loved to eat fruit, especially grapes. She would eat a bowl of them every morning. Before work, she got her bowl of grapes and the newspaper. She sat and ate them while she read the news.
Turtle Rescue. I was walking by the river. I saw a turtle with an injured leg. I Brought him home. I nursed him back to health. I have had him for 6 months now.
Coin Return. I put some coins in a snack machine. The snack would not come out. I tried pressing the button again. The snack did not move. I got my coins back from the machine.
storm. The radio announced a bad storm. Anna was afraid. She shuttered her windows and huddled in her room. The storm was bad, but brief. Soon it was over, and the sun returned!

Ray Rides a Bike. Ray always hated his long commute to work by foot. He decided it was time for him to buy a bike. Ray looked for the right bike for months. Finally he found one that was what he was looking for. Now Ray loves his daily commute to work.

Careful Driver. Sam was a very careful driver. He followed the speed limit and respected road every sign. But one day, someone was driving erratically. And the person crashed into Sam. Unfortunately, the person had a better lawyer and sued Sam.

Backup Receiver. The quarterback threw the ball. The receiver dropped the pass. The coach pulled the receiver out of the game. The quarterback threw the ball to his backup. The backup receiver made a great catch.
The Dog. Pete's dog ran away. He looked for him all over town. He put up flyers in all the stores. Pete's dog never came home. Pete was very sad.

Bike. Tom was a 13 year old boy who loved riding his old bike. His mother bought him a new bike for Christmas. Tom rode it everywhere. Two weeks after Christmas someone stole his bike. Tom was very sad to have his new bike stolen.

Chiggers. Sara went hunting with her friends. They didn't catch anything and they went home. When Sara got home she discovered that she was covered in chiggers. She went to the doctor and got lotion to help with the itching. Sara decided she would always wear long pants when hunting after that.
Loose Shirt. Tom bought a shirt he liked. It fit him a bit too big. He figured it would shrink in the wash. He was right. The shirt fit Tom much better after a while.

Sounds Like The Plot To A ... Jim accepted a new job all the way across the country. He packed up his car and started driving south. Jim's car broke down in Kentucky, far short of his destination. The people he met were very friendly and welcoming. Jim found a better job in Kentucky and stayed there.

Taken for granted. The class was shooting hoops in the gymnasium. My teacher came in and started giving instructions. However, someone told him that we wasn't an athlete. The teacher challenged the man to a one on one match of basketball. He ended up winning by 12 points.

Providence. My nephew and his wife worked Saturday. It was the fifth time they had worked Monday to Saturday. After work they drove to Providence for pizza. Then they watched the water fires on the canal. They felt they deserved the treat.
Funeral. Bill's wife was sick. She had dementia. She was deteriorating fast. He had a funeral. All of his family came.
The Furry Blanket. Sam was having chills. She was wrapped up in a furry blanket. It warmed her up. She started feeling a little better. She got the strength to get out of bed.

Best Present. Susan got a jigsaw puzzle for Christmas from her father. It was a homemade puzzle he cut himself. The picture was of a tropical island. When she turned it over, the back was a ticket to see Taylor Swift. She went to the concert and had a fantastic time.

Violence isn't the answer. Jack was always getting into trouble at school. He was never told off for violence normally. One day, another kid pushed Jack into the lockers. Jack reacted by punching the kid back. Jack was suspended and learned that violence doesn't solve anything.

Pentatonix!. May was a big fan of the singing group Pentatonix. Her parents secretly bought May a backstage pass to meet the band. On her birthday, they presented May with the backstage pass. May began to cry tears of joy. Later that month May went to see and meet the band members!
breakfast. Anna cooked two eggs for breakfast. She put the eggs onto a plate. She took the plate to her table. Anna sat down at the table. Anna ate her eggs while sitting down.

Fostering A Dog. I went to the animal shelter in my town. I was sad to see so many pets without a home. I offered to foster one of the dogs until he found a forever home. The dog learned manners and loved being part of a family! In just a few weeks he found a loving family of his own.

The Christmas Tree. The family went to the farm to find a Christmas tree. The found one and chopped it down. It was the perfect size. The took it the their car and tied it down. When they got home they decorated it.

Sunglasses. I want to wear sunglasses to protect my eyes. But I already wear glasses and they get in the way. My grandfather found a solution for me. He sent me clip-on sunglasses for my glasses. They work great, but make me feel very old.

Landon's Lakehouse. Landon's family has a lake house. They spend many of their summers enjoy the lake. After Landon and her siblings grew up, they spent less time there. Her family decided it was not worth keeping without using it. Landon's family sold the lakehouse.

Painting. My sister used to paint a lot back in high school. She had painted one painting that was really good. She had submitted it to a local art gallery. After a few months of waiting, they accepted her piece. It was displayed in the gallery for several months.

Cheer tryouts. Cindy always wanted to be cheerleader. She tried out in the sixth grade and didn't make it. She was devastated. Cindy decided to practice everyday to get better. Later that year she tried out again and made the squad!

Dead Battery. When I tried to leave, my car wouldn't start. I had jumper cables with me in the car. I just needed someone's help to start the car. Before I knew it someone had stopped to help. We were able to jump-start the car without a problem.

Laura's Flowers. Laura owned a flower shop. Every other day a man would come in looking for fruit. Laura explained many times that she sold flowers, not fruit. The man always liked to talk with Laura. Eventually the man built the courage to ask Laura for a date.

Snack Bars. My wife has lot a lot of weight due to medication. She wants to gain a few pounds. I suggested buying energy or snack bars. We went to CVS and got two bars. She is going to eat them in between meals.

The Sand Dollars. Lucy and Becky's parents took them to the ocean. Becky found a sand dollar! Lucy, unable to find her own, was extremely jealous. Just as she was about to give up, a sand dollar washed up by her feet. Their parents were relieved that now both girls were happy!
gunfire. There was a concert in California. EVeryone was enjoying the music. Gunmen terrorists came into the venue. Luckily the security saw them first. They got arrested.

Branching Out. Trudy had grown a beautiful flower garden. She had cultivated the most beautiful blooms. She had started to venture out of her comfort zone with her plants. She decided to start growing fruit trees. The first blooms of the trees showed up that spring.
Bank Trip. Dan needed some quick cash. He decided to go by his bank. He tried to take money out of the ATM but it was broken. Dan had to go in to do it. They apologized to him for the inconvenience.

Tickle. Tom loved joking with his girlfriend. Tom was a smart guy so he used his wit to say funny things. He wanted to become closer to her but did not know how to proceed. He suddenly thought of tickling. He tickled his girlfriend and felt it brought them closer together.

Worst musical. Susanna went to see a local musical. It was a remake of a very famous show. But during the show it was terrible. The singing and performing was very amateur. As a result Susanna simply decided she wanted to leave.

Rupture. Mary was at the dentist. She had been in excruciating pain for hours. She was surprised her wisdom teeth coming in could hurt this much. He wanted to take all 4 teeth at once. Mary was hesitant, but she would do anything to end the pain.
Rat Problem. Tom's apartment got a rat problem. There were several of them everywhere. Tom tried different methods to get rid of them. None of them worked. Eventually he had to call an exterminator.

Taking the Dog for a Walk. Mike had to take his dog for a walk. When he grabbed the leash the dog jumped up. He took the dog outside for a long walk. When they returned home, the dog sat in front of his treat bowl. The dog wanted a reward for going on a walk.
Serving Time. Jack was in jail. One day his brother came to see him. This made him very happy. Jack and his brother had a great chat. Jack looked forward to the next visit day.

Plan Ahead. Kathy was responsible for buying the groceries. She had a strict budget to feed a lot of people. Kathy decided to plan her meals and make a shopping list. The list made the shopping easy and she stayed on budget. Now Kathy never goes shopping without planning and a list.

Closing down the A&P. My friends and I went to the A&P grocery store during a big sale. The store is closing, so we bought a lot of food for not a lot of cash. On the way out I saw that they were selling the storefront sign. I asked the manager if I could buy that too. Now I have a large A&P sign in my living room.
The Parrot. Ursula had a parrot named Ariel. She could repeat anything you said. She loved to sing. Ursula taught her to say a knock knock joke. Ariel was a big hit at parties!

Spray Paint. Lisa wanted to change the color of her door knobs. She took them off and spray painted them. They looked great! After being used for a few weeks, the paint rubbed off. Now the knobs looked terrible!

Football. A group of high school friends played football after school. They decided to ask their favorite teacher to join them. The teacher hit the hardest out everyone. Everyone had fun getting muddy and playing the game. Everyone grew closer thanks to the game of football.
Hair. Elliot was an attractive man. Elliot was also concerned with his appearance. He decided to visit an expensive stylist to cut his hair. He loved the new hair cut. Elliot was a very happy man.

Putting away groceries. Dustin bought some groceries. He brought them home and put them inside. First he put away all of the fridge items. Next, he put away the frozen food. Finally, he put away the pantry items.

The Piano Lesson. Louise was about to have her first piano lesson. She was nervous that she would not do well. To her delight the teacher was very nice and helpful. At first she did have some struggle learning. In no time at all though she was playing pretty well.

Foggy problems. Yesterday there was a very heavy fog in our city. As a result, many people refused to drive to work. I decided to take the subway, instead. There were reports of many car accidents due to the fog. The fog dissipated by noon.

Space Heater. Bertie moved to the midwest. He found the summers pleasantly temperate and sunny. He found the winters brutally cold and unpleasant. He invested in a space heater for his room. It was insufficient and he had to sleep in many layers.

Lost. Kelly was going to the fair with her mom and brother. But she had lost her hair brush! After hours of searching, she gave up. She twined her hair into a messy braid. She ended up, hair braided, having a great time at the fair!

The Field. I found a beautiful flower filled field today. Even though it seemed like the perfect place there were no animals. The only thing in the field was bees. Honey bees, searching for pollen. I even found the honey bee hives in the field.

Slump. Benny visited his friends house. They decided to watch several movies together. He ended up staying over since the last movie ended late. His friend took out several blankets from the closest. They slept on the couch for the night.
Allergic to Cats. Jessica wanted a cat. Her friend's cat had kittens. Her friend gave her a kitten. Jessica found out that she was allergic cats. She had to give the kitten back to her friend.

A spill in the bag. Remy was digging through his backpack. Suddenly, he realized that there was something wet. He took a closer look and realized he had spilled his soda. He took everything out of the bag. Then, he washed the bag in the sink.

Cooking is Important. Allen grew up and moved out of his childhood home. He had never cooked or chopped before. He had no idea how to buy and cook inexpensive and nutritious food. He ate out for almost every meal. Soon his food budget and his health were in poor condition.
Book. Kelly lost her science book. She had to turn it in at the end of the year. If not, she would owe the money for it! But then luckily, she found it. It was hidden at the bottom of her locker!
Mountain. Tom was a mountaineer. He needed to purchase new gear. He went to REI. He bought many ropes and carabiners. He obtained the equipment he needed.

Todd's First Bike Ride. Todd had always wanted to ride his bike without training wheels. Every time he asked his father, he said Todd wasn't ready yet. Todd knew he could despite what his father said. Todd took off his training wheels when his father was not around. His father looked outside the window to see Todd riding on two wheels.

Dress caught. Lisa was having a party at her house. She got everyone together. When she was about to walk outside in her dress, something happened. Her dress got caught in the door handle. As a result the shoulder ripped.
Dollar Store. Chase was on a tight budget. He needed some things for his home. He didn't know how to pay for them. His sister told him to try the dollar store. They had everything he needed!

Losing balance. Becky was performing gymnastics. She found her way onto the balance beam. As she got on the balance beam, she lost balance. Becky fell to the ground. She hit her head on the beam and needed help.

Kujata. The Kujata have a beautiful cottage on a lake. When the matriarch of the family passed away, chaos ensued. Many of the family aim for the family fortune. The family is torn apart. The cottage is sold.

Biking. Malia thirstily picked up her bottle of water. She took several swallows before putting the bottle back in its place. She wiped a bead of sweat off of her brow. It was hot and she was tired, but she decided to keep going. She got back on her bike and proceed to pedal.

Checker Floor. Bill tiled his kitchen with a checker pattern. He pretended to be a chess piece as he walked though. Bill attacked a box of cereal, pretending it was a rook. The cereal box was open so it made a mess. Bill stomped on the cereal to further his mess.
fridge. The man opened the fridge. He looked for a beer. There was only one left. He left it for his wife. His wife thanked him for his kindness.

Pool. Kristi moved in a new apartment that had a sparkling pool. Even though it was September, she went swimming. The day after, while unpacking boxes, she felt sick. She coughed so much she realized the water had been too cold. She ended up staying in bed for a week nursing a bad bronchitis.

Wires. Evans had to charge his phone every day. One day, he could not find his charger. He searched everywhere but it was simply missing. He went to his friends house to charge his phone. Then, he remembered his charger was at work.

Dream Team. Dan loved being part of a team at work. Recently Dan's boss made him leader of an important project. In addition, Dan had to assemble a team of coworkers for the project. After assembling the team, Dan decided to give the team a name. Dan called his new team the Dream Team.
Sara's Big Move. Sara was hired for a new job. Her new job was several states away. Sarah was nervous about leaving her friends and family behind. She made new friends. Sara loves her new home.
Not Solid. Ben tried to talk to a girl at the bar. He sat on same table. She became disgusted when he was trying to flirt with her. Therefore, she got up and left. Ben simply placed his head down.

Metal in a Microwave. Joey wanted to see what happened if you put metal in a microwave. He put a metal spoon in and turned it on. Sure enough, it started sparking and zapping all over the place! Unfortunately for Joey, his parents also heard the commotion. After seeing what was happening, they grounded him for three days.

Operation Table. Stew loved the game operation. He was just so bad at it. He couldn't grab anything without the buzzer going off. Stew grew up to be heart surgeon. He loves it because humans don't have buzzers.
Crayons. Billy had a box of crayons. There were many red crayons and no blue crayons He asked Sally if she would lend him a blue crayon. She said yes. Together they colored their pictures.
Philip Got Punched. Philip hid behind a bush. A friend walked by the bush. Philip jumped out of the bush to scare his friend. His friend punched Philip in fear. Philip fell on the ground.
The earthquake. Jeb was bored at home. He decided to make an earthquake. He shook the kitchen table. Everything fell down and broke. Jeb was so sad that he never played earthquake again.

The Train Delay. Bob's car broke down. He decided to take the light rail train. Bob had never taken the light rail before. He accidentally boarded the wrong train, an Amtrak. He ended up in North Dakota.

Cells. Bobby learns about cell splitting in science class. In his textbook it shows the process with pictures. He finds it amusing that it makes him think of a venn diagram. When he tells his teacher this they work on a funny joke together. The next week in class they show off a diagram of cells dividing.

Glass down. Two friends drank beer at an overlook in a park. One friend finished a beer and looked at the bottle. He stood at the edge and threw it into the distance. A faint shattering sound was heard. The other friend shook his face in disgust.

Family Vacation. The Walden family decided to visit the hoover dam. It was their first vacation in Years. When they got close there was a road-block. Bad weather had closed off the area for days. They had to turn around and cut their vacation short.

Megan Makes A Fire. Megan decides her campsite will be nicer with a fire. She decides to make one. She gathers sticks and brush to make the fire. Finally she makes a nice and well controlled campfire. Megan is glad that her campsite is warmer now.
Lost Game. Carl was playing video games. He had not saved in a while. All of a sudden lightning struck. It took out the electricity in Carl's house. He lost all the work he had recently done.

Thanks for the Pictures. Joe brought his camera to the wedding. He took many great pictures. He sent the pictures to the couple. The couple offered to pay Joe for the pictures. Joe refused to be payed for the pictures.

David loses his wife. David gets terrible news one day. His wife tells him she has cancer. David breaks down and cries. He supports her day and night while she fights cancer. Eventually she dies from the cancer and David loses his wife.

Cheap Frames. Jan was driving when a lens popped out of her eyeglasses. Suddenly the road before her looked alarmingly blurry. She slowed down and carefully pulled out of traffic. Feeling around on the floor, she was fortunate to find the lens. She carefully popped it back in and was able to get home safely.

New Job. Erica recently lost her job. She felt very upset about it. She spent several hours per day applying to new jobs. Eventually she got an interview at a great company. Erica's interview went well and she was hired.

Chris. Chris was a very kind and respectful boy. He always did the right thing and he loved to draw. His drawings were some of the best anyone had ever seen. One day he drew a huge picture to enter into a contest. The picture was so good, it won the whole competition!

I'm Not A Cry Baby. Patricia hated when her mother and father argued. She would cry every time they fought. She was sixteen when her cousin told her stop being a cry baby. Patricia agreed she was tired of crying. Now she has a hard time showing emotion to her boyfriend.

The Sunburn. Landon's ninth birthday party is a huge success. He and his friends have been playing on the huge water slide. It's so much fun, they don't even stop to reapply sunscreen. Later that night, a sunburn can be seen on his face and shoulders. Landon realized that mom really does know what's best!
Partner. John worked at a law firm. They decided not to make him partner. He decided to quit. He went to work for a new firm. The new firm made him partner!

Drive Away!. Today was the day for Martha to learn to get her driver's license! She woke up feeling super nervous. She had been practicing with her parents for several months. She arrived to the testing feeling anxious but confident. After a few short hours, she walked away with her license!
They all ditched him. Carl had planned to eat with friends. He ordered a pizza. He was quite excited. However, all his friends bailed. So Carl was sad eating pizza alone.

Do the Right Thing. Michael was in love with his brother's girlfriend Marta. Michael's brother Gob was out of town for business. Marta asked Michael to accompany her to an awards ceremony. Michael reluctantly turned her down. Michael felt better because he had done the right thing.

Buying a cell phone. One day my cell phone stopped working. I went to the local phone store. I looked over different styles of phones. I bought a nice looking smartphone. I went home and played with it.
Garden. Otis loved fresh tomatoes. This year he decided to grow his on. He planted the seeds and watered them. Every day he removed the weeds. In July, Otis had delicious fresh tomatoes.

Jan pays rent. Jan is a manager at KFC. She works very hard for her money. Lately she has been so stressed about losing her trailer. She cannot pay the rent this month without overtime. Jan asks for more hours to cover rent and she gets it.

Skip has dreams. Skip always had a passion for singing. He would listen and dream of being a big star. Skip wanted to try but was very nervous. A talent show was coming up in skip's town. He decided to face his fears and sing for the crowd.

Dad's Secret Profession. Jake's favorite sport was basketball. He played on the school team in the 4th, 5th, and 6th grade. Yesterday, he looked through his dad's old basketball trading cards. Jake was surprised when his dad's name was on the card. Jake's dad had his own basketball card when he was a professional.

The Pillow. Todd had a special pillow that he loved sleeping with. He went on vacation and forgot to pack his pillow. Todd tried sleeping with the pillow at the hotel. He had trouble falling asleep. The next day, Todd had to go to the store to find a better pillow.

First Football Game. Teddy never had played football. I explained the rules of the game Teddy. He really wanted to try playing football. We got some people together at the park and played football. Teddy had fun and scored the winning touchdown.

Falling in the Handstand. I tried to learn how to hold a handstand. But, I kept falling. Then, my coach told me to do the handstand against the wall. She told me I had to learn how to hold the position before balancing. The wall worked great and taught me the technique I needed to master!

The Flu Shot. The woman didn't want to catch the flu. She got a flu shot from her doctor. She hoped it would keep her healthy all winter. In January, her body started aching. She had caught the flu anyway!

Grass In The Bed. Gina had used her parents bedspread for a picnic. It had been outside in the back yard. It looked clean to her, so she put it back on the bed. Later her mother found grass on the bed spread. Gina was scolded for using things without asking.

Nervous Mom. Marie was proud to bring her new boy to meet his grandparents. She was also nervous bringing the toddler to their fancy home. Marie watched as the little boy eyed his grandma's curios. She felt more relaxed when they sat down to supper. Then, the toddler reached and grasped the butter in his hand.

Saint Patrick's Day. Our two year old granddaughter is in day care. Today they celebrated Saint Patrick's Day. They put green hats and green shamrocks on the kids. Her father took a video of her walking, wearing the hat and shamrock. We thought it was cute.
Dust. Kim's room was filled with dust. She had dust on her desk. And cobwebs in the the corners. But she was too lazy to clean it up. She became sick and decided to get a dust cleaner.
Popcorn. Sally wanted popcorn. She went to the kitchen and put some in the microwave. She timed it as normal. While she waited, she put her laundry in. Her popcorn burned and Sally cried.

Ninety Years Old. Marilyn was turning ninety years old. She thought that her old family and friends forgot. Marilyn went down to the community room at her nursing room. Her friends surprised her with a party in the community room. It was the best birthday Marilyn had in her ninety years.

Hot Water. I told Elena to avoid touching the pot. She was shaking her head and walked toward the pot. As soon as she grabbed it, the pot splashed water on top of her head. She was crying because the hot water gave her a headache. I placed a bag of ice on her head in order to cool it down.

Bad Donuts. When Bill is in college he loves Dunkin' Donuts. They always have coupons. He can get a dozen Boston Creme donuts for almost nothing. But one day he gets a bad batch that makes him violently sick. Bill never returns to Dunkin' Donuts again.

Right Racquet. Rob was a competitive tennis player. So he spent lots of time looking for the right racquet. But every time he lost, he blamed his racquet. So he never stopped obsessing over finding the right one. Eventually, Rob stopped playing tennis.
Taxes. Martin was doing his taxes. He was concerned about all the write offs. He decided not to waste anymore time. He paid everything in full. He was relaxed though and that's all that mattered.

Bad consequence. Drew came home but he was shivering. My mom asked him for his report card. He slowly gave it to her. While being disappointed, she was aggravated. She told Drew and I to prepare our own dinner.

Friend of a Friend. Kate's friend Tom was in a band. She went to see them play. She thought his friend Jake was hot. They caught eyes but got lost in the crowd. She figured she would never see him again.

Domestic Violence. Char had been in a violent relationship for years. Her boyfriend regularly beat her. She was desperately looking for a way out, so she packed. She took all her things to a hotel. She stayed at the hotel and never went back to the house.
The Cops. Nora was running down the alley. The cops were after her! She had stolen money from a store. She knew it was wrong but she was desperate. Nora was determined to get away.

Prayer. William attended Sunday church service with his family. The pastor droned on with the service. William rolled his eyes. When the pastor asked the congregation to pray, William snickered. His mother elbowed him in the side.

Puppy Race. John and Eric both had six month old puppies. They each argued that their puppy was the best. They decided to race them to see who could run fastest. The only problem was they just wanted to play! So they finally agreed that both puppies were the best.

Movie Night. Tim loved watching movies. He decided to have a movie night at his house. He invited friends over once a night. Everyone got to vote on a selection of movies to watch. It was a fun tradition that lasted a while.

Turning The Drone Against Him. Craig was an engineer for a technology company. He invented a drone that could stream live video on the Internet. The media reported on the new drone. One person bought a drone and used it to spy on Craig. A website was made to watch Craig twenty four hours a day.

Holy Frame. Jane was in her backyard cutting the grass. There was a bird perched on the window frame to her bedroom. The bird was pecking at the wood creating a hole. She shooed the bird to discover a large hole in the frame. She had to admit she had no idea how to fix this.

Golf. My uncle really liked playing golf. He went to the golf course every day to practice. He learned new tricks and got better and better. Unfortunately, he lost his sight recently and can't golf anymore. But he still enjoys going and hear people cheering during a game.

The Miscalculation. Robbie was driving through the countryside. He ran out of gas along the way. He pushed his car to the side of the road. He called his parents to come bring him gas. They finally came after several hours.

The Book. Bart was flipping pages excitedly. He was in the middle of a great new book. He read until he got to the last page. He ran to the store to see if they had the sequel. He bought it and ran home to start reading.

Arranging the place cards. Daniel was setting up for Thanksgiving dinner. She needed to arrange place cards for everyone. At first she put her brother and uncle near each other. Then, her sister warned her that the two had been fighting. She managed to change the arrangement right before they arrived.
Dog. Tom loved dogs. Tom wanted to own a dog. Tom researched every type of dog. Tom decided the Chihuahua was his favorite. Tom bought a Chihuahua dog.

Trading Lunches. Sandy's mom packed her a ham sandwich for lunch again. Frannie had a cheese sandwich that looked much better. She offered to trade her sandwich for Frannie's. Frannie agreed and they swapped. The were both happy with the trade.

An Unexpected Rodent. A woman took her dog the park to play fetch. For a while, everything was absolutely normal. But then, she threw the stick a little too far. It landed in the bushes. The dog came back with a live, but very angry, squirrel.

Game Night. The Anderson family has game night on Tuesdays. They couldn't decide which game to play. They narrowed it down to Monopoly or Life. The Anderson family decided to take a vote. They ended up voting three to two for Monopoly.

Unsweetened. Lilian bought some fancy chocolate on her way from work. She was ready to taste it when she saw it was unsweetened. Disheartened, she threw the chocolate away. A vagrant man took it to taste it. He threw the chocolate away too after spitting it.

Graduation. It was time for Tim to graduate from 5th grade. He knew he was going to miss all of his friends. He decided that he did not want to graduate. His mother had a long talk with him about moving on. Tim reluctantly agreed to graduate from 5th grade.

Kobe's Last Game. Andy is an avid Los Angeles Lakers fan. Andy was glad when his friend Paul invited him to a game. Unbeknownst to Andy, it was going to be Kobe's last game. Andy was in awe of Kobe the entire time he was on the court. Andy was so glad he could see Kobe's last game.

The Passports. The couple was going to take a trip. They renewed their passports. They waited a long time for them to arrive. When they did, they got even more excited. THey hadn't left the country in years!
Boston Trip. One day Jordan took a day trip to Boston. First he went to the Freedom Trail. Then he went to Faneuil Hall. Finally he went to New England Aquarium. He had a great time.

Army. When Mark was a child he always played army. He would run around the woods with his friends with toy guns. At 17, he decided to take the test and join the army. He waited for the results, and was admitted! Mark has been a soldier for 7 years now.

ADHD. Greta had noticed her son was having trouble focusing in school. Greta took her son to the doctor. The doctor diagnosed the boy with ADHD. The doctor prescribed medicine for him. Greta's son now focuses much better in class.

Bad Friends. Jesse had never been in trouble before. He started hanging out with a new group of friends. His friends broke into a house. Jesse was scared of getting arrested. He stopped hanging out with the friends.

The Fabric. The kids were sewing a quilt. They picked out their favorite fabric for it. They carefully cut the fabric into pieces. They began sewing and then noticed a problem. The fabric was too slippery to work with!
New lab gig. Tina loved biology. She wanted to be an intern. She wanted to intern for a bio lab. So she applied. To her delight she got it.

Fitness Competition. John woke up in the morning one day looked in the mirror. He was extremely unhappy with what he saw. Ever since the breakup, he had put on over 50 pounds. John made a vow then and there to get into the best shape of his life. Just over a year later, he won a prestigious fitness competition.

Gas and Money. Randy got a brand new car today. He drives it all around town, showing it off. His wife said that he is going to run out of gas soon. Randy agreed to only drive it when he needs to. Randy is now saving money on gas!

My new Sister. When I was 14 my parents got pregnant. A month after my 15th birthday, by sister was born. I was an only child up till that point. Being honest, not much had changed. I was old enough that it didn't even seem like I had a sibling.

Street of 3G. Ed found a mint condition iPhone in the gutter. He picked it up and took it home, expecting no one would be the wiser. Every night there'd be a call from an unidentified number at midnight. Ed decided he didn't really want the phone, after all. He put it back in the gutter where he found it.

Peanut butter and jelly. Sam made a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. He received a phone call and stepped into the other room. When he got back, his sandwich was gone. Sam looked around and saw his dog. His dog was eating his sandwich.

Tickets in Texas. Adam was on his way to Florida. He was driving through Texas in the middle of December. It was three in the morning when he saw the lights behind him flash. The blue and red lit up his car as he pulled over. The cop gave him a ticket for going two miles over the speed limit.

Moses Went to Church. Moses went to church in the morning. He thought that the pastors sermon was boring. He fell asleep during the sermon. The pastor saw Moses sleeping. The pastor asked Moses for his input on the sermon.

Bathing suit. Kate went to the store looking to buy a bathing suit. She found one she liked and asked for opinions from friends. They all seemed to like it and so she bought it! She got home and took the tags off to try it on one more time. She tried it on and was very disappointed that it didn't fit her.

The Wholesale Club. Alex had a membership at a wholesale club. Over the year, he had barely visited the club. The membership was up for renewal. Alex felt like the fifty dollars was a waste of money. Alex didn't renew his membership.

The New Kid. Nick started at a new school today. He was looking for someone to sit with at lunch. None of the other children would let Nick sit with them. Lucy felt bad for Nick. Lucy let Nick sit by her and eat.

Football Pals. John and Gary were always football friends. After growing up, they kept in touch in the NFL season. Both had different teams they followed. Even so, they got together each Sunday. Football continued to bring John and Gary together.

Babysitting nightmare. Kelly was asked by her neighbors to come babysit. Kelly liked babysitting but the kids were unruly. They were always crying and whining. When Kelly arrived the kids were unbearable. Thankfully they ended up calming down after a snack.

A Used Car. Marissa was buying a used car. She got her boyfriend to check out the car. There were several things wrong with the car. He told her it was not worth buying the car. Marissa looked elsewhere for a car.
Tyler's huge mistake. Tyler is learning to drive. While pulling out of the driveway he hits something. He looks to see what he hit. He had hit the family dog. The family dog died.

Marco Makes His Bed. Marco noticed that his bedroom felt very messy. He realized that he had gotten out of the habit of making his bed. He decided to start making his bed every morning. It made his bed look much neater. Marco loved having a less messy bedroom.

New Shoes. Sam was walking down the road. As she was walking down the sidewalk, her heel got stuck in the grate. She was not able to pull it out. She had to rip the heel off. Sam then had to buy a new pair of shoes.

Off to the Races. Jonas always desired to go to the races. He got tickets for his birthday. His father took him and his best friend. They all had a great time together. Jonas' favorite racer won the race too!

Rent. Alex and Dave did not pay their rent. Their landlord became annoyed. He kicked them out right when a blizzard was coming. Alex and Dave wandered the streets freezing. They finally were relieved to find a hotel to stay in for the night.
Celebrity sighting. Allie went to the mall with her friend. All the sudden they saw a celebrity. Allie was star struck. She went up to talk to him. He gave her his autograph.

The Long Bike Ride. Brett met a new friend at work who invited him to for a bike ride. Brett wasn't in shape but figured they would only go for a short ride. They went to a park Brett thought was pretty small. After a half hour he asked his friend how long the ride would take. Brett found out he was doomed to a four hour round trip.

Ticket. Barney had tickets to take his dad to a USC football game. On gameday, they drove around the stadium looking for a parking spot. Barney's dad saw a parking space but worried whether it was legal. Barney decided to park in the questionable parking spot. After the game, Barney found an expensive parking ticket on his car.

Rent Money. Jenna had no money to pay her rent. Her boyfriend Bill suggested they have a garage sale to raise money. They worked all week gathering and cleaning items for the sale. A lot of people showed up at the garage sale to buy things. Jenna made over $1,500 and could pay all her bills.

The Rain. It had been hot for five days. Kate was tired of the heat and humidity. She went to sleep irritated and hot. At 4 AM she was awakened by the sounds of rain and a breeze. She was relieved to see the heat had finally broke.
Fake. Janet was talking to Matt. Matt commented on her looks. She felt flattered and tried to touch her eyebrow. It ended up falling out. Matt became disgusted.

Final Moments. It was the graduation day from my discipleship school. A guy that I fell in love with there came to hug me. When he hugged me I felt one with him. As I sat down, he looked at me and leaned in to kiss me on the cheek. It was the most pure experience I have ever had.

Kitty Keeper. Brenda found a kitten outside of her house. So she decided to bring it inside. She couldn't find a collar or an owner. So she decided to keep it. Brenda was happy with this unexpected gift.
Sleep. Greg could not sleep. He kept tossing and turning. He got up and went to read a book. This tired him even more. He fell asleep.

Mechanic. Jay wanted to be a mechanic. He signed up for auto class in senior year. He learned all kinds of things. After he graduated, he found work at a garage. He was so skilled, he got his first raise in under a month!

Too Many Dogs. Max was the family dog. Everyone was saddened to find out he had terminal cancer. The only way to ease the pain was to get another dog immediately. Max and the puppy got along well although Max only had a year to live. Max did so well with the puppy that he lived another six years.

George visits the comic book store. George went to the comic book store. He wanted to buy a new issue of his favorite comic book. While he has there, he noticed a new issue of another book he liked. George decided to get both issues. George hurried home to read his new comic books.

Rick Nick and the Bee. Rick and Nick were at the park with daddy. Something flew past Rick's face. Rick grabbed the flying thing. Daddy was upset when he saw Rick had killed a bee. Daddy took the boys and went back home.
Painting. Kelly wanted to give her house a makeover. She decided to paint the bedroom. She moved the furniture away from the walls. Then she painted the walls very carefully. The new color was great!

Food. Roy loved to eat food at diners. One day he ate rotten food at a diner. He called the chef over and complained. The chef gave him a free meal to satisfy him. Now Roy has a full meal of good food to eat.

Climate Change. There was a guy who kept saying that humans can't change the world. He meant that quite literally, that nothing we did had any effect. He said releasing millions of years of stored carbon was fine. He was sure that industrial accidents fixed themselves. Everyone just shook their heads at his crazy ideas.

Cancelled. Will had a hot date one night. Just as he was stepping into the shower, his power went out. Will was irked by being unable to get ready for the date. Will called the girl and cancelled the date. Will went out with some buddies, knowing his stink didn't bother them!

Parade. I walked with my sister to the parade early in the morning. We found a spot to stand right on the curb. When the parade started, the marchers threw candy toward us. Both of us scrambled and collected ten pieces of candy each. We considered it a successful parade day.

Mexican Restaurant. Family went out one evening for Mexican food. Mom had fajitas, her favorite. Dad liked enchiladas the best, and got her to try them. The kids didn't like tacos, but the restaurant had chicken strips. They all had a fantastic time!
Lost. Tasha is going to visit a friend. She buys a map so she won't get lost. Tasha doesn't understand the map. She is lost for 3 hours. After getting advice from a local, she is now on her way.

New Printers. Judy had just bought a new printer for her computer. When she tried to hook it up it didn't work. Despite her best efforts she just couldn't get it to work. Judy had to buy a new computer anyway so that's what she did. The new printer wound up working great with her new computer.

Dress Code. In 1982 I worked in a small office. There was no written dress code but I was business casual. One day a coworker came in wearing shorts and a t-shirt. The manager sent him home to change. The company published a dress code a week later.
A baby's fall. Graham was just learning to walk. He was holding onto a coffee table. Then, he began carefully gliding along the table. Suddenly, he tripped. He fell over and began to cry.
Frozen Food. Lucy bought some frozen food. On a way home she met a friend. They talked for a long time. Lucy's food melted. She ran home to put it into the freezer.

Friends of Mine. Briana runs a small successful company. She keeps productivity high by only hiring her friends. She found another path to success by giving talks. Briana can stymie the competition in a subtle way. She shames them into not just hiring their friends.

Affair in Storage Room. Our office building had a huge storage room. It was used for government documents and was locked. There was a rumor couples used that room to have sex. 5 years after I retired a co worker posted she used the room. I was shocked.

Ultrasound. Our daughter is pregnant with her second child. Last week she went for an ultrasound. She sent us the image. We put it up against the first child's ultrasound in out photo album. My wife is very excited.

Running out of time. The cashier began to scan the food for Joe the customer. Joe was impatient but it seemed to be going quickly. Joe saw the bag boy slowly attempt to put all the food in one bag. Joe was mad as he saw the bag boy take out the food and start over. Joe snatched the bags from the bag boy and stormed out of the store.

Jogging at the park. Mary was a pretty girl, and she knew it. When she jogged at the park, she always wore skimpy clothes. She liked having all the boys stare at her. One day though, an old man made a rude comment to her. After that, Mary wore more appropriate clothing.

Abandoned Home. My friends and I were exploring my neighborhood. We found an abandoned house. It was very unkempt. We cleaned up the outside as best as we could. The local newspaper wrote a story about our good deed!
secret. Ava got her navel pierced. She vowed to keep it a secret from her mom. But her piercing became red and swollen. It had gotten infected! Ava had to tell her mom so her mom could help her.

The Horse. Dusseldorf always wanted to own a horse. One sunny day, he got dressed and set off to a nearby stable. When he arrived, the stable owner told him horses were for sale. Dusseldorf loved the color brown, so bought one of the brown horses. As the sun was setting, the owner waved to Dusseldorf as he rode away.

Imaginary Boat. Tonya and Lisa's parents hired a babysitter and went out on a date. Tonya and Lisa were sound asleep when their parents came home. Their mom woke them up to tell them they had bought a boat. The girls excitedly ran to the window to see the new boat. As dad was tucking them in he told them mom had had too much to drink.

Waitress. When I was a teenager, I broke my wrist. A few years later, I started working in a restaurant. I couldn't bear the weight of a full tray of drinks on my wrist. A family came in and ordered 12 Pepsis. I spilled them all on the father's lap.
Broken arm. Fred loved trees. He decided to climb one. When he did he got stuck. Then he fell out. He broke his arm.

Lost Tooth. Nancy lost a tooth. When she went to put it under her pillow it had disappeared. She wrote a note to the Tooth Fairy explaining the situation. The Tooth Fairy left her a note that she had found it. She left 50 cents under Nancy's pillow as well.

Bad Dog. Kara was walking with her headphones in one day. She wasn't watching where she was going. She bumped into a very big dog on accident. The dog started to growl and bark at her. Luckily the owner came out and stopped the dog from attacking.

Flee. Derek went to the technology store. He ran across a new laptop on sale. He tried out the flip screen on the computer. It was able to turn around however, it ended up breaking apart. Derek ended up running away from the store.

Bad Skyler. Skyler could play many musical instruments well. She decided to stop by the music store. She picked up a saxophone and began to play it loudly. The store manager frowned at her and shook his head. Skyler put down the saxophone and headed toward the drums.

Dog's Behavior. Chad's dog would always jump on people. Chad couldn't bring his dog anywhere. Chad decided to hire a dog trainer. The trainer taught the dog how to behave. Chad was proud to finally show off his dog to others.

Too many kids. Allie was expecting children. She assumed that she would be having twins. But she found out she was having four kids. Allie could not believe it. She then did not know what she was going to do.

Saving a cookie. Julian and his family were making Christmas cookies. He made one cookie that looked like his guitar. He was really proud of it and didn't want to eat it. Instead, his mom found a cool spray that would preserve it. Then, she hung it on a string and made an ornament.
The Old Man. There was an old man on a bench. He smelled so bad that he made people gag. One old lady asked him if he was okay. He didn't answer so she shook him. The man was dead.

Computer. McDonald had always wanted a computer. The only issue was they were very expensive. McDonald decided to save his money. After many months, McDonald had enough money. Now, McDonald owns a computer and he is happy.
new kid. Ella was the new girl in school. At first everyone looked at her strangely. No one spoke to her. Then at recess, she introduced herself. The kids started to play with her.
bored. Jim was very bored. He watched some tv and called his friend. Apparently there was a party. He went there but it was boring. He went back home.

Fire. Tim lit a cigarette before bed one night. He fell asleep before he finished smoking it. When he woke, he saw that it had fallen onto the rug. There, it had burned a deep hole. Tim knew he was lucky he hadn't caused a house fire.
Dive Bar. Tom went out drinking with friends. They picked a small local dive bar. Tom felt uncomfortable there. Some of the regulars talked bad things about him. Tom went home early.

Terrible Name. Tim hated his name growing up. Everyone made fun of him for it. He decided to change it when he was old enough. Tim picked a new name that was even worse. People made even more fun of him.

A Towel. Kate's mom didn't want the basement windows open. She could feel the cold air from the basement in the kitchen. Kate put a towel at the bottom of the door to keep the cold out. She opened the windows in the basement again. Her mother never knew she had opened the windows again.
