Stripes. Bob had a healthy head of hair. He decided to put stripes in his hair with hydrogen peroxide. He had dark hair, so the blond stripes would be very apparent. He took a few hours to do it just right. His hair drew a lot of attention when walking through town.

Lunch. I had lunch with my two high school friends. We graduated in 1971. One friend told us his wife and he were separating. We were sad and tried to cheer him up. He was still down when we ended our lunch.

Snowstorm 5. When the roads cleared slightly, I made it down the street to a lot. I went inside the big chain store. I purchased a comforter. I went back to my car and tried to get some sleep. I woke up when an employee told me to leave.
diving. Ana went on vacation to the tropics. She wanted to scuba dive. She took a PADI course. Then she got her certificate. Now Ana could scuba dive!

Blown Surprise. Frank decided to cook his wife a special dinner. He went to the store and picked up the ingredients. He came home and prepared the dinner. His wife called and said she would be running later than usual. Frank ate dinner alone and was sad the surprise was ruined.
Loud Birds. Tom moved out to the country. He noticed a lot of loud birds nearby. They would make a lot of noise at night. Tom had trouble sleeping at first. After a while he got used to the sounds.

The tribe. The adventurer trekked deep into the jungle. He was looking for a lost tribe of natives. He keenly searched for many days and nights. One night he heard drums in the distance. The next day he followed the sound and found the tribe!

Disappearing Bagels. Ed put a bagel on the table. He went to the refrigerator to get some cream cheese. When he got back to the table, the bagel was gone. He put another one on the table. He hid around the corner only to find his dog stealing the bagel.

Larry passes on. Larry is living with cancer. He was told he had days to live. He spent his last days surrounded by friends and family. Larry was enjoying his last moments on earth. The next day he passed away.

Temptation. Cara had been faithful to her boyfriend tommy. They had been together for 2 years. Never once did they cheat on each other. One night Cara met up with an ex boyfriend Richard. She still had feelings for him and was all alone with Him.
No Fork. Sean ordered a salad at a drive thru restaurant. The worker forgot to give Sean a fork. Sean drove back to the restaurant. He walked into the restaurant. Sean got a fork from the counter.

Eating Fish. Tom wanted to be healthy. He read online about meat being unhealthy. He read about fish being the healthiest meat. Tom decided to only eat meat if it was fish. Tom felt his health improve.

Emily Visits France. Emily had always dreamed of a vacation to France. She saves up her money for many Years for the trip. Finally the day arrives for Emily's big trip. She enjoys many delicious cheeses on her trip. When Emily gets home she is happy she had the trip of her dreams.
poison ivy. Tim was in the woods hiking one day. He fell into a patch of greenery. At first he wasn't worried. Then he saw the red rash on his arms. Tim had fallen into poison ivy!

Safe Water. Linda was drinking bottled water. But she thought that it tasted weird. She sent a sample to a lab. And the results showed that it was perfectly safe to drink. Linda was too suspicious and threw all of her bottled water away.

Breakdown. Alexa was married and a mother of 3 children. Her oldest was diagnosed with autism and he gave her a hard time. Alexa handled his behavior alone because her husband didn't help her. After 6 years of doing it all alone she became extremely overwhelmed. Unfortunately,she had a breakdown and ended up in a psyche ward.

Coffee. My niece lives in Brighton and works in Revere. She does not drive and takes mass transit. It is a ninety minute commute. Today she posted a photo of herself drinking a large coffee. I think she needs it for the daily grind.

Carpenter. Lewis had always wanted to be a carpenter. It had been a dream ever since he was a kid. One day, he decided to do well in school. After succeeding, he was able to get a degree. Now, Lewis is a carpenter and he is happy.

Diet. I decided I wanted to change my appearance for the better. I researched diets and weight control. Online I discovered and ordered the perfect Green Diet. I changed my eating habits with the Green Diet four months ago. I lost thirty pounds and look healthy good.
The Puppet Show. Lynette had designed a puppet show. It was supposed to teach kids about bullying. She asked a lot of schools if she could come to them. They all said no. Lynette felt so discouraged!

Aquaman. Ed and Emma were twins and wanted to have matching Halloween costumes. But they couldn't agree on a costume! Ed wanted to be a superhero and Emma wanted to be a mermaid. Then their mom said she could make costumes that'd please them both. Oh Halloween she have them matching costumes - Aquaman costumes!

Allie's birthday party. Allie was turning ten Year's old today. For her party, her parents rented out the bowling alley. Once her friends arrived, the girls started to bowl. Allie's team lost and she became upset. However Allie felt all better when she opened gifts.

tired. Elbert was very tired one morning. On his way to work, he stopped at a gas station. He ran in and selected a caffeinated energy drink. He drank it all before he got to work. The drink helped Elbert stay awake easily all day!

Mary rides the bus. Mary needs to go to the store. She does not have a car and the store is too far to walk. Mary remembers that she has a bus ticket. Mary catches the bus before it leaves. Mary arrives at the store thanks to the bus.
Late to Practice. Tommy was at basketball practice. He got to practice late. The coach didn't allow tardiness. Tommy had to run laps. Tommy made sure not to be late again.

Bad Reaction. My cousin brought me a burrito. I decided to eat it although it was spicy. Several minutes later, I had stomach pain. When it became intolerable, I went to the bathroom. I remained in the bathroom for several minutes.

Wrong Change. Bob bought Chinese food from a restaurant near his house. He realized that he got too much change when he got home. He drove back to the restaurant. He handed the extra amount to the cashier. As a compliment, he received a coupon for a free meal next time.
Ouch. Susie went to the doctors. She needed a blood test done. Susie hated needles. She wanted this to be done with. Finally Susie got it done and screamed.

Sandwich. John made a sandwich. As he went to eat it, he got a phone call. John laid his sandwich on the table. When he came back, all he found was crumbs. John looked around and saw his dog eating his sandwich.
The Bus. He had hardly any money left. He had no job. He had nowhere to go. He would sit on the city bus for hours in order to waste time. Something soon would change, he told himself.

The Cheater. Ann was a teacher at a local school. One day she gave her students a test. She caught a student cheating on the test. She sent the student to the office. She picked up the student's test and gave him an F.
The Dog Park. Sam took his dog to the dog park. He was having fun at first. Then another dog started trying to attack it. Sam had to intervene. He took his dog home.

The Jester. A king saw three drinks. He asked his court jester to try each of them. The jester keeled over on the second drink. The king asked who had prepared the drinks. The king had the queen's mother killed.

Horses. Amanda really wanted to take horseback riding lessons. However, her mom could not afford it, since it was expensive. Amanda decided she needed to find a way to pay for it. She asked her future instructor what she could do. The instructor told her to work at the barn and she could get lessons.

Not Here. Gina wanted to find her her stolen pencils. She was searching a boy names Dave's desk. But the pencils weren't there. She was alone and needed to look fast. When she heard the class coming she gave up her search.

Remorse. Stan wanted to play a prank on a colleague. He placed his colleague's stapler in jello. When his colleague arrived, he was upset. The colleague was upset as the stapler was a present. Stan felt bad so cleaned it up for him.

Ugly Picture. Tom was going to take his yearbook picture. It was his senior year so he tried to look good. Unfortunately the photographer took it while he was making a face. Tom wound up looking weird and creepy in his picture. He asked them to change it but they couldn't.

John's Chip Dilemma. John had just finished eating an entire bag of chips. He looked down at the empty bag in disgust. He knew he had to make better snacking choices. John started making a list of healthier choices. He wrote Shopping List at the top of the paper.

Lunch box. Little Johnny wanted a new Star Wars lunch box. He asked his mom to go to the store. He picked out a new one with chewbacca on it. He thought it was so awesome and couldn't wait to show his friends. He was so pumped to bring in his new lunch box to school tomorrow.

A life worth living. Patricia felt her life had no meaning. She felt her life was in a rut and endless. She decided to start new hobbies and make new friends. Patricia started to find herself looking forward to her new hobbies. A few weeks later, Patricia felt she had meaning in her life.

Leaving everything behind. Ariadna was ten when she left the USSR. She hid with her family in a boat to reach Western Canada. The journey was fraught with danger. But when they arrived a new life opened for her. She settled in Quebec with her family and still lives there.

Low Bank Account. Tim thought he had a certain amount of money. He decided to make sure before going out. Tim checked his account online. It was actually much lower than he thought. Tim decided not to go out.

Michelle's Dream. For her whole life, Michelle dreamed of having kids. When she turned 23, she got married. After being married for 2 years, she learned she was pregnant. She worked very hard on the nursery for the new baby. Once the baby came, she was very happy and couldn't wait to get it home.

The house volunteer. Lexi decided to join Habitat for Humanity. She immediately got to work on a small house. It took weeks to finish the place. When they finally finished, they gave the keys to a family in need. Lexi felt so good helping someone in need.

Sue Buys A Chair. Sue was looking for a new office chair. Her current one hurt her back. She went to her local Staples. She tried various chairs. She purchased a black office chair with great back support.

plastic mold. There was a scientist who wanted to collect bacteria samples. The samples needed to be put somewhere. The guy grabbed a plastic mold to put them in. The bacteria were then examined in a microscope. The bacteria was non harmful.

Tight Fight. Tom was going cave diving. He had never been claustrophobic before. Once down there things changed, though. After a while Tom started having trouble breathing. He had to be helped back out.

Leftovers. Don had leftover pizza in his refrigerator. But he wasn't sure if it was still safe to eat. The thought of throwing it away made him feel guilty. So he decided to finish it all for dinner. After having a terrible headache, Don't regret eating the leftovers.
Internet. Gene liked the internet. She payed a lot of money for it. One day it went out. She was not able to work. She called the company and got a discount.

Final Exam. Byron showed up at a room at 4 for his final exam. The room was empty. Byron double-checked his class schedule. The exam was scheduled to end at 4, and start at 1. Byron wrote a rueful email, begging mercy from the teacher.
Chemical. The scientist was doing his experiment. He mixed chemicals. They weren't supposed to be mixed. They caused an explosion. The scientist and his lab burned down.

Keeping Out Cold Drafts. I kept cold drafts out this winter by covering the windows. I measured the windows to see what size plastic I needed. I cut the plastic with a knife to fit the windows. I taped and stapled the plastic to the windows. Using plastic is how I kept the cold drafts out this winter.

The pain. Every time I bit down on something I felt a sharp pain. I made an appointment with the dentist. He told me I needed to have my tooth removed. The tooth was pulled and I felt much better. The dentist told me to lay off of the sweets.

Swimsuit. The girl tried on a bathing suit. She felt like it was too revealing. She asked for something with more material. The store owner brought her a one piece swimsuit. The girl felt more comfortable in that swimsuit.

Jim Waches His Brother Play Basketball. Jim was late to his brother's basketball game. He rushed in and out of traffic. He made it with 5 minutes to spare. Jim saw his brother take the last shot with seconds left. His brother scored to win the game.
Bad Cramps. Tina was having her period. She got incredibly moody. Her boyfriend hadn't realized. Tina blew up on him throughout the day. Her boyfriend got her midol for her cramps.
Walking Barefooted. Wendy was walking outside barefooted. She felt something under her foot. It was a piece of metal. The metal had cut her foot. Wendy went to the doctor for a tetanus shot.
Sara's Cake. It was Sara's birthday. Sara's friends bought her a chocolate creme cake! Nobody knew Sara was allergic to chocolate. Sara ate a slice of the cake. She got very sick and threw up.

Bad but Good Sushi. I ended up going to a sushi restaurant that I've been to before. And I was surprised that the sushi chef there remembered who I was. But as I expected, the sushi wasn't that great. However, everyone there was really nice. I got free sushi too and left in a good mood.

Martha's Strict Parents. It was starting to get late outside. Martha was hanging at the movies with her friends. She had to get home by her 9 PM curfew. When Martha arrived back home, she was a couple of hours late. Her parents grounded her for a week for being late.

Thrift Store Rookie. Sue really wanted a new boots. But she couldn't afford them. So her friend brought her to a thrift store. Sue couldn't believe how cheap everything was. Now Sue shops at the thrift stores all the time.

Carousel Barker. No one was riding the carousel. That meant the barker wasn't making any money! He started the carousel even though no one was on it. The movement and music brought all the children near. Suddenly, his carousel was sold out!

Only Blue Pens. Ben went to the DMV to renew his registration. He grabbed paperwork and began to fill it out with a pencil. When he was done he waited in line. The DMV worker told Ben that his paperwork was invalid. She said that they only accept paperwork in blue pen.
Stuck on top. Allie went on the highest roller coaster. She wanted to go on it forever. Finally she took a seat on it. All of the sudden, she got stuck. They had to wait an hour to be rescued.

Mike Soiled His Diaper. Mike was a 28 year old man who wore diapers. Mike only wore diapers because he was to lazy to use the restroom. One day Mike was shopping at the mall when he smelled something bad. Mike soon realized he had soiled his adult size diaper. Mike immediately went home and changed his soiled diaper.

Rave. Olivia liked rave parties. But they were expensive to attend. She ended up spending all of her money on them. And she had to find another job. So one of her friends helped her get a job at a rave club.

The Dog Paw. Harold stepped back and admired his sidewalk. He'd done the concrete and it was perfect and smooth. The next morning, he walked by and saw a paw print in the cement! His dog had walked by and stepped right in it! Harold chuckled at his bad luck.

Grill. Mike went to light the grill. He thought the grill had become lit. When he went to check on it, it was not lit. When he re-lit it, it had been full of gas. A giant fire ball came up and almost burned his eyebrows.

Busted. Rob wasn't supposed to have Mortal Kombat. He traded a friend at school for the game. He was playing on Saturday when his mom came into his room. She yelled in anger when she saw the game. Rob's mom sold his Sega Genesis as a punishment.

Larry Tries Basketball. Larry was having a midlife crisis He decided it was time for a change He joined an adult basketball league Bill was pretty bad at basketball He decided basketball wasn't for him and dropped out of the league

Unsupportive. Lou had always wanted to play the guitar. Instead of buying lessons, he chose to teach himself how to play. After many months of trying, he became somewhat proficient. When he played for his friends, though, they said he was not too good. He has continued practicing since then.
Dog bite. Lucy saw the neighbor's dog yesterday. She went down to pat it. However to her surprise the dog jumped and bit her. Lucy screamed. She was then rushed to the hospital from the bite.

Cookies. Today I tried to make a new cookie recipe. The recipe was given to me by my grandmother. My grandmother and I used to make cookies together all the time. The cookies came out just like I remember. The smell of the cookies reminded me of my childhood.

Needing new glasses. Kelsi needed some new glasses. Things were getting difficult to see. She decided to go to the eye doctor to get checked. The doctor gave her a prescription. Kelsi then walked out with glasses.

Cats. My cousin bought a house that had a barn that was full of mice. She found an adoption service that places families of feral cats. A few weeks later, a cat family was released in her barn. The cat family keeps to itself and doesn't make a mess. There are no longer any mice in the barn.

Power Outage. Peg's workplace had been having power outages all morning. After hours the power was restored, and the computers were started. Peg unfortunately had to help a very rude customer. After several miserable minutes, her computer suddenly shut down. She had never been so grateful for a power outage.
Party love. Steven was really popular at his school. One day he got an invite to a party. He went to the party. In there he met a girl who he liked. They became boyfriend and girlfriend.

The Missing Tooth. John is 8 years old and was brushing his teeth. Suddenly John realized he was missing a tooth. John checked his mouth in the mirror. Indeed he was missing a tooth. John looked around and found his tooth on his pillow.
Not Done. The man flipped the hamburger. He didn't think it looked done. He left it that way. His wife looked at the hamburger. She complained that it wasn't done.
The Lock. Mike went to get his books out of his locker. He had forgotten the lock code. He wasn't able to open the lock. Mike had to get the janitor. The janitor cut off the lock.

Good report card. It was the end of the quarter at Amy's high school. Her father offered to help her buy a car if she got straight A's Amy rushed home to get her report card from the mail. To her delight she had an A in every class. Her father stuck to his word and took her car shopping.
New froyo place. Callie wanted to try the new froyo place. At first she was hesitant. But then she got a coupon. The coupon enticed her. When she came back, she wanted to go again.

The First Job. Larry was looking to get a car. In order to do that he would need a source of income. He decided to look for a job. He never worked one before, and so this was a new experience. He ended up being hired at FedEx.

Positive Attitude. The waitress served my food to me. However, an angry man approached us. He asked the waitress why she works there. In addition, he said he was disappointed in her. Luckily, she was patient and treated the man with respect.

School. Jenny was starting a new school in the morning. She was nervous she would not make friends. When she got to school, she was assigned to a homeroom. While there, she immediately met a new friend. Jenny knew this year would be fun.

Fussy Cat. Our cat had a feeding in the morning. Around 1 pm she was looking for another meal. I gave her shredded chicken. She usually loves that, but today turned her nose up. I called her the fussiest cat.

The autobiography. Chantel had a project for school. She had to make an autobiography. It was coming together very nicely. But, she needed some family history. She called her grandma and got some cool information.

Alex. Alex didn't write well, but he loved to read. He liked how he could immerse himself in fantasy worlds through books. His parents urged him to study other things. They worried he'd have a hard time finding a job. But Alex got hired right after school - as a book critic!

Wounded Bird. Emily is riding her bicycle home from school. She sees an injured bird on the ground. She picks him up and and takes him home. She nurses the bird back to health. It is a bittersweet moment when she watches him fly away.

Milk Trap. Gina's mom thought Gina lost her phone. She had texted her to get milk at a test. Gina had the phone, and picked up the milk. Her mother stared at her when she handed her the milk. Gina smiled as she walked to her room happy to have avoided the trap.

Painted Nails. Ed was still getting used to having two young stepdaughters. One day they asked him if they could paint his nails. He wanted them to like him so he agreed. He totally forgot about it when he went to bed. The next day he went to work with bright red fingernails!

Small Fire. Tim was trying to cook dinner. He was distracted by television. Before he knew it his food was on fire. Tim was able to address the situation in time. He took care of the small fire and cleaned up.

Career Pains. I was offered a new job with better pay and benefits. The only problem is the shift is on the weekends. My family doesn't want me to take the job. I tried to convince them it would be better in the long run. They wouldn't give in so I had to turn down the offer.

Dahlia. Dahlia was blind but it never seemed to get her down. The only thing that bothered her was being alone. She decided to meet another person who was blind. Ronald was blind as well and they both hit it off. The two remain very close and Ronald just proposed to Dahlia.

Raining at pick up. Some kids were outside of the school. They were waiting for their parents to pick them up. Suddenly, a hail storm began. All of the kids ran for cover. Finally, the parents showed up and the kids were out of the hail.

Grease Burn. Mary was frying food for dinner. She was a seasoned smoker who rarely burned herself. As she cooked, a large bit of grease popped out of the pan. The grease landed on her foot and burned her badly. A large cyst to formed on her foot which lasted for 3 days.

Irrigation. The irrigation system is not working. I check all of the valves but I'm unsure which one is out. I then decide to check the water level in the basement. I see that the water level has been turned off. I turn it on, and the irrigation system roars again.
Pouch. She needed a new makeup pouch. She found one at the discount store. It was silvery and glittery. She fell in love with it. She took it home to store her hair accessories.

Cartoon. Allen loved to watch cartoons. He watched cartoons almost every day. He watched so many cartoons that his eyes starting hurting. Allen rushed to the doctors immediately. The doctor told him that watching that much TV is damaging to the eyes.
Airplane Food. Tom was on vacation. He ate the food given on the airplane. Tom became sick that same night. It ruined his vacation. The air company refused to compensate him.
The Castle. The girl visited a castle in Ireland. It was very old and beautiful. She explored the walkways. She even peeked in the dungeon! She felt like a real princess that day.

Refreshing Yellow #3 Batch B. Alex was selling his lemonade left and right, fist over fist. He'd picked a spot by the other vendors so the cops wouldn't bug him. Alex was flustered when circumstances suddenly turned sour. All the people who'd drunk his lemonade had become violently ill. Alex wondered if something in the lemon pledge might be somehow toxic.

The Museum. The class was on a field trip. They went to the history museum. They learned about the dinosaurs and the Civil War. When they were finished, they went back to the bus. They talked about what they'd seen all day.
Tyler breaks his neck. Tyler is skating. Tyler is showing off. Tyler falls and lands on his neck. He is taken to the hospital. Tyler has a broken neck and needs time to heal.

Bill Dates Dumb Girls. Bill's friends point out that he only dates dumb girls. He disagrees and sets out to prove them wrong. So he starts dating a doctor. But he dumps her because they have nothing in common besides sex. Bill admits to his friends and himself that dumb girls are his type.

Late Notice. Brandon went to the mailbox. He opened an envelope that reminded him of an overdue book. He immediately drove to the library. The clerk researched his late payment. She said that the system made a mistake since he already gave the book

Tammy's Computer Skills. Tammy wanted to improve her typing. She practiced playing a typing game after school everyday. She eventually increased her word per minute dramatically. Tammy became really proficient in her computer skills. She was able to get a great job because of her computer skills.

Sleep. Tom couldn't sleep. He tried to take some sleeping pills but it did him no good. He then stayed up on the computer for two more hours. He figured this would make him tired enough. He fell asleep after that.

Lance. Lance had a farm in the North, but he was getting older. The snow bothered him and he wanted to move south. Lacking funds, he put his farm up for auction. When it sold, he used the proceeds to move to a southern farm. Lance ended up with a warm and sunny farm in Florida!
Grocery List. Sam was buying groceries. His wife gave him a list. Unfortunately he forgot it. He tried to get everything from memory. He forgot a bunch of things and annoyed his wife.

Mailbox Surprise. Dan recently had lost his wallet. Dan was sad, because his wallet had a picture of his deceased mom. Dan had given up hope to see the wallet or the picture again. One day, Dan checked the mail and saw a package mailed to him. Dan cried as he realized the package had his wallet and picture.
Basketball Foul. Gary had the ball. Billy wanted the basketball. Billy reached for it. He accidentally slapped Gary. Billy got ejected.

Nothing To Talk About. Gina and her cousin didn't get along. But they were both visiting their grandma's house at the same time. They sat on the porch and tried to have a conversation. But they couldn't find much to talk about. They sat on the porch in an awkward silence.

Worst Fear 2. As I stood back up, the groom fetched my missing shoe. Everyone joked about how it really was a Cinderella style wedding. I laughed and said the bride was supposed to lose her shoe, not me. The entire thing was caught on tape. They made me watch it and we all laughed after the wedding.

The Funeral. Jeremy was at his father's funeral. He had been able to hold it together for most of it. When it came time to speak he broke down. He was unable to stop crying. His friend and family tried to console him.[

A girl who loves to Dance. Denise had a dream to become a dancer. Her mom was practical and didn't want Denise to become a dance. Denise was determined to show her mom how good she was. Denise decided for the family get together. Denise was amazing, she changed her Mom's mind with her dance.

Sprinkles. Angela is taking care of her cat, Sprinkles. Sprinkles has a few ailments that have to be tended to. Sprinkles has been sick for months. Today, Angela thought that Sprinkles looked a little healthier. She is hoping for a big recovery.

Iron Cross. I was in gymnastics. The coach decided to teach me an iron cross. I felt I was too weak to perform one. But, my coach insisted that with hard work I could do it. Indeed, after a few months I mastered the iron cross.

Rafting. My scout troop organized a river rafting trip. I was afraid of going with them. I didn't want them to know I was afraid. My parents forced me to accompany them. It was great fun and I have been rafting twice since.

Holey jeans. Britt loved her holey jeans. They were trendy and looked cute. She decided to wear them to school. Little did she know they were against the dress policy. When she got to first period, she was immediately written up.

The Watch Shop. Ben's wristwatch had stopped working. He brought it to the local watch shop. They told him it was the oldest one they'd ever seen. A week later they called to say the work was complete. They gave him a hug and a peppermint paddy when he came to pick it up.

Dry Lawn. Jim's lawn seemed that it always needed to be watered. So Jim decided to replace his lawn with dirt. He called a landscaping company. And they told him the cost of having his lawn replaced. In the long run, Jim would save money by conserving water.
New Dress. Callie wanted a new dress. She knew her mom could not afford one. Callie decided to get a job. She finally saved up enough. Callie was excited to buy her dress.

A Hot Day. One summer day it was very hot and humid. No one in the town could keep cool. The sheriff sat in front of a fan all day. A bank robber took advantage of this and stole money. The sheriff made wanted posters and a plan to catch the crook.

Pants. Sara was at work one day and leaned over to pick up a pen. When she leaned over, her pants ripped slightly. She was so embarrassed and went to the restroom. Sara vowed to go on a diet to lose weight. She ended up losing 20 pounds and felt great.

Stay at Home Mom. Marcella and her husband had two children. She decided to stop working to take care of the kids. As the children got older, they needed Marcella less. Marcella decided she no longer wanted to be a stay at home mom. She went back to work as soon as possible.

The Security Camera. Jack lived in a bad neighborhood. He installed security cameras. He felt safer knowing they would deter criminals. Jack checked the cameras every day. He felt good about keeping his family safe.

Pool Day. Dan wanted to get some exercise in today. Dan decided he would go to the local pool and swim several laps. However, when Dan arrived he noticed the facility was closed. Dan decided he would go back home and exercise there. Dan was disappointed that he could not swim in the pool.

The test fail. Lauren wanted to go to a party. Her parents said that she needed to pass her English test first. She tried her best on the test. Unfortunately, she didn't pass. Her parents grounded her until she could improve her grades.

Talk Show. The talk show host made a speech. The audience wasn't interested in the topic. The host apologized to the audience. He changed the topic of the show right there. The audience applauded the host's bold move.

Chess. Andrew loved playing chess against his brother. Andrew's brother always beat Andrew. But Andrew was ready for his brother. Andrew went to his brothers house to play chess. Andrew finally beat his brother at chess.

Goo Rue Food. Albert was a weight loss guru. Millions had bought his books and believed in his vision. Albert devoured many, many calories for Thanksgiving. He got on the treadmill to run them off. He died of a heart attack on the last mile.

Doing the Exact Opposite. My mom tried to tell Anthony to throw away his food. Since Anthony was hungry, he decided to eat the food. The next day, Anthony had a large stomach ache. He also threw up several times. I had to take him to the hospital since he felt sick.
Weight loss. Jamie wanted to lose some weight. She went to the doctor for advice. Her doctor told her to exercise more. Jamie decided to join the local gym. She slimmed down very quickly.

Trip. I took my girlfriend out to a new plaza that recently opened up. We walked around several of the outlet stores. She pointed to a shoe store. We went in to check out the deals. When we left, I treated her to some dinner before we left.

Swimming. During the hot summer, Fred's friends always frequented the pool. They urged him to join, but Fred had a deep fear of water. Finally, he agreed to go to a swimming lesson. The instructor was calm and friendly, and put Fred at ease. By the end of the lesson, Fred had learned to love the water.

Pregnant. Sara wanted to have a baby. She was already 35 years old and worried she waited too late. Sara prayed and kept trying to get pregnant. She went to a routine women's health check up. She was thrilled when the doctor told her she was pregnant.

Summer Reading. Amy's school had a reading contest over the summer. Amy wanted to win the first prize. She spent most of the summer reading in the library. The winner was announced on the first day of school. Amy won the first prize!

Job. Kito applied for his first job. He was very nervous when they called him in for an interview. But he did rather well, and the interviewer was very kind to him! The next day, he got a call offering him the job. Kito excitedly said Yes to the job offer!

Green Grass. Larry was jealous of his neighbor's green grass. One day Larry asked his neighbor how his grass was so lush and green. His neighbor suggested that Larry use a certain fertilizer. Larry bought the fertilizer and applied it. Larry's grass grew lush and green like his neighbor's.

The Tattoo. Liz always wanted a tattoo. On her eighteenth birthday, she finally got one. Her boyfriend's name was inscribed onto her lower abdomen. Soon afterwards, she and her boyfriend broke up. She is now searching for a new boyfriend with the same name.

A Bounty of Soda. At the end of the school year we would spend all day outside. This particular year we were provided with sodas. There was no limit on them but water was encouraged. When it was time for tug of war my friend and I sat out. While everyone else played we filled our backpacks with sodas.

I'm a Bad Goalie. I played soccer goalie for one game as a kid. Unfortunately I allowed a lot of goals. The crowd got the best of me and I started to cry. Eventually I cost my team the game. I never played goalie again.

Suspension. Ali was suspended from school. She had been in a fight with a bully. She tried to walk away from the fight multiple times. In the end she had no choice but to defend herself. She was sad she had failed make the principal see her side.

Cops. Timothy grabbed the lit marijuana joint. He smoked a whiff and passed it down. Then he heard a cop car in the distance. Timothy ran down the road fast. The cops turned another corner and he was safe.

Ramen. Bridgette made some ramen. She was very poor and didn't have money for food. She cracked an egg and put it into the ramen. She ate her meal in disgust. She had had ramen every day the whole week.
Loose Cage. Tammy ran a farm. They had chickens. They were all fenced in. Unfortunately part of the fence was loose. A few chickens got out.

Bike Race. Ethan was entered in a bike race. He had bought a brand new bike for the race. He practiced everyday on his street in his neighborhood. The day of the race he was very nervous. He crashed his bike in the first 100 feet of the race.

The New Drink. Mark and his wife wanted to try new drinks. Mark thought it would be a good idea to try a new beer. He came home with a new beer he saw in the market. His wife came home with a new brandy she saw in the market. They mixed the two drinks together a came up with a new drink.

Hunter. Tom's dad and uncle woke him up early. They dragged him out to the truck. They drove Tom out into the deep woods at around sunrise. They gave Tom a rifle. Tom hunted, shooting a deer, for the very first time that day.

Angel at Work. Angel was bored at work. He decided to go on Reddit to pass the time. On Reddit, Angel saw an interesting link. He clicked on the link, and read a good article. Angel felt less bored after reading the article.

The Game. The kids were excited for recess. They were going to play their favorite game! It involved balls and a net. They had invented the game all by themselves. They couldn't wait to teach the other kids on the playground.

Problem Solver. Gloria is the person I go to when I have problems. I made sure to see her privately when I had family issues last month. When I got to her office, she wasn't busy so we talked for an hour. After all was said and done, I didn't have clear solution. However, she had helped enough for me to be on track to finding one.

Sara's New Friend. Sara decided to adopt a cat. She went to the shelter, but none of them seemed right. Then she saw a little black cat at the back of the room. Sara fell in love with the cat immediately. Sara brought the cat home that day.

Wedding Day. Allante and Elise met in college. Soon after, they began dating and fell in love. One day, Allante proposed, and of course Elise said yes. They planned a perfect wedding, and all guests had a great time. Ultimately, they lived happily ever after.

Car Wash. Tori's school club needed to raise money. They decided to hold a car wash. Everyone came to help wash cars. Their customers were very generous because they did such good work. Tori's school club raised all the money they needed, and then some.

First Day of School. It was Anne's first day of school. Both her and her mom were nervous. She got dressed and packed her bag. Her mom walked her to the classroom. Anne was shy at first, but then had a great time in school!

Wish. Victoria wished she had money. Victoria threw a penny in a well to wish for money. As Victoria turned around, she saw a glimmer in the dirt. Victoria discovered there was a chest of buried gold! Victoria had found what she wished for.

Sleepover. Sara had her friends over on Saturday night. They watched movies and ate popcorn. But then they realized it had gotten very late! Sara's friends all called their parents and asked to stay over. Sara's night turned into a two-day sleepover!
Pilates. Tally has been getting in shape. She wanted to change up her routine. Tally started to do pop-pilates. After a few days she started to see results. Tally is feeling very fit.
The Canal. The family took a trip to Venice. They rode on a gondola in the canal. It was beautiful and magical! They took lots of pictures and enjoyed the sights. It was a special place to visit.

Test. Alex was very nervous about the test tomorrow. He asked me for help studying but I was busy. He was very nervous and woke up super early to study. The teacher said he was confident in Alex to take the test! Alex took the test and got a passing grade!

Shut Down. Tim saw a cute girl at the bookstore. He gathered up enough courage to talk to her. He was nervous and nonsensical. The girl didn't bother to even pretend to care. She smiled awkwardly and walked away from him.

Need A Ride. It was getting late and Gina was ready to go home. She had been at her grandma's house for the whole day. She just wanted to go home and get in her own bed. But her mother hadn't arrived at the time she said she would. When Gina tried to call her, there was no answer.

The Girl Scout. Tameka, who is 6, was afraid to join the girl scouts. She thought she would be left in the woods. Her father told her joining the girl scouts would make her brave. Tameka joined the girl scouts and stayed a member. After high school she joined the military because of her experience.

Bought new sheets. I bought some new sheets for my bed this weekend. After throwing them on the bed I went to sleep. They felt great! I woke up the next morning to them covered in dog hair. Now they look just like my old sheets.
The Haircut. Joy wanted a change. She asked her stylist for a new haircut. The stylist started snipping away. Finally, it was in a cute bob. Joy was thrilled!

Marco's Big Goal. Marco played in a local soccer league. He wasn't naturally gifted at the sport, but he had drive. Marco sat most of the last game on the bench. He begged his coach to let him play the last couple minutes. Marco rushed out onto the field and scored the ending goal.

The Glass Bottle. Amanda had always loved glass bottles. She filled them with pennies or rocks or marbles. One day Amanda's mother took her to the recycling center. Amanda found so many pretty bottles and they were free to take. Now Amanda visits the recycling center for new bottles every week.

Weird Channel. Jenny's son was navigating through the television. He ran across several channels. The last channel he went on had pornography. Jenny saw this channel and quickly changed it. She yelled at her son.
Trash. I went to take the trash to the curb. The bag was very heavy, and started stretching. Halfway down the driveway, the bag broke. Trash spilled out all over. I spent an hour cleaning it up.

Shiny Red. Little Tony wanted a shiny red apple from the tree. He tried and tried to get one down by throwing rocks at them. Suddenly he saw a ladder leaning against the house. He dragged it over, climbed up and grabbed the prettiest apple. That was the best apple Little Tony has ever had.

One shot. Perry won a raffle to take a half court shot worth $10,000. Perry constantly practiced his shot at the local basketball court. Perry was nervous on the day of the event. Perry only had one chance to make the shot. Perry was excited that she made the shot.

The Abandoned Car. David saw an unattended car parked on his street. The car had been there for two weeks. David called the authorities to report a suspicious vehicle. The police investigated the vehicle. The car had been stolen and abandoned.

Competition. Ludo has a gambling problem. He made a bet that Harry would win a tournament at school. Harry is the underdog in the competition. Surprisingly, Harry tied for first place. Ludo lost his bet on a technicality.

Louis and the computer. Louis liked working on computers. Louis started his own business working on computers. Louis accepted too much work when he started. Now Louis is overwhelmed with too much work. Louis hired a second person to help him finish all the computers.

High School Football. Derek loved playing football. He was the quarterback and was pretty good. He only had one game left in his career. He wanted it to be a good one. He threw for the winning touchdown.

The Play's the Thing. The local theater play was going horribly. People were laughing in the wrong places, and some of them left. The director was going to stop it when the main lead told him to wait. The lead walked out on stage and started telling jokes and juggling. Soon people stopped leaving and the play was a hit!

Painted House. Herb got supplies to paint his house. He hurt his back before he could start painting. He called a painter to help. The painter gave him a discount for having the supplies. When Herb's back was better his house was already painted.
Happy Birthday. Tyler walked to his mailbox. It was almost his birthday. He was expecting a letter from his mom. He hasn't seen her since she was deployed. Tyler grabbed a letter with a big smile.

Quinn and Rowen at Recess. Quinn and Rowan were playing together during recess. Rowen started being mean to Quinn. He threw a ball hard at her and hurt her. Quinn tried to run away but she slipped on the concrete. The teacher made Rowen apologize to Quinn.

The New Dog. Bob's Mum bought a new dog without telling Dad. Dad was very angry and said it must go back to the shop. Mum said she had to go out but would take it back later. When she got home, Dad was cuddling the dog. He said it could stay.
Hot and sticky room. I woke up this morning. It was incredibly sticky. It was unfortunate. I did not want to be there. So I went to another room.

The Fly. Penelope had noticed a huge fly in her house all week. She could see it flying around and landing all over things. She was sick of it and vowed to smoosh it. One day, she had a perfect shot. She aimed carefully and squashed the bug once and for all.

New job. I took a new job as a writer for a blog a while ago. It is much more difficult than I thought it would be. I often have to listen to new music to gain inspiration. Even then, it is still hard to come up with stories. However, it is worth the difficulty when I write something good.

Rick is hurt. Rick was picking on a classmate during school. He did it all the time. But the person he was picking on didn't want to take it anymore. So he turned around and slapped Rick right in the face. Rick had never been assaulted by a woman before!

A Friend's Thanksgiving. Maryann loved being with her family, and her friends. One year, she spent Thanksgiving with her family, 4 hours away. Later in the day, she drove 4 hours to be back with her friends. She had let them all stay at her house and cook in her kitchen. When she got home, she had another wonderful party with her friends.

Treat. My wife went to Brighton to pick up some bread this afternoon. She had reserved two loaves of sourdough bread. When she got there she found some egg bread. She bought a loaf and I had a slice. I was delighted to eat a piece of my favorite bread.

Olivia. Olivia is in high school. Her favorite subject is math because she is good at it. She doesn't like science and therefore doesn't study it much. She ended up doing poorly on all of her science exams this year. Because of this, she had to take retake science classes in the summer.

Apple Pie. Lucy watched her grandmother peel apples. She always used Granny Smiths for her pie. Lucy plucked one from the growing pile. After all the apples were cut, her grandma put them in the dough. The house filled with the wonderful smell of baking pie.

Motorcycle Accident. Bob bought a motorcycle when he turned seventeen. He had never had lessons but figured it would be easy. On his first day Bob crashed the motorcycle into a telephone pole. He spent 3 days in the hospital with all kinds of injuries. Bob didn't ride a motorcycle for the rest of his life.
Car. The man stopped at a stop sign. He did not see anybody. He started across the intersection. He hit a biker that was crossing. He broke the biker's leg.

First Time Shaving. Glen purchased a shaving kit from the store. He separated the pieces in his bathroom. He managed to shave most of his beard after the first try. His cheek started to bleed a little after the second attempt. Glen eventually stopped since the pain was unbearable.

Registry Wit. My niece works for the DMV. One day a customer came in to register his car. He cracked a joke that my niece must love taking people's $. She responded he must love driving through the tolls, as he owes $100. He left without getting his registration.

All Work, No Play. Rolf is getting ready for work. He brushes his teeth and gets dressed. He finds his keys and checks his phone for messages. Belatedly, he realizes today is Saturday, and he doesn't work today. He decides to change clothes and go for a hike today instead.
Too Drunk. Tim was at the bar with friends. He was having a bad time at work. He tried to drink his pain away. Tim wound up drinking too much. He had to be taken home by his friends.

Winning. Gina was happy she proved her mom wrong. She ate cereal instead of dinner to be spiteful. Her mother refused to acknowledge this. She called Gina to dinner when it was time. Gina yelled as her mother insisted she sit and eat with the family.
Movie Night. Friday night is movie night at our house. My kids pick the movie. My wife makes the popcorn. I make the drinks. We all fall asleep on the couch before the end of the movie.

Bicycle Accident. Tim was riding his bike to school. All of a sudden his bike stopped. He looked at his bike and saw that he had a flat tire. Tim was too far from home to turn around. He had to walk the rest of the way to school.

The Pianist. Denise's daughter was very interested in music. She decided to enroll her daughter in piano classes. Denise bought her daughter a keyboard to practice at home. Her daughter practiced every night. The instructor told Denise how impressive her daughter was.

Speak To His Mom. A girl came to Gina's house claiming her brother got her pregnant. Gina's mom had a long conversation with the girl. Gina tried to eavesdrop but was unable to hear anything. The girl walked to the door crying. The girl left, and Gina never saw her again.

The Birthday Party. Sammy had a birthday party on the weekend. He invited all of his friends and relatives. They sang the happy birthday song to him. Everyone also ate a piece of Sammy's birthday cake. Sammy was happy to be with his family and friends.

A Crazy Sandwich. Oliver was playing in the kitchen with his brother. They decided to pretend that they were chefs. Oliver started building a sandwich with tons of nasty ingredients. He dared his little brother to eat the weird sandwich. His brother did, and Oliver gave him some candy as a prize!

Pancake Time. Deb was making biscuits for breakfast. In her hurry she accidentally poured in too much milk. She went for more flour but the bag was empty. So she cracked in an egg and stirred it up. They would have pancakes for breakfast.

The Basketball Showdown. Johnny and Fred decided to play Basketball against each other one day. Fred started winning early, and began to slack off. Johnny noticed this, and he worked hard to take the lead. In the end, Johnny beat Fred. Fred learned that day to never slack off until the game was over.
The Bucket. Morgan went to the river to get water. She filled up her bucket with it. It was heavy, but she lugged it home. Just before she got there, she dropped it! The water splashed all over.
Floating down the river. My friend and i got a Canoe. We took the canoe to a nearby river. We floated down the river for 2 hours. I got a lot of sun. We had a really fun day.

Alan's Eulogy. Alan had prepared a eulogy for his friend that recently passed away. He was very nervous before the funeral. Alan walked to the podium at the appropriate time. He delivered a passionate speech. There wasn't a dry eye in the room.

Credit Card Debt. Bill was quite reckless with his spending last year. Bill accumulated almost $10,000 in credit card debt. Even with making his monthly payments, Bill still owed a lot. Regretfully, Bill decided that he would file for bankruptcy. Bill was saddened that he had to take such a drastic step.

Trip to the beach. Alicia went to the beach with her cousins. At first she thought it was a short walk. But they ended up having to walk a very long way. Alicia was so tired. She thought she might collapse from walking so far.

Ralph's Dog. Ralph took his dog to the vet. The vet told Ralph that his dog had gum disease. The vet cleaned the dog's teeth and gums while Ralph waited. Ralph was glad that the vet could take care of his dog. Ralph decided to take his dog to the vet regularly.

Hiking up Hawksbill Crag. My family and I went for a long hike. On the hike, we were accompanied by our dogs. We had to climb to the top of a summit. From the summit we could see the most beautiful sunrise. The hike left us all feeling accomplished and refreshed.

The Playground. Erica's favorite place in the world was the local playground. She would meet her friend Susie there every Saturday morning. One morning she got there and Susie was nowhere to be found. She found someone else to play with but worried about Susie. Susie showed up an hour later and the three of them played together.

Lawyer or prosecutor. Oliver was very bright and witty. He decided to become a lawyer to use his intellectual skills. He was very good at his job and helped many people. But more and more he had to represent people who were guilty. As he didn't like it, he switched and became a prosecutor.
Food Truck. We were famished on our lunch break. We saw a food truck in the parking lot. We walked up to the window. The menu was filled with barbecue foods. We ordered pulled pork sandwiches,
First kiss. Ted was nervous to kiss Lisa for the first time. He took her to the park where they would walk. When they sat on the bench he took her face. He kissed her. The two felt sparks.

Cruise. Nia and her friends decided to go on a cruise trip one summer. One day a little kid peed in the pool. Everyone got out. One of the cruise workers drained the pool. Afterward everyone got back in again.

Baby Bottle. Tom had never fed a baby before. He didn't even know how to mix the formula. Once in the bottle he was afraid to overheat it. He kept checking every few seconds. Luckily it all came out fine and he did a good job.

The Big Test. John was nervous about his science test at school the next day. He stayed up all night and studied very hard. He woke up late the next day and didn't have time to eat. He raced to school and sat down nervously. All the studying paid off and John aced his test.

The Dog Bowl. Max's dog was a messy eater. Max decided to buy her different bowls. He bought bigger ones and put them on a mat. The dog didn't make a mess anymore! Max was happy he didn't have to clean up spills anymore.
Peach Ice Cream. I helped my grandparents make homemade ice cream. They had their own peaches. I had to help churn the ice cream. It was a hot summer day. It was a fine addition to the church picnic.

Strange massage. Barbara went to a spa for the first time. She removed her clothes and waited for the masseuse. When the masseuse came in, she covered her in mud. Barbara was disgusted but didn't say anything. And when the strange massage was over, her skin was smooth.

Four Minutes. My wife is threatening me to come to her or else she will leave. After coming out of work, I drove quickly to see her. After arriving home, I decided to wait in the front. When she opened the door, she had several suitcases with her. She told me that she was leaving me and our relationships.

Horror Film. I went to go see a horror movie alone. I got so scared that I ran out of the theater. I never wanted that to happen again. I brought friends with me the next time I went to the theater. I was never scared at a horror movie again.
Old Jeans. Tim was going through his closet. He noticed old jeans he hadn't worn in a while. He tried a few pair on. None of them really fit that well anymore. He decided to give them to goodwill.

Eggplant. Melissa hated eggplants a lot. She didn't like them because they were purple. One day, she was forced to eat one. At first, she declined. But after tasting one, Melissa fell in love with eggplants.

The Rescue. Tim was crying because his kite was stuck in a tree. His dad Dan hadn't climbed a tree in 20 years but decided to try. Tim gasped as his dad almost fell from the tree. Dan was able to catch himself and continue his climb. Tim was elated when his father handed him his kite.

The Divorce. Tim and Kate had been married for decades. All their kids were grown ups. They realized the love had left their marriage long ago. They both decided it would be best to divorce. Tim and Kate stayed on amicable terms.

Finally Alone. Gina was looking for a place to be alone. She just wanted some peace and quiet. Her dad gave her his keys to relax in his car. She waited till her siblings weren't around then got in the car. She lay on the back seat and watched videos on her phone.

Put on Your Pants. I was staying with my grandparents for a weekend. They told me to finish getting dressed so we could leave. I refused to put my pants on so she put me in the car with no pants. I was beginning to fear I would have to walk around in my underwear. Right before we left they gave them to me and I learned my lesson.

The Science Experiment. Tom loved to do wacky experiments. He knew the importance of safety. One day he forgot wear his safety glasses. Tom had a glass beaker explode in his face and glass shards broke. Tom promised to always wear his safety glasses.

Cass. Cass was very thirsty. But she wanted dessert too, since dinner had just ended. Cass decided to handle both problems at once. She made a thick milkshake. She drank it to relieve her thirst AND her craving for sweets!

Tina's Dinner. Tina was hungry and driving home from work. She passed by a strip mall with a few restaurants. She only wanted to go the sushi restaurant. But she knew it was expensive. She decided to eat there but felt guilty.

Car. I bought a car towards the end of the year last year. It was a white Suzuki Forenza with 100k miles. I loved the car, bought it from a young dude who just had a kid. It was my first stick shift, learning it on the fly was challenging. I drove over a thousand miles back to where I lived when it was bought.

The Irritating Neighbor. Downstairs from me lives a man with an overbearing personality. He can hear me walk down my stairs and often meets me at the bottom. It irritates me that I have to speak with him anything I leave. He has made me late for work and appointments. One day, I finally yell at him and I have not heard from him since.

Camel Ride. Neil was about to leave India. He did not want to leave without fulfilling a lifelong dream. His dream was to ride a camel! Neil's guide helped him book a camel trip. Neil was thrilled by his camel ride through the desert!

Horace Eats Donuts. Horace wakes up feeling very hungry. He decides to eat some donuts. First he eats a chocolate donut. After that, he eats a glazed donut. Horace is glad he doesn't feel hungry any longer.

Early Breakfast. Dan woke up early to cook breakfast for his mom. He was frying up some eggs and wanted to be fancy. He tried to make the eggs do a flip in the pan. He flung the eggs in the air, but he missed the catch. The scalding hot eggs landed on his bare foot.

Getting the last ipad. Susie loved ipads. But she never had one of her own. So she decided to go and get one. But unfortunately she found no cheap ones. Finally she saw one at the store but it was the last one.

Brought Lunch. Amy didn't want to eat the school lunch anymore. Her mother told her she was too busy to make her a lunch. Amy decided she would pack her own lunch. Amy made a sandwich, and grabbed chips to go with. At lunch her friends made fun of her homemade lunch.
The catch. John was enjoying playing baseball. He was a center fielder. The hitter hit the ball towards John. John couldn't see the ball in the sun. He put his glove up and squeezed and got the ball.

Sober. Ed liked to drink, but he often got carried away. He tried to stay clean for his girlfriend, but failed. When they wed, he thought he could stay clean for his wife, but no. Then his wife gave birth to a beautiful baby girl! Ed has not touched a drink since her birth, seven years ago.

The restaurant. Janice and Alma were two friends who went out to eat one day. They went to an Italian restaurant and ordered pizza and pasta. There they began to eat but saw a guy sitting alone by himself. Janice said hi to him and they started talking. Eventually, the guy went and sat with them and they all ate together.
Hat. The man put on a hat. It made his head itch. He looked at the label. The label said it was wool. The man decided he didn't like wool.

The snakebite. Jordan was playing with her friends. They were running around in some high grass. Suddenly she felt a pain in her foot. She realized that a snake had bitten her. Someone called her mom and they took her to the hospital to be safe.

Birds. On his birthday Jordan receives a pair of binoculars. His father also takes him out bird watching to bond with him. Together they record a number of different birds in the area. Before they had to go home they found a rare bird to watch. As they drove home they joked about the experience together.
Teeth whitening fail. Martha wanted to whiten her teeth. At first she was scared. Then she went for it. Unfortunately she got bad tooth sensitivity. She could never use it again.

Going to the Zoo. Avery is going to the zoo for the first time today! When she gets to the zoo, she heads to see the bear first. The bear is nowhere to be found! She finds the bear in the monkey cage where he doesn't belong! She watches as the zookeepers carefully get the bear back to his cage!

New Camera App. Sarah just got a new smartphone. The camera app on her phone was really slow. It lagged and took pictures way too slow. Sarah bought a camera app from the app store for $1. Sarah was able to take better quality pictures with the new app.

New dress. Katie found a dress she loved. It fit her like a glove. She went to buy it and it was out of her budget. Katie decided to have the saleswoman hold it. Katie told her mom about it and she bought it for it.

Wrong Number. I heard my mother cell phone ringing in the kitchen. Since she was in the shower, I took it upon myself to answer it. Someone on the other end of the line demanded to speak with Rick. I told the person no one by that name lived at this address. They apologized for the mistake and hung up, rather rudely on me.

Mean Dog. Chris was bit by a dog when he was a kid. Chris's friend invited him over and he accepted. Chris's friend has a dog. He was really nervous around the dog. The dog was really nice and Chris is no longer scared.

The Tower. Jake had wanted to climb the tower for a long time. It had a bunch of stairs, but everyone said the view was great. He began his climb. Jake went up one hundred stories to the top. The view was incredible.

Fish Tales. I bought an aquarium recently to start a fresh water tank. I researched many different kinds of freshwater fish for my tank. After a lot of study I decided on purchasing some cichlids. These fish went well with my tank set up. I plan on watching these fish grow for a very long time.

Newspaper. I was tasked with writing the school newspaper one week. I asked friends for help since I had no idea what to do. They told me to just try my best since they didn't know either. I sat down on the last night possible and wrote as much as I could. The newspaper turned out pretty good but I was still very nervous.

Driving to the beach. The first year I drove my friends and I who had decided to go to the beach. I was nervous taking my friends and I had to stop and get gas. After paying for the gas I put my wallet on the roof. We started on our way and then I realized I left it on the roof. After making a quick u turn I was happy to see it on the road.
The Apple Orchard. The family liked to go to the apple orchard every fall. They picked their crop and took them home. They made a pie. It was delicious! It was a great tradition to do ever September.

David forgets about the sandwich. David was having a busy day at work. He was getting hungry as lunch time was almost here. He got up to go into the break room. He looked all around the Refrigerator. He realized he had left the sandwich at home!
Bad grades. Jill always got bad grades in math. Even when she studied hard, she failed. One day Bob tutored her in math. She took the big test. To her surprise, she got every question right.

The Show. In high school, two friends and I wanted to put on a rock show. We rented a rec center at a local park. We invited five bands we knew in school to play. Because there was little to do in our town, the turnout was high. It was such a success, we did it again two months later.

Beach. She had never been to the beach before. She relished the feeling of sand between her toes. She gushed it over and over again over her feet. She stood in the surf and just listened to the ocean. She loved the salty smell in the air.

Bad Tooth. Scott was eating an ice cream cone. He had a sudden pain shoot through his teeth. Scott called the dentist and made an appointment. The dentist found a cavity in one of his teeth. Scott had his tooth fixed by the dentist.
Day Off. Becky had the day off work. She decided to take her son out to eat. He picked his favorite mexican restaurant. Next she took him to get a haircut. They had such a great day.

Making Out at the Movies. Tom took his girlfriend Lisa to the movies. They chose to watch a romantic comedy. The movie was so incredibly boring and corny! Lisa reached over and began kissing Tom passionately. Tom had the best time ever at the movies that night!

Charlie Helps Paint. Little Charlie and his dad were painting the garage. Charlie had some trouble controlling the brush. His dad turned around and started to laugh. Charlie had paint on him from head to toe. His dad rinsed him off with water from the hose.

Black and white party. One of Lisa's favorite parties of the season was the black/white party Every summer Lisa and her friends would wear black and white and dance She rented a local DJ and caterers for the event. All the girls had a fabulous time. Lisa couldn't wait till next year.

Unhappy about the gift. Lucy had just moved to a new school. She was upset about the change and not into the school. On her birthday, her mom got her some school spirit wear. Lucy was unhappy about the gift and stormed off. Her mom took the gift back and decided not to press the issue.

The Gay Sister. Tony was home for the holiday dinner. His family sat around the dining table sharing life updates. Suddenly Tony's sister wanted to give a speech. In it she announced that she was gay. Everyone was happy for her being able to be honest with them.

Water. When I was a child, I went to the lake with my brothers. My older brother was able to walk along the bottom of the lake. My little brother said the lake was too deep and refused to enter. The bottom of the lake was too deep for me to walk along. I did, however, manage to swim across the lake.

Visit. My extended family was planning a visit to see me. I really didn't want to see them so I kept stalling. They really weren't happy with me but came anyway. We had a really good time during their visit. I felt really bad about not wanting to see them afterwards.

Back to School. Charlie left high school and had not gone back to finish it. Charlie's desired career path required that he graduate high school. Charlie started taking night classes for a GED. Charlie eventually passed the examinations and got his GED. Charlie later landed a job in his desired field.

Late Night TV. Jake always watched late night television. He grew up with all the hosts. All of a sudden they were all replaced. Jake couldn't get into the new ones. He stopped watching late night television all together.
iPhone reveal. Kelly was excited to get the new iPhone. She was waiting for this for months. Finally she got her hands on a pink one. The phone was perfect. Kelly couldn't be happier.

Thrones. There was a popular TV show. It was about a power struggle. The power struggle between 7 kingdoms. The couple used to watch this show all the time. That was until the day they didn't pay the TV bill and we're cut off.

The Brave Fireman. One day at the station, the fire department got a call for a fire. John and his Dalmatian quickly arose and rushed to the fire. Inside the building was a family of four with no way to escape! John and his dog scaled the side of the building and rescued them. John was awarded a key to the city and was in the newspaper.
Met at a Bar. Greg met Candace at the bar. He was so struck by her beauty, he could barely speak. He watched as other men flirted with her. Greg left, but Candace followed. They talked for hours.

Cooking White Rice. One day Missy decided to cook some white rice. She brought 3 cups to a boil with some salt. She stirred in 2 cups and covered with a lid. She turned the burner down to the lowest setting. She set the timer for 20 minutes and took off heat.

Mini golf. We thought we would take the kids to mini golf. They were so excited to go. My seven year old was ready to hit the ball. I followed it as it went towards the hole. Then all of a sudden I saw it fall in the hole.

Dancefloor. Charlie brushed his hair with a comb. He put in gel and looked in the mirror. He felt handsome and went to a club. The girls all were looking at him. He got on the dance floor and busted some moves.
Shirtless. I went on a run at the park one day. It was early morning. I saw my friend's car. She was running with my other friend. They were shirtless.

Short Stories. My college english professor loved giving writing assignments. One day he instructed us to write something untrue. The untrue stories were meant to sound true as possible. After he read mine, he asked if I made it up. He said it sounded true, and he refused to believe I invented it.
The careless destruction. Margaret had a son. The son was playing with fire. Margaret told him to stop. The son kept playing with fire. So by accident he lit the living room on fire.

Big Change. My coworker Sheila was thin when she started in 1985. She was attractive and dated several men. In 1990 she married and left our workplace. She came by to visit in 1995, 40 pounds heavier. Her old boyfriends were shocked.
glasses. Tim could barely see. He had trouble in school. His teacher said he needed glasses. His mother bought him glasses. After that he never had vision trouble again.

More Books. Jenny loved books. She bought a new book every time she went to the store. Jenny had hundreds of books. One day she noticed her shelves were all full. Jenny decided she still wanted to buy more books.

Emma's track race. Emma joined track in third grade. Her parents and sister came to her first meet. They cheered Emma on as the race started. They watched as the teams did a loop around the track. They were proud when Emma ended up coming in third place.
Overstepping Boundaries. I tried playing basketball with a friend the other day. He used to play in high school. I figured it would be fun. I was wrong I should never try to play basketball again.

Terrible Haircut. Jody wanted to cut his own hair to save a few bucks. He bought a fancy scissors and comb. He arranged the mirrors in his bathroom. He started cutting as best he could. When Jody was done he thought it looked terrible.

Birthday Cake. Today is John's birthday. John's wife, Mary, wanted to bake him a cake. Mary went to the store and bought ingredients. Mary then went back home to bake it. The cake was burnt and John was upset.

Team Morale. Charles has a problem at work. He oversees two employees who are currently upset at each other. Charles needs them to get along and work together to accomplish tasks. He sits them both down and the three of them hash out the issues. Now they get along great and Charles feels much better.
A Bad Cut. Joe had gotten a cut on his hand. He didn't clean it out well enough. An infection set in. Joe's hand began to swell up. Joe had to go to the doctor.

Cheaters. I was headed to visit my boyfriend. When I got there, I noticed an unfamiliar car parked in front. I walked in and found him in bed with his ex-girlfriend! I screamed at him, cried and ran out the door. I never talked to him again.

Park Accident. Marcia was watching her little brother Jon play soccer in the park. Jon tripped and fell on the grass. He got up and limped across the field. Marcia placed her arm around Jon. She nursed Jon's bruised leg.

Indigestion. Tyler was getting constant indigestion from his poor diet. He decided to buy some medicine to help it. He also cut down on food that might cause indigestion. After a few weeks, Tyler's indigestion went away. But he went back to eating junk food.

Luke Plays Guitar. Luke has always wanted to learn how to play the guitar. He decides to start practicing. At first he finds it very difficult. However, eventually he improves. Luke is glad to be learning the guitar.

Pull Up Me. Bob was designing a circuit. He forgot to add a pull up resistor before the microprocessor. When he turned on the electricity, it shorted. Bob yelped and quickly cut the power. He was dismayed to have fried his microprocessor.
Getting a snack. I was watching TV. I suddenly felt very hungry. I got up to find a snack. I looked in my cabinets and found crackers. I went back to my chair with the crackers.

Rita visits her grandparents. Rita called her grandparents. She asked them to go to dinner with her. They decided to go to a sushi restaurant. Rita and her grandparents ate every bite of the sushi! They were very full after finishing dinner.

Childhood Games Made Real. Jean brought her son Chris to play at my house every afternoon. She and my Mom would visit while we played. Our favorite game was to jump off the porch and pretend we could fly. Chris sent me a friend request on Facebook today. I was sure he was going to be a pilot!

Pearls before (Guinea) Swine. A girl got a pet guinea pig. She spent hours making it a castle out of pÃ¢pier-machÃ©. She put the castle into its cage before she went to bed. In the morning, there was nothing left but shreds and plaster dust. Guinea pigs do not appreciate fine architecture.

Making a New Friend. Audrey volunteered at an animal sanctuary. She was especially excited to help take care of the cats. While there, she met a 1-year-old black cat that she adored! She decided to adopt it and take it home. Now they live together at her house happily!

Worried. My brother sent me an email awhile ago. I did not respond. I had not seen several emails because gmail put them into spam. My brother was worried as I am not in good health. I finally opened the email and responded.

Burn. Anne had a terrible sunburn. She went to the store for aloe lotion. At home, she smoothed it on her burn. She slept that night covered in the salve. In the morning, her burn was no longer painful.

Open Door. It was hot very late at night. So I left my front door open. I decided to look out my window though. And I saw someone suspicious running very fast across the sidewalk. I decided leaving my door open wasn't a good idea anymore.
Pink Shirt. Tim was doing laundry. He forgot to separate the colors and whites. All of his whites turned pink. Tim didn't care much. He wore pink shirts with pride.

Camping Trip. My friends and I went on a camping trip. I was really excited to try out my new tent. We had a hard time setting it up because it didn't come with stakes. It was really windy and we were afraid the tent would blow away. We put all of our gear in the tent to weigh it down.

The Bad Hair Cut. Jane got a new haircut. She hated the way it looked. Unfortunately it was too short too fix. Jane tried her best to avoid others until it grew out. She didn't go out for anything other than work.
Santa Claus. Santa Claus tried to come down the chimney. However, he got stuck. The chimney was too narrow. The fire department was called to help. Santa was unstuck and Christmas was saved.

Cabin Fever. Richard wanted to rent a cabin. The only problem is the cabin was really far away. Disregarding this problem he went ahead to schedule the trip. Once he opened his cabin he soon grew disappointed. The cabin was filled with rodents.
Cold Pizza. Carl ordered a pizza. It didn't arrive in over two hours. When it finally got there it was cold. Carl called to complain. He was given a replacement in proper time.
Eggs. I wanted to make scrambled eggs for breakfast. My girlfriend ate the last eggs we had. I asked her if she could buy more. She agreed to do so after work. I ate cereal instead.
Clancy Makes Toast. Clancy is feeling hungry. He decides to make some toast to eat. Clancy spreads button on the toast. He is happy to have something to eat. He no longer feels hungry.
Jumping. There is a trampoline in the backyard. Two kids are jumping and laughing. One of the kids slips and catches his finger. It starts to bruise. We ice it and it heals.
Peppermint Bark. My wife got peppermint bark candy this past Christmas. Her niece gave it to her. My wife did not like this type of candy. I ate most of it. I might need to diet for a month.

Hospital Visit. William was feeling very bad. His wife brought him to the hospital. The doctors ran tests on William. All the tests came back negative. The hospital kept William for observation and then released him.

Miniature Dining Room. Joe ordered a dining room set off of the internet for his wife. It was to be a big anniversary surprise. It was a great price at $150 for a table and 6 chairs. When the delivery man came to the door he was carrying a small box. Joe had ordered doll furniture by mistake!

The Snow. I woke up today and it was snowing. I was supposed to run errands, but with the snow it wasn't possible. I had to get creative with what we already had in the cupboards. I decided to make soup using carrots, chicken broth, and noodles. It turned out really great.

The Well. Haruki was walking home when he heard the sound of a cat. He looked around and eventually traced the sound to a well. At the very bottom, a kitten cried for help. Haruki ran to get help. With the neighbor's help, he rescued the kitten and brought it home.

Nathan. Nathan bullied a lot of other boys at school. He found great pleasure in it. One day he bullied the wrong boy and Nathan got a black eye. He went home and his dad bet him even more that night. Nathan knew his violence would never prevent his own abuse.

A Bridge Not Too Far. As a child, Ken wanted to build a bridge to cross a stream in a park. Once older he realized that the stream was small enough to jump. Ken took a running start and jumped as far as he could. He only made it half way and created a terrific splash. He was soaking wet on his walk back home.

Door Slamming. Sam got into an argument with his parents. He ran off to his room. As he went to close the door a strong wind slammed it. His parents blamed him for it. He was grounded when they didn't believe him.

Shot in the Leg. Lucas shot the man in the leg. While he tried to slide himself to the door, Lucas walked up to him. He shot him again in the other leg. The man appeared helpless and begged for his life. Lucas shrugged and walked out the door to leave him alone.
Reading. Deb hated reading books. She preferred movies and the internet. That was until she found one she really liked. She couldn't put it down. Now she reads more often.

Illegal Street Vendor. Charlie was a street vendor. He sold hot dogs in the middle of town. Charlie didn't have a license to do business. The town officials found out Charlie was illegally operating. He received a fine and a warning.

Strong Beer. Tom normally drank Bud Light. A friend bought some high gravity IPAs. Tom tried one but thought it tasted gross. He kept drinking not realizing they had so much alcohol. Tom was drunk within the hour.

Basketball Tryout. John wanted to join the basketball team at school. He was very good at shooting but couldn't really run. He trained and worked on his running before the tryout! He was still very nervous leading up to it but he was confident. The coach said he needed to run a bit better but he was on the team!

Stuffed. After dinner Gina was stuffed. She had eaten way too much food. Now she was very uncomfortable. Feeling full was starting to make her feel ill. She left the living room and went to lie down on her bed.

Crunches. Hannah wants to set the world record for crunches. She decided to start practicing. On the big day, Hannah did as many crunches as she could. Sadly, she could not set a new world record. Hannah has given up on her dream.

Too Afraid For A Second Date. Loretta's first date with Charles was to the Del Amo Mall. They saw a movie. That was twenty Years ago. Recently, over Facebook, Charles asked Loretta on another date. Loretta said no because she was scared Charles would rape her.

Salt in the pepper shaker. Randy always thought it was funny pranking strangers. Until the day he put salt in the pepper shaker. He never took into consideration anyone getting hurt.
