That afternoon the cops came to Randy's door to tell him bad news. His mom had passed away, she died from an allergic reaction to salt.

Broken Dishwasher. Al noticed his dishwasher was leaking in his kitchen. He called a few plumbers to check prices. Al realized he can't afford a plumber. Instead he went to the hardware store to get supplies. Al fixed the dishwasher by himself.

Firing employees. Ted was head of his division at work. He didn't like firing people and was always obliged to do it. That day, he postponed talking to the employee he had to fire. At the end of the day his boss told him it was okay. It turned out they had extra money and could keep the employee.
Pageant. The mom entered her baby in a pageant. She walked on stage with the baby. The baby smiled and cooed. The baby walked by herself. The baby won the pageant.

A Good Bartender. Ron worked at a bar as a bartender. One of his patrons was getting very drunk. The man ordered another drink. Ron decided not to serve the man. Ron called a taxi for the drunk patron.

Bill Goes Skydiving. Bill was turning 40 years old. He wanted to try something new and exciting. He decided to go skydiving on his birthday. He took a video of him skydiving. Afterwards, he uploaded the video on Facebook and Instagram.
Bob's Big Break. Bob had worked at the same job for Years. He was getting tired of the same old thing. One day his boss decided to quit. He offered Bob his old job. Bob accepted it happily!

Real Mom. There was a girl who had never met her mother. She was told at a young age that she never would. She went looking for anyone with her mother's name. She was unsuccessful for many years. By chance, she found her sitting next to her on a plane.
New shoes. Tina needed new shoes. She finally decided to splurge on her favorite pair. She knew she didn't have the extra money. She decided to buy them anyway. She knew she would have to work extra.
The Storm. Today we were playing outside. We saw a lot of dark clouds in the sky. It looked like a storm was coming. We had to go inside to be safe. It didn't rain after all, so we went back outside!

Greg Raposo. Greg was releasing his first album as a solo artist. He planned a huge CD release party concert. The concert was sold out within an hour. The venue asked Greg if they could add a second concert. Greg and the venue worked so hard for both concerts.

Ugly Art. Tom's girlfriend was an artist. Tom wasn't artistically inclined. He always thought her work was ugly. Eventually she got really famous and made lots of money. Tom could never figure out why.

Price Matching. Tom was at the electronics store. He was looking to buy a new television. He found one he liked but it was cheaper online. Tom told the employee about that. The employee asked a manager and was able to price match.

Decision. My coworker is married. Her husband was a pre-med major, but did not become a doctor. She was dating another pre-med major in college. That person went on to become a doctor. She is struggling, but says she still has no regrets.

Falling at the rink. Susie went ice skating for the first time. Her friend Allie took her. When they got on the ice Susie lost balance. She felt like she was falling. She ended up falling right on her friend.

Beanie Babies. Our family had a collection of Beanie Babies. A friend was supposed to sell a few of them at a yard sale. My brother in particular had several of them. One of his sold for twenty dollars! It must have cost about a dollar to make.

Beer. Sam went out for Saint Patrick's Day. She had several green beers. She felt festive at first, but then kind of sick. The next morning, she was very hung over! Sam decided not to drink so much any more.

Food Poisoning. Tom went out to lunch with some of his friends. They all enjoyed their meal but soon started to feel ill. By the next day all of them were very sick. They all had to miss work! Tom and his friends will never go to that restaurant again.
Robot. A science team worked on research. They found out about robots. They decided to build one. They got funding. The robot spoke to people.

Questioning. Celeste read a lot of Platonic dialogues. She wanted to emulate the character of Socrates. She began walking around downtown and chatting with people. Some were friendly, but most were hostile toward her. Celeste was unsure if she shook anyone's epistemological foundations.

Left Out. The boys lined up in front of the club. The security guards checked their licenses before letting them in. Everyone managed to get in except Earl. He begged his friends to go somewhere else. However, they refused and went inside of the club.

Boring Movie. Tom saw previews for a movie. It made it seem full of action and suspense. He bought tickets for opening night. Tom was disappointed that all the best scenes were in the previews. He didn't trust previews anymore.

The Angry Model. Paul was driving his cab in the big city. He saw a woman call for him to pull over so he did. The woman climbed in and was immediately very rude to Paul. Paul tried to talk to the woman but she began to cuss him out. Paul pulled the cab over and told her to get out.

Bill's Wife. Bill wanted to do something nice for his wife. He knew that she would want to do an activity together. He decided to buy her a cooking class. Bill gave her a card telling her about the cooking class. She was extremely happy and impressed with Bill's gift.
How regretful. Dina started college. It was too hard so she dropped out. She got a nice paying job however. It allowed her to live paycheck to paycheck. Now, she regrets dropping out of college.
Dog House. The couple built a shelter for the dog. The dog wouldn't sleep in it. The husband blamed the wife. The wife said it was the husband's fault. Their child tore it down.

Bat. We thought we saw something flying by. The next thing we know we saw a bat. We were able to isolate it to a room. We tried to think of the best way to trap it. We finally were able to catch it in a box.

Backpacking Trip. My fiancee and I are going on a backpacking trip next weekend. We chose a beautiful state park just a few hours from home. We've mapped out what trails we plan to hike and where to camp. We've even started getting the equipment together already. We're going to be well prepared for an excellent and safe weekend!

Random. Kate was doing chat hits on Mturk. She would answer questions for other turkers. One turker would guess items at random. Kate considered stopping the chat hits. But she decided to continue working on the chart hits after all.

Severe Reaction. I decided to treat my brother to some food by a local seafood place. When the waiter gave us a table to sit on, we made our orders. My brother enjoyed the food until he started to get nauseous. His face started to swell and he had trouble breathing. I immediately took him to the hospital.

Solar Panels. Jim was the owner of a fully functional farm. With his property thriving, he was focusing on survivalism. One of his ideas was to install solar panels. It took him years to save the money for the panels. Finally he had them installed and they immediately began saving money.

Wet Floor. Ginger worked in a supermarket. One of the customers dropped a jug of apple juice on the floor. The manager told Ginger to see about the spill. Ginger put up wet floor signs. She finished mopping the floor.

The purse. Bess just bought a new purse. It was a large black designer purse. As she was walking in the grocery store the alarm went off. The clerk had to check it. Lo and behold there were 2 sensors in her large purse!

Soul Mates. I met Michael on Christian Mingle. We talked for nearly a year before we decided to meet. Last December we met for the first time, in Singapore. While we were there Michael asked me to be his wife. I can't believe how happy I am to have found my soul mate.

The Fit. One day, Avery was doing his work when he became very upset. Another boy had said he wasn't awesome, and it hurt his feelings. Avery didn't know how to handle this, so he crawled into the floor. When he was in the floor, he was screaming and crying. He spent the afternoon throwing a fit while everyone looked at him.

I Walked Home. I was twelve and I walked home from school. It was six miles on the level. My mom was supposed to pick me up, but she was busy or forgot. It took longer than I thought. It was suppertime when I got home.
Museum. I wanted to go to the museum. I was so excited. I plotted out my trip. I took the bus downtown. The museum was closed and I had wasted my time.

Pickpocket. Frank was a boy who lived with his aunt and uncle. His aunt and uncle were nicer to his cousin than they were to him. One day, Frank decided to run away. While on the run, he learned that he was a very talented pickpocket. Frank never went a day without food after learning that.

Hearing. John was a student in high school. John arrived at school and noticed many classes had changed rooms. He learned this was because there was a free health screening. John decided to get his hearing checked. He was happy to learn he had perfect hearing.

Professional Photographer. Tom was getting married. A friend offered to take pictures for him. Tom wanted to save money and agreed. Most of the pictures came out bad. Tom regretted not getting a professional.

Try. Carla was at an Ethiopian restaurant with her mom and dad. She was a picky eater, but they urged her to sample something new. Carla did her best, selecting a rice and chicken dish from the menu. When it arrived, she gingerly tasted a tiny portion of it. To her surprise, she liked it very much!

Baseball. I went to the park to play baseball. I met up with a lot of my friends there and we split into two teams. Each team had nine players on it. My team scored first with a home run. My team won the game in convincing fashion.
Spicy Food. Tom was at a Mexican restaurant. He ordered some food. They tried to tell him it was spicy. Tom didn't understand. He wound up crying and drinking a lot of water.

Trash. Neil's chore was to take out the trash. His mom asked him to do it, but he was grumpy. He kicked the bags before picking them up. As he walked, the bag ripped and spilled everywhere! Neil's angry kick caused him a lot more work!
music with sticks. Joe was bored. He found sticks outside. He beat the sticks like drums. Many people stopped to hear the music. Joe ended up playing for thirty happy people.

Bad tattoo. Kelsi really wanted to get a tattoo. She was debating about it. Finally she decided she wanted to get one after all. When she got on the seat, they started doing a bad job. The tattoo was so terrible Kelsi wanted it to end.

Cheerleading Squad. Julia was on the cheerleading squad. On the squad she was team captain. It was fun being team captain for her. She was happy because it looked good on her resume. Julia was captain for three years.

School Winter. A man's brother had to drive his brother to school. So he got up and went to his car. There was way too much traffic that day. So he was late for class and the brother missed a test. This is why he failed the class.
The Belt. Joe loved his new pants. However they were too big. He always pulled them up when he walked. One day he bought a new belt. He never had trouble with his pants again.
Waitress. Cindy was a waitress. She worked at a bed and breakfast. She never got paid less than fifty dollars in tips. Today was an exception. Cindy made three hundred dollars.

Messy Hair. Jess was walking to school one autumn. As she walked gusts of wind hit her back. Suddenly one large gust threw her hair around. She tried combing it but it still looked fairly silly. It took a fresh wash to finally fix her hair for good.

Scared. Tom decided to play a prank on Dick. He bought a scary mask. He waited until Dick got out of work at night. He hid behind some bushes and jumped out at him. Dick had a heart attack and died on the scene.

Easter Egg Hunt. Bobby desperately wanted to find the most Easter Eggs this year. Whatever child found the most would win a huge chocolate bunny. When it was time he ran as fast as he could to the end of the field. All the other kids were splitting up the eggs near the starting line. He had twelve more eggs than any other child!

College. Joe was excited about starting college. He knew his class schedule and was relaxed. He made it to his first class on time. Joe then got lost trying to find his biology lab. All and all his first day of college was great.

Live in Person. Juan was waiting in line to meet his favorite artist. When he came in front of her, she immediately smiled. She took his photo and wrote her signature on it. They also took a picture together. Juan came home happy.

Thud. Dan was awakened by a thud in the middle of the night. Dan slowly rose from his bed. Dan walked over to the window, peering out at the rain. Dan heard the thud again. Dan then saw it was just a tree branch brushing against the window.

Logan's Mistake. Logan was making lunch at home. He poured himself a large glass of milk to go with his lunch. Logan didn't check the expiration date of the milk. The milk tasted okay, but was in fact spoiled. Logan became very ill and was sick for three days.

Lost Keys. Ted lost his car keys. He looked everywhere for them. He looked under his couch and behind his nightstand. He looked high and low, but could not find his keys. Ted eventually found his keys in his coat pocket.
Cell Phone. Luke broke his phone. He knew he had to get a new one. Luke went to the electronics store. He bought a brand new phone. He was excited to have a working phone again.

The Baby's Toy. Gina had a little sister who was not yet two years old. The baby was just beginning to walk. Gina was helping the baby to learn how to walk. Gina showed the baby how to hold onto a big push toy while she walked. The big push toy helped the baby to walk without falling down.
Safe. Jim crashed his bike one day. He fell to the street and landed hard. Luckily, he was wearing a helmet and pads. They had saved him from serious injury. Jim was thankful for his protective gear.
Pee Break. Tim was going on a road trip with his family. They asked him if he had to pee before they left. Tim said no. Shortly after he felt the need to pee. His parents reprimanded him for it.

Potato. Julieanne was a couch potato. Her parents tried to get her up. She just wanted to watch TV! One day her parents signed her up for softball. She tried out and didn't watch TV for the whole season.

Drag Racing. Jed and Jake were ready to show off their new hotrod. They went down to the local raceway and signed up for a spot. They enjoyed going head to head and were next up to race. The revved their engines and tore down the raceway. Jed ended up besting Jake by just milliseconds.
Freeway Speed. Bob bought a new sports car. And he wanted to see how fast it could go. So he sped down a freeway at 2 AM. And he reached 140 MPH. But he was too scared to go any faster.

Baby's First Tooth. The baby picked up the toy and began to chew on it. Mary looked at the baby worriedly. Saliva began to dribble down the baby's chin. Mary wiped at the baby's mouth touching something hard. She realized the baby had a tooth!

Wrong Flavor. Chris and Gia get ice cream every Sunday. They go to Baskin Robbins and get the same two scoops and flavors. Chris gets Cookie dough and Vanilla and Gia gets vanilla and coffee. After ordering and receiving their ice cream Chris noticed something. Chris received the wrong flavor ice cream and Gia received the right flavors.

Grown Apart. Min and Kay were best friends since first grade. But then they chose to go to separate high schools. At first they hung out every weekend. Then slowly they drifted apart. They were saddened, but they understood that that was the way of life.

Shoe Lifter. Tara went to the shoe store to look for new shoes. She didn't see any shoes that she liked. As she was leaving, an employee accused her of shoplifting. Tara showed the employee that there were no shoes in her bag. Tara was upset and vowed to never go back to that store.

Kicked out. My little brother can not control himself when he drinks. He tends to be drinking all day long every day. The people at the local bar are getting sick of the way he acts. Last night he was being very obnoxious. The bartender had enough and kicked him out for life.

The backup singer. Tina was the backup singer in a band. She never got to sing despite practicing. One day the main singer got sick and her turn was up! She was nervous at first but did an excellent job. The crowd loved her a lot and so they started using her more often.
Dumping for someone else. Allie was with Fred. Then a beautiful girl walked by. Fred wanted her instead. So he dumped Allie. Allie was upset.
Meet The Manager. Gina was at her local bank. She was awaiting a manager. He was to interview her for a job. But he was running late. After 20 minutes of waiting the manager was finally ready.

Business. I moved to California to work for my friend's business. She told me it would be a great opportunity. When I arrived, I was very enthusiastic. As time went by, I realized nobody knew what they were doing. I ended up quitting.

Ice Skating. Timmy was a great roller skater. When winter came, he decided to try ice skating instead. He strapped on a rented pair of skates and hit the ice. At first he stumbled, but soon he was doing very well. Timmy could ice skate just as well as he could roller skate!

Zombies. Ed and Sam were playing a video game together. They tried to kill zombies, but they always ended up losing the game. Then they went online and joined a party of 7 other players. The nine of them were much more skilled and able. Ed and Sam finally got to kill the zombies and win the game!

Doing the Dishes. Every time Layla's husband helped wash the dishes he broke one. Apologizing profusely, he would promise to be more careful. But the next time he would always do it again! Layla began to suspect that he subconsciously hated doing dishes. Vexed but forgiving, she decided to cheerfully do them herself.

Tea. Tia grew tea leaves in her garden. Then she dried them and brewed them into tea. It was delicious! Tea made tea sachets for all her family and friends. Everybody who tasted it loved Tia's homegrown tea!

Claire and John. Claire saw John perform last night. He's a drummer in a rock band. Claire couldn't take her eyes off of him. I think she might buy tickets to see them perform again. She's always had a thing for drummers.

Reading the diary. Sarah was snooping in her sister's room. Suddenly, she spotted a pink diary on the floor. She began reading through it. Suddenly, her sister burst into the room. She began yelling and Sarah ran from the room.

Peppers. The other day I made some spaghetti sauce. I put peppers and onions in it. My sister couldn't eat the sauce because she doesn't like peppers. I bought her some sauce that didn't have peppers in it. She like that sauce just fine.

Injured Arm. Ken was a disk thrower. He was slated for the upcoming olympics. Ken accidentally injured his shoulder. He had to do physical therapy to get better. Ken was lucky to be able to make the olympics.

Charm bracelet. It was Maggie's birthday today. She loved all the presents she usually got. This time for her birthday she got a nice charm bracelet. The bracelet was silver and from Tiffany's. Maggie was as pleased as ever.

Makeup Artist. Mara loves makeup. She spends all her spare money at Sephora. She decided to start doing makeup as a side job. She became a very successful makeup artist. Now, she works doing makeup full time.

Pigs. Burt carefully washed his pig, Freddy, with buttermilk. His mother had told him it would make Freddy's coat shine. Freddy was a very large, fat pig. Burt was sure he would get a great price for him. Burt finished grooming Freddy just as the judges came to his pen.

Cornelia Finishes a Book Report. Cornelia needs to write a book report for her English class. She has always hated writing book reports. However, one Sunday, she shuts off her phone and writes the report. She finds that it wasn't as bad as she had feared. Now Cornelia doesn't mind book reports as much.

Pencils. I used to collect colored pencils and erasers. The erasers came in all kinds of cute shapes and sizes. I walked to the bookstore in school and bought unicorn erasers. I did this every week with my allowance. I collected them all together in a metal tin by Lisa Frank.

Bob Nearly Gets a Ticket. Bob bought a new BMW and was out on the interstate for a drive. As the car hit 90 mph, he suddenly saw flashing red and blue lights. So he pulled over expecting the worst. The cop went speeding right past him. Bob was relieved that he wasn't getting a ticket.
Bad smell. Jane smelled something in her car. She wasn't sure what it was. She looked everywhere in it. Then she finally looked in her dance bag. It was her practice clothes.

World Series earthquake. It was time to watch the World Series. I went to the family room to turn on the television. As I sat down on the sofa the ground shook. I got up away from the window. I saw the earthquake being reported on the news.

Pitbull Party. Patrick was a rescue Pitbull from a rescue down the street. Patrick was adopted however he continued to come to events. At one event a little girl was fascinated by his ears. He was being a good boy and she fell in love with him but he was taken She ended up adopting a different pitbull and they were happy.

The Research Project. Penelope had a very big project coming up for school. She worked very hard. Penelope did all of her research. She felt very good about her work on the project. She turned it in and aced it.

Emu and Ostriches. As we entered the safari, we were nervous. We had buckets filled with feed to give to them. We rolled down our windows quickly. We were nervous, ready to roll them back up. The emus and ostriches pecked hard at the feed.
Writer's Block. One day Eric, a writer, experienced writer's block. He sat down to brainstorm ideas. However none came. He decided to take a break until he had an idea. It worked and he got an idea!

Viral. Derrick loved funny cat pictures. His coworkers did not. Derrick always sent out a huge email on Fridays with lots of pictures. His coworkers had asked him to stop but he didn't listen. Derrick was fired one day because he sent it to his boss by mistake.

The New Home. Stacy bought a new home. She started decorating it right away. She changed all the paint colors and carpet. It was starting to feel like home. She couldn't wait to invite all her friends and family over to see it.

Rufus Visits Florida. Rufus wanted to escape the cold weather for a vacation. He decided to book a trip to Florida. In Florida he had delicious seafood and sampled the Miami nightlife. After a week he returned to his normal routine at home. However, he still cherished the memory of his Florida trip.

Monopoly. Emily wanted to play Monopoly. Her three brothers agreed to play with her. She bought all of the properties that she landed on. Emily put hotels on all of the properties she could. Her three brothers quickly went bankrupt and she won the game.

Volleyball. Xavier was playing volleyball with his friends. He jumped up to block the ball but it hit him in the face. Xavier fell down in pain. Xavier started bleeding. Xavier limped to the bench and sat down, fed up.

Astronaut. Andy watched Star Trek with his brother Finn. As they watched, Andy said he wanted to be an astronaut. Finn laughed and said that was never going to happen. Andy didn't mind. He knew one day he would prove his brother wrong.
attention. The men stood at attention. Their commander told them at ease. The men relaxed a bit. The commander told them to break. The men took a well needed rest.

Picking berries. I was out in the town one weekend. I saw a man was offering berries for cheap at his farm. I drove up and the man asked me to pick my berries. I gathered several pounds of blackberries and raspberries. It only cost me a few dollars and the man was very nice.
Car Key. Kia lost her car keys. She figured they'd be a few dollars to replace, like house keys. But she was very wrong! Only the dealer would make her a copy of the key. Kia spent over $300 on it!

Shopping at Target. Yesterday my husband and I went to Target. We bought a lot of snacks and cleaning supplies. We bought a lot of random stuff. We spent a lot more than we should have. On the way home I had to examine the receipt.

Dan can't fly. Dan was not a very smart kid. For some reason, he was convinced he could fly. One day he climbed on to his roof and jumped off. He spread his wings and screamed that he was flying. Landing with a thud, Dan finally realized he could not fly.

The Pacific North. Dan had always wanted to see the Pacific Northwest. He looked for houses in the area to buy. Everything he found was way out of his price range. Suddenly Dan found a manufactured he could afford. He immediately called the agent to buy it.

Reading. Gracie is in first grade and loves to read. Her teacher gives her special books to take home every night. Gracie likes to read the stories to her family. She gets excited when she learns new words. She wants to keep reading every day.

Late to Class. I was running late to class again. The teacher said if I was late he would lock me out. I didn't believe he would actually do it. When I got there, the door was locked. He made me stand in the hall for 10 minutes before letting me in.

Discontinued. Kim took a probiotic for digestion everyday. The Probiotic was crucial and kept the digestion on track. One day there was none at her local stores or online. She called the manufacturer who told her they were no longer sold. Kim was sad a product she relied on was no longer available.

The Move to Tulsa. Jeff was offered a job as a manager of a store in Tulsa. We did not know anyone in Tulsa or anything about the place. Researching the area online was the only way for me to get information. I made calls, wrote emails and texts for weeks to arrange everything. We moved into our new home two days before Jeff's first day of work.
Geese. Bailey hated geese. He lived right on a pond. There were always geese. He decided to get rid of them. He put out swan status to scare them away.

Old Water Bottle. Jill thought she got a fresh bottle of water. She took it with her to work. When she got there she noticed it was already open. The water inside was actually dirty. Jill tossed it and bought another from a vending machine.

Sports Day. Jimmy met up with the boys at the hospital. They challenged him to a basketball match. He scored a lot of points because of his height. After the match finished, we went to the tent. There were several drinks and food prepared for us.

Chase. Allan's dog started chasing a neighbor's cat. He chased the cat into the busy street! A car struck and injured both of them. Allan rushed his dog to the vet for treatment. His dog had to wear a leg cast for weeks.

Not Enough Ingredients. Daisy decided that she wanted to make some cookies. She began placing the ingredients onto the kitchen counter. Daisy began mixing milk and sugar into a bowl. She opened up the egg carton and realized she didn't have enough eggs. Annoyed, she put everything away and left the kitchen.

The Bum. Vinny was walking to the store to pick up some milk. He ran across a beggar in the street asking for money. He reached into his pocket for his wallet. It wasn't in there! If he hadn't seen the bum he would have went to the store for nothing.

Durpston. Durpston Thurpston couldn't play the guitar. Although he claimed he did to get the ladies. Once at his home, a woman asked for a performance. Unable to do so, she was miffed. Now Durpston dates his hand.

Wango. Mango Wangtini was a bartender. He entertained customers with sick bartender tricks. One day someone asked him to pour a flaming drink while blindfolded. Mango obliged, and began his routine. Unfortunately Mango's bar burned down afterward.
Resourceful. Oliver's only socks had holes in them. His shoe would rub against his foot. It hurt his foot. Oliver wrapped a small bag around his foot. It stopped the shoe from hurting him.

Train Ride. When I and my brother Joe were little, our grandfather visited. He had flown from California to our home in North Carolina. Granddad said he came with a surprise. The following morning he drove us to the train station. He took us on our first train ride.

The Barista. I used to go to a Starbucks in my old town. The same barista worked there all the time. Even though I went there a lot, she could never spell my name right. Finally before I moved she did spell my name right on my cup. I felt a sense of closure and knew I ready to move on.

Driving to Work. Amy had just gotten her first car. She decided to start driving to work instead of taking the bus. Amy worked downtown and she had to pay for parking. After a week a co-worker told her to print a validation slip instead. Her boss told her she should have been doing it the whole time.

Valedictorian. Jill had set a goal for herself in the seventh grade. She maintained the highest grades ever since then. She was determined to be valedictorian. When she became a senior, she still had that goal. At graduation, she met her goal and presented her speech.
First Day of School. Today is Henry's first day of school. He is very nervous! He ended up making a lot of new friends. He had a lot of fun. Henry is no longer nervous about school.

Save Often. I was writing a term paper for a class. I made a lot of progress and was 15 pages into the final draft. A thunderstorm hit unexpectedly. My power went out for an hour. I lost the last five pages of text I had written.

Football Star. Damon was a very athletic boy. He dreamed of being a football star his whole life. His sophomore year of high school, things fell into place for him. He earned a starting spot on the varsity football team. Damon excelled at his position and was scouted nationally.

Lecture. Will went to a lecture on a controversial subject. After the talk, they opened things up for a Q-and-A. Will approached the questioners' microphone. Will asked the speaker a very tough question. The speaker was stunned and stumped by Will's insight.

Arcades. Tommy brought some friends to an arcade. His friends thought arcades were old-fashioned are uninteresting. Tommy showed them some racing games. Tommy showed them some rhythm games. They had a great time, and changed their opinion of arcades.

Going to the Movies. Ciara and Quade loved going to the movies. But they always hated buying the expensive snacks. So they shared and rotated the payments so they weren't as expensive. This made the next movie going experience even better. The movie was great and so were their snacks.

Car Sick. Johnny and Susan were riding to Atlanta with their parents. Johnny got car sick. Their parents pulled over. Johnny started vomiting. Susan made fun of him the whole rest of the way to Atlanta.

"School". Dan was always schooling people on the basketball courts. He always said he schooled so hard he should be a principal. One day he decided to live up to his word and found his own school. But he discovered that out you need permits and such to open a school. So instead Dan just kept schooling people on the basketball courts.
The Therapist. Yolanda was a mess. She hired a therapist to help her fix her life. The therapist gave her lots of good advice. Yolanda's life started to improve. She knew she was on the right path.
The pony. A woman found a pony. The pony looked sad. The woman thought of something to help. She gave the pony some fresh hay. The pony cheered up and was happy.

Police. My daughter's best friend in school was the niece of a cop. He was a beat cop in our neighborhood. He was friendly to our family. One day I saw him handle a domestic incident in our building. He did look very friendly then.
Honey Pot. I bought a new lip balm. It was from the Disney brand. It was based on the tum tums game. It was shaped like winnie the pooh. I opened it to find the smell of honey in the wax.
Lost Friend. Tom had a best friend in elementary school. He had to move away. Tom was really sad about it. Tom's friend stayed in touch online. Eventually they met up and hung out again.
Random. Aaron needed to pick a random person. He wrote their names on a note. He put the notes in a hat. He pulled one from the hat. He picked the person on the note.

project. Drew needed an idea of a project for the science fair. He asked what his friends were doing. However, Drew realized he did not want to copy them. Drew looked for ideas online of unique projects and chose one. Drew showed his project at the fair and won second place.

Test. As I was preparing for my test I realized I didn't have any pencils. I asked all my friends if they had any, but they didn't. I looked around the school for one as well. Eventually I just asked the teacher for one. She gave me a pencil and I was able to do the test!
Beer. The man ordered the beer. The beer tasted flat. He asked the waiter for a different beer. The waiter charged him for the flat beer. The man complained to management.

Meter Monitor Or Thief. Johnny was a meter monitor. He started stealing small amounts of coins. He progressed to stealing hundreds of dollars per day. A government accountant alerted officials that money was missing. The police followed Johnny and then arrested him for stealing.

The Long Flight. Kristy hated air travel. Her last flight was delayed. While in the air they had to circle and wait to land. Kristy was in the airplane for hours. She decided to just drive from now on.

Birthday Beach Trip. Jack reached his ninetieth birthday last week. Jack had never seen the ocean, but spent ninety years hoping to do so. He made many sacrifices for his family and was never able to go. For his ninetieth birthday, his family took him to the Florida coast. Upon finally seeing the ocean, Jack shed a tear of amazement and joy.

Benjamin Played Video Games. Benjamin bought himself an XBox for Christmas. The X-Box was bundled with a very addictive game. Benjamin played this game non-stop for a week. Benjamin's work was angry at him for calling in sick too many times. Benjamin was fired and sold the XBox to pay rent.
Disappointment. Timmy liked to draw. He was very good at it. He applied to a design school. They rejected his application. He was very disappointing.

New Show. Tom kept watching commercials for a new show. He thought it looked annoying and lame. Tom decided to watch it anyway. He was actually really pleasantly surprised. It turned into one of his favorite shows.
The Car Wash. David liked caring for his car. He took it to the car wash. He scrubbed it and then vacuumed it out. David was happy when his car looked great. It made his day go smoother.
New Bag. Karen bought a new bag. She found it cheap online. Within a few days she noticed a hole in it. Several items kept falling out. Karen figured out why it was so cheap.

Girls. A boy grew up with all girls. He had a mother and 3 sisters. He did not get along with his sisters. One day he fell off his bike and broke his arm. His sisters brought him to the hospital and he liked them from then on

Tree. James had always wanted a tree. But since he lived in an apartment, he didn't have space. After working hard, he purchased a big house. Finally, James was able to get a very big house. He was very satisfied with his life now.

The Wait Game. James is impatiently waiting on the construction of his home. He expected everything to be done by now. He calls the contractor on a daily basis to check on progress. It looks like it should be ready in a few months at this point. Though he hates the wait he knows it will be worth it.

School dance. Alister needed a date for the school dance. He decided he was going to ask Susie. He was nervous she would say no. Thankfully she said yes when he asked her. They went to the dance and had a good time.
Getting a Raise. Tom was a hard worker. He rarely missed any days and was always on time. He was getting behind on some bills. Tom asked his boss for a raise. His boss said no.

Giving Up. Sandy finished her research paper. She sent it to her teacher and deleted the document after. A few minutes later, she got a reply from her teacher. He told her to re edit the document. Since she deleted it, she accepted an F for the grade.

Thunderstorm. Jill is afraid of storms. There is a big storm heading towards her house. Jill gathers some food and blankets and goes to the basement. Jill turns on the radio and listens to the weather. Jill waits until the storm has passed to go upstairs.

Ball Game. Greg was with his dad at a baseball game. He looked down for a moment. When he looked back up he saw a baseball sailing towards him. He lifted the glove he'd brought with him. The ball plopped right into it.

Enchanted Village. My daughter wants to take her toddler to the Enchanted Village. This is a puppet show featuring early 20th century figurines. The show used to be displayed in a store in Boston. It has since moved to the suburbs. I will go but I think the Enchanted Village is spooky.

Popout. Kelly seemed to get pregnant every time she was intimate. Her many children were just piling up around the house. She went to the doctor to see what she could do. Kelly's doctor prescribed some birth control pills. She hasn't gotten pregnant since.

Quex Quacker. Quex loved to go to the park. He would always go to the duck pond. Quex would always feed the same duck every day. One day Queen's favorite duck wasn't there. Quex came back every day to see him but he never came.

Paid to stand in line. Pruitt saw an ad in his local paper about making a quick grand. Being down on his luck, he thought why not. The job was to hold a spot in line for 12 hrs. Pruitt accepted and waited patiently in line for the next day. Pruitt was surprised when the man came, paid him and took the spot.

barn raising. Ana toured a traditional Amish village. She saw a man struggling to build a barn. Then his friends and neighbors arrived. Ana watched as they all worked together to build the barn. She thought the barn raising was a lovely custom.
Dog. Jenna got a dog. She loved the dog very much. She didn't love that the dog peed on the floor. Jenna looked up videos on how to potty train a dog. Now her dog goes potty outside like a good dog.

Art Obtains Understanding. Art occasionally saw passengers in other cars with head bandages. The bandages completely encircled the heads and looked weird. It reminded him of mummies that he had seen in the movies. When he turned 50 he had a face-lift. When he got home, he realized he looked just like those passengers.

Crazy. The man stretched out on the couch in the doctor's office. His therapist listened closely to everything that the man told him. He made careful notation of one sentence in particular. His patient believed he was becoming a werewolf. The therapist smiled and knew the man was crazy.

Room for Happiness. Susan wasn't enjoying her honeymoon in Las Vegas. She was bored because didn't like to gamble or drink. Her new husband realized something was bothering his bride. He cancelled their plans for the evening, which cheered her up. They had room service and spent a romantic night in the hotel room.
Long Time. Josh broke up with Hayley years ago. He wonders if it's a mistake. He tries to call her and get back with her. All he gets is the dial tone. He figures she's happy with someone else.
The Eggs. Lisa was walking very carefully. She had a bunch of eggs in a bowl. She tripped on the carpet and fell. All of the eggs cracked! She had a huge mess to clean up.

Cooking. I began to cook a meal for fifteen people. I started by putting a turkey in the oven. After that, I washed and chopped all of the vegetables. Then, the potatoes went in the pan to boil. Finally, I sat and waited for the cooking timer to go off.

Need feet to run. Sophie was supposed to run a big marathon today. But when she woke-up this morning, she had a boil on her foot. She put some ointment and padding around her foot. She then walked to the street where the event was taking place. But she had to concede defeat, her foot hurt to much to run.

Jackson. Jackson stole a wallet at a party on Friday. He took all of the cash and threw the wallet in the trash. Jackson was questioned by the host of the party about the wallet. Jackson lied and said he didn't see anyone take it. Jackson now lives with the guilt of being a thief.

Snowball Fight. It snowed a lot yesterday. Sally and I had to shovel the sidewalk. Sally made a snowball and threw at me. I made a snowball and threw it back at Sally. We ended of having a snowball fight instead of shoveling snow.

Sugar. Neil couldn't stand sugar. So when his niece threw a piece of cake in his face, he got mad. She told him it was a birthday tradition. But Neil was already starting to breathe hard. And he had to go to the hospital as he really couldn't stand sugar.

Dishonest Andrea. Andrea decided that she wanted to go to college. She got application forms from a school that she liked. She was supposed to write a personal essay for the application. Andrea got her friend to write the personal essay for her. Andrea felt guilty when she got accepted to that college.

Too Big To Flush. Leo got a pet turtle for his birthday. He thought reptiles were repulsive and gross. When his mom wasn't looking, Leo tried to flush it down the toilet. The turtle got stuck in the drain pipe. Leo's mom called the plumber and grounded him for a week.

Sunday Morning. I slept in late because I could. I woke up and made pancakes. I started doing laundry and called my friend. We talked for an hour about life. Afterward I sat down with my family for a while.

Bitcoin. Tim wanted to send money to his family in Eastern Europe. He was not sure how to do so. His family did not own a bank account. Tim thought bitcoin would be the best way. Tim sent the money using bitcoin.

Driving. Mari and her husband went out to dinner. They took Mari's new truck, which nobody else was allowed to drive. But at dinner, Mari had too many glasses of wine. She knew she could not drive home. Mari had to let her husband drive her new truck home!

Making a Video Game. Recently, I began creating my own computer game. I am doing all of the work myself. Typically, there would be an artist, programmer, and many more people. The progress is slow, but it is also steady. I look forward to finishing it and sharing it with friends and family.

Rhonda Visits a Museum. Rhonda never felt that she understood modern art. One day she decided to visit a modern art museum with a friend. Her friend helped her appreciate the art that she otherwise might not. Rhonda went home feeling grateful and satisfied. She felt that she understood modern art a little bit better.

Wine Lover. Noah is an avid wine drinker and loves to try different kinds. For Christmas he got a win making starter kit. He got to work right away fermenting his own wine. His wine turned out great and now he is trying another flavor. He now loves to drink wine and make his own wine.

Cattle. Gary visited a farm in his town. The first thing he noticed were the cows on the pasture. He timidly approached one. The cow stared at him blankly before moving on. Gary wondered if cattle just didn't find him interesting.
Final Exam. Steven's final exam is an essay. It is due in two days. It has to be 10 pages long. Joe has only written 1 page. Joe decided he better skip the party and write his paper.

The late gift. June was supposed to get a gift for a secret Santa exchange. She didn't have a lot of money and planned on waiting for awhile. It started getting so close to Christmas that she had to buy the gift. Unfortunately, it wouldn't be shipped in time for Christmas. Even though the gift arrived late, the giftee still appreciated it.

The Swimming Competition. Kris had always been a good swimmer. He joined a club to improve his skills. They invited him to swim in a competition just after joining. Kris was very nervous about this as he had never swam a race. He came in second and was very proud of his achievement.

Patience. I met a lady yesterday. She was elderly, very kind, and sweet. She wanted to talk for hours. We sat and chatted about everything. She told me her name was Patience, and I will never forget it.

Family Ski Trip. One morning the Smith Family decided to take a ski trip. They packed all of their gear into their car and hit the road. Once at the resort, little Suzy Smith realized she forgot her skis! The family then waited in line for an hour to rent Suzy some skis. With Suzy's skis rented, the Smiths enjoyed skiing out on the slopes.

Tornado in the Mind. Dan had recurring dreams about an approaching tornado. Dan was disturbed by having this dream night after night. Dan went to see a therapist to talk about this. Dan learned that his dream may indicate some latent anxiety. Dan found great relief in discovering this about himself.

Bad Christmas. Usually I enjoy Christmas. However, this Christmas just went bad. The power went out constantly causing everything to black out. Then, the presents that I received were awful. This day just ended with more issues.

Sweater. Lucas was knitting a sweater. He didn't know how to knit though. He made a big mess of wool thread. He gave it to his grandmother as a present. The grandmother sat him down and taught him how to knit.
Fishing Trip. One day Timothy and his dad went fishing. Timothy caught a bass. His dad was proud of him. Timothy was proud too. They had a good time that day.

Spanish Test. Jan has a Spanish test tomorrow. Instead of studying, Jan decided to go out. When she got to class, she fell asleep. Jan did not finish her test. She failed her test and was not able to retake it.

Wire Hangers. Jane asked her boyfriend to buy some coat hangers. He didn't really know much about them. He decided to get the cheapest wire hangers he could find. Jane was very displeased with his decision. She had to go back and get the right kind.

World view. When Emma was born, the world around her felt infinite. But when she was five, it was as big as her house. She grew up and saw how vast the real world was. But in the end, she ended up in one single room about to die. She hoped that when she went, she'd embrace infinity again.

Rainy Day. Bobby was excited for the weekend. His father had promised to take him to the zoo. Unfortunately it started raining Saturday morning. Bobby's father took him to the zoo anyways. Bobby got to see the baby elephant splash in the rain puddles.

Glenda. I think the character Dorothy was a freak in the Wizard of Oz movie. She trusted a lady who travelled by bubble. She went in the woods with three perfect strangers. She slept with the weird strangers in a poppy field. She woke up in her own bed, didn't know where she'd been or with whom.

Family. He hated Thanksgiving. His more successful relatives were sure to bring up his retail job. The worst was his brother with the great career. His shoulders were at his ears as his brother entered the room. His brother despairingly told the family he'd just been fired.
Flat Tire. Tina was driving home. It was dark and she got a flat tire. She pulled over to the side of the road. While calling for help a cop pulled up. The cop changed her tire for her.
Riding Lawn Mower. Tracy and Lee had a really big yard. It took Lee all day when he had to mow. It was hard work. For Lee's birthday Tracy surprised him with a riding mower. He was so happy!

Leaving. Greg had just finished packing his car for college. He was just about to leave. When he went to say goodbye to his parents, his mom started crying. Her crying made Greg cry as well. Greg realized that he was going to miss his parents.

Boring Main Event. Tom bought a pay per view for a big fight. He got really hooked into the first few fights. They were really exciting and hard fought. Tom thought the main event would be the same. Unfortunately it came out being a boring disappointment.
Chair Claimed. When it was hot this month, our cat stayed on the floor. She avoided couches and chairs. Today it was cooler. The cat jumped up onto the chair. She is now napping.

Running. Tim began running as a way to improve his fitness. His friend recommended listening to music during the run. Tim went out and bought a MP3 player. Tim added music to the device. Tim enjoyed running more with music.

Fired in One Day. I woke up and realized that I overslept. My phone had several missed calls from my boss. As soon as I saw him in person, he didn't bother to talk. He simply said that I'm fired. As much as I wanted to complain, I didn't and left the office.

The Spite of Rodents. A man wearing of squirrels nesting in his birdhouse. So he suspended the birdhouse from a rope. He added a barrier akin to those used to keep rats off ships. A few days later, he found the birdhouse on the ground. Squirrels had gnawed through the rope.

Softball Tryouts. Liz had never played softball for school. She always played on rec leagues. This year she decided to try out for her school's team. Liz was super nervous but gave it her all. When the team was called out Liz made varsity.

New Sister. Young Myron was used to being the center of his parents' lives. When his mother was pregnant, his parents tried to get him excited. But Myron was jealous, and was reluctant to see his new sister. When he saw her, he was shocked to feel tenderness towards the baby. Myron realized there were good parts to being a big brother too.

Drews big date. Drew needed to find a date. It was almost time for his prom. He decided to ask his best friend Jennifer. He was nervous and asked her. She said she would go with Drew on his big night.

First Day. Eric was nervous for his first day of preschool. He didn't know what to expect. His dad told him not to worry. He also told him that it was everyone else's first day too. Eric felt better about going to school.

Water Slide. Last weekend we went to the water park. We got to ride a bunch of different rides. I really wanted to go down the big water slide. I was too short to go on it alone. Fortunately my mom was able to go on it with me.
The Blender. Kelly was making a smoothie. She added yogurt and berries and milk. She blended it all up with some ice. She drank it with a long straw. Her new blender had done a great job!

Scared. Lillie was always nervous leaving work. Her car was parked in a parking garage. One night, she heard footsteps and was soon attacked by an assailant. She got away and called the police immediately. She decided to pay more for outside parking and carried weapons.

Joy. We got on the plane feeling happy. We sat in our seats beside each other. We were both very nervous about flying. We were scared during the turbulence. Neither of us admitted to our fears until we landed safely.

The Compassion Of Crazy. Willard can't do any work. The computers turned on all around him confuse his senses. He's awarded a worker's compensation claim. Willard no longer needs to come into work. He decides to sell his house and move.

Countdown. There were 7 minutes left in the test. Bryan still had 35 questions to finish. He went as fast as he possibly could. He was distracted by the sweat trickling down his cheek. He checked the final box just as the buzzer sounded.

The bird. I was woken up by my cat running across me at full speed. He had brought a bird in and let it go so he could chase it. I got up and started chasing it with him. I found a towel and threw it over the bird in mid flight. I then took it outside and let it go unharmed.

Waterfall. I decided to go to Maui for a vacation. My friend said I should check out the waterfalls in Maui. So, I decided to visit the tallest waterfall. It was nothing spectacular and I didn't have fun. That was the last time I took advice from my friend.
Ride. Bill was driving down the road. He saw his friend Amy walking. He stopped his car. He gave her a ride. Then he went home.
An accident. Mary cleaned the whole house. She was proud of herself. She made a cup of coffee. The cat jumped right into it. Coffee ended up on the carpet.

Coffee Coffee Coffee. One of my new favorite drinks is black coffee. I read in a magazine that black coffee is very healthy for you. It also has lots of caffeine in it so it helps me get through my job. I found a great coffee shop down the street from my house. I now drink about three cups of coffee every single day.

J'accuse!. Five people played poker one night. They were having an excellent time. Until on one hand, when they all revealed royal flushes. This is not strictly possible with four suits. Suspicion came to rest on the player whose flush was ampersands.

Wild Scare. Nancy was swimming in the ocean. She saw a large fin rise from the water. She got scared and tried to swim as fast as she can to the shore. Jenny had to help her get up since she had breathing problems. Terry rose from the water, with the toy fin on his head.

Cancun. My coworker went to Cancun in 1992. She was a senior in high school. When she got to Cancun she stood on her hotel balcony. She saw her boyfriend flirting with another girl. She broke up with him.
Laundry. It was the weekend and Andrew had no school. He wanted to relax for the rest of the day. But his mom made him wash his and her clothes. He was mad that he had to wash. It ruined his day.

computer class. Tom wanted to do good in his computer class this semester. He made sure to go through every assignment thoughtfully. Tom made sure he could do every task in the assignments. When his final project came he was relaxed because it was all familiar. Tom recalled all of his knowledge to complete his final project.

Lasagna. Chris was making lasagna. He bought all the ingredients. As he was cooking, he could not find the ricotta cheese. Chris had forgotten one of the main ingredients. He was upset he couldn't finish his dinner.

The New Bike. Randy got a new bicycle and helmet for his birthday. His mom told him he had to wear the helmet if he rode. He did not like the helmet so he did not put it on. He crashed the bike into a big oak tree. Randy got stitches in his head and his bike taken away.
New PHone. Tom bought a new phone. It had a big screen and was much faster. He ordered a special case for it. Unfortunately Tom dropped it before the case arrived. His new phone broke instantly.
Rock climbing fun. Lulu wanted to go rock climbing. She only liked climbing indoors. She went to an indoor facility. When she went she had fun. The only problem was she lost balance many times.

Angry Mom. My mom came home work. She noticed that the house was untidy and dirty. She immediately started to clean up the house. I asked what's going on and I got a mean response back. My mom was quiet for the remainder of the day.

Lunchtime. Glen was a geeky boy at school. He loved anime and video games, but never really talked to people. A girl in his class really liked him and invited him to sit with her. Glen was really shy and didn't want to do it. The girl took his hand at lunch and brought him to her table.

The Bears Game. Pat was so excited he couldn't sleep! He was taking his family to their first NFL game. They were going to Chicago to see their favorite team, the Bears. They all put on jerseys and face paint. This was going to be an amazing night!

The Roadside. Dan and his family were very poor. He would often skip school to pick peaches with his dad. Dan would stand by the road and sell them to motorists. One day a man took pity on him and paid $1000 for a single peach. Dan was so happy and his family was able to live a little better.

Jay's Garage. Jay had always wanted to clean his garage. However, Jay always procrastinated on this. A hurricane swept over and flooded his house. Now Jay could no longer delay. He discovered it was mostly junk anyways!
Sick Day. Bobby woke up with a stomachache. His mom took Bobby's temperature. Bobby had a bad fever. She called Bobby in sick from school. Bobby was happy to not go to school today.

Barking Dog. Martha's dog would not stop barking. Martha tried everything. She gave her dog some treats. When that didn't work Martha put the dog in time out. The dog eventually stopped barking after an hour.

Release the Stress. Matthew found out that his savings wasn't enough for his tuition. Therefore, he dropped out of his classes. In an effort to remain alone, he ignored contact with his friends. When his parents called him tonight, he didn't respond. Matthew came home early in the morning.

City. Nick and Tom were best friends. They decided to drive into the city to watch a band perform. They had a great time listening to the band. They got lost on the way home, it took 2 hours to arrive at home. They laughed about it and enjoyed seeing their unique city.

Bomb threat. One Monday afternoon at school all the students were escorted outside. We have no idea what was going on. Turns out there was a bomb threat at the school. We were all panicking because we never had this happen before. Turns out it was just a bad prank.

Rocket Surgery. Alice was making cookies one day. She had all the ingredients she needed. She went step by step through the recipe. The cookies baked but no one liked them. She mixed up tablespoons for teaspoons for the salt ingredient.

Gum Hair. Aiden was chewing a piece of gum. Somehow it got into his hair. Aiden's mother tried to get the gum out of his hair. The gum was stuck really bad. Aiden's mother had to take him to a barber to cut it out.
Plane. Ana had never flown on a plane. Her boyfriend moved across the country. She loved him and didn't want him to leave. She cried and cried. She decided she was brave enough to get on a plane.

Lucretia Prints Her Paper. Lucretia has been up all night writing a paper for her class. She finally finishes. However, she notices she has no paper to print it. She goes to the store to buy some paper. Finally Lucretia prints the paper for her class.

The Accident. Randi woke Roman up at 8:00 to get ready for school. He brushed his teeth, got dressed and had breakfast. They both got into the car and drove to school. When they arrived, Randi accidentally hit another car. She spent the rest of the day dealing with her insurance company.

Christmas shopping. I went Christmas shopping last weekend. First I tried the mall, but it was too packed with people. Next I went to the shops on Main Street. I found the perfect gift for my mom, but couldn't buy it due to price. I headed back to the mall where it was on sale for fifty dollars less.

unrealistic. The boy had a project. The teacher wanted them to make a realistic sculpture. He stayed up all night doing it. When he presented it he thought he did well. But, the teacher said it looked unrealistic and failed him.

Clown Lover. Rick always liked clowns. So he wanted to have a clown at his birthday party. His parents eventually gave in to his idea. But all the other kids hated the clown. And Rick ended up having a terrible party.

Fire. Gina was going to the CVS near her home. She thought it was odd the lights were off at the store. She pulled into the parking lot to have a look. The store was closed. Gina later found out they had a small electrical fire at the store.
Games. Brian and Karyn were playing Monopoly one afternoon. Karyn was losing the game. She became angry. Karyn threw all of the board pieces at Brian. Brian never played Monopoly with Karyn again.

Pizza Delivery. Amy ordered a couple of pizzas. An hour and a half later the pizzas hadn't arrived. Amy called the restaurant. The pizza still hadn't left the restaurant. The manager sent out the pizza for free.

Disney World. Last summer the Smith Family went on a trip to Disney World. It was a surprise for their little daughter. She loves all the Disney princesses. Meeting Cinderella totally made her day. And she even got a picture with and signature on it from her.

The Pets. Evan couldn't decide if he wanted a kitten or a puppy. He spent all month trying to decide. He looked at pictures of kittens and puppies. His parents told him he had to choose. In the end, he went with a kitten because they're softer.

The suet and the squirrel. Ellis had placed the suet in a safe place. The squirrel could always jump onto it in the old place. He was so excited to see that his placement was right. But, when he looked the next morning, the squirrel was on it. Ellis had to take it down and try to put it in new place.

The Football game. Scott was excited to play in the football game. He got to the field early for extra practice. He fell during practice and hurt his knee. Scott was so disappointed that he couldn't play. He did cheer his team on from the sidelines.
Ears. She bought a headband. She took it home with her other crafts. She grabbed the glue gun. She cut felt into the shapes of two ears. She glued them to the band to make a set of mouse ears.

Work's a Beach. Sheena made coughing sounds into the phone. She confirmed to work she was taking a sick day. She promised she'd be better by Monday. She squeezed herself into her new bikini. Within an hour she was at the beach, sipping a Martini.

Apartment Repairs. Tim rented an old apartment. Things often broke down on it. He had to call maintenance often. After a while Tim became friends with the maintenance guys. Tim would call them directly to fix problems faster.

Bad temper. Miles had a short temper. He got angry as soon as his kids were making too much noise. As he was rough and violent too, his wife left him and took the kids. Suddenly alone, Miles started thinking. He went to therapy and mended things with his wife eventually.

Picnic Clean Up. Gina and her friends were cleaning up their picnic. Her sister spilled soda. She should have cleaned it up. She only picked up the cup. Gina went inside, assuming the mess was taken care of.

Morning. Frank woke up with a splitting headache. He went to the cabinet and found no coffee. Went to check his bank account and found no money. Frank decided today wasn't his day. He layed down and went back to sleep.

Rally. Lolita was making a campaign sign. Gina told her that it was too vulgar for the rally. Lolita made some letters into new letters on the sign. She showed it to Gina. Gina said it wasn't evocative enough.
New candy shop. A new candy shop opened up. I was eager to try it. But when i went in it was expensive. I never wanted to go back. I went to the drugstore instead.

Cook Work. Alona was unhappy with her current job in the office. She needed a major change in her life. Her favorite thing was too cook, and it was a huge stress reliever. She decided to cook and sell plates for twenty dollars. She built her own successful cooking business for the locals.

Chess. Brian was trying to teach Karyn to play chess. Karyn didn't like following the rules of the game. Brian had taken almost all of her pieces. Karyn crafted a plan to win the game. She launched atomic warheads and destroyed the rest of Brian's pieces.

Gamestop. Ethan jumped on his bike, heading for Gamestop. The change jingled in his pocket as he neared the end of the block. He raced over the hill and parking lot to the store entrance. The bell jangled on the door as he entered. The clerk gave him a familiar smile and ushered him in.

Detention. Anette wanted to prove how tough she was. At her school's lunch period she picked a fight. No real blows were exchanged and a lunch monitor stopped it. Both students were given detention. Anette felt that she had gained a modicum of schoolyard respect.

Frank's Diet. Frank was supposed to be dieting. His wife was monitoring what he was eating. One day Frank left a receipt to a fast food place in his pocket. His wife found the receipt when she was doing the laundry. Frank's wife confronted him about not sticking to his diet.

The Dusty Puppy. Michelle's parents took her to pick out a new puppy. There were six puppies, all attractively clean except for one. He had been rolling on the dusty ground for fun! Michelle liked him and picked him despite his dust-covered fur. After his bath, Michelle gave him his first of many hugs from her.

Mascara. Kara decided to enhance her thin blonde eyelashes. She decided to start wearing mascara. At first it was clumpy and left marks on her brows and eyelids. But soon she got the hang of applying it. Soon Kara's lashes were thick and dramatic and lush!
Our Visit. Today we went to visit a friend. She lives an hour's' drive away. She showed us her chickens while we were there. She also made us peppermint tea! It rained very hard on our way home.

Cockroach. I was sitting in my living room. My dog started to bark. I looked over and saw he was barking at a cockroach. I picked up a heavy book and smashed the cockroach. It died and my dog stopped barking.

Survival. I was camping out in the woods with my dad. My dad wanted to teach me how to survive on my own. I thought I was going to use the skills my Dad taught me. However, I never had to use my survival skills. It was a waste of time.
Bread. I wanted some pumpkin bread. I asked a good friend to make me some. I offered to pay for it. He brought it to me, and refused payment. I sat down and ate a big slice with a cool glass of milk.

Tired in the line. Sara was at Disneyland with her family. It was late and they were going to go on just a few more rides. They were in a very long line for one ride. Sara started to feel so tired, she was falling asleep standing up. Finally, they made it to the ride and Sara woke up.

Case. Anna and her seatmate on the plane got along well. They were both young stylish women - they even had the same bag! But that ended up causing some trouble. When Anna disembarked, she grabbed the wrong bag! Luckily, her seatmate had contact info printed inside her bag.
Cat Fur. My wife decided to vacuum the apartment. The cat went into hiding. It took an hour. When she was done she showed me a canister full of cat fur. The cat looked the canister quizzically.

Car Wash. Beverly and her cheer squad needed to raise money. They needed new uniforms. Beverly decided to have a car wash. Many people came to get their cars washed. The cheer squad was able to get new uniforms.

The preconceived notion. Melissa had a crush on a boy she had met. She was talking to her friends about it and they knew of him. They all told her that he was a sexist jerk. She confronted him about it and he said that it wasn't true. She trusted him, and soon he had proven that it was true.

Reenactment. Alec works at the renaissance fair. He often puts on medieval reenactments. Last week he was in a sword fight. His opponent slipped and hurt himself. They had to make it seem like part of the act.

Brad and the water life. Brad loved being out on the ocean. Brad did not want to be away from the ocean. Brad started looking at buying a houseboat. Brad found a houseboat that he loved. Now Brad never leaves the ocean!
Taxi. Carol got off work really late one night. She could not find a cab anywhere. She ended up walking for a long time. She finally got a cab. She was so relieved to finally get home!

Nature. Walking on a California beach I came upon a jellyfish. He was stranded on the beach. He was still alive. His tentacles were twitching pathetically. It hurt when I picked him up to throw him in the water.

Ben's new pet. Ben wanted a pet. Ben went to the pet store. He looked at ferrets, but the ferrets smelled strange. He looked at puppies, but the puppies were very loud. Ben chose a cat, as cats are quiet and don't smell very bad.

Larkscall. Tommy Larkscall was bleeding. He'd gotten into a fight with another miner. Spending every waking hour near him in the mines took its last toll. The two miners squared up while the others shouted. But the radio interrupted them, saying a war had broken out.

Tennis. I beat my best friend. He was a little better than me. I got taught a trick from someone who played high school tennis. I practiced with him for an hour. The trick worked better than expected.
Christmas Morning. Tom spent all night wrapping gifts. He passed out late. In the morning his family struggled to wake him up. They opened gifts without him. Tom eventually woke up a bit saddened.

Tabby. Tabby was one of my best friends, until the day she died. We left a campground just outside of our town in her mustang. She turned left onto highway 64, but drifted into oncoming lanes. The last thing I remember was her looking at me, hand on her chest. She fell over sideways just before the semi hit, driving over her side.

Forgotten toothbrush. Rob checked in to his hotel in Houston. After he entered his room, he began unpacking his belongings. It was then that Rob realized he had forgotten his toothbrush. He went to the front desk to ask for assistance. The front desk gave him a new toothbrush to keep.

Homemade Cards. Annie decided to make her own cards to hand out on Valentine's Day. She gathered materials and worked hard to make each card special. Annie pictured how pleased her classmates would be with the cards. At school, Annie saw her classmates swooning over store bought cards. She stuck her homemade cards in her backpack instead of giving them.

On the Subway. The subway was especially crowded at eight in the morning. A pregnant woman got on the train and looked around. Several minutes passed, but nobody got up. Feeling guilty, I gave up my seat, motioning to her to sit down. The woman smiled and bowed in acknowledgment of my good deed.

No Kenny. Kenny did not enjoy walking to school everyday. Kenny's mother bought him a bike to aid in his trip to school. He rode his bike to school everyday. Kenny was able to get home much faster thanks to his bike. Kenny is back to walking to school because his bike was stolen.

Torn Pantyhose. Jane was out on a date. While at dinner her pantyhose got stuck on her chair. When she got up they tore loudly. Jane was embarrassed by the situation. Her date assured her it was no big deal.

Valentine's Gifts. Gina wanted to give Valentines to all her friends but had no money. She decided to make some gifts and started looking for materials. Walking along the river, Gina collected a dozen smooth white stones. Her mother gave her pink and red nail polishes to use as paints. The decorated river rocks delighted her friends and cost Gina nothing.

Gayle's chores. Gayle wanted the yard work done. Knowing her husband wouldn't do it willingly, she devised a plan. Gayle went outside with her work clothes on. Her husband grumbled, following shortly. Gayle was glad she knew how to manipulate her husband into chores.

Working hard. Vivian worked on a busy movie set. She was always there when people needed her. She fetched water or food for the actors. She also helped carry some boxes around. To thank her after a long day, the crew took her out for a beer.

Metabolism or illness. Dylan was always hungry. Despite eating a lot, he was considered thin for his build. He visited the doctors to see what the issue was. It turned out that Dylan had worms. He was prescribed medicine to fix it and he soon gained some weight.

I Almost Killed Myself Playing Pokemon Go. I've been playing a lot of Pokemon Go lately. I went around the neighborhood twice and felt myself getting hot. Figuring I was just out of shape, I kept playing. The heat sapped my strength and I couldn't muster any will to go home. I had to sit underneath a tree and wait for myself to cool down.

Chef's Kitchen. Patton had a dream of becoming a chef one day. His goal was to work at a famous restaurant in Paris. His family and friends told him he was not being realistic. Patton spent many years perfecting his craft. On his 30th birthday, he achieved his dream.

James's New Job. James got a new job at an animal kennel. He got to walk and feed dogs twice a day. He found it to be dirty work. It was also super rewarding too. The dogs greeted James with such joy each time they saw him.

Macy's Favorite Ice Cream. Macy loves to eat ice cream. Strawberry ice cream is her favorite. She went to the store to buy some. The store was out of strawberry. Macy went to another store and bought her favorite ice cream.

Mule and Plow. The old farmer had two mules and one plow. Both mules like pulling the plow for the farmer. Each day the farmer worried about which mule to used. One morning he saw both mules standing together. He got the idea to hooked both mules to the plow.
The Jail. Pete was a criminal. He was currently in jail. He was getting ready to be released. He didn't know where to go or what to do when he got out. Pete wanted to just stay in jail.

Keep on Giving. Mary contracted a sexually transmitted disease from her girlfriend. At first she didn't understand what had happened. Her girlfriend swore she hadn't been cheating on her. When Mary confronted her girlfriend about the STD, she confessed. Mary broke up with her girlfriend for betraying her trust.

Working Stores. Susan restocked products for a national business. The local stores she stocked were all over the place. Susan disliked the long commute times in between stores. Susan scaled back her travel availability. The company assigned her to close stores and kept her happy.

Goaltending. Mark was the goalie on his high school soccer team. When the team won, he got none of the glory. When the team lost, he got all of the blame. Mark's position was exceedingly unfavorable for him. Mark quit the team after that season.
Banana boat. We loved going on the banana boat. Six people would get on this big raft. The boat would then take us around the lake. Everyone tried to hang on as best as possible. It was so much fun.

The Beach. One time in high school my friends and I went to the beach. We quickly became bored laying around in the sun. So we decided to build a giant dragon out of sand. After a couple of hours the dragon was at least twenty feet long. People from all over the beach came to look at what we made.

Lost for Awhile. Joey's dad told him not to run off when they were hiking. But he wandered away thinking he could find his way back. When he realized he was lost he started to panic. Then he heard his dad calling for him. He promised to stay close the rest of the hike.

New Shoes. Chad was eight Year's old and growing fast. One day his mom noticed that his shoes were too small for his feet. She took him to the mall to get new shoes. Chad tried on many shoes before he found the perfect pair. He was certain that his new shoes were the best in existence.

The Fireman's Dog. I was four years old the first time I was ever bitten by a dog. It belonged to the fireman who had moved in across the street. Just like in cartoons, the Dalmatian was white with black spots. I remember thinking that his wagging tail wanted to be tugged. I tugged it, and the Dalmatian gave me some spots of my own.

The New Alphabet. Stan was bored one day and tried to better rearrange the alphabet. He put the vowels at the start and all the useless letters at the end. In the middle put his favorite letters in order of favoriteness. He then made a song to better memorize his order. Everyone loved the song but was too attached to the original.

Time Lost While Playing. I had spent a week studying hard for my gross anatomy midterm exam. That Friday, I decided to blow off a little steam. A buddy and I started playing video games that night, as a break. We made it a marathon, playing nonstop. Before we knew it, it was Sunday night and we needed to study!

The Cat. Naomi noticed a cat sleeping on her porch when she took out her trash. Over the next few days, she noticed the cat spending more time there. She went outside and pet the cat. Naomi put some missing cat signs up. No one responded, so Naomi kept the cat.

Spoiled. Cami's mom married Ani's dad, and the two girls became stepsisters. Cami, 12, had grown up in a low-income single-parent household. But Ani, 7, was wealthy and spoiled, so she was very bratty. At first she hated Cami and was always mean to her! But then, finally, the two girls began to become friends.

Can't see who's calling. Eric was walking around a group of students. One of his classmates in the past recognized him. He was trying to call Eric's name. Eric heard his name. He recognized who it was and looked up since the man was tall.

Animal safari fun. At the safari yesterday we were shocked when a lion came up to us. We literally sat in our seats as the lion came over. We were afraid it would bite. Thankfully it didn't bite. It just stood there and we took a photo.

Out of Beer. Jake went to the store to buy beer. They ran out of his favorite kind. He decided to try something new. He chose a random one that sounded interesting. Jake liked his choice and bought it again.

Home Econ. Clare hated babies. She knew she never wanted to be a mom. She was forced to take a home economics class in high school. She had to carry around a flour baby for two weeks. At the end of it she still hated babies and felt she wasted two weeks.

Cranky. Jessica was sitting in the cafeteria alone. I decided to give her company. However, she yelled at me when I asked her if she's ok. She also smacked me with her purse. A few hours later, I found out that her brother passed away.

Can't Click Away Fast Enough. Bob was really interested in the product the company was selling. He went to their website with the intent to buy it. As soon as their page opened, a popup filled his whole screen. Bob couldn't find the close button on it to dismiss it. Frustrated, he closed the tab and didn't buy the product.

Too Hot For Ice Cream. Jerry was eating a bowl of ice cream outside. It was a hot and humid summer day. He left his porch to check his email. When he came back he saw a big puddle. He cleaned up his melted ice cream afterwards.
My niece. My niece got engaged this summer. She got an emerald ring from her fiance. They had been dating for a year. We met her fiance in a restaurant. I look forward to the wedding next year.

Jacob Breaks His Phone. Jacob was texting on his phone while walking on the sidewalk. Jacob tripped over a tiny rock on the concrete. He fell and lost control of the phone in his hand. His phone flew up into the air. Jacob's phone landed on the ground and broke.
Riley is too loud. Riley is an upstairs neighbor. He makes too much noise. Riley receives constant complaints filed against him. Riley get evicted. His new apartment complex puts him in the basement.

Elizabeth can't kick. Elizabeth loved soccer. Elizabeth was going to play in her first game. She was having a hard time kicking a goal with other people around. Elizabeth's coach kept pushing her to practice kicking. Elizabeth scored the winning goal in her first game.

Cleaning the house. Greg had a list of chores to complete that day. He started by sweeping the floors. Next, he mopped the kitchen and bathrooms. Lastly, he wiped down all the surfaces he could find. After Greg finished, he laid on the couch and took a short nap.

Too Fat. I needed to lose 80 pounds for my wedding. I was told I needed to lose weight before gastric bypass surgery. In 6 months I lost 100 pounds! I lost so much weight, I didn't need the gastric bypass anymore. I was in shape and ready for my upcoming wedding.

Small world. My husband and I live in a small town not far from Reno. We are big fans of the musician Boz Skaggs and have seen him a lot. Last spring we traveled to Reno to see him, again.
