At our table for the concert sat three other couples. To our amazement those couples live three blocks away from us.

Going to School. Last week I was driving my son to school in the morning. I was preoccupied. I drove in the school parking lot and kept going. I left school without dropping my son off. He was happy about that until I turned around and brought him back.
Mahabharata. In 2014, I started reading the Mahabharata. This Indian epic is 6,000 pages long. I began in November of 2014. I read 100 pages a day. I finished in January of 2015, much to my relief.

Blanket head. I've always been a girly girl. As a child, I used to want long hair so bad. So, I put a blanket on my head and ran around. I felt like a glamorous woman. I've worn long hair ever since then.

The Promotion. Janice saw a job posting on her company's website. The job pays almost double what she makes now. Although she didn't have all the qualifications, she applied for it. She impressed the manager at the interview. Janice starts her new job next week.

Sledgehammer. Forest was doing construction work. He needed to break apart cement. He tried using a regular hammer, but was unsuccessful. He then tried using a larger sledgehammer. He was able to easily break the cement.
Being rude. Suzy wanted to invite her friend over. She sent her a text. But her friend never responded. Suzy gave her a few days. But her friend totally ignored her.
Test. John has a science test tomorrow. He has studied all week. When he got to class, he was ready. The teacher gave out the test. John finished and knew he made an A.
The Pencil. Kevin was running in his class. He had a sharpened pencil in his hand. Kevin slipped on his shoelace. He tripped and fell. Kevin stuck himself in the hand with the pencil.

The Babysitter. Sue babysits for her neighbors on the weekend. She sits on the couch while the kids play in their room. She also talks to her friends on the phone. The parents arrive back home just before midnight. They pay Sue a good amount of money for babysitting the kids.

Dark Stranger. Linda fell in love with a tall dark stranger in town. Though practically strangers, she invited the man to move in. One day, Linda left her new man a note to pick her up after work. When he didn't arrive, Linda was furious. She didn't know that the dark stranger couldn't read.

Mounting Bills. Jane started to open all the mail after she got home. In total, there were four new bills that arrived that day. She got out her spreadsheet to make sense of the finances. She looked dismayed that they may not be able to pay them all. She took a break and went to watch some television.

Addictive Game. A game was brought back from vacation. The game was shared and became alarmingly popular. Wesley was suspicious when testing showed the game highly addictive. Wesley used a computer virus to disrupt the game software. The games headsets were all destroyed.

Marco Visits Utah. Marco had always wanted to visit Utah. Finally he had saved money and booked his trip. Marco loved exploring the natural beauty of the state. He had a terrific trip. Marco was glad that he had visited Utah.

The Interview. Sam was rushing to an interview for an exciting new job. He tripped and tore a hole in the knee of his black suit. He did not have time to go home and change. Instead, he colored his knee black with a magic marker. No one was the wiser, and the interview went well.

Stray kittens. My roommate and I have been leaving food out for stray cats. There is a litter of kittens living in our back yard. The kittens didn't like us at first. We eventually taught them to enjoy our company. They are still feral despite enjoying a good brushing sometimes.

Spring Water. Tom wanted to become healthier. Tom asked a nutritionist about the health benefits of water. The nutritionist informed him that all water is not equal. Tom asked if using a filter on the tap was good. Tom learned spring water is better than filtered tap water.

Driving again. Michelle hadn't driven a car in six months. Previously she had been in a terrifying accident. The event left her shaken and afraid to get behind the wheel. Her friends decided to help by making her drive and encouraging her. After a few weeks she regained her confidence behind the wheel.

Seth Rides a Bike. Seth is tired of walking to work every day. He wants to buy a car but they are too expensive. Finally Seth decides to buy a bike. He loves getting to work on his brand new bike. Seth is very happy he no longer has to walk to work.

Ribs. Henry was at an important meeting at work. When it was lunchtime, the group ate a catered lunch. Henry chose to eat ribs during lunch. He dropped one on his suit. Henry vowed never to eat messy food at a company event again.

Fluffy Socks. Han had a cat named Fluffy Socks. One day, her cat went out to play and never returned. Han was scared because tomorrow was moving day. Han moved five miles away, but left her cat's toy on the new porch. Fluffy Socks appeared at Han's new house the next day!
The Dare. Bill was playing with his friends. They dared him to climbed the tall tree. They said he was chicken if he didn't do it. Bill thought long and hard. He decided to go find better friends.

Battle of the Bands. Toby was nervous, but excited. His band was up next in the battle of the bands competition. They were well prepared. They began playing. Toby's band did great and won the competition.
Terrible perfume. Kelly's boyfriend got her perfume for her birthday. Kelley thought it was a sweet gesture. She immediately put some of it on. When she tried it, she was disgusted. It was horrible.

The Prisoner. Jim was a prisoner but he was allowed out of his cell an hour a day. He was even allowed to go outside. Because he so rarely saw the sky, he didn't take it for granted. He would look up and be amazed. Absence does make the heart grow fonder, he reflected.

Clean Up Your Toys. Martha awoke from her sleep with a full bladder. She climbed out of her bed and made her way to the bathroom. On the way, she stepped on several Lego pieces. The next morning, Martha confiscated all of her son's toys. Martha never stepped on a Lego again.

Wrestling Show Disaster. Billy enjoyed watching wrestling with his dad. They were enjoying the wrestling pay per-view Summerslam. Billy heard thunder and the power went out. They were upset that they were going to miss the rest of the show. The power came back on and they were overjoyed and finished the show.

Winner. Sara bought a lottery ticket. She never played, but she was feeling lucky this week. She eagerly watched the drawing on TV. As the numbers were called out, she grew excited. She had matched every number and won the lottery jackpot!

The Smallest Player. Kevin was the smallest boy on his basketball team. He often couldn't make as many plays as the bigger boys. Kevin didn't stop practicing everyday at his home. He developed a method of quickly dribbling around the bigger boys. Kevin was soon just as good a player as all the other kids.

New years eve. My family and I are going out to celebrate New Year's Eve this year. We have a plan to drive to New York City. This will be my first time there. The weather is supposed to be nice too. I am so excited to go.

The Staircase. I decided to rebuild my staircase. Alas, I didn't use reinforced wood. The staircase lasted for the first few week. Then, one day it collapsed. I had to hire a carpenter to fix the staircase.
The Cereal. The kids woke up hungry. They wanted to eat big bowls of cereal. The mom poured the cereal into the bowls. Then they realized they had no milk! The kids went to school hungry.
Cleaning Up. The day of the big move was almost here. They had everything packed up. All the furniture was moved as well. They were all cleaning up. It felt bittersweet moving.

The Sunglasses. Gregory received a pair of sunglasses as a gift. He thought that they were the best gift he had ever gotten. Gregory showed off the sunglasses wherever he went. People started to think that he liked the sunglasses too much. No one hangs out with Gregory any more.
mike is angry. I was really hungry. I checked the fridge and found pizza. The pizza box said it belonged to Mike. I ate it anyways. Now, Mike is angry.

cotton candy. Ana went to the carnival. She was looking for cotton candy. But she couldn't find any anywhere! Then she asked an employee to show her where it was. Ana was happy to finally get her cotton candy.

Windy River. Todd took his little brother fishing for the weekend. Upon arriving, he set up chairs and a cooler to relax. His brother started nodding off, so Todd let him sleep. After a few minutes, Todd's pole began to spring and wiggle. Todd, yelling with excitement woke his brother up and caught a fish.
Laughing. Joe was a comic. He did stand up for a living. One day a person was heckling him. And he got really upset at it. He never went back to the comedy club ever again.

Pharmacy. My girlfriend hates making phone calls. She always makes me call in her prescriptions for her. I went to go pick up the prescription and they didn't have it. They said they needed her to call them or they couldn't approve it. She made me call and pretend to be her instead.

The new job. Jim had been working at a hotel for three years. He needed to move for family reasons. Luckily, the hotel offered him a job at a branch in his new city. Jim started there that week, and at first he didn't fit in very well. Luckily, within a few weeks he had integrated well into the group.

Purchasing Decisions. Tom wanted to buy a Surface Pro. He was deciding between that or a new laptop. So, Tom went to Bestbuy and asked a representative about it. Eventually, he bought the Surface Pro. He was ultimately happy with his decision.

Fire. Stan was cooking dinner one night. Suddenly his toddler began to yell. Stan rushed to see what the problem was. The food on the stove caught fire while Stan was gone. When he rushed back, he had to hurry and put out the flames.

Dumb Prank. I and my friend Joe wanted to prank our Spanish teacher, Senior Perez. We managed to get a copy of his car key made during our lunch hour. Marty moved his car to a different area of the parking lot. We watched Senior Perez come go out to his car at the end of the day. We laughed at his bewildered expression.

Lola drinks coffee. Lola was very tired before work. She decided to get a Starbucks coffee. She drank the coffee in the car on her drive to work. She had much more energy after her coffee. Lola did not get tired throughout her shift at work.

Michael goes to prom. Michael was worried he wouldn't have a date for the prom. It was only weeks away and nobody had said yes to him. As prom came closer he was even more worried. Then one day his best friend Jill asked him to go to prom with him. Michael didn't know what to say he was so happy and excited to go!

Lanterns. After the movie Tangled Lisa became obsessed with lanterns. Her boyfriend went to the store and saw Chinese lanterns on sale. He bought a few to surprise her. On her birthday he brought them out and told her to write her wishes. They then lit the lanterns and set them off into the sky.

Online Chess. I just played three games with my friend Steve. I won tied the first game and lost the second. Then I won two games in a row. Steve said his roommate was noisy and stopped playing. We will play again tonight.
Clams. Spence has always been grossed out by seafood. He and his friends took a trip to the coast. They went to one of the best seafood restaurants. He decided to try clams. He loved them!

The Dance. Sarah was excited, but nervous for the dance. The dance had been advertised for months at the school. Sarah didn't have a date, but wanted to go anyway. She locked eyes with Steve across the gym. Steve came over and asked her to dance.

Painting Pottery. We thought it would be fun to paint some pottery. We went to a large pottery shop. I picked out a large plate to paint. I painted a plaid pattern on it. It is my favorite place to eat on!

Books. My sister in law offered to help me sell books after my stroke. She and her husband drove to a library and picked up books. One day she asked for gas money or a cut of the profits. I gave her some gas money but thought that was low. I blamed it on her husband who was mean and stingy.
Degrees. I couldn't find any deodorant. I knew I had two containers. I finally had to borrow my husband's. I went to the store to buy more. I bought a package of five and took them home.

What did mom tell you  about talking to strangers. Jerry went for a drive in new 2016 Chevy Camaro. Jerry saw a man hitch hiking along the highway. The hitchhiker thanked Jerry for the ride and asked about the car. After a short discussion, Jerry tells him "I'm not selling my car." The man looks at Jerry seriously saying "I'm not buying it."

Mturk. My friend told me about a way to make money online. This is when I heard about Amazon Mechanical Turk. I was able to pass the probationary period. I have made over five hundred dollars since then. I am glad that I have found a way to make extra money.
Leg. She scratched the sore on her leg. The scab came off. She ran to get a towel. She thought there would be blood. She was so swollen that water leaked out instead.

Elephants. I've always loved elephants, ever since I was a little kid. Today I got to see an elephant at the zoo. It's name was Zooney, and it was missing both of its tusks. Although it was missing its tusks it was the largest of the five. Zooney is so large, that he is automatically the alpha of the herd.

Volleyball Match. Arlene still felt weak from a previous illness. The volleyball match was only a few days away. She still could not breathe too well or practice. Her coach came up with a home remedy to help her get better. Arlene ended up competing in the match and had a good game.
A waterfall. Mary has been redoing her yard. She added an awesome waterfall to the pond. It gives the area a serene feel. She has been so creative with the yard. You have to go see it.

Michelle's New Puppy. Michelle's dog had puppies. One puppy was brown with a black mask on her face, like a brown panda. When Michelle's dad said she could keep her, Panda became her name. As Panda grew, over time her mask faded away. When asked about her name, she smiled because it was their secret.

The baby won't sleep. Georgia was trying to get her baby to sleep. He was very fussy and wouldn't stop crying. She tried many different tricks that usually worked. Still the baby wouldn't sleep. She finally gave up and let him cry it out.
Growing up. I was finally eighteen. My parents forced me to move out of their house. I didn't have a job. I tried to look for a job but my luck was down. I ended up homeless.

Grease Fire. Kim wasn't a very good cook. She tried to make french fries. Some grease spilled over and caught fire. She tried to put it out by throwing water on it. The fire spread and Kim had to call the fire department.

The Circus. Drew was ready for a night out with his family. They had tickets to the circus. The kids were so excited to go. They all loved the clowns and elephants. After it was over, they all clapped and cheered.

Life Changes. Last week, I decided to start looking for a new job. My best friend at work had gotten a new job already and moved on. Being alone at work forced me to face the realities of my position. I evaluated the pros/cons & found it was time for a change. I submitted five resumes last night and am waiting for a callback.

Pen Caps. Jared was trying to quit smoking. He was doing well but he started chewing his fingernails. Jared bought a pack of cheap ballpoint pens. He started chewing on those instead of his fingernails. Jared eventually quit smoking and chewing on pen caps.

First Day of Work. Today I started training for a new job. I was a bit overwhelmed and worried going into the day. However, my trainer was very patient and understanding. He taught me well, and showed me in ways I could understand. By the end of the day, I had mastered most of the skills needed.

No Friends Left. Carl was always mean and rude. His friends usually put up with it. After a while Carl kept getting worse. His friends asked him to stop but he wouldn't. Eventually Carl lost all his friends.

Allergy Medication. Sue was having trouble dealing with her summer allergies. She was allergic to the pollen floating around in the air. Sue went to her doctor for a check-up. Her doctor prescribed her a nasal spray. Sue no longer sneezed with the medication.

Sweatpants. Harold had eaten way too much Thanksgiving dinner! He was miserably full. He unbuttoned his pants but it wasn't enough! We went to his closet. He put on the biggest pair of sweatpants he could find.

Angela 5. I didn't see Angela again for 5 years. When I did, she had a little girl of her own. She was very serious and different. The bubbly easy going Angela I had known was gone. I never knew why she changed so much.

Italian. We went with our grandparents to dinner. They were so excited to take us to their favorite place. All the waitresses knew them there. They ordered the same thing every time. I'm not going to lie, it was pretty amazing.

The Office. John is an accountant who works long hours. He is loved by his coworkers and boss. They gave him cheesecake for his birthday. John brought donuts for them as a thank you. They like him even more now.

Keurig. My wife bought a Keurig in 2012. We used Mister Coffee styled coffee makers until then. I was home alone often and it was hard to make a single cup. My wife had a coupon and she bought the Keurig. It has served our purposes nicely.

Tibet. Neil was writing an article on a foreign country. His country assignment was Tibet. He flew to Tibet and interviewed citizens there. He got a good grasp of both sides of the story. His Tibet article was well-received!
Hockey Game. I used to play hockey when I was young. I practiced 6 days a week. The competition was very fierce. We went to state once. We won 2-1 in overtime!

The worst cup of coffee. Mariah wanted a cup of vanilla coffee from the coffee shop. She got in the car and drove to the shop. She ordered a vanilla coffee with two sugars. The cashier gave her the coffee and Mariah took a sip. She scrunched up her nose because the coffee was bad.
gold. Ben was digging in the sand at the beach. He found a lump of what looked like gold! He was so excited. He took it to get appraised right away. But he was told it was only pyrite, fool's gold!

Soft Avocado. Don bought an avocado at the store. It was fairly fresh and hard. He figured he would wait for it to ripen. Days later Don wanted to make guacamole. The avocado was perfectly ripe for it.

The Kiss. Kelly had the prettiest lips in the world, according to some people. Joe e-mailed her asking for a kiss. Kelly said no. Joe asked again and again. Kelly took a selfie with her lips puckered and said there's your kiss.

Trying hard. John had a hard time at work. Everybody was always ahead of him. He brought some work at home to get ahead. But even then, it was not enough. So he accepted he would never make it big and did his best.

The broken tail light. Christy was driving on the highway. Suddenly, a cop turned on his lights. She pulled over and spoke with him. He told her that her tail light was out and ticketed her. She immediately went somewhere to have the light fixed.
Mouse. One day when I was little I saw a mouse. It was trapped in a big goldfish bowl. The bowl was glass so the mouse could not climb out. I told my mother. She drowned the mouse in hot water.

Missing the Last Episode. Liz was binge watching her favorite tv show. She got to the last episode. It was really late at night. Liz passed out before the ending. The next day she had to watch it again.

Catch the Thief. The police were trying to catch a neighborhood thief. They decided to stake-out the entire area that night. They didn't catch the thief so decided to continue the stake-out. Four nights later they saw the thief. All the police officers rushed to grab the guy and they caught him.

Contaminated Shorelines. The Roberts went to beaches along the Gulf Coast every summer. They loved the beach and had a lot of fun on them through the years. Unfortunately, there was an oil spill off the coast earlier this year. The beaches were closed this summer. The Roberts  decided to stop going to beaches for their family trips.

TuTu. Kate wanted to be a ballerina. She had to wait until she was 5 to take classes. And she was only 4. As a treat her mother bought her a pink tutu to wear. She danced around in her tutu for an hour.

Lipstick mishaps. Jessica wasn't used to wearing lipstick. So when she went on a date, she put too much. It smeared the face of her date. It even went all over her utensils and glass. In the end, she removed it and kissed her date with clean lips.

Jackpot. Fany was walking home from school. She noticed a shiny object on the ground. She immediately ran after it. It turned out to be a golden pendant. Rachel hired an expert to evaluate the pendant's value.

Boring Movie. Lucy was watching Funny Girl with her grandparents. Her grandma made the movie sound interesting. It was anything but. Lucy decided not to finish the movie. She crept out without them noticing as they laughed at the movie.

John Visits His Grandma. John realizes it has been too long since he visited his grandmother. He packs up his bags and gets ready for the long trip. When he finally arrives, he is happy to see his grandmother. They spend a few days catching up. John is pleased that he has visited his grandmother.

Clothes Shopping. Albert needed a new pair of slacks. His mom took him shopping at the mall. He was embarrassed to be there with her. Luckily they didn't run into anybody. He got new pants and looked great.

Brand. I am very good at branding my name. I started out with only $50 million when I was 20 years old. Now I have amassed $10 billion through selling my brand. I put my brand name on buildings, water and steaks. I even have my own brand of clothing, but I don't wear it myself.

First day of school. Yesterday was the first day of school. I was really scared because I didn't know anyone. During lunch I sat next to someone names Phillip. Me and Philip became really good friends. Now I'm not scared to go to school anymore.

Tokyo Trouble. Amanda always wanted to go to Tokyo. One day she was able to save up enough to go. When she finally arrived she met a guy named Stan. Stan ended up stealing all her money. Amanda was stuck in Tokyo with nowhere to go.
Nice investment. Alicia bought a tech company. She thought it would do well. But the next year she made a lot of money. The company reported fantastic earnings. Alicia doubled her money.

Sick Daughter. Barbara's daughter had been throwing up all night. Barbara stayed up all night watching her. Eventually her daughter felt better in the morning. Barbara called in the school to tell them her daughter was sick. Barbara took the day off from work to take care of her daughter.

Failure. She knew she was a failure. Her parents always told her so. She tried hard sometimes, but it did no good. They continued to berate and judge her. She gave up, knowing it was what they wanted.

Camping. The family loved going camping. They loaded their tent and sleeping bags up in the car. They drove to the campsite and unloaded it all. It took an hour to get their camp ready. THey couldn't wait to settle in for the night!

Borrowed car. Sarah borrowed her mom's car. She used it to get some things done outside of the house. She lost track of time. She was very late returning the car to her mom. Her mom was very upset with her.

First Time Drinking. Danny had never drank alcohol before. He pretended to have at his first party. He didn't know his limit. He wound up throwing up and passing out. His friends had to carry him home.

Javier Scores A Goal. Javier is frustrated he hasn't scored a goal this soccer season. He decides to try his best to score one. Javier scores a goal during a game. He feels so much better. He is happy that he finally scored a goal during this season.

Noisy Toddlers. Tom's neighbors had kids. The kids would run around early in the morning. It would wake Tom up. Tom felt bad about saying anything since they were kids. Instead he just dealt with it by getting earplugs.

Fold Them. Kate's mom made her do the laundry. It took hours to wash the clothes for the house. She poured baskets of clothes onto the couch in the living room. Her mother saw the piles and gasped. Kate was forced to spend 2 hours folding all the clothes on the couch.

Surprise Dinner. Jake wanted to surprise his girlfriend. He cooked dinner before she got home. When she arrived she had fast food bags. She had thought of getting him food on her way home. They both appreciated each other's thoughtfulness.

Tornado Alley. A tornado tore through the town of Richmond one summer. Many of the homes were destroyed. Fires roared through what homes were left standing. Firefighters worked hard to put out the flames. Eventually order was restored, and people began to rebuild.

Bob's Son Hits a Homerun. Bob was at his son's baseball game. His son was up to bat. Bob cheered for his son. His son hit a homerun over the fence! Bob chased after his son's home run ball afterwards.

The Epidemic. Tiny Tot's Daycare was known for their cleanliness and service. One day though, the children all started itching rapidly and heavily. Upon inspection of the children, lice and their eggs were found. It became a three month epidemic that proved hard to get rid of. They lost their license and had to close due to the heavy fines.

Read to Me. Beau started kindergarten a few months ago. His mom was amazed at how much he was learning so fast. One night at bedtime, he announced he was going to read to her. He took a little book out of his backpack. And read it to him mom.
Speech. The man blew the whistle. The team got quiet. The man gave a speech. The team felt excited. The team chanted in approval for the coach.
Newbie. A new girl joined Ed's office. She was very shy and spoke little. Ed decided to befriend her. He sat with her at lunch every day and chatted. Soon he had drawn the shy girl out of her shell!

Arm Wrestling. Thelma challenged her older brother to an arm wrestling match. He was much larger than her and played many sports. Laughing in a dismissive manner, he accepted her challenge. After only a minute of struggle, she won! Her sheepish brother apologized for having doubted her.

Swimming. I knew that I was a very good swimmer. So, I decided to try out for my school's swim team. There were a lot of other great swimmers there. The coach had the tryouts compete against each other. Afterwards, the coach told me I earned a spot on the team.

Homework Help. Sam needed help on his math homework. But he was too embarrassed to ask for help. He tried to learn from the textbook on his own. But he became more and more frustrated. Sam ended up guessing on every problem.

NYSE. I wanted to make more money. I decided to try my hand at the NYSE. I put thousands of dollars into my account and set up a portfolio. Alas, the portfolio did terrible in the fiscal quarter. I lost almost all of my money!

The Find. I was at Goodwill last week. In the video game section there was a Super Nintendo. It was only five dollars with four games. I bought it right away. When I got home I played for hours non stop.

Candy Store. Michael wanted to visit a candy store. He hasn't been to a candy store since he was a kid. He spent time looking at all the different candies the store offered. He ended up spending fifty dollars all on candy. By the end of the week, Michael was already sick of candy.

Sleepy. Max noticed he was always tired so he went to the doctor for help. His doctor asked Max if he slept through the night regularly. Max couldn't remember the last time he had slept through the night. The doctor gave him a small sample of sleeping pills to try. After taking a pill for four nights, Max felt awake during the day.

Kidneys. My friend Cam's back started hurting him. He went to urgent care. They said his kidneys were not functioning well. He went to his pcp, a urologist, and a nephrologist. They are still running tests.

Jackie's New Shoes. Jackie wanted a new pair of shoes. They were very expensive and she couldn't afford them. Her husband felt bad because she really wanted them. He decided to buy them for her for her birthday. Jackie was very happy.

No Response. He picked up the discarded toy. Handing it to the child on the way inside, he didn't notice the mess. Sure enough he began to walk pass knocked over furniture. Alarmed, he ran into the back bedroom. There she was, unresponsive as he screamed and screamed.

Truman's Keyboard. Truman was a professional typist. Gradually Truman's keyboard deteriorated. Truman ordered a new keyboard from the internet. Truman was overjoyed when he got his package. However, he would need some time to adjust to the new layout.
Games. We set out all the board games. We picked our favorite ones. The three of us started to play. The youngest won every game. We didn't tell him it was because we let him.

Mturk. Kevin was posting hits on mturk. People finished the hits quicker than expected. He gave them all rejections. Many turkers wrote him demanding compensation. He overturned the rejections because they nagged so much.
Noises. Loud noises were driving me crazy. He was smacking while he ate. It disgusted and angered me. I wanted to scream at him to shut up. I stayed quiet so I wouldn't cause an argument.

cookies. It was raining outside that's why i can't go anywhere. There is no good movie to watch so i just eat whatever i want. When i get bored,i decided to bake some cookies. I was satisfied with the taste that's why i baked more. I gave few to our neighbor and the rest i gave it to my friends.

Sign the Autograph. Travis won the blue ribbon at the rodeo. Some of the girls in the town wanted his autograph. Travis refused to give any autographs. The local paper wrote an article about that. Travis was not invited to the next year's rodeo.

Spin class. There was a new spin studio that just opened up. Tina was rather eager to try it. When she stepped foot on the bike she was amazed. The workout was intense. By the end of the workout she was very exhausted.
The Couch. The boy wasn't feeling well. He laid on the couch all day. When he got up, there was a dent in the cushions. He had worn out the couch! He threw a blanket on it to hide it.

Car Accident. Tycho and Brian received remote control cars for Christmas. Tycho and Brian's friends had received ride on jeeps for Christmas. Brian decided to race their remote control cars against the big jeeps. One of the big jeeps accidentally smashed Tycho's car. Because it was Brian's idea, he gave Tycho his car.

The trip. Sophie lived in Mexico. She lived with her family in a small farmhouse close to the border. One day Sophie's father told her they were going to see the USA. After a long trip through the desert Sophie stood on American soil. Sophie and her family were soon found by ICE and deported.
Money. I gave the waiter my cash. It was time to pay. I had never paid at a restaurant before. He was having a party. I was with my brother close to his wedding.

The Snowball King. Mike called himself the snowball king one day. He made a crown out of snow and wore it. When he saw someone come his way he threw a snowball at them. The person ran away from Mike. Mike laughed at the people he called his snowball peasants.

Stan's Hat. Stan wore his blue beanie outside. His friend took the hat off of his head. Stan chased his friend through a field. His friend got away from Stan. The next day his friend came over wearing Stan's hat.
Peppermint tea. Alicia really needed a mint. But she had no mints around. The closest thing she had was peppermint tea. So she took some. Luckily it did the job well.

First Dye. Tanya had just turned sixteen. Her mom would never let her dye her hair before she was this old. She already knew what color she wanted and everything. Yet at the last moment she had her doubts. She decided to give her own natural hair color a chance.

Stray. Will came home one day after work. There was a stray cat lounging by his front door. Will brought the cat a bowl of milk. The next day, the same thing happened with the cat. Will decided to keep the cat and love it as his pet!

Long Journey. Mark decided that he would travel across the country. He decided that he would begin walking in the morning. He ended up walking for 24 hours straight without stopping. He met a woman during his walk that admired his determination. After he made it across the country he married the woman he met.

Theo. Theo was a high school aged boy. He wanted to go to college. His parents could not afford to send him to school. Theo decided to take out student loans to go to college. Theo graduated college and is in debt.

Aurelia Learns to Tango. Aurelia had always dreamed of learning to Tango. One day her friend mentions that a Tango school has opened in town. Aurelia signs up for Tango classes. She practices diligently until she is an expert Tango dancer. Aurelia feels very satisfied that her dream has come true.

Not a Federal Holiday. Someone told Stanley he couldn't do his banking today. They said it was a holiday and the banks would be closed. Stanley transferred 20k from his his CITI account. He deposited money into his Smith Barney account. Stanley showed them the stubs to prove they were wrong.

Swimsuit. Tim invited his girlfriend to swim at his pool. She informed him she did not own a swimsuit. Tim picked her up and they went shopping for a swimsuit. They purchased a swimsuit. They went swimming together in Tim's pool.
Corner. A renter was looking for an apartment to rent. She really wanted to find a corner spot. She looked in tons of ads. She looked online. She never found a corner apartment.
New Puppy. Paul wanted to get a new puppy. His mom told him no. She said he would not take care of it. Paul showed her he was responsible. His Mom was happy and bought him a puppy.

Ken's Kilt. Ken took a trip to Scotland. He saw many people playing bagpipes wearing kilts. He thought they looked majestic and bought one before he left. He wore his new kilt to school but people laughed at him. Ken was so embarrassed he never wore it again.

Military. Tom had a fascination with total institutions. He wanted to be the best he could be. He knew the military would utilize his unique skills. Tom joined the military. Tom had a successful career as a military man.

Unaffectionate. Ginette told her husband that he wasn't affectionate enough with her. She wanted him to show a little more feelings. Her husband didn't know what to do. So he pet her on the head to satisfy her. Ginette took it as a sign of progress.
The Arrest. Carol was driving home. She got pulled over. She wasn't speeding and was confused. The cop arrested her. He thought she was someone else.
New Boys. Trisha had a boyfriend. She thought she was going to love him forever. A new boy started in her class. She fell in love with him. She left her boyfriend.

Accident or fate. Cuba's father believed that everything happened for a reason. So when he was in an accident, he claimed it was fate. Cuba wasn't so sure about that. So he sued the man who had hurt his father. When the money came, Cuba then believed that there were no accidents.

Cable Service. Ernie had been working a lot. He hadn't been watching a lot of television. Ernie decided that paying the cable bill was a waste of money. He cancelled his cable service. Ernie watched internet television in his free time.

Vance Veers Verbose. Vance was a normally very quiet person. He liked to talk about his interests though. At a work gathering, someone mentioned how quiet he was. Soon afterwards, they mentioned one of his hobbies. He began talking about it and went on for an hours straight.

Early Race. Bjorn entered into a bike race. He got up early on the day of the race. He got himself ready in plenty of time. When he was the ninth person to register at the race. He got a good starting position in the race.

Anniversary Gift. It was Justin and Lisa's first anniversary and they went on a date. To Lisa's surprise, Justin gave her a beautiful gold necklace. Lisa tried it on and instantly loved the way it looked. She thanked Justin by giving him a kiss. The two walked out of the restaurant elated.

Las Vegas. Kate and her friend Liz were planning a trip. They weren't sure where they wanted to go. Jule had a friend who suggested they go to Las Vegas. Kate found a good deal on a luxury suite at a hotel on the strip. They decided Las Vegas was an excellent idea.

The Picture. Emily loved to paint. She spent all day creating beautiful art. When she walked away, her cat knocked over the easel. The painting was ruined. Emily always closed the door to her studio after that.

Lost Voice. I went to a concert for a band I love very much. The room was very energetic. I screamed along with everyone else. The next morning, I couldn't talk! It was a small price to pay to see my favorite band.

Basketball Superstar. McKynlee began playing basketball at the young age of six. She started out timid and shy, and did not really like it. Her dad became her coach and worked with her day after day. She began to understand the game and started loving it. Her team has now won the championship two years in a row so far.
Injured. Pat was at a race. He wanted to win badly. He ran until he fell and hurt his knee. Pat decided to hop on one leg to finish. The entire crowd was impressed with his perseverance.

Jason gets robbed. One day Jason is walking down the sunny streets of Fresno. He see's a bunch of guys who are much cooler than him. Jason tries to introduce himself. The cool guys start to attack Jason. Jason is left on the street with nothing but his obama cell phone.

The Speech. Max was working on a speech for the upcoming school elections. He was running for school Treasurer, but was very nervous about it. He practiced his speech everyday. When election day came, Max gave the speech perfectly! Much to his excitement, he was elected Treasurer.

Cheese Bandit. Art walked through the cheese section of the grocery store. He would grab some cheese and slide it into his pocket. He continued doing this until his pockets were full. Art could feel the suspicion of the store manager on him. When the manager was distracted, Art ran for the door.
New Car. Tom bought a new car. He didn't do enough research on them. He had several problems with it right away. There were multiple recalls. Tom wound up swapping it in for something else.

Cute Girl. Michael assured his teacher that he would bring his grades up. He sat down in the library to study. Almost immediately, he got distracted by a cute girl beside him. He kept trying to get her attention. Finally, the girl looked up and told him to start studying!

Broken Stove. Tom had a gas stove. He started noticing a smell in his house. He realized that the gas had been leaking from the stove. Tom cut the gas off and called someone to fix it. They were able to do so and Tom stayed safe.

The Pizza Coupon. Olivia was ordering pizza. She was all ready to pay when she checked her mail. In it she noticed a great coupon for the pizza place. She applied the coupon to her order. To her delight this saved her nearly half of her money.

Snowstorm. The snowstorm was the worst he could remember. They predicted two feet and it was up to 6. They could barely get out of the house. They just waited for the power to come back and the roads to be plowed It was the craziest thing they have ever seen.
Saying Hello. One time my friend and I were playing tennis. We were finishing up. A friend's dad was jogging past us. He said hi to me. My friend wondered why he only said hi to me.

The Code. Mark was an American spy during the Cold War. He was told to steal a document from the Russians in Berlin. At night, he snuck up to the hidden building. A guard heard him, but did not see him sneaking inside. Mark stole the document and escaped easily.

The Bar. Cal had a rough day at work. He decided to end his day with a visit to the bar. Cal drank a couple of beers and talked to a few beers. When it was time to go home, Cal called a cab. The cab brought him home safely.

Ice Cream. Ben and Angel were hungry for some ice cream. They decided to go to McDonalds, because they had cones for 49 cents. When they got there, they realized the prices had gone up. They now had to pay 69 cents for each cone. Ben bought Angel ice cream, anyway.

Bruce Dog. Bruce has a dog that keeps trampling over my flower garden. I caught his dog doing that yesterday and put a collar on him. I took the dog over to bruce. I talked to Bruce about what has been happening. Bruce told me it would never happen again and I'm satisfied with that.
Car Lock. Beatrice took out a coat hanger. She straightened it out. Then she pushed it down the car window. She gripped the lock and unlocked the car. Then Beatrice drove away in someone's car.

Wrong Pizza. Jimmy was too lazy to cook dinner. He decided to order a mushroom pizza to his home. When his pizza arrived, he got an anchovy pizza instead. Jimmy complained about his incorrect order through the phone. He was able to get a new pizza delivered to his home.
Colin wants ice cream. Colin wanted an ice cream sandwich. Colin walked to the grocery store. The grocery store did not have ice cream sandwiches. Colin was disappointed. He bought popsicles instead.

DJ. Michael was a late night DJ. One day while on air he lost his voice. He tried to introduce the next song but nothing came out. Michael went to commercial and ran out of the studio. The listeners were confused when the commercials never ended.

French Fries. Tom loves french fries and eats them for dinner every night. One day, Tom notices that his pants are very tight. Tom must give up his french fries and lose weight. He works very hard and is successful. Tom misses his fries, but is happy that his pants fit.
Clean up duty. Allie had her friends over. They made a mess. So she had to be on cleanup duty. She was not happy about it. But at least they went home so.
bank. Nick robbed a bank. He thought he did a good job of it. But his face was caught on camera. The cops played the tape on the news. Soon Nick was caught!

Discount. Amy's job had a great discount. There were people who worked there just for the discount. Amy met a co-worker she had never seen before. The co-worker told Amy she only worked during the holidays. It shocked Amy to find out the woman got to use the discount all year.

Break Not Break Up. Steve and Sherry had been together for six years. They felt like they needed a break. Steve couldn't stress enough that it was a break and not a break up. Everyone still assumed it meant they were broken up. After four months they got back together and were happier than ever.
A Snack. Morgan decided to get herself a snack. She took some cookies from the pantry. She sat at the table with her cookies. She ate them happily. The cookies were a great choice for a snack.

Trey's Soup. Trey went to the store to buy ingredients for a soup. He bought vegetables and meat and broth. He went home and started the soup. He cut up vegetables and meat and put them in the broth with seasoning He heated up the pot of food until it was hot enough to eat.

Losing a Wallet. Charlie couldn't find his wallet. He looked in his car and most of his apartment. He decided to check between his couch cushions. Charlie found his wallet there. It fell when he was watching tv earlier.

Wolf in Sheep's Clothing. Ezekiel was herding his sheep one fall evening. He noticed a wolf running along a hill in the distance. Ezekiel put on his wolf hide and crouched towards the wolf. The wolf approached and sniffed Ezekiel. Ezekiel jumped from the hide and stabbed the wolf in the neck.

Jill's Surprise. Jill's birthday was Saturday. Her daughter wanted to surprise her, so she contacted all her friends. They all bought presents and showed up at the right time. Jill's daughter forgot to tell her she was having a party. So Jill didn't show up for her own birthday party.

Greg's party. Greg wanted to throw the best party ever. He cooked up lots of burgers. However, he got tired from all of the work. His friends decided to help. With the help of others the party was a huge success.

Christmas Gift. Vera's husband loved to watch TV and enjoyed all types of electronics. Vera knew he loved electronics and decided to buy him a big screen TV. Fortunately, there were many great sales during Black Friday. She perused all the sales ads and stepped out to shop for his present. She was able to get a really low priced TV within her budget.

College advertisement. Kenzie had an idea for a product. Since she had no experience in business, she started college. When she was halfway done with her degree, her computer stopped. She decided to use some money from her loans to get a new computer. She went on to finish her degree and launch her product.

Home Perm. Gwen decided to give herself a home perm. She bought a kit and got to work on her hair. When the curlers were in place, the phone rang. Gwen lost track of time chatting on the phone. When she took off the curlers, Gwen had a head of springy coils.

A Car Baby. Julianna was expecting a baby and had gone into labor. Her and her husband loaded up in the car and sped down the highway.q. As they drove, her contractions sped up quickly. Soon she felt the urge to push and she had to give birth in the car. Luckily, her baby was delivered safely.
Slow keyboard. I was typing on a keyboard today. I liked the keyboard. But it was very slow. It was kind of annoying. I had to get another one.

Pretty Pictures. The photographer was looking for something interesting to photograph. He happened to walk by a beautiful garden. It was full of lovely flowers. He started snapping picture after picture. The next month, he opened a show featuring the lovely flower photos.
sky. The man was falling from an airplane. He pulled his primary chute cord. His chute did not open. He pulled the backup chute cord. That parachute opened.

Tonight's Supper. I am going to make a special supper. I gathered the meat and fresh vegetables. I prepared them by cutting and slicing into appropriate sizes. I put all of them into the crock pot. After cooking for 5 hours, my special meal will be ready.
Interesting Run. My brother and I went on a run. There are plenty of trails in one area. I had to cross a creek. I grabbed a vine. And I almost fell in.

Jana Looks For A Home. Jana has decided she wants to move to a different town. Jana begins to read about towns on the coast. Jana narrows down her target towns to two in particular. Jana looks at real estate listings online in these two towns. Jana makes an appointment with a realtor to look at homes.
Fajitas. Tom loved eating at restaurants. His favorite was Mexican food. A new mexican restaurant opened up near him. He immediately went there to try it. He loved the fajitas.
Earl gets in trouble. Earl has lost his job. He starts to sell movies illegally. One day he sold a movie to a man. The man turned out to be a police officer. Earl is arrested and taken to jail.

Train Ride. Reginald is commuting into the city. Reginald has been frustrated by the heavy traffic recently. A friend tells Reginald that he should try the train. Reginald gives the train a try and really likes it. Reginald finds that he is much more relaxed by using the train.

Sharks at the Aquarium. Benny watched in awe as big sharks swam by. He was visiting the aquarium with his dad. There were also lots of fish in the same tank. He asked his dad why the sharks didn't eat them. He stumped his father with that question.

Jealousy. Gina aced her first exam in our Chemistry class. She couldn't stop bragging about how she's better than her classmates. Since I got mad, I decided to study hard everyday for the next exam. A month later, we took our second exam for the class. I got a perfect score and belittled Diana since she failed hers.

The broken arm. Cassidy was riding her bike. She was going down her driveway when she hit a rock. The bike flipped and she fell on the ground. Her mom rushed out to check on her. It turned out that her arm was broken.
Pepper safety. Nicole live in a rough part of town. She was worried about her safety. She bought herself some pepper spray. She felt safer. She never had to use it, though.

Mike's Mountain Adventure. Mike wanted to climb Mount Everest. He began training for months to prepare. He felt like he could conquer the world. When he finally got to Everest he was unable to get halfway up. Mike was discouraged and simply went back home.

Baby Passport. My daughter and son in law went to Montreal last year. They decided to take their 1 year old daughter. She needed a passport. The postal clerk took a photo of her while she was crying. Now her passport photo shows a crying little girl.

Media Day. It was Media Day and Amy's class went to the library. The library had a small computer lab. Half of the class was allowed to visit the computer lab at a time. Amy crossed her fingers and hoped to go in the first group. Amy was sad she wasn't picked to go first.
The Ring. Jasmine opened the small box. Her husband had given her a new ring! It had a huge diamond in the center. She slipped it on and smiled. She thanked her husband with a kiss.
Simple Hunger. Nick was hungry. He searched the kitchen for food. He found bread and bologna. Nick made a sandwich. He ate the sandwich with satisfaction.

I'm Sorry, Baby. It was raining today and I was in a good mood. I decided to try dancing in the rain with my girlfriend. As I swung her around, I accidentally hit her head on a lampost. She started crying and immediately went home. Later that night she called to break up with me.

Hoping for a snow day. Megan woke up one morning and saw some snow outside. She was hoping that it might be a snow day. She called the hotline and heard that so far, it wasn't. Then, she got ready for school while calling the hotline a few times. Luckily, just before she left the house, a snow day was declared.

President. Tom runs for president of his classroom. He promises the class impossible things. When it is election time, he becomes president. The class discovers that he could not provide what he promised. Tom loses most of his friends.

Visiting Santa. When I was a child I visited Santa at the mall. I sat on his lap and he asked me what I wanted for Christmas. I told him my list, which was very big. The man dressed up as Santa said he would try his best. I walked away excited for Christmas day.

Bicycles are Fun. The Riley family enjoyed playing video games together. One day their PlayStation stopped working. It could not be fixed. The family decided to go for a bicycle ride together. They had so much fun they never got their PlayStation fixed.

Knockout Gas. Jimmy farted in class. Everyone started to notice the smell. Many decided to run out of the classroom since the smell was bad. The professor tried to get everyone back. Eventually, the smell went away.
A grade. Lucia was nervous for her test. It was the biggest test of the year. When she got it back however she got an A. It was the best in the class. She jumped for joy.

Creepy Basement. Lucy's grandpa was going to clean the basement. He offered Lucy $10 to help. Lucy stood at the top of the stairs and tried to hide her fear. When grandpa reached the bottom stair Lucy started down. She found the basement wasn't as scary as she originally thought.

The Mailman. For as long as Jake could remember, he loved when the mailman came. Every time the mailman came, he would give Jake a few pieces of candy. One day the mailman stopped coming and a new one was in his place. Jake told the new mailman what the old mailman used to do for him. Now every time the new mailman comes around, he has candy for Jake.

Vineyard Blues. Matt visited France while on vacation. Matt took a tour of a French vineyard. At the vineyard they had a wine tasting. Matt became ill because he tasted too much wine. Matt was stupid and blamed the French for making him sick.

Cat and Dog. The cat was up on the counter. The cat saw some food it did not like. The dog was trying to get to the food but couldn't. The cat swatted the cookie onto the floor. The dog ate the cookie.

Alternative. Ben wasn't happy with how his friends treated him at school. He thought maybe a change in wardrobe would get him a new reputation. He went to the mall and spent one hundred dollars on new clothes. He was so excited to wear his new clothes to school. When he got there, a girl told him she liked his alternative look.

Law Breaker. Janice wanted to get beers for her boyfriend after work. She couldn't decide which to get. Eventually she figured she would just get a variety of his favorite. Instead of paying, she tried to steal them. She got away with it and he got drunk.

Mario. My brother and I played Mario Bros. I beat every level before he could. He tried to get me down by poking me. I ignored him until I finished the last level. He punched me in the arm for winning.

The Closet. Andy and Christina were always arguing about one thing or another. Everybody thought they should get together. So we plotted and locked them in a closet together. After an hour, the two finally escaped through picking the lock. It turned out they didn't get together, but are now good friends.

The Surprise House. Milton was a huge New Edition fan. The main reason he wanted a house was to play New Edition songs. Milton didn't know Ron Devoe, of New Edition, was a realtor. Ron heard that Milton was a fan who couldn't afford a home. On TV, Ron gave Milton a house that Milton was able to afford.

Fair. Sally was at the fairgrounds. She was eating a lot of food including sweets and burgers. She started to feel odd getting onto the ferris wheel. Her worst nightmare happened. She threw up all over the people down below!

Hungry. Fred had been jogging for several miles. And it was hard to keep his mind off of food. He passed by several restaurants during his jog. And he decided to finally eat at one. Starving, Fred ordered $20 worth of burgers and fries for himself.

Grilled cheese. Parker had just made a grilled cheese sandwich. Just as he was about to eat it, he got a phone call. He went to the other room to talk. When he came back, his sandwich was gone. He looked around and saw his cat eating his it.

The Tulips. It was beginning to look like spring. The tulips had pushed out of ground. Soon, they would be blooming! Jasmine couldn't wait to take pictures of them. Spring in the Netherlands was her favorite season!

The Call. Giselle had a bad feeling with the phone rang. The voice on the other end said they were the police. Someone had hit her car in the parking lot and driven away. She filed a report with the police. Then she called her insurance company and filed a claim.

Intern to Director. JB wanted to work in show business. He took an unpaid internship on a TV show fetching coffee. After a year, he was hired at minimum wage to run errands. After two years, he became a production assistant. Ten years after JB started as an intern, he became the director.

Boredom. I never want to do anything, but today is worse. I need to do laundry, but I'm sitting here working. I need to buy groceries, but I'm going to bake another pizza. When it's over, I'm going to go to bed early. I will probably lie in bed watching tv.

A Day at the Beach. Joe went to the beach with his family. It was a chilly day. Joe stood on some rocks watching the waves. A huge wave hit the rock and shot water high above the rocks. Joe  got drenched.
Stomach. Tom was overweight. He always ate too much. He felt pain in his stomach one day. He decided to start eating healthy. Tom eventually became healthy and thin.

Lingering Cramp. I decided to go jogging with Ted. We did a few laps and continued to run. His leg caught a cramp. I tried to help him stand but he wanted to stay on the ground. His leg continued to hurt for several minutes.
The Bonfire. Tim was out with friends. They decided to stay out late. Everyone wanted to have a bonfire. Tim got some wood gathered up. They got a good blaze going.

Shin. Bob was playing a friendly game of soccer with his friends. One of Bob's friends kicked him so hard in the shin. Bob had a large purple bump on his leg after the game. Bob went and saw his doctor to have it checked out. Bob did not have a fracture in his leg.
Out of battery. Yesterday I charged my phone completely. Today I used it all up. When I had no more power left I was upset. Thankfully I found an extra battery. I was then able to keep my usage.

Raging Rivers. I always wanted to go to Raging Rivers as a kid. We finally took a family trip there. When I got there, I went straight to the wave pool. It ended up being way too deep, with waves I couldn't handle! After that, I hated Raging Rivers and wanted to go home!

The Broken Pot. Kelly was boiling a big pot of beans for supper. Suddenly she heard a loud hiss and a pop. She inspected the pot and realized that the bottom was opening up. Luckily, it didn't seem to be leaking so she continued cooking. Luckily, the pot was pretty simple to fix.

Aliens. A little girl saw a green light out the window. She got up and saw an alien spaceship! Aliens walked out of the spaceship. The aliens invited the little girl to ride with them. The little girl went into space with the aliens.

The Fender Bender. Alice was driving her car to school. Suddenly she hit a patch of ice. Alice spun around in a circle and hit a tree. Alice, upset, got out and saw she had damaged her car. She had to pay a lot of money to get it fixed.
First dibs. Kandy's class was having a candy draw. Whomever was picked first could pick some candy. Kandy was picked first. She walked to the front of the room. She picked a lollipop.

Losing the mail. Alicia got her mail and took the elevator upstairs. All the sudden she realized she dropped some letters. They fell down the hole. Alicia freaked out. She did not know if she could retrieve them.

Gerry. Gerry found life difficult after she lost her hand in an accident. She adapted physically to her new life but socially wasn't as easy. She finally joined a group with similar challenges. She ended up meeting a lot of friends. She also met her boyfriend.

The Coming Out. Last week was Thanksgiving. The extended family got together for dinner. In the middle of it my uncle came out as gay. A few people were shocked. Everyone was overall supportive and loving.

Runny Makeup. Selena was walking to school and reading over some homework. Suddenly, her paper slipped from her hands and blew away. She rushed after it, running for ten minutes before catching it. When she made it to school, she realized her makeup was running. All day she felt embarrassed without her makeup.

The Promotion. Sam had been a hard worker for years. He received several compliments by his bosses. He was sure he would get a promotion soon. Sam kept getting passed over. Eventually he decided to find a new job.

Charlene the Song Bird. Charlene wanted to be a singer. But when she auditioned for the choir, they said she had a bad voice. Charlene's mother hired a singing coach to teach her. Charlene worked hard with her signing coach for several months. Today Charlene has a solo performance in the choir.

Heart Attack. The old woman was walking up the street. She started feeling dizzy. She walked into an alley. She grabs her arm and falls to the ground breathing hard. She dies slowly with nobody to help her.

ice cubes. Ed was supposed to bring ice to the family picnic. As he pulled in, he realized he had forgotten it! He backed out hurriedly. He went to the convenience store and bought a few big bags. Then he returned, bearing the ice!

Struck. Driving home one rainy night, Ken struck a small animal. He got out to see how it was and if he could help. It was a tiny rabbit with a slightly injured leg. Ken wrapped the leg and nursed the rabbit back to health. Soon it was fully healed and ready to return home!

The Anime. Michelle loved to watch anime. One day when her favorite anime was on the cable was out. She frantically tried to call the cable company to fix it. After an hour to no avail she remembered she had an online account. She was finally able to relax and watch anime.

Oliver's Birthday. On Oliver's birthday, he started the day with a big breakfast. After that, he went to the park and played for awhile. When he got home, he opened a few presents from family. Then, his parents ordered some pizza. They ate dinner and had a cake afterwards.

The Lightning Storm. One afternoon we were having dinner at the table. It begins to thunder and lightning. We continued eating and laughing. We weren't paying much attention to the weather. Suddenly a volt of lightning came through hitting my sister and me.

Fleas. My dog loves to run in the woods. One day I noticed he was scratching himself a lot. It turned out that he had fleas. We had to give him a special treatment to get rid of the fleas. He is better now and loving life.

England. For their annual summer vacation, the Jones family went to England. The first place they went to see was Big Ben and they were impressed. After that, they took a red double-decker bus across town. Their next stop was Buckingham Palace and they loved it! On their last day, they toured the London Tower.

Camping Trip. Sam and Steve went camping in the woods. Steve was very safety-conscious, but Sam was not. Sam left all his food on a picnic table overnight. While they were sleeping, a bear raided their campsite. Steve decided he would not go camping with Sam again.

Fast Playing. Tony loved playing his guitar, and would spend hours practicing. One day while in the garage playing, he tried playing his fastest. Hammering on the strings, he produced a new song on the spot. Setting up his recorder, he played the song again, only faster. After recording, he uploaded it to his friends on the computer.

The Contest. Tom entered his office's chili cooking contest. He didn't have his own recipe. He decided to just get a lot of chili from Wendy's. He added a bit of spices and that was it. Tom won second place.

Heavy rainstorm. Tina and her friends went out to the beach for some fun. The girls had fun for a few hours in the sun. However to her dismay, it started to rain. Rain poured down and got on everything, Tina then had to run for shelter.

Home Work. Ronnie, seven, needed help with some of his computer homework. I invited over to my place to use my computer. For about two hours he did some math and some geography work. When he was done he went back home. The next day he told me he got A's in math and geography.

Sea Turtle. The mother decided she would take her children to the park. They participated in a program about sea turtles. At night they gathered for a talk about the turtles. The ranger got a call about a turtle on the beach. They all raced together to watch the turtle lay eggs on the beach.

Dinner. Will felt like having a nice steak for dinner. Will hopped online to look up menus at local restaurants. Will narrowed it down to two steakhouses nearby. Will chose to go with The Peddler Steakhouse. Will had a delicious steak dinner at The Peddler that night.

The Vest. Tom was a policeman. He got a call one day about an armed robber. He arrived at the scene and the man began shooting at him. Luckily, Tom was wearing a bulletproof vest. He was able to walk away from the scene unharmed.

Baking a Cake. Anita wanted to bake a cake. She looked in her cupboard for ingredients. She needed cocoa powder but could not find any. Anita remembered that she had some chocolate bars. She melted the chocolate down and mixed it into the cake batter.
Dentist. My tooth hurt. I went to see the dentist. He told me that I had a cavity in one tooth. He filled my tooth. My tooth doesn't hurt anymore.

Regrets. By the time the troop arrived at camp, Clara was covered in red spots. Her shortcut through the woods had earned her a bad case of poison ivy. The other girls gave her some allergy medicine and anti-itch lotion. In the end, Clara had to go home to get stronger medicine. She learned never to take shortcuts again.
The Shower. Jake was tired from work. He wanted to take a hot bath. He noticed his tub was really dirty. He didn't want to clean it. Jake decided to just take a shower instead.

Mugged. Pearl was meeting friends that night in a bar. But before she got there, she was attacked in the street. She had to go to the police station to report her missing purse. And when she finally arrived at the bar, her friends were worried. Her ordeal provided a conversation that lasted long into the night.
Protest. Tom wanted to have his voice heard. Tom was frustrated. Tom wanted an outlet for his frustration. Tom attended a political rally. Tom protested and expressed his ideas.

Carson Wins the Game!. Carson was a basketball player. He challenged his friend to a basketball game. His friend was a professional basketball player. Carson doubted his ability to win the game. Surprisingly, Carson won the game by twenty points!

Late Flight. Drew was scheduled to attend a business conference in Europe. The night before his flight he gathered the items he would need. His wife helped him load the luggage. The morning of the flight he was picked up and driven to the airport. He almost missed the plane but luckily it was running late.

The GoldFish. A little boy went to the fair by himself. He saw a goldfish as a prize and wanted to win it. He had to throw a ball and knock down some cups. With one mighty throw, he knocked them all down! The goldfish was his and he was very happy.

Rose and Her Rose. Rose went outside to play one Saturday afternoon. She ran around to the garden in the back of the house. She found her mother's rose bushes. She tried to pick one, but the thorns were too sharp. She found her mother's gloves and picked one of the roses.

Desert Journey. Ivan had always wanted to visit the desert. His family went on a road trip through Las Vegas. Ivan loved those wide open vistas. He was really enjoying himself. Ivan was sad when they stopped to stay in the center of Las Vegas.

Molly's Beau. All her life, Molly had wanted a horse. When she was an adult, she started taking riding lessons. She learned how to ride on an older horse named Beau. One day, Beau went up for sale. Molly was able to buy Beau and she finally had her horse!
Race. A girl had an upcoming swim race. She was extremely nervous. She had practiced for weeks. Despite her worries, on the day of the race, she won! From then on, she relaxed before future races.

The Scissors. James is in third grade. Mira sits in front of him in class. One day he uses his safety scissors to cut a small lock of Mira's hair The school treats the incident as an assault with a weapon. The school suspends James for 3 days.

Tom Gets a Mechanical Keyboard. Tom's wrists had been hurting recently. It was due to his poor keyboard ergonomics at work. Tom ordered a brand new mechanical keyboard online. It came in the mail the next day. Tom's wrists no longer hurt with his more ergonomic keyboard.

Movies. My daughter cannot make up her mind. She changes movies every thirty seconds. It feels like we go through 80 movies a day. Because of this, I put her movies in a place she cannot reach. Now she has to ask to get her movies.

FB Affair. My friend Cate found out her husband was having an affair. The other woman had a lot of Facebook posts up about the affair. The woman took down the posts after being discovered. Yesterday she put all of the posts backup, defying Cate. Cate was very angry and is considering divorce.

Sinking Boat. Ted bought a new fishing boat. He brought it or onto the lake and began to fish. All of a sudden the boat started to fill with water. Ted's new boat sank and Ted had to swim to shore. Ted went to the boat store and demanded a refund.

The Man with the Cane. Maria saw an elderly man with a cane struggling with a bag of garbage. He was walking it to the apartment complex's garbage dumpster. It was about a quarter mile up the road. Maria hated the idea of a bag of trash in her car, but she felt moved. She drove his trash to the dumpster for him.

Girl Scout Cookies. Rae and her mom decided to walk door to door to sell cookies. They walked up and down the neighborhood. They knocked on every door and almost everyone bought something! Rae was very proud of her sales! She sold the most in her troop and won a prize.

Car accident. Susie was stuck in traffic for a long time. She was on the highway and getting kind of irritated. Finally she saw there was a car accident. That explained why the traffic was so heavy. Once Susie bypassed it, she was in her way.

The Turkey Leg. Courtney had been cooking all night. She had company coming over for Thanksgiving Dinner soon. She pulled the turkey out of the oven and saw that it was beautiful. The skin was a crispy brown color. Her grandfather eagerly took the best turkey leg when he sat down.
A lost wheel. Martin was driving on a highway. Suddenly, something crashed in his car. He lost control over the car. He had to stop. He found out the right front wheel fell off the car.

Cavities Galore. Teresa had not gone to the dentist in a long time. She decided to go to a dentist that had advertised a cleaning special. The dentist told her she had ten cavities. Teresa was upset, and went to get a second opinion. When the other dentist told her she had no cavities, Teresa was happy!

The Proposal. Alexa was on vacation with her boyfriend. She was having a nice time but she was also upset. Her boyfriend seemed distracted and sneaky all week. Just as she planned to confront him, he told her he loved her. Suddenly, he was on his knee proposing and Alexa said yes.

Exchange. Ivy's parents announced that they were taking in an exchange student. Ivy was unhappy at first because it meant living with a stranger! Ivy was shy and thought it would be a challenge. But the new student was shy too, so soon she and Ivy bonded! They worked to overcome their language barrier and become friends!

Secret Smoker. Scott swore to everyone he quit smoking. His wife made him because she was afraid of cancer. She told him she'd leave if he didn't quit. Scott did quit for about five days. He now leaves ten minutes early for work to smoke.

Down the Stairs. Kim was going into the basement to do laundry. Her flip flop broke, her foot slid out and she tumbled down the stairs. She tried to grab the railing to stop herself but couldn't. She fell all the way to the bottom of the stairs. When she got up she was fine but her ego was bruised.
Spaghetti. Cindy decided to make spaghetti for her mom. She had never made it before. She tried to follow the instructions. However, it was a disaster. Cindy decided to order pizza instead.

The Track Meet. Nate was preparing for his upcoming track meet. He wanted to get first place in the hurdles. During practice, he had huge trouble with the tallest hurdle. Luckily, with enough practice he managed to clear it. He ran at his track meet and managed to make first place.

Used Books Suck. I bought my college textbooks used. They cost me nearly $200 all together. When I got to class I found out they didn't come with an online code. The code is needed to complete classwork. It costs $90 a piece and I can't afford that.
The Burger. Sasha loved to grill. She grilled a big burger. She put it on a bun and put lots of toppings on top. Then she put some fries next to it. The burger looked amazing!

The Accidental Crime. In the state Charles lives, not returning a library book is a crime. Charles found out how bad a crime. He forgot he had checked out library books. Then he received a letter to show up in criminal court. In court a judge told him the judge had to lock him away.

Making Music. Brad was a band director. He worked with his band to help them get ready for a big concert. He encouraged the kids to practice as much as they could. Finally, the day of the concert arrived. Their hard work showed in their great performance.

System Failure. Bella was busy one night on her computer. It was a stormy night and Bella felt the thunder. Bella decided to save her work for later. She saw a bright flash and the power went out. Bella was glad to have saved her work.

Trick or Treat. Joe's favorite holiday was Halloween. He planned his costume weeks in advance. He met his best friend Luke at 6:00 sharp on Halloween. They spent three hours Trick or Treating. It would take them months to eat all of the candy they collected.

Football. Mary wanted to play football. Even though she tried really hard, she was not very good at the sport. One day, she decided to ask a friend to teach her. She practiced hard for many weeks. Now, Mary is an expert and the best football player on the team.

A Wild Zebra Attack. Joe was on a trip through Africa with his wife. Just when he least expected it, a wild zebra appeared out of nowhere. Joe had never seen a zebra in real life before and was startled. The zebra panicked and began to charge! Luckily, Joe was carrying a tranquilizer gun and saved them from harm.

Food. Elliot worked for a nice company. He enjoyed his lunch break because the area nearby was lively. Elliot found a unique restaurant to eat lunch at. Elliot ate there every day. Elliot loved that restaurant and seeked it out after changing jobs.
Walking in the store. Suzy walked inside the store. However she got scared. She realized there was too much perfume. She felt suffocated. She had to leave.

Busted Pipe. The Mitchell's moved into their new home 2 months ago. They loved it and were planning to put a flower garden out back. One morning, they noticed their backyard had turned into a lake. The water pipe had burst and had been leaking for a while. When they received their bill, they thought wanted to answers.

Justin's Job. Justin was nervous about applying for a job at a local plant nursery. I finally convinced him to go talk to them. The owners loved him. He got a raise almost immediately after starting. He ended up working there for 4 years.

Like father like son. Gary is very good at basketball, but his dad is better. So Gary practiced every single day so he could beat his dad. Eventually, Gary challenged his dad to a game of 1 on 1. His dad was shocked how much better Gary got! Gary ended up beating his dad by 1 point, and is now better than him.

Bad Weather. Jane knew the weather looked bad but she decided to take a chance. She started off on her run and was getting further and further away. When was about three miles from her house, it started to pour. Jane tried to run back as fast as should could, but it was pointless. She decided she would pay more attention to the weather next time.

Marty's Roach Problem. Marty had a pretty major roach problem, but he wasn't sure what to do. He woke one morning to find them walking all over the wall by his bed. He watched them for awhile, and counted them. He managed to count 37 cockroaches on his wall. He decided it might be time to call an exterminator.

Making chili. Miranda was hungry from some chili. She loved chili but had never made it herself. She followed a recipe. She added extra spices because she loved hot food. She had to throw the chili out because it was way too spicy.

First Snowfall. Anna had heard snow forecast that December day. She rushed home from school, hoping to play in it. Happily, the flakes began to flutter down around five PM. Anna and her neighbors got to frolic in it for hours! Then they went in for dinner, eager to warm up!

Gas pump. Filling up my car seems to get more and more expensive. When I fill up my car I just get angry. Even when I choose the cheapest gas, it is still expensive. The numbers go up and up while I am filling my car tank. I wish I didn't have to drive anymore.

The Playdate. Kevin was having a bunch of friends over. His mom liked for him to have playdates. The kids all ran around and played with nerf guns. They screamed and laughed and had a great time. Kevin asked if they could come over the next day as well.
New Shirt. Gina needed a new shirt. She decided to go shopping. The shirt she wanted was too expensive. Gina decided to get an extra job. When she saved up enough, she bought the shirt.

Last Minute. Paul forgot to get his girlfriend a card for Valentine's Day. He ran to the store to pick one up for her. When we go there, the selection was limited. There were only cards for grandma from grandchildren. Paul bought it anyway and wrote over it for his girlfriend.

Tired. Amanda stayed up all night studying. She had put off studying until the day before her exam. She wished she had not done so! In the morning she was very fatigued. She vowed to never procrastinate again!
Delivery Mistake. We ordered groceries via delivery today. We ordered a gallon of milk. The delivery service brought a half gallon. I called customer service. I was refunded.

Peapod. We ordered Peapod for delivery this Tuesday. The delivery came on time. When my wife checked the order, she found one item had expired. I contacted customer service and got a refund for the item. We posted neutral feedback on the service.

Game. We stood in line for hours to get into the stadium. The place was completely packed with fans. We ordered some amazing garlic fries. We sat and ate while the game started. Our team won, and we screamed with excitement.
March. The men went on a march. It was very hot out. One of the men got dehydrated. The man collapsed. The men stopped marching to assist.

Angry. My friend Dick and I used to play chess in the atrium of our building. We played speed games during lunch. One day a stranger walked by and asked if he could play. He won a game against Dick. Dick was angered by the stranger's smug look.

Food Sale. My group took our food cart to the front of the school. When the bell rang, everyone ran out of their class. They surrounded the cart since they wanted to purchase food. When the crowd was gone, we counted our total sales. It ended up being $450 dollars.

off the beach. Jen was excited to go the the beach, but she just had knee surgery. If she sat on the sand, she knew she could not get up. It would be embarrassing to get up on her own. Jen sat on the beach anyway. She dug a deep hole for her feet, used it like a step, and was fine.
Loud Music. Sean was trying to sleep. His neighbors were playing loud music. He tried to call the ask them to turn it down. Nobody answered. Sean was forced to ask them in person.

No Knife. Lucy was in the kitchen with her grandma. Her grandma allowed her to have a piece of cake. Lucy picked up a butter knife to cut the cake. Her grandma snatched the knife afraid Lucy would cut herself. Lucy was shocked since her mother allowed her to use a steak knife.

Lexie brings breakfast. Lexie was new at her job. She didn't know any of her colleagues. One day, she decided to bring breakfast for everyone. All of her colleagues were so thankful for the treat. Lexie now has friends at work!
