Vegetables. Ida vowed to eat more veggies. Each day for lunch she took a bag of carrot sticks to eat. Then she made a salad with dinner. Eating more veggies was turning out to be delicious! In a month she had doubled her daily vegetable intake!

Grocery store. The grocery store manager was worried. There had been a big storm and snow was blocking the roads. His workers all called to say they couldn't make it to the store. He didn't know if it was worth it to open the store. He decided to stay home and take the day off.

Store Clerk. Rose checked out at the grocery store with flour and sugar. She was excited to make cookies from scratch. When she got to the car she dropped the flour. The bag broke and spilled everywhere. She was so embarrassed, she drove away without getting new flour.

Revenge. Dave gave an apology to his US friends on behalf of Canada. Mark and Ricky didn't listen to his apology though. They were typical Americans, and beat Dave up. Dave ran back to Canada. Dave brewed some coffee and watched moose while he planned revenge.

The Book Fee. Candace was sorting through her mail. Suddenly she noticed a letter with a big red stamp. After evaluating it, she realized that she owed the library fines. She went to the library that day to make a payment. She was so glad to be debt-free.
Baseball Fever. Jimmy was a huge fan of baseball. He wanted to join the team. He worked hard to practice. He tried out for the team. Finally, he made it on the team.

Climbing. John had never climbed a mountain before. He was scared but motivated. His friends were there and encouraged him along the way. He tripped and fell and broke his leg. He hasn't been the same since.

A sad day. Margaret had been not feeling well for several years. Her doctor told her she only had a short time to live. Margaret had decided she would go on a vacation while she felt well. The morning of her vacation Margaret fell down the steps. She broke her hip and did not go on a vacation.

Camping. Sheena went camping for the first time. She went with all of her friends, who camped many times. She planned carefully and was well prepared. When she got there she found out they had electricity. She didn't think camping would be like that.

New Running Shoes. Carol always wanted to go jogging. Unfortunately she didn't have the right shoes. She bought a new pair for that reason. Carol eventually wound up using them just once. They spent most of their time in her closet.

Reuniting. Michael was very anxious. He hadn't seen his brother in five years. Michael was afraid he would be distant. When Michael saw his brother, they hugged tightly. The two brothers were happy to be together at last.

Owner. Leo always wanted to be a chef when he grew up. He went to school and got his education. He got out of college and got a great cooking job. He decided he wanted more. Leo built his own restaurant.

Tech Troubles. Sue switched on her computer and heard a weird noise. The monitor flickered and then a blue screen appeared. Sue restarted it, but the same thing happened. She took it in for repair, hoping it was fixable. The techs ended up having to replace the motherboard.

Salad. Sue decided to eat a salad every day for lunch. She packed her salads every night before bed. She started to see a difference in her clothes. She started to get tired of salads. Sue lost of her willpower and ate ice cream.

Math Mastery. Stacy was struggling in her math class. She decided to see her teacher privately for extra help. Her teacher gave her an extra problem set to help her practice. She did the practice work diligently every night. When it came time for exams, she got the best grade in the class!
Softball. Courtney wanted to try out for softball. She had never played before. Her dad started practicing with her. Courtney got to the field early for tryouts. She tried out and made the team.

Karen's Trip. Karen wanted to go on a trip to France. She started doing research on the trip. She decided to book a week long trip. She left the next day for her trip. She had the best time ever on her trip.

Ants. Kenneth was very afraid of ants. One day, he went outside and saw a colony. He saw how they worked together to create something beautiful. Then, Kenneth began appreciating ants. Now, Kenneth loves the ants.

Louis Breaks Down. Louis was traveling down the road. His car started to make a noise. He decided to check it out. He looked on the back of his car. He was shocked to see that a nail flatten his tire.

Cream. Jennifer loved to apply cream on her skin. One day, the skin caused an irritation. She rushed to doctors to find out what was happening. The doctor stated that she applied cream too frequently. Now Jennifer puts on cream once every week.

Quentin Cleans House. Quentin had lived in very dirty conditions for many Year's. His friends and family encouraged him to clean but he always refused. One day Quentin awoke to mice gnawing at his furniture. He knew he needed a change. He cleaned the entire apartment and felt much better afterwards.

Fighting Neighbors. Kerry had a huge tree in his yard. He trimmed the branches from the tree. He put all of the branches in a neighbor's yard. The neighbor was very upset about it. Kerry picked up the branches.

Good Neighbors. I was watching television when a breaking news story came on. A woman had driven her car off a bridge and was being rescued. I had a bad feeling until I recognized her as my neighbor Cathy. I felt very scared for her because she had always been so nice. I was grateful when she was rescued and returned home the next week.

The Conference. The parents were looking forward to the conference. Their daughter's teacher usually had wonderful things to say about her. When they sat down, the teacher told them their kid had been terrible. She was talking too much and never did her homework. The parents were shocked and disappointed.

Janice's First Day. Janice started school yesterday. She was very afraid to meet her teacher. Once she settled in the classroom everyone was really friendly. Janice's teacher greeted everyone one by one. Janice is excited to go to school today!

Hungry. Amy was hungry. She skipped breakfast that morning and it was past noon. She decided to get some Mexican food for lunch. Amy's mouth watered as she waited for her food. When Amy's food arrived, she devoured everything on her plate.

Pizza Pie. Who doesn't love pizza? Sam sure did so he ordered 3 larges. He saw a hungry kitten and felt bad. Sam decided to go outside and give the kitten some pizza. The kitten and Sam are now best friends.

Closer Desk. Jane couldn't see the board from the back of the classroom. She traded her desk with another student. She was sure this would make it easier to see the chalk board. But everything was still a little blurry. She hoped this didn't mean she needed glasses.
Work. Tim was unemployed. Tim asked his friend for advice. His friend suggested he try Upwork. Tim applied to many jobs on Upwork. Tim was hired and thankful to Work and his friend.

Leg Press. I was in the gym. I decided to use the leg press machine. My trainer insisted that I don't lock out my knee in the leg press. I decided not to listen to his advice. I locked out my knee and it snapped in half under the pressure.
Lactose. Ida was lactose intolerant. Ida wanted cereal, but couldn't have milk. One day, I discovered almond milk. Ida tried almond milk and cereal. Ida loved the combination she had discovered.
Animal safari fun. Yesterday I went on an animal safari at animal kingdom. The ride was fun. We saw lions and cheetahs. I took a lot of pictures. The pictures would last a lifetime.

Oven shopping. The Zimmy family discovered their oven is broken. They start to use a microwave to reheat food. A hot plate is also used for frying food. But now they realize they'd rather have an oven. So they go to Home Depot to shop for an oven.

Door Handle Disaster!. Yesterday I received a huge box of door handles I had ordered. I opened it to reveal beautiful, shiny new handles. I carefully removed the old, ugly handles from my doors. The new latches and striker plates do not fit the openings on the doors! I must fix the new parts so that the doors close properly.

My niece. My niece started her first year of college in August. Her sister has been in college for two years. My niece is interested in poetry and French. She is enrolled in a nursing program. I think she will switch to liberal arts after her first year.

Cancer. Jeff was in shock. He couldn't believe the words his doctor uttered. Jeff was told he had cancer. Jeff was determined to beat this sickness. Jeff lost his battle nearly a year after his diagnosis.
Baby. Nancy had a baby boy. The baby boy was very fussy. She tried to give him a pacifier. He spit it out and cried more. Nancy gave him a bottle and he happily ate.

Transit Photos. I have a collection of photos of transit cars. Most of my photos are of trolleys. I have some subway car and bus photos as well. I was able to get some framed photos. My favorite photo is of a woman boarding a trolley at night.

New Leg. Pablo had several health issues. He learned he had a bad infection in his leg. Pablo had to have his leg amputated. He was given a prosthetic but he was nervous about using it. Pablo worked with a physical therapist and learned to walk again.

Hepatitis A outbreak. I do not like preparing food, so I get a lot of takeout. I'm trying to eat better so I have been buying salads. I buy them premade from the grocery store and from restaurants. But there has been an outbreak of Hepatitis A in my state. So it looks like I'll be making my own salads from now on.
Robbery. Kathy bought a new house. It was in a bad neighborhood. She went to work one day. Her house was robbed during the day. Kathy wants to sell her house now.

Hack. In 1995 our government agency received a new worker. Sam was very friendly and polite. He had no job tasks, though. Sam sat in the office and made phone calls. He was eventually removed after the next election.

The Heat. It was 90 degrees when Harold woke up. It got even hotter during the day. Harold stayed inside and drank cold lemonade. In the evening, he went for a short walk. He returned home covered in sweat!
Cereal and Milk. Jake was having cereal for breakfast. He poured the cereal and milk into a bowl. Jake took a bite of the cereal. It was stale. Jake threw the rest of the cereal away.
Old shirt. My dad was painting my room. He was wearing an old shirt. It got paint all over it. He told me that it was not a problem. He kept his old shirt for dirty tasks.

Tantrum. Our 2 year old granddaughter went shopping with her dad. She needed flip flops. She tried on 15 types and did not like any. She threw a tantrum in the store and had to go home. It was a stressful day.

Gymnastics. Jen knew it was up to her. The rest of her team and already gone and it was her time. She got up on the balance beam. She performed an amazing routine. The judges scores came in, her team had won!

Mike's Dream. Mike always admired his older brother. His older brother was a talented rapper. In his free time Mike began to practice rapping to himself. As he grew, he began to record his own music at home. Mike now sells his music online across the globe.

school id. Me and my friends went to the park after class. We decided to go home because it's already getting late. When i got home i noticed my school is missing. I asked my friends if they saw but they did not. I went back to the park and luckily i found it.

Float Plane. It was a clear day in Victoria. A float plane was expensive, but the day was too nice. They decided to spend the money and fly to a glacier. Only the four of them flew to the glacier with the pilot. The views were amazing and it was worth every scary moment.

Jane Moves Out. Jane was tired of her commute being so long. Jane decided to move closer to her work. Home prices were really expensive there. Jane had to save up for months to afford the down payment. After she moved, Jane was fired and had to make another long commute.

Visiting. Omar went to visit his dad for a week in Asia. He loved the sights and smells of the exotic foreign country! When he returned home, he kept thinking about Asia. Finally, he thought of a way to return. Omar flew back to Asia the next year as an exchange student!

Old Friends. Carlton hated to get rid of his encyclopedia set. He took it the Goodwill store down the street. In his car, he silently said goodbye. The salesclerk told him they couldn't accept his donation. He happily took them home.
The Pork Dinner. Val was sensitive to pork meat. She had gone to eat at her mother's house. Her mother had served a pork dish. Val ate mostly vegetables. She only took a little of the pork.

John burns the biscuits. John was having a get together with friends. He was making his grandmother's biscuit recipe. Friends begin to arrive and John is all over the house. John greets and meets with all his friends. John totally forgets about the biscuits until it's too late.

Scrapbooking. Cara loved to scrapbook! Every chance she had to make a scrapbook for someone she did. She was asked to be a bridesmaid in her friend's wedding this summer. She took pictures the entire night and made a giant wedding scrapbook. She surmised the newlyweds with it a week after the wedding!
Facetime. We facetime our granddaughter on Saturday or Sunday. She is only 18 months old. She lives 235 miles away from us. My wife misses her. Facetime lets us stay in some contact.
Stuffed Animal. Tim was on a date at the carnival. He played some games to win her a prize. Tim wasn't that good, though. INstead he just bought his date a stuffed animal. She loved it just as much.

The Weird Deer. Wilson was walking through a park one night. Suddenly in a foggy mist he saw a larger than average deer. Strangely, the deer stood still and watched him. Wilson didn't know what to do so he hurried along. He always thought of the deer from then on.

Ventilation. Ray was constantly sick. And he realized his indoor air quality was bad. He left his window open. And he got a high quality window filter. And the air quality in his house was much better.

Hair. Michael has beautiful hair. He needs money due to losing his job. Unfortunately, nobody will give Michael a job. Michael decides to cut his hair and sell it. He sells his hair to a wig maker and is able to pay his bills.

A Job At 14. Nate was 14 and lived in a rural area. He was desperate for a job so he could begin saving for college. Finally he found an old farmer who needed help mucking stalls. Nate was willing to work and said so- the farmer shook his hand. Just like that, Nate had found his first fob!
Spaghetti. Jill was cooking spaghetti. She put the noodles on to boil. She began the sauce. She kept thinking she was forgetting something. Jill forgot the meatballs!

Gravy Boat. Beth went to Thanksgiving dinner like normal. She had her family around her and lots of food. She asked for the gravy boat for her potatoes. As it was handed to her, the gravy boat fell into her lap. Beth was covered all over with the gravy her mom made.
Wetting the Bed. Tim wet his bed. He was really embarrassed in the morning. He tried to keep it a secret. His mom saw the sheets in the washing machine. Time fessed up and asked for help.

Interview with Strange Man. I was walking in New York when a man asked me for an interview. He told me his name, but I forgot it. He asked me confusing and weird questions. When he asked me if I was lactating, I asked him for his name again. He ran away and I never saw him again.

The Jack O'Lantern. The kids gathered their supplies. They were carving their pumpkins that night! They traced the shapes with a marker. Then they carefully carved them out. The put candles inside and lit them.

Tea Time. Sneha always had tea with her lunch. It became a part of her daily routine. There was a day when Sneha forgot to bring tea to work. The water tasted bitter and her lunch was ruined. Sneha devised a notification system on her phone to prevent such days.
Loan Shark. I needed a new car. I couldn't afford one. The bank would not give me a loan. I decided to use a loan shark. I was able to buy a car with the loan shark's help!

A Flat Tire. Ed was driving down the highway. All of a sudden it felt like something was wrong. He pulled over to the side of the road. When he got out of the car, he saw one of his tires was flat. He put on the spare tire that was in his trunk.

Teacher. Ella really wanted to be a teacher. She studied hard in school and went off to college. In college she majored in education science. Ella finally graduated and took a job teaching. This year, Ella was nominated for national Teacher of the Year.
Skiing Black. I was 12 years old. I went skiing with my family. I went off on my own on the mountain. I took a black diamond trail. I had a very bad accident.

A Stolen Coat. Jasmine was invented to a private dinner party. Upon her arrival she checked in her coat. One guess noticed they shared the same coat. After dinner Jasmine receives the wrong coat. Jasmine rushes out the party and keeps the newer coat.

Acoustic Guitar. Elaine felt that acoustic guitars were always superior to electric. She started an all-acoustic band. After a year of low returns, the band was re-tooling their formula. They voted to include an electric guitarist. Elaine quit the band in a huff.

Dream to Reality. My cousin had a dream that my sister was attacking her. When she woke up, she immediately washed her face. Afterwards, she walked towards my sister and slapped her. When my sister woke up from the slap, she was confused. Eventually, my cousin understood that her dream was over.

Helpful. My son went outside to play. A few hours after he came back in, my neighbor came over. He said he wanted to tell me how helpful my son was. He told me how he helped him rake leaves on his lawn. I went and found my kid and told him how proud I was.

Making potato chips. Liza was ready to make some potato chips in the kitchen. She got potatoes ready and her slicer to cut the vegetables. Liza sliced each potato into thin pieces and placed them in the oil. The slices cooked within a few minutes and were crisp chips. The chips tasted delicious to Liza and she was content with them.

A New Friend. Emma started a new job on Monday. She walked into the office and introduced herself. The secretary smiled at her, then laughed excitedly. The secretary was Emma's best friend from elementary school! Both girls had a wonderful time working with each other.

Money is no good. Two families went out to eat a fancy dinner. When the check came, the waiter placed it between the two fathers. One father grabbed it and placed a stack of money in it. The other father grabbed it and ripped the money. He told the other man that his money was no good here.
Skipping Lunch. Carla had skipped her lunch. She was starting to get hungry. Carla left work. On the way home she stopped at a fast food restaurant. Carla ate at the restaurant.
Shaving. Sally had not shaved for 2 weeks. Her legs looked like a boys. When she went to shave, she cut her leg. It bled and bled. Sally vowed to never shave again.

Irony. John woke up realizing he was late for work already. He raced in between traffic at dangerous speeds. About halfway to his work, John rear-ended another driver. Frustrated, John stormed out of his car. When he got the other driver, he saw it was his boss staring at him.

Wine Taster. Mark had an interest in wines. He read voraciously about many different wines. Mark attended several wine tastings to learn more about them. Over time he became quite knowledgeable about wine. He was asked to write a weekly column about wines for his newspaper.

Hill. I was riding my bicycle near downhill near my house. As I was confident of my abilities, I rode very fast. A squirrel can in front of me, and I swerved to avoid it. I fell off my bicycle and slammed onto the ground. Fortunately, I was wearing my helmet and was unhurt.

Beating the Rain Home. Doug wanted to go for a walk but it looked like it was going to rain. He decided that he could beat the rain so he started walking. Halfway through his walk it began pouring rain. Doug was lucky to find some shelter to wait out the rain. Once the rain stopped, Doug walked home.

Pizza party fun. Michelle decided to throw a pizza party. She got all the girls together at her house. The girls had a fabulous time. But when the girls made the pizza, they burned it. Luckily it still tasted good.

The Lost Contacts. Zoey was getting ready for school. She couldn't find her contacts anywhere. She tried her hardest to find them but it was soon time to go. She was forced to head to school without them. All day she couldn't see anything and it really slowed her down.

Messina. Messina was at a stakeout. He was waiting for a drug dealer to leave his house. Then he saw the drug dealer through a window. The dealer spotted him and bolted. Messina ran inside but the dealer was already gone.

Match. Kya was playing tennis with her mom. At first she was winning. But then her mom started winning easily! Kya saw that her mom had just been letting her win. In truth, her mom was much better than her!

New Appliances. Marge had to take her clothes to the basement to do the laundry. One day she slipped on the stairs going to the basement. She suffered a severe sprained ankle. She could not get to the basement to do her laundry. Marge had a washer and dryer delivered to her apartment.

Changing routine. Tony found his life extremely repetitive. He wanted to change it but didn't know how. He started by taking some books at the library in the travel section. After perusing a few of them, he called his travel agent. He booked a flight for Majorca and was pleased with himself.

New Puppy. Bob went to the local pet store, to look for a new puppy. He asked the clerk to see the Yorkshire Terrier. Bob played with the Yorkshire Terrier for about an hour. He purchased the dog, and got a few accessories for his new pet. He took the dog home, and welcomed it to its new home.

Flooded Street. The street in front of the Smith home often floods during rainstorms. Sometimes young Jimmy will go outside and warn drivers to turn around. One time Jimmy began shouting when he saw a car approach the street. The driver did not listen and continued straight through. The car stalled in the deep water and had to be towed.
Cardiac Arrest. Tyler is very obese. His heart is in trouble. One day he decided to eat deep fried butter. That evening he had a heart attack. Tyler knows he needs to change his lifestyle.

Fishing trip. Ollie had never been fishing before. Last weekend, he got invited by his step dad. Ollie was initially unsure, but decided to go in the end. He was glad he did, as he bonded a lot with his step dad. He even managed to catch a large trout.

Late getting home. Jerry was in the theater club. One night after rehearsal, the kids decided to go out to eat. Jerry ended up arriving home late. When he came inside, his parents were angry. They grounded him for a week.

The Garden. Weeks ago, my family and I began and garden in our backyard. We plowed the dirt into furrows and places various seeds inside. Every day, we'd water the dirty and check the ground for weeds. Slowly but surely, little sprouts began to emerge from the ground. Our family was in awe about how our hard work produced new life.
Vegas. The couple planned an anniversary trip. They went to Vegas and ate and drank a lot. They went to casinos and dressed up. It was a fun trip. They couldn't wait to do it again!
Sunrise. John woke up at 5am. He then ate breakfast. He saw the sun rising. He decided he wanted to see something beautiful. He went into his yard to see the sun rise.

Basket. It was easter time at the Roger household. All the baskets were full of candy except for one. Rosa didn't like candy she liked vegetables. So her basket was full of kale and lettuce. Everyone was surprised by how happy she was that day.

The Poker Game. The neighbors decided to get together to play poker. They didn't really know how to play, so Tom gave them a quick lesson. They all started playing and Angie won every round! They discovered that she had hustled them. She actually was a great poker player.

Shopping with Bill. Martin and Bill both needed new shoes, so they went shopping together. While shopping, Bill kept acting rude towards the salespeople. Martin tried to confront him about it. Bill yelled at Martin and broke off their friendship right there. Martin felt terrible, but he knew it was for the best.
Tires. I had to get new tires for a long trip. I went to Sam's to get them done. I also got an oil change while I was there. It cost an arm and a leg. The trip was much safer with the new tires.

Lost ring. My girlfriend and I were walking at night. She dropped a ring while she was playing with it. I looked all over the sidewalk but it was too dark. Then, a jogger with a flashlight arrived and helped. We located the ring, thanked the jogger and walked away.

Looking for a dog. Jimmy opened the door to go outside and play. But he left it open behind him. Soon, a flash of gold ran by - it was spot! The dog seemed hopelessly lost, but then a bark! The bark around the corner was spot, bringing a ball home!

Older Child. Lynette hated being the older child. She has to babysit her younger siblings. Lynette has to do all of this despite being busy. This made Lynette stress out a lot. Lynette still babysits to help the family.

Cable Issues. Amber turned the television on, and noticed her cable wasn't working. She called the company, and was told there was an outage. Amber went to the store and bought a digital antenna. She installed it on her television. Amber was able to watch basic channels without any issues.

T-Bar. Tom was skiing for the first time. He was going very well staying up on his skis. So he was allowed to take the T-bar up to one of the small hills. He was afraid he wouldn't be able to get off when it reached the top. He was a little shaky, but he got off the t-bar without falling.

Reynolds. Andy was playing at my house. His mother came over to pick him up. She was standing in the kitchen talking to my mom. He looked out the door and saw smoke coming from their chimney. She had left the stove on and caught the house on fire.

Eddie He crashes hard. Eddie is driving his new sports car down the road. He is going to pick up his three kids from his house. He gets a call from his wife Jamie. He looks down to accept the call. He is crushed by a head on collision with a Semi Truck.

Sewing a Dress. My mom sewed me a dress for the dance. We went to the fabric store. We picked out a pattern and bought the fabric. I helped her cut the fabric. She sewed the dress together with her sewing machine.

Back pain. Tim was suffering from back pain as of late. He went to the doctor to find out the cause. His doctor said his posture was causing his back pain. The doctor recommended that he wear a posture brace. Tim's managed to rid himself of his back pain.

Kristy's First Recital. Kristy always loved to dance so her mom enrolled her in a class. She practiced hard to learn her dance for her first recital. On the day of the recital, Kristy was so nervous. She stepped out on the stage and remembered the whole dance! The audience applauded loudly for her and she was so proud!

The Game. Madison was getting ready for a state basketball game. She was nervous and afraid of losing. The team was depending on her skills and she knew that. Madison had decided to practice every night after school. Her practice paid off and she scored the winning points.

Overweight Dog. Nancy always spoiled her dog. She gave it anything it wanted. It got really overweight. Nancy eventually realized the dog had to lose weight. She started feeding him less treats and a healthier diet.

New screen protector. I dropped my iPad yesterday. So I had to buy another screen protector. My current one was broken. When I got another one it took forever to ship. I got my money back because I waited so long.

Ballet Class`. Earl wanted to sign his daughter up for ballet class. Earl looked through the internet for an experienced ballet teacher. After finding the class, Earl decided to pay a visit to the class. Earl was impressed with the teacher, studio, and the staff. Earl decided to sign his daughter up for ballet classes at the studio.
A roach. Sue was in her room. She seen something crawling. She got close up to it. It was a roach. She then smashed it.

Facing the Fear. I was afraid of the dark as a young kid. I decided I needed to face my fear. I locked myself into my bedroom and turned out all the lights. I forced myself to stay still no matter how scared I got. After that night I was never afraid of the dark again.

Angry Dog. Mike walked downstairs to leave for work. When he opened his front door, a large dog was standing there. The god looked very angry and began to bark at Mike. Mike ran inside and grabbed his bottle of mace. He sprayed the dog who began to whimper and went on his way.

First Day of School. Bill did not know the bell schedule for the first day of school. He couldn't find this information on the school website. Bill sent texts to several friends who were in his class. According to his friends, school began at 10am. Thanks to his friends, he was on time.

Ana Eats Cereal. Ana woke up and began to make breakfast for the day. She wanted to make cereal but was out of clean spoons. She took her cereal and mixed it with milk in a glass. She gulped down her cereal from her glass. She began adopted this new way of eating cereal everyday afterwards.

The Look. Jeff had an interview and wanted to look his best. He tried to fix his hair but he had no mirror. Jeff went to the living room to use the TV screen. He was able to see his reflection well in the dark screen. Jeff fixed his hair and left for the interview.
Puppies. Kasey's dog was going to have puppies any day. She made sure she was comfortable. When Casey came home from work, Pepper was in labor. Pepper had 8 little pups. They kept all 8 babies.

Gift. Ed wanted to give his mom a nice birthday present. But he had no money to buy her anything. Then he had a great idea for a birthday surprise. He woke early on her birthday and brought her breakfast in bed. His mom said it was the nicest gift she'd ever gotten!

Beatles. His favorite rock band was The Beatles. He listened to their music late at night. He was unusually young for a Beatles fan. The legend had lived on through him. He deeply believed in all they stood for.

Brockton Rox. In 2005, I went to a retirement party. It was held at the Brockton Rox stadium. I went partly because I like minor league baseball. The game went into extra innings but the Rox won. I did not get back to Boston until midnight.

Death Scare. I jumped out of the plane. Afterwards, I tried to release my parachute. The lever ended up getting stuck. As scared as I was, I took a few seconds to make it loose. It ended up working after I pulled it.

First Day. The first day of school is always exciting for Troy. He loves showing off his new style each year. He treats the first day of school like a runway show. The second Troy walked into school, he got bombarded with compliments. Troy works his style all day.

A Good Student. Jabim had always been a poor student. He was even held back in the sixth grade. The second time around he decided to make a change. He followed all of his teacher's instructions and studied extra hard. That year Jabim got straight A's and was a good student.

Life Changes. Roberta is married with four kids. She thinks she might rather be with someone else. One day she left her husband. Her kids were very sad. Roberta felt good for the first time in a while.

Allergic Reaction. Tim was allergic to peanuts. He was out eating at a restaurant. He asked them if there were any in his food. They told him there wasn't but he still had an allergic reaction. Tim is now suing them for medical costs.

Travel Spanish. Winston was going on a vacation to Mexico. He was going to stay for a few weeks. Before he left he took basic Spanish classes. He learned some great travel Spanish phrases. He was able to get along really well in Mexico.
Energized. Molly was lacking energy. She was feeling really run down. Her doctor told her to work out. She joined a gym. The workouts made her feel energized!

Class. Paul had bad grades and didn't think he would graduate. There was only 5 days left but he studied and did make up work. He worked hard and stayed late after school. Finally, the grades were posted and he went to look. He had passed and was going to graduate!
Shampoo. I started getting some dandruff. I needed a new shampoo. My wife stopped by the store to get some. She brought it home for me. My new shampoo helps cure my dandruff.

Caught. Our company hires college interns for the summer. They are given mind deadening tasks, such as copying. One intern was rather handsome, and dated a worker. They snuck away from work and watched a movie. They got caught, and the intern lost his summer job.

Headphones. I was listening to some music. Suddenly, my headphones stopped working. I tried to fix them but it was no use. I had to go to the shop to buy new headphones. I bought some headphones and could listen to my music once more!

Tough Negotiation. France and Italy were at war for years. The war was over when France threatened Italy with the atomic bomb. In the peace talks, the Italian negotiator asked for reparations. The French negotiator told him that the surrender was unconditional. The French negotiator slapped the Italian to emphasize his point.

Jason Goes to Spain. Jason had wanted to travel to Spain for his whole life. It would be an expensive vacation to take. Jason started saving money for his big trip to Spain. Finally he had enough to book a ticket. Jason had the vacation of his dreams in Spain.

Aw Nuts. Since she was little, Abby was very allergic to peanuts. Her dad found out the hard way through a PBJ. One day a friend snuck a peanut into her jelly sandwich. Thankfully her dad was nearby and had an epi-pen to save her. Abby and her dad went home, avoiding disaster.

Bulk. Ray was always too skinny. But not matter what he ate, he never gained weight. So he decided to drink lots of protein smoothies. And he worked out everyday. After a month, he was proud of how much muscle he gained.

Swimming Lessons. Joanie's mom signed her up for swimming lessons at a lake. Each day she rode a bus to the lake to take lessons. Joanie learned the final test was swimming from a boat to shore. She was petrified and prayed to get out of the test. On the last day of lessons, the bus broke down and she was spared.

Johnny plays basketball. Johnny was waiting nervously for his basketball game to start. Once the game started he was no longer nervous. Johnny scored twenty points in the first half and ten in the second. Johnny's team won the game. Johnny was named MVP of the game.

Making a painting. I sat down with a canvas and some paint. I looked out my window for inspiration. I decided to paint an old memory of the city. I painted the lights and buildings. It didn't turn out very well, but I kept it anyway.

The Blanket. Before I go to bed, I clean up my sofa. I try to make sure nothing is on it. That involves folding my blanket if it has been used. My cat immediately jumps on the blanket after it is folded. It is my cat's favorite place to lay.

Dottie Needs A Bath. Dotty was being very grumpy. She had snapped at her husband, making him cross. He told her to go take a breather. Dotty decided to take a hot bubble bath. She felt much better afterwards.
Hunting. Tom was an avid outdoorsman. Tom decided to go hunting. He decided to eat what he killed. Tom shot a moose. The moose provided a year's supply of meat for Tom.
Health Care. My uncle couldn't afford health care. He got sick last year. The costs made him go bankrupt. He was still not able to get all the treatment necessary. He passed away poor and desperate.

Work Life. Mona wasn't satisfied with how much money she was making. She decided to apply for a new job. She visited a business and asked for work. They told her to apply online. She never heard back from them.
Hair. Jesse wanted to change her hair color. She asked her friends for advice. Her friend suggested dying her hair red. Jesse listened to her friend. Jessie dyed her hair red.

Amy's New Child. Amy has been pregnant for nine months. She went into labor early this morning. Her husband took her to the hospital. Amy gave birth to a baby boy this afternoon. Amy and her husband love the new child very much.

cooking class. Brandon wanted to learn how to cook. He signed up for a free class at the city center. It was a twelve week course. Over the course of the class he became comfortable in the kitchen. Brandon is looking forward to showing off his cooking skills.

Fusion. Eliza and Tanner are getting married. He is Chinese and she is Spanish. They can't agree on the type of food to serve at the wedding. They hire a famous caterer who presents a brilliant idea. They decide to serve tapas and dim sum fusion cuisine.

First Haircut. Yolanda was scared to go to the salon and get her haircut. This was the first time she was going to get her haircut. Yolanda sat in the salon chair as the hairstylist worked magic. To her surprise the stylist did not take that much off. Yolanda looked in the mirror and actually liked the cut.

Train Trip. Teddy was happy to be going with his family on a trip. He had never been on a train before. They boarded and found their seats. Teddy looked out the window with glee. He was having such a great time.

The Investigation. The police showed up to the crime scene quickly. They took photographs and conducted interviews. The witness told them they saw a man in a red hat running away. A short time later, an officer spotted the suspect. They arrested him quickly and took him to jail.
Berry gets hurt. Berry is playing basketball. Berry loves to play sports. Berry is driving to the basket. He lands on his leg. He breaks his leg in two.

Too tired to remember to pay. Mildred had worked all day as a nurse and was very tired. On her way home, she stopped to get a bottle of cough syrup. Mildred found the medicine and some other stuff she didn't need. She paid for her items and walked out of the store. When she got in her car,she saw she forgot to pay for the medicine.
stray. Ava found a stray cat wandering around. She began to leave it milk and meat. Soon it followed her around outside. Then she lured it into her room. Ava had her own pet cat now!

Land Surprise. My grandmother passed away from cancer when I was 28. Her lawyer called me after the funeral to talk about some things. To my surprise, my grandmother had left me 100 acres of her land! Her three children were unhappy with the situation. I split the land 4 ways, making everyone happy with the outcome.

The Trampoline. I got mad at my brother one day after school. I was trying to jump on the trampoline, but he stuck his head under it. I jumped on it anyway, bouncing up and down on his head. He yelled for our mom to help him, but I didn't care. I was so tired of being bullied, it didn't matter anymore.

Best job. Stevie changed jobs a lot. He had a total of 140 jobs over his life. At the age of 40 Stevie finally found a job he could stick with. It was a job working for a homeless charity. The job satisfaction he got was worth more than money.

Dishes. It was Jane's turn to do the dishes. Jane didn't want to do them. She bribed her little brother with some candy. He broke several dishes while washing them. Their parents blamed Jane and she was very ashamed.

Cancer. Aya received a sudden diagnosis of stage IV pancreatic cancer. She was told she had only a month to live, maybe less. She did not wallow in self-pity - instead, she used her time well. She wrote long letters to her loved ones and passed on her jewelry. When Aya passed away, she did so peacefully, knowing she was ready.

Fashionista in Training. Harry was a keen fashion designer. He studied fashion his whole life. Recently, he got asked to design dresses for A list celebrities. His first client was currently in the top 10 charts. He wasn't allowed to tell us who it was but he wanted to tell us.

Cat at the  window. My  cat  always  wants to  look  out the  window . The  cat  is  upset  because  he  can't  jump  high  enough. I  moved  the  furniture  and  used  a footstool. The  cat  can  now  climb  on the  furniture  like  a ladder. He is able  to  look  out  the  window.

The Dented Car. Cooper was playing catch with his friend Ryan. Ryan threw the ball and it hit Cooper's mom's car. Ryan ran back to his house. Cooper's mom walked outside and saw the car. Cooper got in trouble for the dent in the car.

Large. When I turned twelve, I blossomed faster than the other girls. I suddenly looked like an adult. I no longer wanted to be seen in public. As I grew older, I began to view it as an asset. I embraced my larger endowments and made the best of the situation.

A new bike. Jackie got a new bike for Christmas. It was red and white, exactly the one he wanted. He took the bike outside. He fell down several times at first. After weeks of trying he finally rode around the block.

Phone Service. Our phone line was damaged in a windstorm. We lost the signal on Friday night. I called in a repair request that night. Verizon did not come until the following Tuesday. Finally, service was restored on Thursday.
Bee. When I was 8 my mother took me on an outing. We went to a park. I found a bunch of bees around a mound. I kicked the mound and got stung. I learned to keep away from bees.

Painting. Jim wanted to learn how to paint. So he bought painting supplies and a painting book. When he became better at painting, he took his canvas outside. And others watched him paint. And people admired his landscape paintings.

Shark Attack. Darius went to the beach with his friends. There was a shark warning. Darius decided to ignore the warning. Sure enough, a shark attacked Darius. Darius lived but had to have his leg amputated.

Beach. Today was the first sunny day in months. Sara wanted to go outside to enjoy the sun. She decided to spend the day at the beach. The water was still slightly too cold. She laid on her towel and got sun.

Life is No Beach. We decided to go to the beach for the weekend. The drive took 4 hours instead of 2 because of construction. The hotel room had cockroaches and bedbugs. To top it all off it rained all weekend. Next year we're going to the mountains instead.
Loud Neighbors. Jay had loud neighbors. He woke up to the noise of them using a power saw. He decided to order ear muffs. They blocked the noise. But they were too bulky to sleep in.

Found Change. Tom was cleaning his apartment. He was going through his sofas. He found a lot of loose change between the cushions. There was enough to get a beer. Tom did so after he was done cleaning.

Out to lunch. Amy decided to get a burrito on her lunch break. She figured her 30 minute break was long enough to go. She drove to the restaurant, and was shocked to see a line. She decided to wait in line. Amy's boss was disappointed she was 15 minutes late from lunch.

Songwriter. Dennis loved to listen to music ever since he was a toddler. Dennis tried to learn a lot of instruments as well. He did not succeed however, and he was not good at playing them. Dennis was very mad and then tried to learn how to write songs. Now Dennis is able to make a lot of money from writing songs.

Defensive Driving. Tim had recently gotten a speeding ticket. He was given the option of taking defensive driving. It would negate the ticket and be cheaper overall. Tim took the agreement and went to the class. It was educational and he dodged getting points on his license.

Just Order Pizza. Mom had people over for my father's birthday. She was making all of the food. She was cooking for eleven people. Sadly, she ended up burning the main course. So we decided to order pizza instead.
Rock climbing fear. Alicia went rock climbing. She started climbing the cliff. Fear engulfed her. She was afraid she would fall. Thankfully she made it safe,
Accidentally. The man was running. He ran a little bit too far into the street. A car was coming fast. The man in the car looked too late. The car hit the man running accidentally.

Robbed. Michael was walking home from work one night. Suddenly two men approached with a knife. They threatened him and demanded his wallet. Michael pretended to retrieve it and then threw it far away. The hoodlums went for the wallet and Michael ran far away.

Embarrassment at the Mall. As a chubby kid I always wore sweatpants. One day my grandma took me to the mall to buy some replacements. The string had come out of the waist of the pair I was wearing. As I ran toward the store my pants fell down. I was mortified when everyone started laughing.

Bench. George wanted to be an Olympic benching champion. So he bought a weight set and bench. He lifted weights almost everyday. His muscles grew and he got stronger. However, he never became a champion.
Warm Milk. The woman warmed some milk. She poured some into a saucer. She gave the milk to her cat. The cat drank all of the milk. The cat vomited up the milk later.

Ghost. My wife's nephew lost his father when he was 9. He was scared of death. One day he was in the hallway of his building. He saw a man who resembled his father. He ran away, thinking he had seen a ghost.

New Chromebook Laptop. Bob was trying to write an essay for class. He could only type for 10 minutes at a time. His lap hurt due to his laptop overheating. He bought a small Chromebook laptop the next day. He was able to type comfortably with his new laptop.

The Good. Ollie has started watching the news each evening. He's very worried about all of the wars, crime and unhappy people. His mom explains that the news shows more good than bad. He asks her to show him some of the good. Together they go to the soup kitchen to help feed the homeless.

Tough burn. Kelsi was cooking some tomato sauce on the stove last night. She took a metal spoon and tasted the sauce. The sauce was perfect. To her surprise she spilled some and burned herself. Thankfully she had some aloe Vera nearby to heal it.

Objection. I secretly recorded my recent performance review. My told me things I know he should not have. I filed a civil lawsuit in federal court. The defense argued my evidence was inadmissible. My lawyer objected, the judge agreed and we won the case.

Gym. Laura wanted to start going to the gym together. We looked around and tried to decide which gym we wanted to go to. I told her that a certain gym was bad and she agreed. We were about to give up searching but found a nice one close by. We applied for membership at the nearby gym and now go daily!

First Female Football Player. Jan is a great soccer player. When she says she wants to try out for the football team people laugh. But she doesn't let that discourage her. She tries out and becomes the best kicker in the state. She becomes the first female player in state history.

Bird Feeder. Karen bought a bird feeder. She put it out right away. No birds ever came around. One night Karen noticed a big cat running around. She realized it had killed all the birds that got near.

New School. Charlie is going to start a new school tomorrow. He is nervous that he won't be able to make friends. On Charlie's first day one of his peers invites him to eat lunch. Charlie is continuously invited to each lunch with his new friends. Charlie now enjoys his new school and the new friends he has made!

Funny Girl. Lucy and her grandparents decided to watch a movie. Lucy and her grandpa were trying to decide what to watch. Grandpa always wanted to watch a western. Lucy was sick of westerns. Lucy and her grandma both voted to watch Funny Girl instead.

History. Anna had been assigned a paper for history class. She had to write about her family's history. Anna asked her grandparents about their lives. She wrote a richly detailed paper and she enjoyed doing it. Best of all, Anna scored an A on the paper!

Angela's Essay. Angela wanted to be a doctor when she grew up. Angela's family was too poor to afford to send her to college. She decided to enter an essay writing contest for a scholarship fund. Angela's essay was so good that it won! With her scholarship Angela was able to go to medical school.

The Phone Fiasco. Kaley went to the bar last night. She had a really great time with her friends. Unfortunately Kaley dropped her phone in her drink. Kaley thinks her phone has water damage. She went home and put her phone in rice when the night was over.

Moused. Amy loved Disney World. Mickey Mouse was her favorite character. Amy saved up all her money so she could see him. Finally, she was able to fly to Orlando for a vacation. She got her picture taken with Mickey Mouse!

Karen's help. Will's mom needed help with her job so he called Karen. Karen offered to take her shift so Will's mom could sleep. She was ecstatic that she was able to sleep longer. Will's mom went back to sleep and enjoyed her rest. The next day she thanked Karen so much and offered to help her too.

One Man Circus. A man put on a top hat and found a stick. He shouted to the neighbors that he was a one man circus. A few people heard his call and came over to watch. The one man circus did some acrobatics and sword swallowing. The neighbors threw him money for his great talents.

economics class. Antonio wanted to take an online economics course. His advisor suggested him taking the class on campus. Antonio did not take his advice. He found the class difficult and had to drop out. Antonio will have to retake the class next semester on campus.

sailing. The Johnson family rented a sailboat for the weekend. They weren't avid sailors. However, they were really having a good time. They sailed all over the bay. They all agreed it was a marvelous time.

Trip to the Vet. The small dog refused to walk up the stairs. The dog's owner was worried, so he took him to the vet. The vet carefully examined all four paws and diagnosed a sprain. The vet prescribed a painkiller to make the dog more comfortable. The owner was glad it wasn't something more serious.

Baking. Today i decided to bake some cookies. i was looking forward to eat some too. I got distracted and forgot to take them out of the oven in time. All of the cookies were burned! I was very upset, but decided to do another batch.

Not Impressed. Jill's neighbors were having a party. And she wanted to impress them anyway she could. So she tried to learn how to cook and brought spaghetti to the party. But hardly anyone touched the spaghetti. And Jill was angry that no one was impressed.

James and the Driving Test. James wanted to get his driver's license. He studied the book every day for 2 weeks. James got his mother to take him up there to take the test. He was so nervous. James passed the written part which made him happy.

The New Puppy. Allison moved to her first apartment this week. She was feeling lonely so she went to the shelter to adopt a puppy. She found a brown dog with white ears that she loved. She brought the puppy home and named him Bobo. Allison and Bobo are now best friends!
Birthday Cake. John was at a child's birthday. He was very bored. He cut the cake and ate a piece. It was delicious, so he ate another. All total, John ate over half of the child's birthday cake.

Rebooting The Network. Charles was an intern at a social network company. They were called Unified Beat Incorporated. Charles was asked to code a new feature and he did. He implemented his code but some accounts were buggy. Charle' boss said, It's stop the press for coders, reboot the network!

Visiting Family. I thought it would be nice to drop in on family last weekend. I drove an hour away to where my aunt lives. When I got there nobody was home. I called to see what was going on. Apparently they had the same idea and were visiting me at home.

Bottom of the sea. My family was on vacation in Florida. We had decided to spend the day taking a glass bottom boat tour. We got on the ship and headed downstairs. The entire trip the water was cloudy and we did not see much. We left the tour feeling disappointed.

Chef Tasha. Tasha wasn't a very good cook. Every time she tried cooking, something went wrong. Tasha attempted cooking spaghetti for her friends. The spaghetti sauce was very runny and gross. Tasha and her friends decided to go to a restaurant instead.

Hamster. Sara's brothers was sad. His pet hamster died. Her brother was distant and just stood in his room all day. Sara's check came and Sara went to the pet store. She bought him a new hamster and he was happy.

Allergic. Drew gave his girlfriend a pair of flowers. Her girlfriend gave him a large hug and took the flowers away. A few minutes later, her face started to get puffy. She immediately fell on the ground. Drew called the ambulance and they gave her medication.

Doll. My wife was looking at a vintage doll on eBay. It started at $10. She put in a proxy bid of $25. She was quickly outbid, and was not going to go higher. She bid $50 on impulse and was the high bidder.
Getting Fat. Loyd was in a car accident. He broke his leg. While recovering he gained a lot of weight. Lloyd blamed the leg but it went beyond that. He continued to let himself go.

Nature. John wanted to live closer to nature. He felt stressed all the time and the city was too loud. He found a place in the woods and was in heaven. Then his parents got sick and he moved back to the city. John once again longed for the country .

The Big Storm. Jessica was scared of bad weather. There was a bad storm crossing over the area. Jessica was terrified when she heard the thunder. She stayed under her bed all night. Jessica was relieved when the storm had passed.

Haunted?. People said the hotel was haunted. They wanted to stay there, because it sounded interesting! It was very old and beautiful. They saw no signs it was haunted, but it was such fun! They completely enjoyed their stay.

The Ski Trip. Jackson was having a great time. His family had decided to go on vacation in the Alps. They were all enjoying snow skiing. Jackson was quite good and was tearing up the slopes. They all had a wonderful time that day.

Muffler. Emma's car was a little old, but it ran pretty well. All it needed was a new muffler. Her friends laughed at how loud the car was. But then Emma saved up enough to fix the muffler. Now nobody could mock her quiet car!
Class. Wayne was late for class. Wayne rushed to get ready for class. Wayne rode his bike to school quickly. Wayne ran through the halls to his first class. Wayne arrived just as class was starting.

Ears Pierced for the First Time. Lisa was quite nervous to get her ears pierced for the first time. She walked into Claire's with her mother and sat on the chair. The sales person grabbed the earring gun and put it in her lobe. Lisa was surprised the pain did not hurt at all. She looked in the mirror at her new earrings and was happy.
mermaid. Anna was on a ship in the ocean. She was watching the waves eagerly. She hoped to see a mermaid! She tried to scan the entire ocean. But after weeks, she had not seen any mermaids.

Tomboy Ballerina. Jasmine loved to dance around the room in her nightgown. Her sister Mara thought she was a silly girl full of romantic notions. Mara would rather climb trees than dance around like a silly girl. Jasmine and Mara both tried out for a school play. Everyone was surprised when Mara got the part of a ballerina.

Garbage Man. Chris is a garbage man and gets up at two every morning. He usually drinks energy drinks but wants to stop. He doesn't need all the sugar but likes the caffeine. He decided to switch and to drink black coffee on his route. It works just fine and he is more productive than ever.
Poor artist. Arthur was painting a girl's portrait. She sat quietly and smiled. When he finished, he showed her the portrait. She did not like it. She did not want to pay him any money.

Roasting Session. Timmy was walking around school with his flip flops. A group of guys noticed and surrounded him. One of the people in the group criticized his flip flops. The others stepped in the conversation. Timmy never wore his flip flops to school after that day.

Flat. Anna had a flat tire. She tried calling for help, but her cell phone was dead! She could not find a pay phone anywhere. Luckily, a passerby lent her his cell phone to call for help. Soon a tow service came to help repair Anna's tire.

His Feet. My best friend always props his feet up on the table. I never tell him not to, but it bothers me a lot. Today he has his feet on a table right next to me. I want to tell him to stop, but I know he'll be mad if I do. I'm probably going to ignore it this time, also.
The last chance. Tina worked at a retail store. She worked there every day. Her boss told her today the store was closing. Tina was crushed. She would have to find another job.

Horse Races. Sammy's mother loved going to horse races. She brought Sammy with her quite often. Sammy learned a lot about how the races work. He never really liked going to the races himself. When he grew up, he went to them to remember his mom.

Homework. Sara was very diligent in completing her homework. She always received good grades as a result of her attentiveness. Sara told her friends that they would get good grades if they studied. They started studying together in the library after school. After a little while, Sara's friends also received good grades!

Fruit salad making. One of Leslie's favorite snacks was fruit salad. She went into her garden to gather all the fruit she needed. When she chopped it up and placed it into a bowl she tasted it. It tasted delicious and she couldn't wait to try more. She was so hungry she ate it all.

Cake. I decided to bake a cake. I followed a recipe I found online. Alas, the recipe used incorrect measurements. My cake did not bake properly. Thus, I decided to never again use a recipe from online.
The Lipstick. Jamie was shopping for makeup. She found a great lipstick. She bought it and took it home. It was way too bright! She wished she hadn't wasted her money on it.
Fred. Matt met a man named Fred. They talked a lot and became good friends. They went everywhere together. Then Fred betrayed Matt. Matt was upset and decided to never talk to Fred again.

Figuring out the story. Movies have become very predictable for me. I was watching Wreck it Ralph the other night. I figured out how the movie is going to end. Movies are following the same plot line for a long time. Hopefully hollywood will get better at making movies.

The Wedding Announcement. Helen was enjoying her wedding reception. Suddenly one of her cousins stood and began speaking. The cousin announced that she was pregnant earning cheers. Helen was annoyed at her cousin for stealing the attention. Still she didn't want to seem rude so she didn't say anything.

Billburg. Bob Billburg wanted to buy a restaurant. Though he lacked the prowess to make a meal. One day he found one for sale, and purchased it. He tried his hardest to cook for the people. Unfortunately, he couldn't figure it out, and went out of business.
A few drinks. I had a few drinks with my boyfriend the other day. We don't usually drink together. We both had a few too many. We laughed all night. It was a perfect night.

Snow Storm. Max was getting ready for the big snow storm. He had a shovel, but did not have salt to melt the ice. Max went to the store to buy the salt. He was able to buy the last bag of salt. Max got home right as the snow began to fall.

Hypnotism. Charles read a lot of information online about hypnotism. He convinced himself that it was possible. He trained to be a hypnotist. He tried to hypnotize his brother. He only succeeded in convincing his brother it didn't work.

Hail Storm. Tyler was taking a walk on the beach. He saw the dark clouds coming towards him but still walked. The clouds got darker, and it started to rain. Tyler liked the rain so he decided it couldn't hurt. Until it started to hail, then it really hurt Tyler, so he ran home.

New Name. Regina did not like her name at all. Every time she heard someone say it she would nearly wince. She decided to have her name legally changed. She filled out all the forms and got her name changed. She was so happy to finally be named Berry-Smoke Winchester IV.

Last Letter. In the back of the mailroom there was a box no one ever moved. One day Carl moved it to clean behind it and found a letter. It was dated 60 years ago to an address that no longer existed. He opened the letter and read it. It was an apology from one friend to another.

Smash. Gina's mother found a tape of cursing rap music. She took the tape away from the kids. They all followed her downstairs expecting to be in trouble. She didn't say a word to them just kept walking. They were more confused than ever when she went outside.

Moving Out of State. For Ashley, going to medical school it meant leaving behind her life. She had gotten into a medical school out-of-state and had to go. Ashley was very scared but she knew that she could handle anything. Once she moved and started school she got used to the routine. She learned that moving away isn't so bad after all.

Torn Shorts. Kim bought a new pair of shorts. They fit a bit tight. She decided to wear them publicly right away anyway. They tore in the butt area right away. Kim didn't realize until she got back home.

Tony Grills a Fish. Tony wanted to make a delicious dinner for his friends. At first he had trouble deciding what to cook. His grocer recommended the grill a fresh fish for them. He grilled a delicious bass fish and served it with wine. Tony was very proud of the dinner he made for his friends.

Sam has a fall. Sam is playing with her friends in her room. They decide to play hide and seek. Sam goes and runs to hide. While running she trips and falls down the stairs. Her friends all go and check on her and she turns out to be okay.

Alarm. Angel forgot to set her alarm. She woke up when the light came in through the window. Angel looked at the clock and saw she was late for work. She called her boss and told him she overslept. The boss laughed and told her to take her time coming in.

Food Poisoning. Alex went out to eat at a steakhouses with some friends. As soon as he got home Alex felt very sick. He vomited for three hours and had a bad headache. After three hours he suddenly felt better. Alex read online that he had the common symptoms of food poisoning.

Bowling Champion. Rick always thought that he was a great bowler. He was invited to a bowling tournament in his home town. He ended up scoring 270 and needed one more strike to win. He managed to get the last strike and won. He was awarded a first place trophy.
Quiz. Sam needed to do well on his quiz. He went home the night before and studied all night. He did not watch any TV or play games. The morning of the quiz, he crammed. And he did great on the quiz!

Check Again. Mitch went to a basketball game. There was a big crowd at the ticket counter. The worker told Mitch that there were no more tickets. Mitch slammed a $50 bill on the counter and told him to check again. The worker said that he just found a ticket for him.

The Cubbies. The teacher renovated her classroom. She added some cubbies against the wall. They were supposed to hold books and papers. The students liked to store their book bags there instead. The teacher's organization hadn't worked well.

Good enough. There was two nails to go in the birdhouse Jim was building. He reached for his hammed but could not find it. He looked all around the table but alas it was nowhere. Jim picked up a heavy steel wrench and used it like a hammer. The end result was satisfactory.

Laundry Cash. I gathered up all my clothes to do laundry. As I put the clothes in the washer I emptied the pockets. In some pockets I found money. All the money I found I put in a jar. I had found $15 in this way.

Piano lessons. Rene wanted to take piano lessons. Although she was fifty, she still wanted to learn. She ended up impressing everyone. When Rene was done with the lessons she had a recital. She got a standing ovation.
Hair Loss. Cohen was beginning to lose his hair. His friends would tease him about his hair. He tried a hair treatment he saw on tv. His hair began to grow back. His friends stopped teasing him.

The Fair. Arthur was at the state fair with his friends. He bought a lot of fried food. Then he went to go play the carnival games. He was not very good at the games and wasted a lot of money. Arthur left the fair feeling very angry.
Out of Deodorant. Tim got out of the shower. He realized he was out of deodorant. Tim was a sweaty person. He decided to buy some on the way to work. He stopped at a walgreens and was set.

Lost and Found. Julie decided to go out for a walk. While walking she noticed the same fliers on different poles. She pulled one down to get a closer look at it. It was a flier for a missing dog with a reward. During her walk Julie found the dog and returned it to it's owner.

Uncertain about Lecture. The principal decided to take a trip to Ms.Diana's class. When he looked inside, the kids were playing video games. Ms.Diana was resting on her desk with her head down. The principal was furious and pulled her out of class. She received a short suspension.
Running in a race. Kelly decided to run a race with her friends. At first she was doing well. Then she slipped and fell. She ended up scraping her knee. Thankfully she has a band aid on her?

Riding a Bike. Danny was learning how to ride a bike. His dad told him he would hold on to the bike. When Danny looked back, his dad was far away. He panicked and rode straight into a tree. Danny cried and said he wouldn't ride the bike again.

Weight Sadness. Becky is sad about about her weight. She wishes that she was skinny like her sister. She decides to start eating healthier food. The weight is starting to come off. Becky is starting to feel better about her weight.

Norma Cleans the Fish Tank. Norma decided it was time to feed her goldfish. She noticed that her goldfish tank was dirty as she fed the fish. First she scrubbed the algae off the inside of the glass. Next she removed and replaced one fourth of the water. The fish tank looked much better after it was cleaned.

Manicurist. Kylie loved to paint her nails. She wore different color paint several times a week. She decided to become a manicurist. She worked at several different nail salons. Last month, she opened her own nail salon.

Smoky Barbecuing. Todd was trying to grill some burgers one day. His grill was cheap and was producing a ton of smoke. Soon his neighbors came out complaining about the smell. Todd reluctantly put out the flame on his grill. He decided he'd have to wait until he had a better grill.

Exam. Lesley scrambled at the last second to study for her exam. She arrived in class exhausted and her head clouded with sleep. She looked at her test and all the letters were blurred. A minutes later, she fainted on the floor. She woke up in the infirmary with a headache and an F.

The Windy Day. Lucy was sure it was going to rain. She made sure that she had her umbrella when she left the house. When the wind picked up it turned her umbrella inside out. Before she could fix her umbrella it started to downpour. Lucy was soaked to the bone and holding a broken umbrella.
The Lightning. The team was having practice. A thunderstorm blew in. The lightning was getting closer and closer. The coach decided to send everyone home. Immediately, the rain started pouring down.

Building a House. Mike wanted his own home but couldn't afford it. He decided that he would build one by himself. He started by buying up all of the cheap material he could. When he was ready he began assembling the cabin like home. To his delight he was able to quickly finish a good house.

She Understands. Amy's friend Ella was asking personal questions. The questions were about Ella's brother Ray. Amy didn't feel comfortable answering the questions. She tried to change the subject nicely. Ella let Amy know she understood, and changed the topic.
Too Drunk. Tom was at a house party. He kept drinking all night. Eventually he was too drunk to drive home. He had the spend the night there. The next day he apologized and went home.

Molly. Molly was so excited about her upcoming birthday. She was finally going to be 18, officially an adult. She decided to move out and be on her own. Her parents threw her a surprise birthday party. Molly was sad about leaving them.

Bear. A bear wandered through the woods. It sniffed at branches and dug up buried nuts. Feasting on the land it made its way to the river. Once there it fished for a while for a larger meal. Satisfied with the catch and the fish it returned home to sleep.
Cold Morning. Tom's car was old and busted. He tried to get it started one morning. It was too cold out and wouldn't work. Tom stayed a while until it warmed over. It took him several minutes.
Cat Poop. Our cat is good with the litter box. She poops on the floor on rare occasion. Last night she pooped on the bedroom carpet. Luckily it was a dry stool. My wife yelled at the cat.
Mark Cooks Dinner. Mark's family was hungry. He had a pack of steaks in the freezer. Mark thawed the steaks. He cooked them with some onions and mushrooms. Mark ate dinner with his family.

A Fun Trip. Emma visited an amusement park. She got to go on many rides. Her favorite was the train ride. The conductor let her blow the train whistle. Emma can not wait to go back to the amusement park.

Johnny Runs a Marathon. Johnny has always wanted to try a challenging physical test. He decides to sign up to run a marathon. Johnny works hard to practice for the marathon. After months of preparation, Johnny completes the marathon. Johnny is very proud for challenging himself so much.

The Sore Loser. Jake loved gambling as much as he hated losing. He and Tom were playing cards. Tom won the hand but was afraid to say so. When he showed his cards, Jake started hitting him with a wooden slat. Jake only stopped when his mom yelled at him.
The Cookies. Jen wanted to bake cookies. She found a recipe. She bought ingredients. She mixed them all up. Jen then burned the cookies.
Helping Out. Kate's cousin ran a small business. He needed Kate to do some sewing for his business. Kate was not fond of sewing. Kate was hesitant to help. But she agreed to help since he was family.

Baseball Throw. Becky tried out for the softball team. She did not make the team though. The cache told her she needed to throw the ball harder. Becky spent the next year working on her throwing every day. The following year Becky tried out again and made the team!

Hard Work Pays Off for Alexis. Alexis has always done extremely well in school. She carefully fills out the application to Harvard. Alexis anxiously sends her application in the mail. A reply letter comes back right away! Alexis is very excited to be accepted to Harvard!

Broken. I reached back just as the door slammed behind me. The ring on my finger hooked in the door handle. It pulled my finger hard. My knuckle swelled exponentially. I went to the emergency room, where they told me I cracked my knuckle.

Copy. Fred looked at the diets of various athletes. And impressed by the high amount of calories they ate per day. Fred decided to copy their diets and workout routines. But he felt himself getting sick and weak. Fred went back to his normal diet and his health improved.
Martini. The man shook the martini shaker. It sounded like it needed ice. He added some ice. He tasted it. It tasted watered down.

Swept by the wind. Irene wore a big hat that morning. But as it was very windy, it got blown away on the beach. As she approached it, the tide swept it away. Irene removed her sandals to swim after it. But as much as she tried, the hat bobbed far away from her reach.

Fred Collects Stamps. Fred had always wanted to have a stamp collection. He decides to start buying some stamps. Eventually he has many stamps. He puts them into a small folder. Fred is glad to have a collection of stamps.

Canned Peas. Kate wanted chicken noodle soup. In the cupboard all the cans were turned facing backwards. She needed to turn them around to find the soup she wanted. She only meant to turn around a few to find her soup. She ended up taking 20 minutes turning the cans to face forward.

The Bad Sitter. Elena was going out for the first time since she had a baby. She had hired a babysitter for the first time and she was nervous. She tried to remain calm, went out and enjoyed her night. When she got home the baby was screaming and rashy. Elena fired the sitter and vowed not to leave for at least a year.

The Wet Paws. Jordan was watching TV on her couch. It was raining outside and she noticed her cat scurrying inside. The cat ran over to Jordan and hopped onto her lap. Jordan realized that the cat's paws were wet, but it was too late. Her clothes and blankets were all wet and ruined.
Clowns. I was at the circus with my friend. A clown came out on the stage. My friend put her hands on her face. I asked her why she was doing that. She told me she was scared of clowns.

Pie Eating Contest. Lou was in a pie eating contest. He could eat more than anyone in his family. As Lou was finishing his first piece of pie, he looked over. The person next to him was already on his third piece. Lou realized he couldn't possibly eat enough to win.

A good fit. Zeke went to the department store to buy some shoes. He went to the sales clerk and asked for a size 9. The clerk told him he needed to be more specific. Zeke pick up a boot and asked for it in a size 9. The clerk checked in the back and brought Zeke the shoe.

Running into old friends. Kelly went on a trip to California last week. While she was there she attended to business. However to her surprise she ran into an old friend. The girls chatted just like old times. When Kelly left she called the girl.

Red Sorghum. Yesterday I finished reading the novel Red Sorghum. I am Chinese and had heard a lot about the novel. I finished the book in four days. I found it to be violent yet lyrical. I am going to watch the movie version soon.

Don't Give Up. Lacy loved to dance. She wanted to be a ballerina growing up. Lacy had a huge recital, and she was scared. Her mother hugged her and comforted her. Lacy went out on stage and performed her heart out.
beach. Eva went to the beach one day. She decided to get a suntan. She laid out on the sand. But then she dozed off! Eva woke with a terrible sunburn.

Wedding. Rita had just been proposed to. She couldn't wait to get married! She spent months planning the party afterwards. All her guests showed up to the wedding. They told her she had planned a great party!

The Bus Fight. Fran was riding on the bus trying to keep to herself. Suddenly a woman complained about Fran's grocery bags. When Fran didn't respond, the woman became aggressive. Soon she was fighting meanly with Fran. Fran hurried off of the bus as soon as she could.

Time to cook dinner!. I have friends coming over for dinner tonight, so I need to get ready. I'll start by getting the drinks together. Once the drinks are together, it's on to an appetizer. Once I have all of those things together, I'll start the steaks. It won't be long before they eat!

Sarah Flies On An Airplane. Sarah steps into the airplane. She takes her seat next to the window. The airplane takes off into the sky. Sarah looks out of the window to see the clouds. She arrives at her destination two hours later.
New bag. Jen wanted a new bag. The one she wanted was too expensive. She decided to save up. She also took on extra hours. She was happy when she was able to buy the bag.

Cheap sale. Today I went to the mall to look at shoes. I searched a lot of stores but couldn't find what I wanted. Eventually I found a discount store. I picked up one pair. Then I saw I could get another half off so I picked another pair.
Sparky. Sparky loved computer games. He played on his laptop after bedtime. He was tired all day at school. His teacher called his mom. Sparky's mom now locks his laptop in the car after bedtime.

Tarts. I told my cousin about my pumpkin flavored pop tarts. In a fit of jealousy, he got dressed and went shopping. He texted me angrily from the parking lot. He said he'd wasted his time. All he found was disgusting watermelon flavored ones.

Losing religion. Cynthia used to be a deeply religious person. She went to church daily. After a series of bad events Cynthia started to question religion. She was shunned by people she trusted for asking questions. Ultimately she decided to let it all go to focus on her own happiness.

The Striker. Rowan wiped the sweat from his brow. He was running fast toward the goal. He knew at any moment the defender would run at him. Rowan was right, but prepared, as he swept past the defender. He kicked the ball hard and watched as it sailed into the goal.

Browser. Tom loved browsing the internet. Tom was visiting a new site. The site said his browser could not view the content. Tom had to download a new browser to see the site. Tom downloaded a new browser.
The talk. My mom came over last night. She was a little sad about her finances. She had been having some trouble with money. I tried to help cheer her up. I think our talk helped.

Mommy's Sick For Now. Little Poe worried about his mother. She seemed tired all the time and didn't seem to want to do much. One day, Poe's mom was taken to the hospital. When she came back, Poe was in for a surprise! His mom brought a new baby sister home!

Wresting. I have been training for my next wrestling match. I have been lifting a lot of weights to get stronger. I have gained a lot of muscle. Now I have to move up to a higher weight class. I am glad I lifted weights and I can be in a different weight class.

Julie Gets a Trainer. Julie wants to start losing weight and gaining muscle faster. She decides to hire a personal trainer to work with her at the gym. While having a trainer is expensive, Julie is happy with the results. She finds herself becoming much stronger than she thought possible. Julie sends her trainer a special thank you note.

Arrows. Hank bought a bow and arrow and learned how to use them. He was very proud of himself. One day, he accidentally shot an endangered eagle. Hank didn't think anyone saw him do it. He took the bird home and ate it, with a side of potatoes.

Carpet. Rita wasn't sure if she should have carpet or wood floors in her room. She thought of a nice soft carpet to walk on. So she chose to have carpet installed. But the next day, her cat tore it all up. And she had no choice but to remove it.

Kids trip to the mall. Esther took her grandchildren to the mall to shop for their parents. She gave each of the children $20 to get something for mom, and dad. The oldest asked her for $20 more. Later the oldest told Esther the Ester was to get a gift for her. Esther was moved by her granddaughters kindness.
Bad Landlord. I was supposed to share a house with someone. I took all of my things over there. His sister had to approve me. I spent one night there. She didn't let me stay.
