Compulsive Liar. I asked Jeanette if she was free Friday night. She eagerly said no and looked forward to seeing me that day. However, she sent an urgent message to me on Friday. It says that she got hit by a car and was hospitalized. I found out that she was lying since she posted partying photos.

Second Home. Rick had a nice home down near the beach. Last summer the house caught on fire. It took forever to get the insurance stuff taken care of. But finally the house is done being rebuilt. Rick likes it even more than his old home.

Samantha's Flight. Samantha had always dreamed of flying. She decided she wanted to learn to fly a plane. She saved up her money for flying lessons. When she was finally ready to start flying, she became ill. She realized she couldn't fly because of her terrible fear of heights.
Bad Pasta. Greg ate a huge plate of pasta. When he got home he felt sick. He made himself vomit in the bathroom. Noodles got stuck in his nose. Greg promised himself never to eat pasta again.

Ebay. Lisa listed some clothes to auction on Ebay. She was pleased to see that the auction got quite high. When the auction ended, she received the buyer's information. She was shocked the winner was a girl who bullied her in high school. Lisa decided to cancel the sale.

Football game. The football team made it to the state playoffs. The whole school was ready to cheer them on. However, the quarterback got hurt in the first quarter. The freshman backup was called in. The team still won!

Cat leash. Kyle had decided to teach his cat how to walk on a leash. That way he could take it for walks around the city. He went to the pet store and bought a leash and collar. The cat did not fight him at all when he put the collar on. They go for walks twice a day with no problems.

Stage Props. Adam loved making small objects. He would carve wood and metal to make fascinating things. One day the drama teacher asked if he would make some props. Adam was nervous but decided to give it a try. He made creations that were featured in all the plays that year.

The Mine. Terry worked hard every day in the mine. He hated it, but needed it at the same time. The old mine was the only thing keeping the town afloat. Without the mine, Terry couldn't provide for his family. It was a tough life, but Terry knew deep down that the mine was needed.

The Sick Boy. Carl was playing on his bike with his friend, Fred. He noticed a boy in a bedroom window across the street. He asked Fred who the boy was. Fred said that his name was Derek and he was always sick. The next afternoon, Carl and Fred went to Derek's with toys.

The Dress. Sam was excited to wear her new dress. It was the perfect shade of pink. It was full of ruffles. When she put it on, the zipper busted open. Sam was so upset and cried that she couldn't wear it.

Charlie. Charlie was a smart boy, but he thought he knew everything. Any time a teacher tried to teach him something, he didn't listen. He spent all his time drawing during class and not listening. One day, Charlie had to take a test over what he learned in class. Because he didn't listen, Charlie didn't pass the test.

The Dune Buggy. Eddie liked to be outside being adventurous. He bought a dune buggy to drive around the desert. He drove it so fast! It threw dust into the air and made tracks in the sand. Eddie had a great adventure.

Beating the Game. Blake was playing a game on his computer. He was having trouble beating the game. Blake got frustrated and quit the game. He tried playing again later when he was more relaxed. Blake finally beat the game.

Alphabet. Kimberley was just learning the alphabet. Sometimes she would miss a letter. She worked very hard to memorize it. She even missed out on some sleep to learn it. Finally, Kimberley learned the alphabet.

Spilled medication. I was in the bathroom one morning getting ready for work. While standing in front of the mirror, I began to brush me teeth. When I finished brushing my teeth, I reached for my medication. After I grabbed the bottle, I spilled pills into my sink. The pills fell into the drain, and I had to call in for replacements.

Obsessive Sam. Clare invited Sam to her house to work on a school project. Sam was nervous but was required to help Clare. He was proud to arrive precisely on time. However, he deliberately worked slowly to stay with Sara longer. Before leaving, Sam picked up a strand of Sarah's hair to keep.

Backyard Tennis. Rick wished he could play tennis every day. But he didn't like having to drive to his local tennis court. So he built a large wall out of plywood in his backyard. And he created a large concrete surface to play on. Rick was happy that he could practice tennis whenever he wanted.
Pool. Zoe loves to lay by the pool. She had just gotten a new swimsuit. She decided to go tan. When she got to the pool, she fell asleep. Zoe is now sunburned.
Drugs. Drugs controlled my life at one time. I went to rehab. The people there helped me. We talked about what I wanted out of life. I am sober now.

New Cat. Sal's cat died after ten years. He mourned for a few weeks before deciding to get a new cat. Sal went to the pet store but on his way he heard noise in an alley. Looking in the alley, he found a skinny, filthy cat. Sal took the cat home and soon the two were best friends.

Rax. Jimmy had one job, to destroy the barracks. Everyone pleaded with him to do it. Alas, Jimmy was hardheaded, and would not listen. Instead of destroying the barracks, Jimmy went to the jungle. Jimmy was fired for insubordination.
The Book. Jane loved to read. Her mother gave her a book for her birthday. She spent the whole day reading. She fell in love with the story. When she finally finished, she felt sad it was over.
tired. It was college exam week. Ed was very tired. He had exams every morning! But he made it to every test on time. Then he slept for twelve straight hours!
IHOP. We went to IHOP for breakfast today. They were offering pancakes for $1. Proceeds would benefit childhood hunger. We each ordered a short stack and some eggs. I think this was a worthy cause.

Apartment. Mark was late on his lease. He did not have enough money to pay it. Mark asked his friend Alex to lend him some money. Alex agreed when Mark promised to pay him back by next week. Mark rushed to the leasing office before it closed.

A light Jog. I tried to start jogging last week. I got my running shoes on and went out. I was excited and ready to go when it started to rainy. I turned around and went home instead. It hasn't rained since but I haven't wanted to risk it.

Bingo. Ellie went to bingo with her granny once a month. She felt frustrated because she never won. Just once she wanted to get to shout out bingo. As she sat with her card, the caller called her missing number. She yelled bingo at the top of her lungs!

Surgeon. Kayla always dreamed of becoming a surgeon. The only problem was she was scared of blood. She fainted anytime she had her blood drawn. She persevered and kept trying. She eventually became a surgeon.
Gym Visit. I drove to the gym today. I went to the front desk to check in. The front desk clerk assigned me a locker. I put my coat and keys in the gym locker. I walked into the weightlifting room.

Job Interview. Haley was nervous about her job interview. She decided to practice with her roommate. The next day she put on her nicest outfit. Her nice outfit and savvy interview skills were well received. Haley now has a really great job.

Yevgeny gets a flat tire. Yevgeny rode his bike to the library. He accidentally ran over some broken glass. The tire became flat. Yevgeny sprayed aerosol flat fixer in his inner tube. After inflating the tire he continued to the library.

Fancy Dress. Kate bought a new dress for homecoming. It was expensive but she really liked it. The night of the dance Kate noticed someone else wearing it. They both matched almost exactly the same. Kate was embarrassed and tried to stay on the other side of the room.

Cheap as dirt. A man went to the garden supply store for potting soil. He was amazed by how much the soil cost. The man accused the clerk of overcharging him for dirt. The clerk tried to explain why it so expensive but the man scoffed. The man thought it was a con and left the store.

Cheater. Jill finds out that Jan's boyfriend is married. She tells Jan her boyfriend is married but Jan doesn't believe her. So she brings Jan to meet her boyfriend's wife. Jan is devastated by the truth. But she thanks Jan for having the courage to tell her.
Food Critic. Jamie handed her dish to the chef. He took one bite out it He spit out the food in the mouth. Jamie was immediately shocked. The chef criticized her food.

The Plan. A teacher was busy teaching math in grade school one day. The fire alarm rang and the students cheered. Everyone lined up by the door. The teacher led them outside. The teacher cursed the fire drill for ruining her plans.

The New Neighbors. Last week new neighbors moved in. This week they had a moving in party. They were really loud and didn't stop until late at night. We went over to ask them to turn the volume down. I hope this isn't a sign of things to come.

Birthday. My niece's college roommate turned 20 yesterday. They drove from Chicopee to Holyoke. They played music on the radio and sang on the way up. They had dinner in a nice restaurant. Her roommate had a nice day.
Orange Juice. I walked into the kitchen. I got a glass and some orange juice. Just as I removed the cap, the bottle slipped. It fell to the floor. I cleaned up the huge mess, frustrated and frazzled.

Fall. Tim is struggling in school and at work. Tim is falling quickly and needs to seek help. His addiction to the bottle is detrimental. He works his way through counseling. Tim is back on track and in school again!

The Old Lady's Boots. In the month of November the shoppers come out of hiding. They fill the stores with excitement and fight over sales merchandise. Pam's family loves to shop. I saw Pam at the store just this afternoon. She was fighting with an old lady over the last pair of snow boots.
Bookmarks. I lose my bookmarks easily. I found Amazon sold 100 bookmark lots. I bought a lot six months ago. Today I am down to a few. I had to order some more tonight.

What Shade. Kate's mom bought paint to paint the living room. Kate thought it looked pink and suggested she not use it. Her mother swore it was brown. Her mother decided to use the paint anyway. They ended up with a purple living room.

Feeding Frenzy. Lily's wanted a fish tank just like her friend had. Her mom helped Lily buy a tank and a few fish. Lily wasn't satisfied because her friend's fish were much bigger. Lily dumped the box of fish food in the tank so they'd grow. The next day, Lily had to replace the fatally overfed fish.

Math pride. Felix was very good at math but his nephew wasn't. As his nephew had many problems at school, he went to see Felix. Felix helped his nephew every day after class for a full month. When his nephew had a math test, he successfully passed it. Felix was very proud of him and gave him a calculator as a reward.

Computer Problems. I went to turn on the computer. When I turned it on, there was a blue screen. I decided to call tech support for help. When I called, they said to reboot it. I did and the computer worked like normal.

The Futon. The kids wanted a place to play with their friends. Their dad decided to build them a playroom. They added a futon for seating. Soon, the kids spent all their time sitting on the futon watching tv. They made a lot of memories on the futon.

Ghost Sheet. Will took a white sheet down from the attic. Will splattered the sheet with some blood. Will cut two eye holes in the sheet. Will then charged into his roommate's bedroom wearing the sheet. Will cried with laughter at how scared his roommate looked.

Cooking Class. My teacher took the class to the cafeteria. We took out our equipment and gathered several ingredients. I rolled up some dough and placed it into the oven. After the dough was baked, I immediately took it out. Hannah poured glaze onto it and added the finishing touches.

Ronald's Speech. Ronald was chosen as a keynote speaker at a conference. Ronald was honored but also very nervous. Ronald spent hours and hours preparing his speech. The day of the speech Ronald realized that he lost his notes! Since he had practiced so much he didn't need them after all.

Hot sun. The man walked across the beach towards the water. The sun was so hot it slowed him down. When he was 5 feet from the surf he collapsed. The water splashed against him on the ground. This woke him up and he crawled into the sea.

Walking in the woods. I was walking with my dog through the forest. He was nose down sniffing all of the new smells. Suddenly he stopped in his tracks to look at a small animal running. He barked like crazy until it was gone. Eventually I got him to stop so we finally continued down the path.

Movies. A young mom had a son who was obsessed with this one movie. She tried to get him to watch other movies as well. Unfortunately her son refused because he loved his current favorite. Finally his mother got a subscription for Netflix to show him others. As soon as he saw the movie Home he was hooked to Netflix.

Cell Phone. The man signed up for a new cell phone plan. He got a new phone with the plan. He was not happy with the service. He cancelled the service early. He had to pay the full retail price of the phone as a penalty.
Dad's Comet. Marvin loved to study astronomy. His dad got him a telescope for his birthday. He looked at the stars every night. One day he discovered a comet. He named it after his Dad.

Trouble Board Game. Dan loved having game night with his family. Tonight, Dan's family decided to play Trouble for game night. As the game progressed, Dan was losing badly. However, Dan's luck was changing as he was winning. Dan was glad that he was no longer losing the game.

Ring. Lauren's wedding ring fell into the faucet. The ring fell too far for her to reach. Luckily she used to be a trained plumber. She frustratingly took apart the upper pipes of her faucet. Although her ring was dirty, she was happy to be able to retrieve it.

Puzzle game. Pam liked to do puzzles during the holidays. She would pull out all the puzzles she had. And then finish them very quickly. But one of the puzzles was missing a piece. It ruined her day and she was very sad.

Taking my cat to the vet. It was time for my cat's yearly physical examination. I booked an appointment at the vet. On the day of the visit, my cat reluctantly got in her carrier. At the vet she was nervous but well-behaved. When we got home she was happy to be out of the carrier.

Healthy. Last year, John went to the doctor for his annual checkup. The doctor said John's blood levels were alarming. She advised John to get more healthy in eating and lifestyle. John committed to doing it. This year, John's blood levels were in the normal range!

Power House. Jenny has been trained in gospel singing since she was seven. She's had a passion for singing for as long as she can remember. Every day, she makes sure to practice. Now at 24, she is considered a "power house". She gives all her credit to dedication.

New Job, Old Fear. Kelly had a serious fear of flying, so she always avoided airplanes. After starting a new job, she was told she'd have to travel for work. She confided in her boss, and he suggested trying hypnotherapy. Kelly had several sessions with the hypnotherapist, which helped. Thanks to the treatment, Kelly was able to fly without panicking.

New Jersey. Chase needed a new football jersey. He didn't want to tell his mom. She had asked him a million times to be careful with his clothes. He finally decided to try to buy one on his own. He took his allowance and was able to buy one by himself.

The Peace Corps Beckons Again. Jan joined the Peace Corps and spent two years in Hungary. While there, she taught English to high school students. Upon returning home, Jan became a high school English teacher. This past spring, she retired after 30 years on the job. Jan has joined the Peace Corps again and is heading back to Hungary.

Money. The trial going on needed an expert witness. The expert witness was expensive. The expert witness was 10k but we'll worth it. The expert was able to help win the case. Everyone was happy with the work the expert did

Smell. Tom loved his girlfriend very much. One day, his girlfriend told him he usually smells bad. Tom never wore deodorant. Tom decided to begin wearing deodorant. Tom pleased his girlfriend by wearing deodorant regularly.

Infestation. Matt brought home a cloth chair he found on the street. When Bob learned that it was from the street, he became distraught. Bob figured that the chair probably had bedbugs! Sure enough, bedbugs from the chair soon infested their apartment. They had to spend a lot of money and time on exterminating them.
The Walk. Sally likes to walk. Long distances are her favorite to do. But one day she fell and twisted her ankle. And she couldn't walk for 2 weeks. She has been reading alot lately.

Cheater Cheater. Ashley was a star high school student. She was an A+ student in almost all of her subjects, except math. Ashley had a big math test coming up and was afraid of failing. She chose to cheat on the test by writing the answers on her arm. Ashley felt guilty when she got an A+ on her test because she cheated.

First Day of School. It was the first day of school for Timmy. Timmy was going into kindergarten. Timmy met his teacher on the first day of school. He also made lots of new friends that day. Overall, he was excited to go back to school.

Jasmine gets her car stolen. Jasmine drives her car to class. When class is over she goes outside to find her car. She can't find her car anywhere. She notices someone has stolen her car. She calls the police to report her car stolen.
Being Missed. My wife just enjoyed her first week of retirement. She has been working for 35 years. She worked at the last job for 18 years. Today her boss sent a text. She said she missed my wife.

Martha's Reward. Martha was walking home from school. Suddenly she found a small lost puppy. Martha checked his collar and found a phone number. When she returned the puppy, the owner gave her a reward. Martha was happy but sad to say goodbye to the puppy.
Stress reliever. I went to the gym yesterday to relieve stress. The day before I was in a stress overload. When I went to the gym I did cardio. Instantly I felt better. I went back the next day.

Fool's gold. Rhonda wanted to pan for gold. She learned that gold settles in the heavy sand in rivers. She panned the sand until she found many gold pieces in it. She took a week's worth of the pieces to sell. She learned all that glitters is not gold.

Waiting. Gina sat in the plastic chair. Her legs were sticking to the material. She lifted one leg from the chair. It made a long sticking sound like velcro. She wished she were wearing pants instead.

The Girl. I went to the store to pick up some food. On my walk there I noticed an attractive girl. As I passed by, I asked her what she's doing. As time went on, I asked if I could have her phone number. I'm now sitting at home awaiting our date tonight at the movies.

expensive troubles. John's car had broke down. John made use of the warranty. John did not realize it would cost a lot to fix the car. John realized the price of the fix was similar to a new car. John bought a different car from a different brand.

The Art Thief. Shelby attended an after school arts class. She brought her art supplies with her. Shelby excused herself to the restroom during the class. When she returned, her supplies were gone. Another student told Shelby who the thief was.

Dental work. Jenny didn't like the dentist. When she was young she had to have orthodontic work. The orthodontist gave her braces that she wore outside her mouth. They looked very ugly and made her feel bad. Although it was a bad experience, she appreciates her straight teeth.

Sign Language. A rescued Gorilla was sent to a research laboratory in America. At the laboratory, the researchers taught the gorilla to sign. The gorilla struggled immensely to learn more than few words. However, the gorilla kept learning slowly and methodically. Eventually, the researchers taught the gorilla over 300 words!

Pregnant again. Alicia found out she was pregnant again. She could not believe it. She was not even married. She called her mother in tears. It was not easy but she decided to give it up for adoption.
Kate. Kate was in love with her boyfriend Jim. She kept hoping he would propose. But then she grew tipped of waiting. Kate decided to propose to Jim herself. She was so happy when Jim said yes!

First Day of School. Mandy was five years old and enrolled in kindergarten. She was nervous about going to school. She did not want to get up early on the first day. Her parents dragged her to the school. Mandy enjoyed her first day of school and was anxious to go back.

It was his call. A fellow named Glenn was intimidating people with his skills. Gabe was intimated despite his own abilities. His friends tried to get him to join against Glenn. He was too scared but he believed in himself. Gabe ended up beating Glenn.

Blind Date. Kimi's friends set her up on a blind date. At first she thought the man was annoying. But as dinner passed, he became funnier and more endearing. Soon Kimi found herself actually liking him. She was glad she'd agreed to the blind date!
Paying off credit card. Susie always had a balance on her credit card. But she kept putting off paying it. Finally she had enough. She decided to pay it. The next week her credit score rose.

New Phone. Tito wanted a new cell phone. He saved up money from his job. In a few weeks he had enough to upgrade. He went to the mobile store and selected a new phone. Tito was so happy with his upgrade!

Fast Food Party. Martin got a job at a fast food place. One day his boss asked him to host a birthday party. Martin was nervous and didn't do a good job. The family that bought the birthday party complained. Martin was never asked to host a birthday party again.

Out of Hot Water. Tim was waiting for his brother to stop showering. He wanted to have his turn. Tim's brother took a really long time. By the time Tim got in there was no hot water left. Tim was upset with his brother.
Belly. Ted was a college student. He found a restaurant near campus he really liked. He ate there everyday. He loved the food very much. One day he looked down and was shocked to see a large belly.

Late Night Swimming. It was a hot summer night. Jane and her friends had nothing to do. They all decided to go swimming. They went to a river and the water was cold. Jane and her friends felt refreshed.

Big Moose. Bill goes to visit his grandparents. Bill and his grandmother decide to go for a walk. When they come around the corner there is a giant moose in the road. He stares at them for what seems like forever and then walks away. Frightened, the two turn around and go home.

He Returns. The door to the main office opened and the principal entered. He stood and looked at Gina. Ashamed she looked at the ground. When instructed she entered his office and took a seat. Gina knew she was in a lot of trouble

Snow Day. One day school was cancelled due to snow. A bunch of kids was so happy. They went outside to play in the snow. They got so cold their bodies felt like ice. They went inside to drink hot chocolate.

The Great Coach. Once, there was a coach named Mike who was very old. Mike had never won a championship, but he always worked hard. One year, he got a surprisingly good team of athletes. He taught leadership and valuable technical skills to help his team. His team performed well and brought him his first championship.

Laughing At Good Price. Charles had to call a customer and sell him a warranty. He dialed a number and then looked at the name. His customer's name was Good Price. Charles laughed so hard at his customer's name. He laughed so hard the customer hung up.

Jenny. I met my friend Jenny in high school. We decided to live together when we went to college. We lived together for six months. We did silly things like wash dishes in the bathtub. Now we live separately but we are still friends.

Musician Signs Himself. Charles wanted be a Rap star since the early nineties. Although he made demos, no record company would sign him. In 2015 he made a record and obtained a digital file of his recording. He used his credit card and joined a music sharing site. Now Charles is selling downloads of his music, his dream is reality.

The World Series. Mike was so excited he couldn't sleep. He'd just gotten tickets to the World Series! He loaded up his car and got ready to make the drive. When he arrived at the stadium, he quickly found his seat. He couldn't wait for the game to start!

Hopscotch. Carolyn was on the sidewalk playing hopscotch. When her mom called her for refreshments, she refused. She was on a winning streak she didn't want to spoil. She played five more minutes until she accomplished her goal. When she was done, she run to her mom to drink her lemonade.

Dax's Decisions. Dax had several arrests for drinking and driving. He lost his car and his driver's license because of the arrests. One night he wanted to go to a party. He took a friend's car without permission. Dax keeps making very bad decisions.

A Trip to the Store. Fiona decided to make a special meal for her brother. She made a list of all the ingredients she needed from the store. She grabbed the list and started walking the ten blocks to the store. After walking six blocks, she realized she forgot her purse. She turned around and went back home.

Bill's Big Break. Bill wanted to be an actor so he auditioned for a local play. He was very nervous that he had done a bad job. When the cast list finally came out, he rushed over to see the results He had been cast as the lead! Bill knew it was going to be hard, but he was ready for his big break.

Phone case. Jack wanted a new phone case. He decided on a certain case and ordered it online! When he got the phone case it wasn't the right one! Jack called the company that sent him the phone case. The company sent him the right phone case next week!

Quentin Tastes Cheese. Quentin has always loved eating different kinds of cheese. He decides to attend a cheese tasting party a friend is throwing. At the party he tries many cheeses, including some stinky cheese. Although he had never tried stinky cheese before, he enjoyed it. Quentin was happy he had attended the cheese tasting party.

Kitchen. Sally was struggling to make a meal in her kitchen. She decided she had enough and to upgrade and remodel it. The next day she hired a contractor and came up with a plan. The contractor set to work the next day. A few weeks later Sally was cooking in a kitchen that she loves.

Mary's Flower Basket. Mary always day dreamed of the wildflowers that grew next door. One day she decided to take her basket with her to pick some. She spent a whole hour observing and picking the flowers. Her mom came outside and gasped. Mary didn't realize the flowers belonged to their neighbor!

Tennis. Peter was playing tennis with his dad. At first he thought tennis looked easy. But then he began to play! Peter swung and swung, but he missed every ball. He realized tennis was a lot harder than he'd thought.

Kids in a Pool. Amanda's kids were playing in their above ground pool with friends. There were too many kids in the pool. The kids were playing too rough. The walls of the pool suddenly collapsed. Amanda's kids were upset at the broken pool.

Buying Water. Gina drank a specific brand of bottled water. Each week she went to the store and bought enough for 5-7 days. But the stores near her house were always running out of the water. Gina often had to visit 2 stores to get enough. It was inconvenient, but Gina felt it was worth it.

First Credit Card. Ed got his first credit card. He ate out eight times the first month he had it. He also bought himself some new electronics. He was shocked when he got his first bill. He vowed he would be more careful in his spending.

Inventor. The inventor couldn't come up  with anymore ideas. He was having a hard time. His boss was hounding him to come up with an idea. He finally thought of an invention. He gave it to his boss and got an instant raise.

Rude Joe. Gina's brother had a friend named Joe. Gina disliked like Joe and always left when he came around. One day Gina was at her friend Ruth's house and Joe came over. It was the first time he spoke to her. Everything he had to say was rude, and filthy.

Arm Wrestling. Tom was very competitive. Tom was a middle school student. Tom enjoyed watching arm wrestling. Tom exercised his forearms daily for months. Tom challenged the football team captain and won.

Job Promotion. Mary and Cindy work together in the office. They are also best friends outside of work. One day Mary gets promoted to a job that Cindy secretly wanted. Cindy was a bit frustrated at first but she never told Mary. She didn't want to ruin a friendship so she made herself get over it.

Noise Complaint. Tim was having a party at his house. He invited all of his friends. Tim played music over his huge surround sound system. Soon after, he received a knock on the door. The police told Tim to keep the music down.

The Drunk. A drunk man walked into a grocery store. He wanted to get some tomato sauce for dinner. He stumbled as he picked up a jar of sauce. The man knocked several jars on the floor. The grocery store manager kicked out the drunk for his mess.
Doug has a problem. Doug is a country music singer. He has one problem. He is an alcoholic. One night doug came stumbling home and wanted to fight. It was time for Doug to get help and go to Rehab.

School. For a few years I was bullied in school by two girls. They used to be my friends, but they were mad at me. We got into a huge argument, and I called one a dirty word. She started spreading rumors about me after that. We eventually made up at a football game.

The White Dog. Andy looked around the neighborhood. His dog had run away. He told his neighbors he was looking for a big, white dog. He went home and worried until he heard a knock on his door. His dog had been brought home!

The Reporter. Monica had just gotten a new job. She was a reporter for the local newspaper. She was going to be covering local news. She had her first interview with a local mayor. She was nervous but she felt that she'd done well.

Too much. Ernie's family was getting ice cream. He was not that hungry. He told the lady at the counter he only wanted a small scoop. She gave him a tall, heaping scoop. He walked over to the trash and scooped part of it in.

Elms College. My niece is a student at Elms College. Her club was selling books to make money for the school. She asked me to post some books on Amazon. I posted thirty books and made $100 for the school. She was very grateful.

The one that perseveres. Tina was a horrible car accident. Her legs were messed up terribly. Doctors said she would never walk again. But Tina persevered in therapy. And she regained the ability to walk again.

The Fruit Juice. Heather wanted her kids to eat healthy things. She switched their soda with fruit juice. She thought she was making great progress. Then her dentist told her how unhealthy it was for her kids. Heather was so frustrated!

The Wild Cat. Last summer, a wild cougar was in our suburb. Several neighbors noticed their pets were scared to go outside. Some of the dogs and cats were killed or maimed by a large animal. Eventually, the police said their was a wild cougar in the area. It look almost 2 months, but finally the cougar was caught.

Rude Awakening. A homeless man was walking across the street. He approached my car as soon as he saw my family. My dad tried to argue at him however, the man didn't give up begging. My dad ended up closing his door window and drove off. We ended up being pulled over by a cop since we passed a red light.

Caterpillar Panic. I have a phobia about caterpillars. One day, after doing some yard work, I came inside for a cool drink. As I raised my cup, I brushed against something spiky on my shirt. I looked down and saw a hairy caterpillar on my chest! I screamed and threw my cup of water straight up in the air!

Gross Mold. Colby was at the orthodontist's office. He was having braces put on soon and they needed a mold of his jaw. They put a yucky pink putty in his mouth. When it had hardened, they roughly yanked it out. Colby hated it but luckily it was over quickly.
Monument. A government had a big event. They wanted to celebrate it. They asked artists for help. One sculpture made a monument. They put it in a plaza.

The Tire Machine. Dan works at a tire shop. He works hard all day changing people's tires. While working, accidentally broke a seven hundred dollar machine. He thought he would be fired for this. Dan didn't get fired and was more careful from then on.

The extra cookies. Sylvia was a girl scout. She had been selling cookies. When she had delivered all of them, she realized she had extras. She took them to her mom's work. There, she was able to sell the rest.
Shoes. It was Ben's first day of school. He was worried about his shoes. He couldn't afford a name brand pair. But when he arrived at school, no one even noticed. Ben was very relieved.

monster. Bill was sure there was a monster hiding in his closet. He called for his dad. His dad came in and Bill begged him to check the closet. Bill's dad opened the closet door and turned on the light. There was nothing inside but Bill's clothes!

Ray. Ray had a blue car with a sunroof. He loved the car more than anything else. One day a woman crashed into the back of his car. Ray felt in love with the woman that hit his car. He no longer has the blue car.

Music man. A man went to an advertising agency to promote his product. The advertising man called his best musician to help. The musician spent all day writing a jingle. The jingle was played on radio and TV for days. As a result,  the product sold in great quantities.

Lost. Tim was driving through the forest one night. Suddenly his car sputtered and died. Tim was terrified! He had to get out and walk to the nearest town for help. Tim was exhausted and unhappy by the time he arrived.

The Bird. Micky wanted a bird. His mom thought it was a bad idea. He did extra chores around the house and kept his room clean. His mom still felt that it was a bad idea but gave in. Micky turned out to be very responsible for his new bird.

Bird Friends. Sarah went on a hike. On the hike she saw many animals. One of the animals was an injured bird. She picked up the bird and carried it with her. She then took the bird to the vet to help it.

Playing by the Pool. Last week I was at a friend's bbq. They had a pool and there were kids running around. One of the slipped and fell into the pool. Everyone freaked out but someone jumped in to pull him out. The kid was alright but it gave us all a good scare.

Max Cooks an Omelette. Max decides that he spends too much money buying food at restaurants. He knows he should start cooking breakfast at home. He decides to learn how to cook an omelette. He practices cooking omelettes many times until he is an expert. He is very happy to be saving money by cooking at home.

Breakfast. John woke up at 6 in the morning. 6 am is early for John to wake up. John's family was still asleep, so he decided to make breakfast. John mad Bacon and eggs for his family. John's family loved the bacon and eggs he made.
Peanut. Donna is very allergic to many foods. One food she is allergic to is peanuts. Unfortunately, she accidentally ate a peanut. She took out her epi pen. Her life was saved by her epi pen.

Dan loses a bet. Dan was playing a video game with Steve. The two were playing call of duty. The winner would be the one who gets the most Kills. Dan loses to Steve and has to run around naked in the street. Dan is totally humiliated running through the street naked.

Erica Trips. Erica was in a hurry in the morning. She tripped on the way to her car. She had forgotten to tie her shoes. She made she she tied her shoes up correctly afterwards. She arrived at work on time.

Casual Friday. Jill has to wear a dress to work everyday. Except on Friday they have Casual Friday. She can wear whatever she wants. Jill usually wears jeans and a t-shirt. She says that she is most comfortable that way.

Too many favors. I was supposed to hang out with my family today. However, my friend came over and needed company. After she left, my cousin called asking for help in math. When I went to visit my aunt, no one was home. We promised to hang out, but she had to go to work.
Snoring. She snored loudly, much to her embarrassment. He often woke her up to tell her. Annoyed, she would grumble and roll over. She hated being woken up. Eventually she would stop snoring.

Gold Digger. I saw him driving around town with the girl I loved. I gave her an Atari when we were dating, but that wasn't enough. He gave her a new XBox. She broke up with me for him. Now I'm sad, and I might never get over this.

Poisonous Mushroom. Tara was taking a hike in the woods. She found a red colored mushroom on the ground. She decided to eat the mushroom. Tara immediately fell ill. She had to go to the emergency for eating a poisonous mushroom.
Cupcakes. I found a pair of earrings. They looked like little purple cupcakes. They even had little sprinkles. I bought them immediately. I put them in my ears.

He Wasn't Much of A Fan. Jake's employer held a month long sales contest for Super Bowl tickets. He did very well, meeting all of the requirements along the way. Most sales people were football fans, and the contest was very fierce. It came down to a drawing, and Jake won, to the envy of all onlookers. This would be the first and only game he'd see all year, or cared to.

Lessons. Hao grew up in China, where money was always very tight. Then, when He was 11, his family moved to America. There, Hao was shocked to see kids throw away entire lunches! He told them about the hunger and poverty in China. After that, fewer kids discarded their meals.

Uncontrollable. I first knew something was wrong when my son couldn't sleep. He couldn't stop moving long enough. He couldn't focus on anything at all most of the time. I took him to see a doctor. The doctor blew us off, and I felt defeated.

What color. We had to decide the color for our product by tonight. We went to the Apple store, to Home Depot, we went everywhere. There was so many colors to choose from! We ended up calling one of our partners to help with the choice. He said you don't have to pick a color til next week, not tonight.

Shelly's Lunch. Shelly had only brought three dollars to spend for lunch. She wasn't really hungry. Shelly bought a soft drink and a bag of chips. Her friend gave her half of her sandwich. Shelly was full after lunch.

Visit to the Doctor. Once a boy got a piece of corn stuck up his nose. He kept trying to get it out with his finger. When that didn't work his parents took him to the doctor. The doctor removed it with a pair of tweezers. The boy promised to be more careful in the future.
4K TV. Sammy was in line for Black Friday. She wanted to get a new TV. She waited for hours. She was able to buy a 4K TV for $500. She watched the football game on her new TV later that night.

Jerky. Tom made jerky for a living. He was trying out a new recipe that involved hot spices. He poured the large bag of spices into the mixer. He ended up dropping the bag and got hot spices in his eyes. He couldn't work for a week.

New Friends. Tony had trouble making new friends. All the kids would tease him because he was so tall. One day a couple boys were playing catch. Their ball got stuck in a tree. Tony helped them get it down and they asked him to join.

Anything for Pizza. Derek had saved his lunch money for a piece of pizza. After school he quickly walked to the store. When he got there he discovered he'd lost his money. He was hungry and didn't want to retrace his steps to look for it. He grabbed a slice of pizza and secretly ate it in the corner.

Unemployed. My father just got laid off from work. This was weird for me because I never saw my Dad so depress. He just filled out job applications and stared at his computer Things seemed hopeless for a little while. Fortunately, my dad was able to bounce back.

Major Switch. Dana wanted to switch into the electrical engineering program. Dana was required to take a qualifying class on circuits and devices. Dana found the workload overwhelming and the material dry. Dana did not end up passing the class. Dana decided to pursue computer science instead.

No Free Money. Michael needed money and wasn't sure how to get it. His parents were dead. Michael went by his mother-in-law's house and asked for money. He said he would accept any amount. His mother-in-law was offended and said no.

The Upset DJ. Sam was DJ at a wedding last week. They kept asking him to play the same songs over and over again. He got frustrated and told them he wouldn't anymore. The people requesting them got equally upset. Sam didn't budge and played other music instead.

Check on it. Gina's sister was afraid of a deer at a truck stop. The dead deer was in a truck next to their car. Gina went out to see the deer. The truck had been replaced by a sports car. Gina's sister was relieved to hear it was gone.

Butch Awakens. Martha had a dog named Butch. Butch would lie all day on the sofa like a lazy dog. Martha came home one day with a cat. Butch woke up from his slumber and lept from the sofa. Butch grabbed the cat and shook it, and killed the cat.

Binge Watching. Chuck was offered a free month of Netflix. Chuck tried it out as long as it was for free. He binged watched tons of television shows and movies! But he was also very unproductive for the entire month. Chuck decided not to sign up for Netflix.
Lion. Tom was a professional photographer. Tom wanted a picture of a lion. Tom went to Africa. Tom saw a lion. Tom took a picture of a wild lion.
Mopping the Floor. Jane swept and mopped the floor. It took her a long time. She was happy with how clean it was. All of a sudden her dog dragged in mud from outside. Jane was annoyed and frustrated.
Cooking. Nick's mom lived next door to him. He would usually go to her house for dinner. Nick moved across town. He no longer ate at his mom's house. Nick learned how to cook for himself.

Fired. Jill is very excited when she hires her best friend. But when her friend does not respect her authority and is very lazy. She has to fire her friend. Her friend is mad that her best friend fired her. But eventually she understands why Jill had to fire her.
Hotel Lobby. A family settled on a hotel. They got there the next day. Their bags were picked up for them. The lobby was their first view. They thought it was amazing.

Boot Camp. Beth was a new recruit in the Army. She arrived in North Carolina on a warm sunny day. She didn't realize they would get to work right away. She was forced to hike 10 miles in the heat with a heavy load. Beth lay in her bunk afterwards absolutely exhausted.

Pantsuits are great for work. I needed to choose an outfit for work. First, I tried on a dress. I decided the dress was too tight and looked unprofessional. Next, I tried on a pantsuit. The pantsuit looked great, so that is what I wore to work that day.
Hurting my mouth. I was 8 years old. I was at a cub scout meeting. Us boys were roughhousing. I was tripped into a door. My mouth needed 4 stitches.

Diapers. Jessie wants to save the planet. She believes global warming is real. One day, she bought cloth diapers for her baby. This keeps diapers out of a landfill. The summer was a little less warm this year.

The Perfect Couch. Caitlin Recently married her boyfriend of three years, Cal. They needed furniture for their new home. They both searched online and found a couch from IKEA that they liked. They drove to IKEA to see the couch in person. They liked the couch and ordered it in the store to have it delivered.

Lunch box. I couldn't find my lunch box. I looked through my bag, my car and my kitchen. When I went to work, I saw my lunch box in the trash. I must have left it in the refrigerator at work last week. The secretary must have cleaned out the refrigerator over the weekend.
Midnight mass. It was Christmas Eve. Suzy decided to go to midnight mass. She took her sisters and brothers. But she was so tired. She ended up falling asleep.

Broken Heart. Jessica was a single woman and was lonely. She was at the grocery store one day shopping. A nice man walked up to her and called her beautiful. He took her to dinner the next day. They fell in love quickly.

Teaching French. Giselle was teaching French to a group of students. They learned very fast and soon were able to hold conversations. She took them to see movies and theater plays in French. They learned to write and express their opinions too. At the end of the year, Giselle was very proud of them all.
The Dance. She was so excited for the dance. She bought a new dress. Her hair and makeup were perfect. Her date was the cutest boy in the class. She could not wait to get to the school for prom.

Mean women. I was talking to my girlfriend and some girls came by. They made some snarky remarks at my girl friend. My gf seemed depressed and upset because of it. I told her it's ok and that everything will be just fine. I hugged her and let her know everything will be ok.

The purse. Leslea drove off in her car in a hurry. It took a few hours for her to realize her purse was gone. She searched her whole car for her purse but didn't find it. When she was finished with work she drove home. To her surprise her purse was still in her garage!

The Easter Present. Raymond woke up excited because it was Easter morning. He jumped out of bed and ran downstairs. He wanted to see if the Easter Bunny had come. To his delight he saw his Easter basket full of presents and candy. He knew that this was going to be an amazing Easter.

Love Song. Dave really loved a girl named Jen. Dave wrote a song for Jen. Dave surprised Jen at school by pulling out his guitar in class. Dave played the song and sang his heart out. Jen loved it and now they are a couple.

Eyeglass Debacle. Steven wore thick heavy glasses to school. He is near blind without them on. One day at school he tripped on a backpack and his glasses fell off. They slammed hard to the floor and shattered into many pieces. Steven wears contacts now.

Cold Sore. Jane woke up to a painful bump on her lip. She quickly realized she was getting a cold sore. Jane ran to the kitchen and got ice for her lip. She kept the ice on the bump all day. Jane's sore never formed because of the ice.

Headed to France. Maci was a straight A student in high school. She applied to attend college in France. She was ecstatic to learn she had been accepted to her school. After graduation she prepared for her move. Her parents were sad to see her go but we're very proud of her.

Pain in the Back. Jake hurt his back at work. His doctor told him it was bad. He went to a specialist that told him surgery was needed. Jake was scared but knew it was important to do. He had the surgery and recovered quickly.

Mild Food. Tom was at a chili cooking contest. He was excited to try all the spicy flavors. Everyone talked their recipe up as being the spiciest. Tom went around trying different ones. He was disappointed to find out that none were that spicy.
Seeing an Ex. I saw an ex-girlfriend at a party. She looked good. She avoided me the whole night. That hurt my feelings. But leaving the party, I saw her in the front yard, vomiting.

Joan. Joan was a poor college student. She decided to get a part time job. She applied as a waitress at a restaurant. She got the job and worked 20 hours per week there. She made a lot in tips, and eventually, was no longer poor.

Keyboard. I spilled a soda on my keyboard. This broke it, so I wanted to buy a new one. I went to the thrift shop and looked all around. Finally, I found exactly what I was looking for. I was able to replace my keyboard for a reasonable price.

Baking Hand Pies. Sarah was baking hand pies. First she had to make the crust and cut it into circles. Then, she filled the crust with an apple mixture. Finally, she pinched them all shut and covered them in cinnamon. After cooking them in the oven, they were ready to eat!

The wrong cake. It was Elizabeth's birthday. She had been looking forward to her chocolate cake all day. When it came time to eat, her mom brought a cake out. The cake turned out to be vanilla. Elizabeth was disappointed, but she still appreciated it.
A New Pet. My mom brought me to the pet store. She said that I could pick out any pet. I decided to choose a pitbull. She was surprised by my choice. We took the pitbull home.

School for the Blind. Jane was born nearly blind. She has spent her entire life away at school. At the school for the blind she excelled. She finished the school with high marks. She loved it there so she became a teacher there too!

Mom's Cookies. Gina and her sister were in the dining room. Her older brother came into the kitchen. He opened cabinets looking for snacks. There were cookies which belonged to their mom on a shelf. Even though Gina warned him, he ate a row of the cookies.

From New to Broken. Jeff just purchased a new sweater from the outlet store. He quickly fled to the front entrance after making the purchase. However, the bottom of it got caught in a needle. The needle tore a large hole into the sweater within minutes. Jeff was sad, especially since he couldn't get a refund.

A cat. Mike had decided to let the family get a pet. He was promised he would not have to clean up after the animal. The family took a vote and decided to get a cat. He hated cats but agreed to get the animal. Every day he complains about the litter on the floor.

Unorthodox Choice. Lisa was finally getting married. She needed to choose the members of her wedding party. For her small wedding, she only need a maid of honor. Lisa' best friend was not a maid, but a man. Lisa had her best friend stand as her man of honor.

The Story. Leo was a reporter for a local newspaper. He was writing a story about local politicians. The politician tried to avoid Leo for many days. Leo was finally able to catch up with him at the gym. Leo got a great interview and got a promotion because of his story.

Kind Words. Dan recently learned of a coworker who was diagnosed with cancer. Dan decided to give her flowers, and a card filled with kind words. After Dan gave the items to the coworker, he broke down in tears. In good spirit, the coworker gave Dan a huge hug and said kind words. Dan was shocked of the kindness displayed by his coworker.

Barefoot. I was used to going outside barefoot. I ran around in the yard, playing happily. I saw a bumblebee on a dandelion. I decided to kill it by stepping on it. It stung my little foot instantly, making me cry.

Never too late. Cathy has always wanted to have a child. She thought she was told old to conceive. Cathy talked to her doctor. He gave her confidence she could still have a baby. Last week Cathy found out she was pregnant.
Tree. An organization chopped down their tree. The old tree was shredded. They wanted a new tree. They bought one. They planted it.

Teacher Leaves. Gina had returned early from recess to find her teacher in the room. Gina hoped to find the room empty. Now the teacher was leaving to make copies. Gina waited until she was down the hall. Then she went to search Dave's desk.

Strike. Roland came to the bowling alley looking to improve his skills. He paid for 2 hours of bowling as well as premium equipment. Roland hadn't been playing for long when he got his first ever strike. Feeling accomplished, he did his signature dance and ordered food. He managed to do it 3 more times before it was done for the evening.

Swan. Jean went to the lake by her house for a quick walk. When she arrived there, a crowd was blocking the path. She peeked through to see a white swan. It was gliding on the water among the ducks. She took a picture like everybody else before resuming her walk.
Cat Food. The cat was purring. The cat put its head back down. The cat had a funny look. The cat started eating. I had bought it a different food.
Tired workout. Yesterday I went for a workout. I ran three miles. I was exhausted. When I was done I collapsed. I needed sleep.

Driving after my stroke. I suffered a stroke in October of 2011. I could not walk for five weeks. I had to learn how to drive again. I took special courses from a driving school, and took a road test. I was very proud to pass my road test and get my license.

Halloween on the street. Felicia was walking down the street when a man bumped into her. He was scary looking and she screamed when she looked at him. People around her gathered in case she needed help. The man removed his Halloween mask and smiled at her. Felicia smiled too but her heart was still beating strong.

Birthday Cake. For her birthday, Maryann's dad was going to bake a cake for her. He's never baked a cake in his life. Maryann requested a blueberry cake. Her dad spent all night baking. It was the best cake Maryann ever had!

The Tree. There was a large, old tree in the ditch across the street. The tree was an oak, and sloped downward into the ditch. In the tree was a giant hole, and the kids would crawl into it. We called it our treehouse, and we put a board in front of it. One day some younger kids took over our treehouse.

The cook off. Joe and Rafael wanted to see who can cook better wings. So they agreed that on Saturday that they would have a cook off. Joe and Rafael's family where the judges. They cooked their wings. The family agreed that Joe's wings were better.

Wedding Day. Today is the day of Maria's wedding. She is excited, in the morning she went and got her hair done. At three pm she took a limo to the Church to marry her husband. Maria and her new husband James looked great during their dance. They left in the limo for the airport.

The Big Test. Elizabeth has a big exam tomorrow morning. When she wakes up, she realizes she forgot to set her alarm! With ten minutes to spare, she skips breakfast and runs to school. She arrives just on time and aces the test. From then on, Elizabeth made sure to always set her alarm.

Banging Noise. There was a banging noise across the house. I searched into the garage, but there was no noise there. As I came closer to the bathroom, the noise got louder. The sound was coming out of the bathroom door. When I opened it, it was my baby daughter.
Freshly baked rolls. Lisa was hungry. She decided to make some rolls. Lisa loved rolls. When they got out of the oven they were great. She immediately ate five.

Zoo. Last week my parents took me to the zoo. We saw a lot of animals. At the zoo i was allowed to ride a pony and pet a turtle. I like going to the zoo because i love animals. We all had a nice day at the zoo.

The present. Tiffany's boyfriend loved video games. His birthday was coming up and she wanted to surprise him. She went out and bought a game that he had his eye on. She wrapped it and on his birthday she went to his house. When she gave the gift, he told her that he already owned the game.

Wrong Change. Leidy decided to shop for a few groceries. When she came in front of the checkout, the cashier took everything. The bill was $17 and Leidy gave her a $20 dollar bill. The cashier gave her back $5 dollars in change. Leidy was surprised and ended up giving her some money back.

Bad Back. Cole played video games all day, everyday. But he didn't bother sitting properly. Over time, he developed several back issues. And he had to get surgery. Cole decided to never sit with a bad posture again.

Guys. Last week the guys and I decided to watch sports. We bought beer and got some snacks. We watched football for hours and had a great time. My girlfriend was at work and liked coming home to beer. Overall everyone enjoyed the day.

New York. I was in New York for a vacation. My girlfriend joined and we had a great time. We got into an argument about tipping street performers. She stormed off in the middle of the city. I found her and we almost broke up.

Shareholder. Arnie was heavily invested in a company that makes phones. He decided to attend the annual shareholders meeting. Arnie didn't like the information that he heard at the meeting. He decided to sell his stock in the company. He was glad he sold his stock when the price dropped significantly.

Family Photos. I brought some family photo albums with me to my new home. I wanted to use them to populate some photo frames for the shelves. Most of my family photos are in a horizontal orientation. Most of my photo frames are in a vertical orientation. I plan to fill the frames with cell phone pictures instead.
Too Fast. Tim was driving. He was late for work. He started driving at eighty miles an hour. A cop pulled him over to give him a ticket. He never drove fast again.

Bad Pie. Bill decides to try a pie from the new bakery. It is the worst pie he has ever eaten. He wonders how they can stay in business with such awful products. Then next week Bill sees a story about the bakery. The owners were arrested for using the bakery to launder money.

Plumbing Problems. Harry was preparing vegetables for dinner one day. He turned the faucet on to wash some lettuce. The faucet started to rumble and water spewed from the handle. Harry quickly turned off all the water and called a plumber. The plumber fixed the pipe but it cost over 500 dollars.

Missing. My little cousin was missing yesterday. He never got home from school. His parents were really worried. It turns out he went to a friend's house. He got in trouble for not telling anyone about it.

First Day of School. My daughter was terribly nervous about the first day of second grade. She was feeling terrified, no matter what we said to comfort her. The first day of school finally arrived. She was crying in the car when I drove her to school. But when I picked her up she only had good things to say.

A Bad Movie. Caleb went to the movies. He bought a ticket to a comedy movie and got a tub of popcorn. Caleb found a seat and got ready to watch the film. The film was boring and not funny at all. Caleb fell asleep watching the movie.

Double Rainbow. Kia's mom called her out into the yard. Kia went, perplexed. But then she saw what her mom was pointing at. Her mouth fell open in awe. There was a rare and beautiful double rainbow overhead!

Jesus the great. There was a boy named Jesse. He could read people's lips One day, his friend Michael whispered something to another person. He tried to read the lips but it was too hard. That day he gave up on reading lips.

Violin. Trina has been drawn to the violin. Seeing this, her parents put her in lessons. She had a natural gift for the music. After a year, she was performing in recitals. She is considered a prodigy.

Distraction. Amy called her friend Beth. She wanted to talk about anything But Ray. But all Beth talked about was him. Beth didn't understand why he hadn't called Amy. Amy simply refused the think about it any longer.
Registering to vote. Callie just turned 18. As a result of she wanted to register to vote. She couldn't wait. As she walked into the office, she registered as a republican. Callie was very happy.

Lemonade Stand. Jade and her sister set up a lemonade stand in their yard. The next door neighbor bought two glasses of lemonade. The neighbor gave them each one dollar. The girls put their money in a piggy bank. They decided to buy a card game with their money.

Saturday Cartoons. Gary worked hard all week, and wanted to relax on Saturday. As Gary awoke, he poured himself a bowl of cereal. After eating Gary turned on the TV, and saw his favorite cartoon. Gary immediately sat down and watched his favorite cartoons. Gary was glad to be relaxing after a week of work to Saturday cartoons.

Dinner Proposal. Dan wanted to take his girlfriend to a nice restaurant. Dan asked her friends where she really liked to eat. Dan took their advice, taking his girlfriend to the recommended place. Dan waited until the end of the dinner, and proposed. Dan's girlfriend cried and said yes!

Sushi Roll Prices. Timothy loved eating sushi. But he found it terribly expensive to get full. One day he stumbled upon a new restaurant. They had a lunch special with cheap, tasty half-price sushi rolls. Timothy went there rather often after that first visit.
Henry gets caught. Henry needs money. Henry has an idea. He goes to the bank. He tries to rob the bank. He is caught and taken to jail.

New Beds. Gina's parents had purchased new beds for everyone. Gina was ecstatic. She ran to her room to see her bed. It was a black lacquered daybed with golden balls on the poles. Gina was thrilled with her new bed.
Bra. The woman put on the bra. It fit well. She bought ten of them. Her husband noticed the bras. He congratulated her on the purchase.

Vacation. Recently Tom felt constantly exhausted by his job. He requested a week off for relaxation. Tom's boss approved his request. Tom relaxed for the entire week. When Tom arrived back at work he felt rejuvenated.
The bug bite. Lily was at the park. She was sitting on the bench. Suddenly she felt some crazy pain. She looked and saw a huge caterpillar. The bug had stung her or something.

The Cleaning Lady. Claire hired a cleaning lady. She had always loved having a very clean house. The cleaning lady did a great job. She scrubbed the toilets and did the laundry. Claire came home to a spotless house!

Lost Book. I drove my teenage daughter to a concert one night. I parked in a lot down the road and read a book. I picked up my daughter after the concert and headed home. I realized my book was missing, and drove 3 exits back to the lot. The book was in the parking lot, and I retrieved it.

Bonfire. Today at work I was thinking about a bonfire. When I got home my husband approached me and hugged me. He told me that he's been thinking about a bonfire all day. We went to the store to get smore supplies. When we got home we made a bonfire and made smores.
The War. The nation was tense. Their president had just declared war. The soldiers prepared for battle. It was the first war they'd been in in decades. The president asked for the nation's support.
The Pizza. Tamara was cooking dinner. She made pizza dough from scratch. She spread the sauce on it. Then she added cheese and pepperoni. Her kids couldn't wait to eat the homemade pizza!

Bad First Day. I started a new job recently and almost burned the place down. I plugged the wrong charger into a laptop cooling fan. I tried to play it cool and hide the incident. The smoke detector led everyone to my area. Didn't make such a good first impression on my new boss with that.
Icy Road. Tim had bat tires. It had just snowed. He tried driving home. Tim kept sliding around. He had to park and wait for a plow.
Fertility. Our daughter's college friend Charlene had a baby. She is six months old. She just told our daughter she is pregnant. Furthermore, she is expecting twins. Our daughter was amazed.
Nerves for the date. Fred had asked Lucy out on a date. Lucy was so nervous. It was quite unlike her to be nervous about something. Her hands were shaking. But when she saw him her nerves went away.

The bad grades. Tom wanted to go on a trip with his friends. He asked his parents but they said no. His grades were too low. That week, he worked really hard to bring his grades up. When they improved, his parents let him go on the trip.

Detention. Hannah skipped her history class two days in a row. Because of this, the teacher gave her a note. The note explained that she had to go to detention. Hannah showed up for the detention and did her homework. Afterwords, she was glad to be done with it.
Far too hot. Lisa had to go to a baseball game. She was excited. Yet then it started being too hot. She had to leave. She felt badly.

A gift she didn't like. Juliet was at her grandparents for Christmas. They were giving her several random gifts. She liked them all except for one thing. It was a really boring looking book. Still, she acted happy and thanked them.

Startled Cat. Greg wanted a late night snack. He went to the kitchen barefoot. He didn't notice his cat was sleeping on the floor. Greg accidentally stepped on it. The cat screeched and Greg got startled.

Full Volume. Stan drove his car to work while in a bad mood. The new hit song came on the radio and he took note. Stan turned up the volume on the radio and sang along. He didn't know most words so he made them up. When the song was over he was feeling better.

Back to Ukraine. Phoenix travelled to Ukraine, to scatter his father's ashes. He knocked on an old farmhouse in the countryside. A haggard old woman answered, his father's mother. With her permission, Phoenix wandered into her potato field. Phoenix scattered his father's ashes in the field where he had grown.

Knots. Job had a rope that he tied into many different knots. While practicing a new knot, he accidentally got tangled. Job couldn't break free. Hours later, his father returned to see Job still struggling. The father just laughed and walked inside, and didn't help poor Job.

The broken headphones. Jerry was in the car with his mom and brothers. They were on a long drive. He was watching a movie when his headphones broke. He begged his mom to stop for new ones. Luckily, she agreed to stop and buy him some new ones.

Chicken to Car. My favorite restaurant in town was the KFC on the corner. They went out of business a few years back. They were replaced by a Sonic's, which I sort of enjoyed eating at. That place also went belly up. Now I avoid looking at the used car lot that replaced it.

Fish. My father wanted to buy some fish at the pet store. We drove to the store and talked about what fish to get. At the store we saw fat goldfish and small turtles. We decided to buy three goldfish and some fish food. When we returned home we dumped the goldfish into their new bowl.
